loans.name: Grupo 15 Group

texts.es:
Este banquito es denominado "GRUPO 15", Se fundó el 17 D. septiembre del 2007, biene siendo comformado por 13 miembros actuales, D. los cuales 06 son mujeres y 07 varones, estos socios son gente emprendedora y muy trabajadora, pese a las limitaciones ellos llevan a sus hogares día a día lo que les genera su trabajo, este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco, pero dichos socios encuentran en este banco mucho respaldo y apoyo social a sus necesidades, lo cuál ellos agradecen D. todo corazón.

El préstamo que estos socios recieben es muy valorado, ya que les permitirá a 03 socias la implementación D. sus abarrotes (azúcar, leche, harina, arroz, etc, a otros 02 socios la construcción D. sus casitas, a 02 socios la apertura D. un cafetín, a 03 D. ellos comprar repuestos y hacer el mantenimiento D. sus vehículos D. trasporte público, 01 socia venderá productos D. salud, 01 socio necesita el préstamo para poder comprar madera y hacer puertas, finalmente 01 socio necesita el dinero para los estudios D. sus hijos, esté último socio no aparece en la foto que fuera tomada el día D. hoy, por tener permiso por salud, él está en otra ciudad operandose D. la vista.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Grupo 15". It was founded on 17 September 2007 and is currently comprised of 13 members, of which 6 are women and 7 are men. The members are enterprising and very hard-working people, in spite of limitations they look after their families each day through their work. This bank is located in Cusco and within it the members find support and social help for their needs, for which they are thankful from the bottom of hearts. The loan that the members will receive is appreciated very much and will allow 3 of the members to start up grocery stores (sugar, milk, flour, rice, etc.); 2 others to build houses; 2 members to open up a small cafeteria, 3 to buy parts and do maintenance on their public-transportation vehicles; 1 member to sell health products, 1 member needs a loan to be able to buy wood and make doors; and finally, 1 member needs the money for their children´s education. This last member does not appear in the photo for health reasons; he was in another city having his eyes operated on.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra Hilda tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella. Vive con su madre quien tiene domicilio propio. Se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y ropa de mujer como ser zapatos, vestidos, etc., los cuales los compra en la feria, ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad. La competencia en este tipo de actividad es muy fuerte debido a que hay muchas promotoras de cosmeticos de diversas lineas. La Sra Hilda tiene varios clientes fijos a los que vende sus productos y tambien manda a España donde tiene su hermana quien tambien los vende alla. El credito sera invertido en la compra de mas mercaderia ya que a mayor monto de ventas ella tiene mayor margen de ganancia y mas premios. La Sra Hilda ha tenido un buen comportamientos de pago ya actualmente tiene un credito vigente en otra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is 32 years old, single and has no dependent children. She lives with her mother who owns her own house. She sells cosmetics and women's clothing such as shoes, dresses, etc, which she buys at the market – she already has a number of years of experience in this activity.

Her competency in this kind of activity is very strong given that there are a lot of people selling various brands of cosmetics. Señora Hilda has a number of fixed clients who buy her products and she also sends them to Spain where she has a sister who sells them.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise as with a larger amount of sales she gets a bigger margin of profits and more benefits. Señora Hilda has shown good payment behaviour and currently has a loan with another financial institution.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Durlescu

texts.en: M. Durlescu is 25 years old. She recently graduated from the agricultural university in Chisinau City. M. now wants to start her own business and needs the necessary working capital. For this purpose, she would like a loan from Microinvest. M. is grateful that Microinvest is willing to help young entrepreneurs who want to achieve their goals.

loans.use: Start a farming business

loans.name: Restauracion 1 Group

texts.en:
Restauracion is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their fifth loan from Esperanza International. This group hopes to utilize this loan to further establish their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels.

Regina is the coordinator for this group in the city of Hato Mayor. Regina plans to utilize this fifth loan to buy clothes in what's called "pacas", which are large bundles of clothing that can be of one kind (women's or children's, for example). Purchasing her merchandise in bulk will allow Regina to acquire a larger amount of items and keep her business well stocked for a longer period of time, at a smaller price.

Regina is committed to making her business grow as she dreams of one day owning her own large variety store and converting a room in her house to a store. Regina has 3 children, ages 22, 20 and 12. She hopes to provide a better education for them.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of new and used clothing

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: BETTY ES SOLTERA  TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN CASA PRESTADA, EL NEGOCIO QUEDA UBICADO EN EL BARRIO 24 DE JUNIO, ESPECIFICAMENTE EN EL COLEGIO DE LA LOCALIDAD, NO TIENE COMPETENCIA PORQUE ES EL UNICO KIOSKO ADJUDICADO EN DICHO ESTABLECIMIENTO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIAS (PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO) , BETTY TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO .
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and she is single. She lives in a house that is lent to her. Her business is in Barrio 24 de Junio. More specifically, it is on the local school grounds. Because her business is the only kiosk located there, she has no competition. The loan is to buy more merchandise to sell. Betty has a very good loan history.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise (Operating Capital)

loans.name: Sabina Aydee

texts.es: LA SRA SABINA TIENE 22 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA PERO VIVE EN CONCUBINATO, TIENE DOS HIJAS DE 4 Y 2 MESES DE EDAD; LA VIVIENDA EN LA QUE HABITA ACTUALMENTE  ES PROPIA. CUENTA CON UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA PARADA DE TRUFIS Y VEHICULOS QUE VAN AL CHACO, TIENE PENSIONADOS, ADEMÁS PREPARA Y VENDE EMPANADAS Y COSTILLITAS EN SU DOMICILIO LOS DÍAS DOMINGOS. SE DEDICA A ESTA ACTIVIDAD HACE MUCHO TIEMPO ATRAS, ANTES LO REALIZABA JUNTO A SU MADRE,PERO DESPUES SE COMPRÓ SU PROPIO PUESTO. CABE RECALCAR QUE EL NEGOCIO ESTÁ EN UNA BUENA UBICACIÓN, YA QUE EXISTE MUCHA AFLUENCIA DE PERSONAS, SOBRE TODO VIAJEROS. EL GRADO DE COMPETENCIA ES ALTO, YA QUE EXISTEN VARIOS PUESTOS SIMILARES ALREDEDOR, PERO AÚN ASÍ CUENTA CON MUCHOS CLIENTES. ESTE ES EL TERCER CRÉDITO AL QUE ACCEDE LA CLIENTE, MUESTRA UN COMPORTAMIENTO RELATIVAMENTE BUENO, YA QUE SI PRESENTÓ ATRASOS EN EL PAGO DE ALGUNAS DE SUS CUOTAS, SE DEBIÓ A LOS PROBLEMAS EXISTENTES EN EL DEPARTAMENTO, COMO PAROS CÍVICOS Y LA ESCAZES DE CARBURANTES, GAS LICUADO DE PETRÓLEO MÁS PROPIAMENTE, QUE IMPIDIERON EL NORMAL DESEMPEÑO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES, ADEMÁS DE QUE ESTABA EMBARAZADA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is 22 years old, single, lives with a partner, and she has two daughter ages 4 years and 2 months. She lives in her own home. She has a food stand at the transportation stop for buses and vehicles that are going to the countryside; she has renters, in addition she prepares turnovers and short ribs in her home on Sundays. She has been doing this work for quite some time, she used to work with her mother, but after some time she bought her own stand. She stresses that her stand is in a good location, as there is a great flow of people, above all travelers. The competition is high, as there are many similar stands in the area, but even so she has many customers. This is her 3rd loan, she has demonstrated relatively good payment history, as she was behind in some of her payments which she attributed to the problems in the state such as civic work stoppages and the shortages of fuel, propane, which impeded her normal activities; and in addition to these challenges she was pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and purchase supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for retail

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: LA SRA. RITA QUE CUENTA CON 43 AÑOS VIVE EN SU PROPIA CASA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO DE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD Y SUS TRES HIJOS DE 16, 14 Y 10 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE, UBICADA EN LA ZONA SUROESTE DE LA LOCALIDAD, MAS CONCRETAMENTE EN EL BARRIO SAN ANTONIO, EN SU DOMICILIO SU ESPOSO TIENE SU PEQUEÑA GRANJA ARTESANAL DE DONDE LE PROVEE POLLOS A SU ESPOSA CUANDO LOS TIENE. DOÑA RITA TIENE SU PUESTO DE VENTA DE POLLOS EN LA ZONA DEL MERCADO CENTRAL DE ESTA CIUDAD, PARTE EXTERNA. LLEVA BASTANTE TIEMPO EN EL NEGOCIO Y EN MUY BUENA UBICACION PLENA ESQUINA, POR LO CUAL CLIENTES NO LE FALTAN. LA COMPETENCIA ES MEDIANA PORQUE HAY OTRAS PERSONAS CON LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD. PERO EN SU LUGAR, NO HAY MAS QUE UNA, POR LO CUAL TIENE MUCHA CLIENTELA Y POR ENDE SALIDA DE SU PRODUCTO. DICE LA SRA. RITA QUE INVERTIO TODO EL CREDITO, BS. 3,500,-  EN EL DESTINO PREVISTO, COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION Y LE FALTO UN POCO MAS. ESTE SERIA EL SEXTO PRESTAMO DE LA SRA. RITA Y TODOS LOS ANTERIORES LOS A CANCELADO EXCELENTEMENTE. SU ESPOSO TIENE UN PEQUEÑO CREDITO VIGENTE Y PUNTUAL EN BANCA COMUNAL (AGROCAPITAL).
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old and lives in her own home along with her 49-year-old husband and her three children, who are 16, 14, and 10 respectively. The home is located southeast of town, specifically in the San Antonio neighborhood. At their home her husband has a small poultry farm and supplies Rita´s business. Doña Rita has a stand where she sells chickens outside the city´s central market. She has had this business for a long time and has a good location on a corner and always has customers. There is competition from others who have the same activity, but in her location there is only one other merchant and she always has a lot of customers. Rita will invest all her loan to buy construction materials. This will be her sixth loan and Rita has repaid all her previous loans on time. Her husband currently has a small loan and is also on time with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Shalom 1 Group

texts.en:
Group 1 from the Shalom Bank of Hope is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their sixth loan from Esperanza International.

Carolina C., the group coordinator, is 27 years old and has three children, ages 9, 6 and 4. She sells a variety of home items, but specializes in kitchenware. She will use this loan specifically to purchase cups, plates, cooking pots and pans, and silverware.

Carolina's goal is to succeed in her business, in order to be able to own a house. She also hopes that through the teachings in bank meetings, she can grow in her spiritual life.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase new kitchen items for sale

loans.name: Ademola

texts.en: Ademola is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells yam flour and palm oil. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more yam flour and palm oil to sell. She says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more yam flour and palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells medicine. The demands for her medicine are high. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She says, "Thanks to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: LUISA TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA, TODOS SUS HIJOS YA SON MAYORES DE EDAD, SU VIVIENDA ES PROPIA. POSEE EN SU DOMICILIO SU VENTA DE ABARROTES Y SE ENCUENTRA EN UNA ZONA BIEN ESTRATEGICA AL FRENTE DEL HOSPITAL DE SAAVEDRA. EL CREDITO LO INVERTIRA PARA COMPRA MATERIAL ESCOLAR Y ASI AMPLIARA MAS SU VENTA DE ABARROTES. CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION A TENIDO MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO Y CON OTRAS INSTITUCIONES TAMBIEN HA SIDO MUY RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
Luisa is 56 years old, single, and all her children are now adults. She owns her home. She sells groceries from her home, which is strategically located across from the hospital of Saavedra. She will invest her loan in school supplies and thereby expand her line of items for sale beyond groceries. With our institution she has a very good credit history and has also been very responsible with other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Durlescu

texts.en: V. Durlescu is a young entrepreneur who wants to start his own farming business. He is very motivated because he inherited 20 hectares of arable land from his grandparents in Gradiste, a village in the Cimislia district. As any young man who dreams of being independent, he wants to build a successful farm by himself. He would like a loan from MicroInvest to buy working materials for growing grain and vegetables, and to build a green house to start seedlings.

loans.use: Start a farming business

loans.name: Ayangoke Ayano

texts.en: Ayangoke sells electrical materials, and he also repairs generators. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He is 48 years old and he is married with 4 children. He lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. He says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: Abigil

texts.en: Abigil is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She sells goats and rams at Saja market in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. The demand for her goats and rams is high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and rams to sell.

loans.name: Lidio Luis

texts.es: LIDIO TIENE 56 AÑOS Y SU ESPOSA TIENE 49 AÑOS, AMBOS SON CASADOS, TIENEN UN HIJO QUE VIVE CON ELLOS Y QUE ACTUALMENTE ESTUDIA. VIVEN EN UNA VIVIENDA PROPIA, HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO, EN LA CUAL HA HECHO VARIAS MEJORAS, LUGAR DONDE HAN PUESTO UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, SU ESPOSA TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE LA COMIDAS. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA POR ESO TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA, ADEMAS  QUE ESTA EN BUENA UBICACION, NO HAY OTRO NEGOCIO POR ESTA ZONA, TAMBIEN EL TITULAR DEL CREDITO ES EMPLEADO EN EL INGENIO DE LA LOCALIDAD, DONDE TRABAJA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN MEJORAS EN SU INMUEBLE, ESTE CREDITO ES SU QUINTA OPERACION, HA TENIDO UN BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO EN AGROCAPITAL, PRESENTA DEUDAS EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS QUE SE PAGAN CON NORMALIDAD.
texts.en:
Lidio, 56, and his wife, 49, have a son who lives with them and is currently a student. They have made various improvements to their home, where they have lived for a long time, including the addtion of a business selling food. His wife has experience in food sales. There is not a lot of competition because the work is demanding. Additionally, it is a good location and there is not another business in this area. Also, the borrower is employed in the local mill, where he has been working for some time. The loan will be invested in building improvements. This is his fifth loan and he has had good credit with Agrocapital; he has debts with other financial institutions that he pays regularly.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building improvements

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells palm oil. Palm oil is an essential commodity in Nigeria and it is used in the preparation of local soup in Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Olagunju

texts.en: Olagunju sells drinks. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine and embroidering equipment

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas sells provisions, hair cream, and hair extensions. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and hair extensions to sell. Dorcas is 32 years old and married with a child. She hopes to own a big supermarket in future. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquire necessary tools and refurbish his workshop

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: VICTOR HUGO TIENE 50 AÑOS Y SU ESPOSA TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE, ELLOS SON ESPOSOS TIENEN 3 HIJOS, QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, SU VIVIENDA ES PROPIA, LOS CLIENTES SE DEDICAN AL FAENEO Y COMERCIALIZACION DE POLLOS,CHORIZO, HUEVOS, ETC. TIENE SU PUESTO PROPIO DENTRO DEL MERCADO GERMAN MORENO, LLEVA VARIOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN ESTE NEGOCIO, TIENE BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA ADEMAS QUE EL NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN LUGAR ESTRATEGICO. HAY COMPETENCIA DENTRO DEL MERCADO PERO ELLOS TIENE BASTANTE CLIENTELA POR LOS AÑOS QUE LLEVA TRABAJANDO EN EL MISMO LUGAR, ADEMAS QUE EN ESTE MERCADO HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA, EL CREDITO FUE INVERTIDO PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU VEHICULO EN EL TRANSPORTA LOS POLLOS DE SU PROPIEDAD A SU VENTA, TIENEN BUENOS ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS, ESTE ES SU OCTAVO CREDITO DEL SOLICITANTE CON UN EXCELENTE COMPROTAMIENTO CREDITICIO EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS, ACTUALMENTE TIENE DEUDA EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS QUE SE ESTAN PAGANDO CON NORMALIDAD. YA QUE SU NEGOCIO QUE ELLOS TIENEN ES RENTABLE.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo, 50, and his wife, 51, have 3 children currently in college. They own their home, and devote themselves to the hard work of selling chicken, chorizo, eggs, etc. Mr. Hugo has his own stand within German Moreno market that he has worked at for many years. Through this experience, a strategic location within the marketplace, and the popularity of the market itself, the stand has managed to continue attracting many customers despite competition. This loan will be used to invest in the maintenance of the vehicle Hugo employs to transport his chickens from his home to the stand. The family has an excellent credit history (this will be their 8th loan!). Previous loans have been paid back in full, and, due to the profitability of their business, they are currently right on schedule for repayment of those loans that are still outstanding.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle mantenance

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: LA SRA MARIANA C. TIENE 24 AÑOS,CUENTA CON UNA HIJA DE 8 AÑOS DE EDAD LA MISMA QUE ESTUDIA EN COLEGIO FISCAL, SOLTERA, CONTANDO CON CASA PROPIA DOTADA DE TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS, TRABAJA COMO SECRETARIA Y PERCIBE INGRESOS POR ASISTENCIA FAMILIAR, CONTANDO CON 3 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. SU TRABAJO COMO SE SECRETARIA LE PERMITE COLOCAR SUS PRODUCTOS EN SU ENTORNO DE FORMA QUE NO LE AFECTA LA COMPETENCIA. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA CONCLUSION DE LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU CASA EN LO QUE SIGNIFICA LA COMPRA DE MOSAICOS PARA SU BAÑO. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2007, CON 5 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, TAMBIÉN TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS.
texts.en:
Mariana C. is 24 years old and has an 8-year-old daughter who is in public school. She is a single mother and has her own home equipped with all the basic amenities. She sells cosmetics and has three years experience in the field. She also works as a secretary and receives family support payments. Her work as a secretary allows her to sell her products to her co-workers without any competition from other cosmetics vendors. This loan will be used to purchase bathroom tiles to complete construction on her house. She has been a client since 2007, with 5 loans and punctual repayments. She also has experience with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Candido Humberto

texts.es: Don Candido tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio camilo chamorro, su esposa le tiene tres hijos mayores de 13,15 y 18 años de edad, dos de ellos cursan la secundaria y uno esta en la universidad lo cual son muchos gastos es por eso se esfuerzo por salir adelante para apoyar a sus hijos a que tengan una buena educación que en  futuro puedan ser unos profesionales. Su negocio es la fabricación de colchones desde hace trece años esta elaborando los suaves colchones. Inicio trabajando en elaborar colchones en una empresa, luego ahorro y con su liquidación decidió comenzar. Lo cual hasta ahora se ha beneficiado ya que ha crecido en inventario, también da gracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha dado para mejorar su negocio, esta es la quinta solicitud, que quiere para invertir en la compra de cuatro quintales de tiras para la elaboración de colchones. Que espera obtener muchas ganancias con los pedidos y ventas. Sus metas a futuro es poder crecer y poder ofertar sus productos a diferente departamento del país
texts.en:
Candido is 50 years old and lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood. He and his wife have three older children, ages 13,15 and 18, two of whom are attending high school and one who is at a university, which is very expensive; It is for this reason that he strives to get ahead in order to support his children so that they receive a good education and can be professionals in the future. His business is mattresses production. For 3 years he has been manufacturing soft mattresses. He began working in mattress production in a business, then saved, and with his severance decided to begin. This has benefited him until now, as he has increased his inventory, also thanks to Afodenic for the support that they have given him to improve his business. This is his fifth application, which he requests in order to invest in the purchase of four 100 pound strips of material to manufacture mattresses. He hopes to gain a lot of profit with the requests and sales. His goal for the future is to be able to grow and to offer his products to different provinces around the country.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four 100 pound strips of material for mattress production

loans.name: Cicila

texts.en: Cicila O. sells sarongs. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. sells fish. She hopes to expand this business by meeting the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Iyabo is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. She says, "Thanks" to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: C.r.c Primary School, Kabala Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Christian Reform Church Primary School, Kabala. The Christian Reform Church Primary School Kabala was founded by Mr. Dennis De Groot and the school started its operations on the 26th of September 2007. At the end of the war, the school was set up with a desire to give quality education to the children of Koinadugu District and to rebuild good moral attitudes in the minds of the children by diligently teaching them the word of God. The school currently has 147 pupils with a staff of seven.

The school is still a new one with only classes one to five. Come next year, they will get their first group of pupils to write the National Primary School Examination (BECE). Only two years since its inception now, the school has gained a reputation for quality education. It is the only school in Kabala with a ratio of thirty pupils to one teacher. It has a very good resource center for both teachers and pupils. They encourage teachers from other schools to use their resource center. By comparison, their resource center is far more equipped than many secondary schools in the town (i.e. for the few schools that have a library). It is also the only primary school in Kabala that provides cooked rice to its pupils. Other primary schools either do not have this facility or manage to provide for their pupils with bulgur wheat supplied by the UNHCR.

This school is not a government-assisted school like the other schools in town; hence, it gets all these opportunities that are lacking in other primary schools. Its teachers receive their salaries from Frasirvalley Christian High School in Canada, and their salaries are said to be far better than government-sponsored schools. (Learn more about this school at http://kabalaschoolproject.blogspot.com).

The Christian Reform Church Primary School Kabala suffers from a few constraints. The school is situated far away from the town center, making it strenuous for both pupils and staff to come to school everyday. The continuing rise in the cost of food stuffs is also affecting the running of the school, and in addition to these, the school currently lacks enough drugs to give first aid to the children.

James T. K. (left) is the Head Teacher of the school. He was born in Koinadugu District and he is thirty-five years old. James is married and the couple have four children together: one is in secondary school, one in primary school, one in nursery and the last is still sucking. With this loan, James will buy building materials like bags of cement, truckloads of sand, and boards.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Yssac

texts.es: YSSAC TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, CUENTA CON DOS HIJOS INDEPENDIENTES, CASADO CUYA CONYUGUE SE ENCUENTRA DE VIAJE, LA FAMILIA VIVE EN CASA PROPIA DOTADA DE TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS. CUENTA CON SU PROPIA VAGONETA. YSSAC PERTENECE A LA ASOCIACION DE TRANSPORTE "JORGE NIEME" QUE CUBRE LA RUTA MONTERO-SCZ TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 5 AÑOS EN EL RUBRO. EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA SIN EMBARGO POR CONTAR CON PARADA FIJA UBICADA EN EL MERCADO VILLA VERDE HACE QUE TENGA BASTANTE CLIENTELA. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA COMPRA DE UNA LINEA DE TRANSPORTE DE FORMA QUE PUEDA CUBRIR OTRAS RUTAS. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2004, CON 5 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, EL MISMO QUE NO TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS.
texts.en:
Yssac is 50 years old and married with two grown children. His wife is away traveling at the moment but he and his family live in their own home which is equipped with the basic amenities. Yssac owns his own van and belongs to the "Jorge Nieme Transportation Society" which covers the Montero-SCZ route. He has five years of experience working in that area. There exists significant competition but since Yssac has an established stop located in the Villa Verde Market he gets plenty of customers. The loan will go towards the purchase of a new transportation line that will enable him to work on other routes. He has been a client since 2004 taking out five loans, and has a history of punctual payments. Yssac does not have a loan history with any other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a transportation line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish the inventory of his depot

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells clothes. She loves this business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She says, "Thanks to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Anteriormente María trabajaba de empleada en un centro comercial, donde se dedicaba armar carteras. Este fue su trabajo durante tres años, pero decidió dejarlo para poder cuidar a su única hija aún menor de edad.  María es separada de su esposo, entonces no pudo dejar un trabajo sin empezar otro, así que comenzó con un negocio de frutas muy pequeño.
Ahora son 5 años que María se dedica a su negocio y, gracias a los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pudo agrandar su negocio alquilando un puesto en el mercado e incrementando la variedad de productos que vende.
A parte de su negocio, desde hace seis años ella realiza cortes de cabellos eventualmente los fines de semana.
A sus 32 años María sueña en un futuro agrandar su negocio y darle más seguridad a su hijita.
texts.en:
María used to work as an employee in a shopping center, where she assembled wallets. This was her job for three years, but she decided to quit so she could take care of her only child, who was still young. María is separated from her husband and could not quit one job without starting another, which is why she started up a small fruit business. It has now been 5 years since María has worked at this and, thanks to loans from EDAPROSPO, she was able to grow her business and rent out a space in the market and increase the variety of products she sells. In addition to her business, for the past six years she has been cutting men´s hair on the weekends. At her 32 years, María dreams of expanding her business in the future and giving more security to her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: LA SRA ROSA TIENE 49 AÑOS,CUENTA CON DOS HIJOS (DE 17 AÑOS Y 22 AÑOS), SOLTERA, LA FAMILIA VIVE EN CASA PROPIA DOTADA DE TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS. CUENTA CON SU VENTA DE ABARROTES Y UN PUNTO INTERNET EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO CONTANDO CON 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. NO TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE ES UNA DE LAS VENTAS MAS SURTIDAS DEL BARRIO. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA COMPRA DE UN TELEVISOR Y PLAY STATION CON EL CUAL COMPLEMENTARA SU PUNTO INTERNET. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2002, CON 7 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, LA MISMA QUE TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old, has two children (17 and 22 years old) and is single. The family lives in their own home with all the basic services. In her home she has a grocery store and an internet cafe and has 5 years of experience in this. She does not have much competition since she is one of the most well-stocked stores in the neighborhood. This loan will be used to buy a television and a PlayStation with which she will complement the internet. She has been a client since 2002, with 7 loans with this instution and on-time payments, and has the same history with other loan institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a television and a PlayStation.

loans.name: Olusegun

texts.en: Olusegun sells phone accessories. The demand for his phone accessories is high, and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. Olusegun is 34 years old and he is married with 3 children. He says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, junto a su mamá, empezó desde cero a aprender a manejar una tienda, y le parece que todavía puede ‘crecer’ en su conocimiento del negocio. La idea de comenzar con su tienda de helados, gaseosas, dulces, jugos y salchipapas nació de la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá y proveerla de algún ingreso.
Anteriormente María trabajaba como contadora en una empresa. Se dedicó a esta ocupación durante cinco años tras haber conseguido su título en contabilidad. No obstante, cuando implementó el negocio de la tienda con su madre terminó por manejarla ella misma.
Su negocio tiene casi tres años, y está ubicado en un local que es parte de la casa de sus padres y ella lo alquila a ellos. Mientras que antes tuvo ayuda de un par de primas en el trabajo de la tienda ahora ella trabaja sola, y a veces recibe ayuda económica de su hermana. Por esto, hace cinco meses se juntó a EDAPROSPO y los préstamos la ayudan a llevar para adelante su comercio.
Sin embargo, a sus treinta y tres años María planea trabajar solo un par de meses más con la tienda, y luego a dedicarse a algo diferente por ella misma, ya que ni está casada ni tiene hijos.
texts.en:
María, together with her mother, started from nothing to learn how to run a store and she believes that she can still increase her knowledge of the business. The idea of starting a store for ice cream, soft drinks, candy, juices and salchipapas (a fast food dish of sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs and french fries) came out of the need to help her mother and have some income. María used to work as an accountant for a company. She worked at this occupation for five years after she graduated with her degree. However, after she started up the store with her mother she ended up running it herself. The business is almost three years old and is located in part of her parents´ home, which she rents from them. Before, she was helped in the store by a few of her cousins but now she works by herself and sometimes gets financial help from her sister. For this reason, five months ago she came to EDAPROSPO and receive a loan to help out her business. At her 33 years, María plans to work just a few more months in the store and then look for something different for herself since she is neither married nor has children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, drinks and candy for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Pedro Rivas se dedica a su actividad de ganadería y agricultura desde muy jovencito habiéndose destacado en esta actividad ya que es el sustento con que mantiene su humilde familia compuesto por su esposa e hijos.

Diariamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Pedro se traslada con su Ganado para dar lugar a la crianza y a la vez brinda asistencia a sus cultivos de papas, por las tardes regresa con el Ganado y esta es su tarea de todos los días. Actualmente el crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere para la inversión en los cultivos y en la crianza del ganado y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiado grandemente por medio de la entrega de su crédito que está solicitando.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Pedro Rivas has been dedicated to his job of cattle raising and farming since he was young. He has been prominent in this activity which is the sustenance that supports his humble family comprised of his wife and children. On a daily basis, from the early hours of the morning, Pedro moves his herd to allow for breeding and at the same time, provides assistance to his potato crops. In the evenings, he returns with his herd and this is his work every day. Currently, the loan that he has requested he wants for investing in his crops and in the raising of livestock. For this, he has sought out financial support from Ceprodel, hoping to benefit greatly through the delivery of the loan he's asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural and farming needs.

loans.name: Luisa Teresa

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y siete años Luisa tiene más de treinta  en su negocio: confección y arreglo de ropa. Su carrera empezó, tras sus estudios, en una empresa. Llevó su propia máquina al local de la empresa y trabajó allí durante un tiempo. No obstante, este trabajo quedaba muy lejos de su casa, por las noches se demoraba más de tres horas para regresar a casa, así que se animó a empezar su propio negocio de confección.
Entonces comenzó su comercio en casa, y ahora ya tiene seis máquinas, por que a veces los pedidos son tantos que necesita la ayuda de otras personas en su trabajo. Sin embargo, en este momento su taller está siendo remodelado, así que Luisa está dedicando la mayoría de su tiempo a su otra ocupación, promotora de un colegio particular. 
Hace dos años Luisa se juntó a otras señoras y fundó un colegio particular. Esto es en lo ella se ocupará en su futuro. Ahora, antes que empiecen las clases, está confeccionando las uniformes para los  alumnos.
texts.en:
At her sixty-seven years, Luisa has more than thirty years with her business: making clothing. Her career began after her studies with a company. She brought her own machine to the company's local shop and worked there for a time. Nevertheless, this job was located far from her home. At night she spent more than three hours commuting home. As a result, she was encouraged to start her own clothes-making business. So then she began her business in her home and now she has six machines because sometimes the orders are so large that she needs the help of other people for her work. Still, at this time, her shop is being remodeled so Luisa is dedicating most of her time to her other occupation, promotor of a private school. Two years ago, Luisa joined forces with other women and founded a private school. This is what she will occupy herself with in the future. Now, before classes begin, she is making uniforms for the students.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric so that her customers may choose with which material they want her to make their orders.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La sra. Adela reside ene. Barrió Isaías Gómez, en la ciudad de Managua
Y tiene 33 años de edad, con cinco hijos de3, 9, 10,12 y 18 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante ambulante de ropa, y otros productos. Doña Adela tiene una abarrotaría en el mercado, y por las noches vende fritanga para tener otros ingresos y poder subsistir ya que su familia es numerosa, con este crédito va  comprar granos básicos, y cereales, leche en pote entre otros para surtir su negocio. Sus planes es poner una pulpería en su casa y poder remodelar su infraestructura para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. a si como dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela lives in the neighborhood of Isaías Gómez in Managua. She is 33 years old and has five children aged 3, 9, 10, 12 and 18. Her husband is a salesman who sells clothing and other products. Mrs. Adela runs a stand in the market and sells fried snacks, "fritanga", in the evenings as a second source of income which helps her feed her large family. With this loan she plans to buy simple grains, cereals and bottled milk, among other things, to help stock her stand. Her plan is to remodel her home so that she can install a small store and provide better service to her customers and thus, provide an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Grains and Cereals

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es:
La mamá de Lidia también tenía un puesto en el mercado cuando era niña, es así que ella creció en “este mundo” y con esta “visión del negocio”: en el mundo de los vendedores del mercado. A sus cuarenta  años de edad ya tiene veinte con su propio puesto en el mercado y su negocio de venta de carne.
Además, Lidia también es inversionista. Con sus ahorros ya compró otro puesto en el mercado, hace seis meses, y tres años atrás  hizo construir un tercer piso en su casa,  los dos para alquilar y de esta manera tener unos ingresos más y asegurarse su bienestar en el futuro y el de su familia. Tiene dos hijos, un chico de 18 años y una niña de 13.
Para lograr estos objetivos Lidia se juntó a EDAPROSPO hace tres años, y sobre el préstamo grupal también saca uno individual, ya que sus buenas condiciones de trabajo se lo permiten. 
Sus planes siguen creciendo: ahora está planificando comprar aún otro puesto con sus ahorros futuros, y alquilarlo asimismo como sus otras propiedades.
texts.en:
Lidia's mother had a stall in the market when she was young. As a result, she grew up in "this world" and with this "vision of business": in the world of the market sellers. At her forty years of age, she already has twenty with her own market stall and her business selling meat. In addition, Lidia is an investor. With her savings, she bought another market stall six months ago and, three years ago, she built a third floor on hour house. Both are for renting out and in this way earn more income and assure her and her family's wellbeing in the future. She has two children: an 18 year old son and a daughter of 13. To achieve these goals, Lidia joined EDAPROSPO three years ago and, besides the group loan, has requested an individual one since her good working conditions allow it. Her plans are to continue to grow. Now she is planning to buy another stall with her future savings and to rent it out like her other properties.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest capital for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila de 31 años, es una mujer agradable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia de manera independiente con sus 3 pequeños hijos, luz de 9, Diana de 8 y Andrés de 4 años, lo que más desea es darle a sus hijos buenos estudios. En un pequeño puesto de venta, en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias) de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra Luzmila, ella empieza a vender sus tejidos artesanales desde muy temprano y por lo general es una de las ultimas en irse, ella se esfuerza en su trabajo porque quiere darle una adecuada educación a sus pequeños hijos, los cuales corresponden su dedicación con mucho amor.
A Luzmila le gusta tejer, mientras más lo hace se siente mejor, pero ya que trabaja en su casa siéndole muy difícil trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta, son ya 4 años los que lleva en el negocio y tiene mucha demanda, sobre todo en los turistas, ella espera que más adelante pueda tener una empresa de tejidos artesanales y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Es el primer préstamo de Luzmila en MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal siendo muy participativa, siempre esta ayudando al resto de las socias. Luzmila planea incrementar su capital de trabajo con el dinero del préstamo, invertirá todo en la compra de más lana, para hacer más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 31 years old. She is a personable and simple woman. She lives independently in her own house with her three small children: Luz who is 9, Diana who is 8 and Andrés who is 4 years old. What she wants most is to give her children a good education. You may find Luzmila in a small stall in the Laguna Temporal esplanade (a place where they have fairs) in the city of Juliaca. She begins to sell artesenal textiles early and, in general, she is one of the last to leave. She works hard at her job because she wants to provide adequate education to her small children, who return her dedication with a lot of love. Luzmila likes to sew since it makes her feel better. However, since she works in her house, she finds it very difficult to transport her textiles to her stall. It has been four years since she started her business and she has a lot of demand, from tourists, above all. She hopes that in the future she may have an artesenal textile company and improve her quality of life. This is Luzmila's first loan with MFP and she feels the responsibility to pay all of her repayments punctually. She participates a lot in her community bank, always helping the rest of the members. Luzmila plans to increase her working capital with the loan and will invest it all in the purchase of more wool in order to make more artesenal textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for her textiles.

loans.name: Deri René

texts.es:
Deri se dedica a tejer colchas de lana desde hace quince años. Conocidos le piden unos ciertos productos y ella los produce en su casa por las tardes. Las mañanas las dedica al  mercado donde vende verduras en su propio puesto. Empezó con este negocio hace diez años. Además, desde el mismo tiempo, en los fines de semana cocina y vende tamales, solo en algunas oportunidades atiende cuando le hacen pedidos grandes.

Deri es casada, y conduce el negocio del mercado junto a su esposo. Tienen tres hijos pero ya son todos mayores de edad e independientes.

A sus cincuenta y dos años está planeando usar sus futuros ahorros para implementar una tienda en su casa donde podría vender productos variados, abarrotes, golosinas y productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Deri has been dedicated to sewing wool blankets since she was 15 years old. Acquaintances request certain products and she makes them in her home in the evenings. During the day, she works in the market selling produce from her own stall. She began this business ten years ago. In addition, since the same time, on the weekends she cooks and sells tamales at some opportunities when large orders are made. Deri is married and she manages the business in the market with her husband. She has three children but they are all older and independent. At her fifty two years of age, she is planning to use her future savings to start a shop in her house where she would be able to sell various products: groceries, candy and products for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material for her sewing and ingredients for her tamales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a motorcycle to use as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 64 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y se siente en la responsabilidad de mejorar no solo su vida sino también la de su hija, con la que comparte el cuarto donde pasan sus días. Los 30 años que tiene Maria en el negocio de la venta de ropa, la han convertido en la vendedora más conocida de la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, su puesto es el más visitado por los clientes que buscan ropa de calidad a bajos precios, a los cuales siempre atiende de muy buen humor, ella es una vendedora por naturaleza y disfruta mucho haciéndolo, anhela para el futuro de su negocio, poner una tienda muy grande donde pueda surtir mejor las prendas que vende.
Maria tiene muchas dificultades consiguiendo ropa, ya que es muy exigente en sus pedidos, pero igual se las arregla para que no le falten los modelos más novedosos del mercado, para lograr sus metas esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho y no decae en su idea de salir adelante. Es el cuarto préstamo que adquiere Maria en MFP, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que siempre separa parte de sus ganancias para pagar sus cuotas, es muy respetada en su banco comunal, ya que es la socia de mayor edad. Con este nuevo préstamo, Maria planea incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería, invertirá los mil nuevos soles en la comprar ropa, para surtir mejor su puesto.
texts.en:
Maria is a 64-year-old woman, very happy and hard-working, who lives in a rented room and feels responsible for improving not only her life but that of her daughter as well, with whom she shares the room where they spend their days. Maria has been selling clothing for 30 years which has made her the best-known retailer of the Sunday market in Juliaca. Her stall is the most popular with customers looking for good quality clothing at low prices. She is always pleasant with her clients, a natural-born saleswoman and she enjoys her role. Her greatest wish for her business is to have a very large store where she could better stock the clothes she sells. Maria has a hard time finding clothing as she is very demanding, but she always manages to have the most fashionable clothing in the market. In order to achieve her goals she is prepared to work hard and she clings to her idea of becoming prosperous. This is Maria's fourth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual in her repayments as she always sets aside a portion of her profits to repay her loan. She is very much respected in her community bank as she is the eldest member. With this latest loan, Maria will increase the amount of clothing she has for resale; she will invest 1,000 soles to buy clothing in order to better stock her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia empezó con su negocio, una tiendita D. abarrotes que tiene en su casa, para ayudar a su esposo que se quedó sin trabajo. Necesitaban un ingreso, pero ella no quería estar lejos D. sus tres hijos, que ahora son mayores D. edad pero en aquel entonces todavía eran chiquitos y para cuidarlos mejor se animó a empezar con este negocio.
Cuando empezó solo tenía pocos productos, pero hace cuatro años empezó a sacar préstamos con EDAPROSPO y solo entonces pudo agrandar la cantidad y la variedad D. su mercancía

A sus cincuenta y cinco años Dionisia planea usar ahorros y ganancias futuras para mejorar y arreglar su tienda, para incrementar su negocio y asegurar un futuro más estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Dionisia started her business, a grocery store she has in her home, to help her husband who lost his job. They needed an income but she didn’t want to be away from her three children. They are grown up now but were still little back then. She decided to start with this business in order to take care of them better.

She only had a few products when she began, but four years ago she started getting loans through EDAPROSPO and only then was she able to increase the amount and variety of her merchandise.

Fifty-five-year-old Dionisia plans to use her savings and future profits to fix up and improve the store, increase her business and assure her family a more stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: La joven emprendedora Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez tiene 25 años, está soltera, tiene un hijo quien tiene la edad de 7 años. Por lo que en estos momentos está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresa ya que en sus planes esta el saber administrar de buena forma su negocio. La actividad económica de la joven Darling es la venta de cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes y pinturas de uñas entre otros. Su sueño es de emprender su propia empresa ya que la experiencia que ha obtenido le ha otorgado la confianza necesaria. El préstamo que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez is a young entrepreneur. She is 25 years old, single and has a seven-year-old son. She is currently studying business administration since she plans on knowing how to manage her business well. Young Darling works selling cosmetics such as powders, creams, perfumes and nail polishes among other things. Her dream is to start her own business since her experience has given her the confidence she needs. She is applying for a loan of 6.000 Córdobas in a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana es una joven de 25 años, es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, con su pequeño hijo Carlos de 4 años, a quien desea darle una buena vida y brindarle unos buenos estudios. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se encuentra Tatiana, ella tiene un locutorio donde aprovecha para vender sus flores artificiales, en un pequeño rinconcito vende rosas, claveles, violetas, etc, son flores muy bonitas y aun precio accesible. Ella disfruta de conversar con otras vendedoras y no pierde la oportunidad de venderles una flor para que adornen sus puestos, pero sufre mucho para conseguir las flores, ya que las trae desde Bolivia. Tatiana lleva ya 4 años con este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda más grande dedicada solo a la venta de flores artificiales, de esta manera podrá pagar los estudios de su querido hijo. Este es el primer préstamo de Tatiana con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los 400 nuevos soles del préstamo Tatiana planea comprar más flores para surtir mejor su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 25-year-old young woman. She is a single mother and lives at home with her parents and her little 4-year-old son Carlos. She wishes to give him a good life and offer him a good education. Tatiana can be found at the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in Juliaca). She has a phone center where she also sells her artificial flowers. She sells roses, carnations, violets, etc. in a small corner. They are very pretty flowers and priced reasonably. She enjoys talking with the other sellers and doesn’t miss an opportunity to sell them a flower to decorate their stalls. She suffers a lot in order to get the flowers since she brings them from Bolivia. Tatiana has been in this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. She still doesn’t feel fulfilled since she would like to open a bigger store just to sell artificial flowers in order to pay for her dear son’s education. This is Tatiana’s first loan with MFP. She knows she has to meet her payments and she hopes to be able to do that. Besides, she doesn’t want to cause problems for her community bank where she was well received. Tatiana plans to buy more flowers with the four hundred nuevos soles from the loan to supply her business better and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Luz Rosario

texts.es:
Luz lleva casi tres años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. Su negocio está compuesto de compra y venta de ropa que empezó hace seis años, y también se dedica a la venta de postres y jugo de néctar por litro, que empezó a producir recién hace dos años. Se animó a empezar con la venta de jugo de néctar porque anteriormente estuvo en un taller donde aprendió a elaborar el producto final.
Anteriormente no trabajaba, se dedicaba al cuido del hogar y de sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad.
Con las ganancias que tiene ahora Luz se encarga de pagar la luz y el agua, y comprar varias cosas que se necesiten en la casa. Además,  junta parte de sus ganancias a las de su conviviente para cubrir gastos básicos y seguir construyendo su hogar.
Hace unos años una ONG llamada ADRA le regaló un horno. Por lo tanto, a sus cuarenta y tres  años Luz está planificando ampliar este horno para poner una pastelería en su casa y dedicarse a este negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Luz has been an EDAPROSPO client for almost three years. She operates a business buying and selling clothes that she started six years ago. She's also earned extra money for two years selling deserts and juice drinks that she recently started making herself. She got the idea to make her own juice drinks at a shop where she worked and learned to make it. Before that, she hadn't worked outside the house. She worked at home, taking care of the house and her three children, two of whom are now grown. With her earnings, Luz is now responsible for paying for light and water and buying various things for the home. She also combines her earnings with her partners to cover basic household expenses and to continue construction on their house. Some years ago, an NGO called ADRA gave her an oven. Now, at forty-three years old, Luz is planning to expand the oven so that she can set up a pastry shop in her house, a business that will allow her to earn a more stable living.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita empezó con su negocio, una tiendA de abarrotes, para tener un comercio de donde podía sacar comida incluso si no tenía muchos ingresos algunos días. Siempre ha estado vendiendo poquito, pero desde que empezó a adquirir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, hace cuatro años, pudo incrementar la cantidad y la variedad de sus productos.
A sus cincuenta y seis años Felicita vive con su única hija y su nieto. Su hija tiene otro trabajo y con las ganancias la apoya en la economía de la casa. Entre las dos logran cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.
Felicita siente que estos son tiempos precarios y de violencia, y por esta razón una de sus prioridades para el futuro es de ponerle seguridad a su tienda, para prevenir algún robo – que han sido frecuentes en los últimos tiempos en la zona.
texts.en:
Felicita started her business, a grocery store, so that no matter how much or how little she earned, she would always be able to pick up food for her family. She's always made a living selling here and there but since she started getting loans from EDAPROSPO four years ago, she's been able to increase the quantity and variety of her products. At fifty-six, Felicita lives with her only daughter and her grandson. Her daughter has another job and she contributes to paying the costs of the household. Between the two of them, they manage to cover all the household expenses. Felicita feels these are precarious, violent times and, consequently, one of her priorities for the future is to make her store safe from robbery, a frequent problem in the neighborhood recently.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth es una joven muy decidida, a sus 24 años ya es conciente que tiene que trabajar mucho para alcanzar sus metas, ella vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres y siente que es hora de mejorar su vida. A los 19 años ya sabía que sólo trabajando duro iba a salir adelante, es por eso que decidió ayudar a sus padres en el negocio familiar y aprendió a tejer artesanías, ahora ya con 5 años de experiencia, tiene su negocio propio de tejidos artesanales, los cuales vende en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), es una vendedora muy convincente y alegre, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes. Ella desea tener una tienda exclusiva de tejidos artesanales, ya que le gusta mucho tejer y más si son artesanías, lo único difícil de su trabajo es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta y esto le demanda muchos gastos. A pesar de todo ella es muy feliz y quiere mejorar su futuro y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Este es el segundo préstamo de Yaneth con MFP y piensa pagarlo a tiempo, igual como hizo con el anterior crédito, ya que no falló en ninguna de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida y recibe el apoyo de todas las socias ya que es muy joven aún. Con este dinero incrementará su capital de trabajo, ya que desea comprar más lana para tejer más artesanías y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a determined young woman and, at 24, she is already aware that she has to work hard to meet her goals. She lives alone in the house that her parents left her and feels that now is the time to improve her life. Even at 19, she knew that working hard was the only way to get ahead so she decided to help her parents with the family business and learn to weave and make local crafts. Now, with 5 years experience, she has her own crafts business. She sells her products on the esplanade at Laguna Temporal (where the local market at Juliaca is sited). She's a persuasive and friendly saleswoman and, consequently, she has a lot of regular customers. She hopes to have an exclusive shop selling local crafts because she likes weaving and especially the art that goes into her products. The only difficult thing about her business is moving her goods to the place where she sells them, a big expense for her. Despite everything, Yaneth is happy and wants a better future, something she knows she will get with hard work. This is Yaneth's second MFP loan and she believes she will repay it on time, just like she did the last one. She didn't miss a single payment. She's very dear to her community bank and has the support of all its members because, after all, she's still a very young woman. With this money, she will add to her working capital. She wants to buy more wool to make her crafts and better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for crafts business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene tres años con su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes. Se animó a empezar este comercio para “salir adelante”. Anteriormente en los días trabajaba de limpieza tres o cuatro veces a la semana, mientras que en las noches todavía trabajaba de enfermera en un hospital desde las 20.00h pm hasta las 8.00h am.

Nilda estudió para se enfermera, pero no pudo seguir con su carrera y sacar su título por falta de dinero. No obstante, el jefe de la empresa donde trabajaba de limpieza sabía que ella había estudiado, y cuando su papá se puso enfermo él la contrató para cuidarlo en las noches. Así empezó su carrera de enfermera.

A sus 37 años, y con sus 24 horas de trabajo al día, Nilda comparte los gastos del hogar, y la crianza de sus dos hijas menores de edad, con su conviviente que es taxista pero de un carro alquilado.

En el futuro le gustaría comprar útiles y agrandar su tienda para cimentar su negocio y asegurar una vida más estable para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nilda has had her business, a grocery store, for three years. She was inspired to start this business to "get ahead." Previously, she worked three or four days a week cleaning, while at night she was still working as a nurse in a hospital from 10pm until 8am. Nilda studied to be a nurse, but she could not continue her career and gave up her title due to lack of money. Nevertheless, the boss of the business where she worked as a cleaner knew that she had studied, and when his father became ill, he contracted her to care for him during the nights. Thus began her career as a nurse. At 37 years old, and working 24 hours/day, Nilda shares the household expenses and the raising of her two underage daughters with her partner, who is a taxi driver, but of a rented taxi. In the future, she would like to buy tools and expand her store to strengthen her business and ensure a more stable life for all of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandra Patricia

texts.es: Alejandra Patricia R. R. tiene 27 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijas. Esta joven tiene muy buenos propósitos para con su negocio seguir manteniendo esta fuente de ingresos ya que es el único medio de supervivencia para su familia. Su actividad económica es la venta de oro laminado y plata, así que la venta de estos productos la realiza de manera ambulante y lo ofrece a sus familiares y compañeros. Su deseo es de establecerse con sus productos en algún mercado en donde pueda exponer sus productos por lo que necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de variedad de productos. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 5.500 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Alejandra Patricia R. R. is a 27-year-old married mother with 2 children. This young woman has very good goals in order to keep her business afloat because it is her family’s sole source of income. She sells silver and gold-plated jewelry for a living as a street vendor, offering her merchandise to family and friends. She wishes to establish her business in some market where she can display her products, which is why she needs business capital to purchase a greater variety of products. She is requesting a loan for C$5,500.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
Jovana es una joven de veintidós años. Siendo muy joven tuvo una hija quien ahora tiene cinco años. Ella es su principal motor para trabajar y planear un futuro mejor.

Hace algunos años, gracias a un programa llamado PROJOVEN que brindaba el Ministerio de trabajo de su país, estudió cursos de confección de tejidos. Dentro del mundo del negocio ella empezó vendiendo ropa por pedidos. Compraba ropa al por mayor y luego re vendía las prendas a un mayor precio visitando  a amigos y familiares. 

A este trabajo estuvo dedicándose alrededor de un año. No hace mucho consiguió un trabajo junto a una señora. Desde hace tres meses Yovana se encarga de hacer control de calidad  en la empresa de la señora.

Más adelante ella piensa abrir un taller de confección propio.
texts.en:
Jovana is a young woman of 22. When she was very young she had a daughter who is now five years old who is her motivation for working and planning a better future. A few years ago, thanks to a programme called PROJOVEN offered by the Ministry of Labour in her country, she studied weaving. She ventured into the world of commerce, starting with selling clothes on order. She purchased clothing wholesale and later retailed the items at a better price, visiting friends and family. She was in this line of business for roughly one year. Not long ago she found work with a woman. For the past three months Yovana has been responsible for quality control in this woman's business. In the future, she is thinking of opening her own dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma Ciriaca

texts.es:
Durante veintitrés años Irma se dedico a atender en su puesto de condimentos y especerías en el mercado de su localidad. No le iba mal en su negocio, sin embargo creyó necesario mudarse a su casa y emprender uno nuevo  ya que quería dedicarle mas tiempo a su única hija de dieciséis años.

Es así que hace un año dejó su puesto del mercado, que ahora lo alquila a una tercera persona, y diariamente, como ambulante, vende desayunos y jugos en la esquina de su casa.

Irma es una persona muy alegre que vela por el bienestar de su pequeña familia. Por ahora esta renovando sus electrodomésticos poco a poco ya que dentro de un periodo de tiempo piensa construir en la esquina de su casa una juguería.
texts.en:
For 23 years Irma manned her condiments and spices stall in her local market. Business was not bad but she felt nevertheless that she had to move her business to her home and open a new one as she wanted to spend more time with her only daughter of 16. And so a year ago she left her stall in the market, which she now rents to a someone else, and every day she sell breakfasts and toys at the street corner by her house. Irma is a very happy person who watches out for the wellbeing of her little family. She is now fixing her home appliances little by little as in a short while she is thinking of building a stall at the corner of her home from which to sell juices.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new stall to sell juices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo Marcio D. U. tiene 46 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan y tienen 22, 19, y 9 años individualmente. Anteriormente, Nilo Marcio poseía un trabajo pero debido a que la empresa en donde trabajaba realizo recorte de personal por el bajo presupuesto del gobierno, él fue uno de los despedidos. Es así que da comienzo a su negocio con la venta de recargas y gaseosas. Más tarde con algunos préstamos realizados a fundación su negocio creció y con esto ha podido invertir en la compra de pan y de esta forma poder venderlo. Su sueño es de comprar un vehículo con el que pueda salir a vender verduras y pan. El va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 10.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nilo Marcio D. U. is a 46-year-old married father with 3 children, ages 22, 19, and 9, who all work. Nilo Marcio was previously employed at a company, but due to government budget cuts, he was one of the personnel who was let go. Thus, he decided to start a business selling cellular phone minutes and soft drinks. His business later grew thanks to loans from the foundation. He has now been able to invest the loans in purchasing bread in order to sell it. He dreams of purchasing a vehicle with which he can go out and sell vegetables and bread. He is requesting a loan for C$10,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
A sus cincuenta y ocho años, Estela no se limita cuando de pensar en implementar un nuevo negocio se trata. 

Hace diez años por la mañana vende abarrotes y pollo en un mercado improvisado muy cerca de su casa. Por la s tardes se dedica a manejar su tienda ubicada en su misma casa. Aunque empezó con su tienda, se animó a vender también en el mercado ya que había mucho mas movimiento de clientes y posibilidad de vender más.

No obstante, la tarea de ganar un espacio en aquel mercado no fue fácil, pues al inicio, ese lugar, estaba lleno de basura. Gracias al permiso de la municipalidad, ellas y unas socias, pudieron limpiarlo y ser acreedoras de un puesto. En un futuro quisiera construir su puesto con material de concreto y abrir una juguería

Todos sus esfuerzos lo hace con el fin de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su última hija de doce años, quien padece de retardo mental.
texts.en:
At fifty-eight years of age, Estela does not limit herself when thinking about a new business. Since ten years ago, in the morning, she sells groceries and chicken in an improvised market very close to her home. In the afternoon, she tends to her store located in her own home. Even though she started with her store, she decided to also sell in the market because there were more customers and gave her the possibility to sell more. However, the task of gaining a space in that market was not easy, because in the beginning that place was full of trash. Thanks to the permit from the municipality, she and some associates, they were able to clean it and get a space. In the future, she would like to have her own stand made out of concrete and open a juice stand. The goal of all her efforts is to be able to offer a better quality of life to her twelve-year-old daughter, who suffers of mental retardation.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying vegetables, pasta, and milk for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jhonny Antonio

texts.es: El joven Jhonny tiene 29 años de edad, reside en el barrio Riguero de los talleres moderno 5 c al este, en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene una niña de 8 años de edad, ella vende productos de cosmético. El se desempeña en servicio de seguridad desde hace tres años. Anteriormente vendía ropa junto con su esposa, pero para obtener un salario fijo ya que abecés no le iba también en las ventas. Con este crédito va a comprar mercadería variada para que su esposa siga con el negocio de la venta de ropa y otros productos que sastifagan la necesidad del cliente. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener una tienda surtida en mercaderías y dejar de trabajar y dedicarse a tiempo completo al negocio.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 29 years old and lives in the Riguero neighbourhood in Managua. He has an 8-year-old daughter with his wife, who sells cosmetic products. He has been working in security for three years. He previously sold clothing together with his wife, but his sales weren’t going well enough to gain a steady income. With this loan he will purchase various merchandise so that his wife can continue to sell clothing and other products to satisfy customer needs. His future plans are to have a shop selling a variety of merchandise and to quit working in order to dedicate himself full-time to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and various products

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
A raíz de que sus hijos empezaron a trabajar en un centro comercial, se fue dando cuenta de la demanda que existía de parte de los trabajadores para poder vender menús como pensión, es decir un servicio delivery al centro de trabajo. Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos fue haciéndose conocida y hoy en día cuenta con un número regular de clientes a quien reparte almuerzo a diario.

Por otro lado,  Delma se dedica también a vender productos de belleza en sus tiempos libres y por las noches vende salchipapas.

Su esposo trabaja como albañil y entre ambos contribuyen a cubrir los gastos de la casa. Sus seis hijos ya son independientes, por ello en un futuro quisiera abrir un restaurante en su  propia casa.
texts.en:
When her children started to work in a commercial center, she realized that there was demand by the workers for daily homemade meals. That is, a delivery service of meals to their workplace. Thanks to the support of her children, she became well known and nowadays she has a regular number of customers to whom she delivers a daily lunch. In addition, Delma also sells beauty products in her free time, and at night, she sells salchipapas (meat and potatoes fast food dish). Her husband works as a laborer, and together they contribute to the household expenses. Their six children are already independent, and so they would like to open their own restaurant in their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing a cart for selling fast food (salchipapas)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic supplies and a machine

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Antes de construir su casa, Celestina trabajaba en un mercado ubicado en el centro de la capital. Ella tenía un puesto ambulante donde vendió verduras durante dieciocho años.

Gracias al gobierno en aquel tiempo pudo construir  su casa y a la vez un espacio para abrir una tienda.  Es así que decide abandonar su negocio en el mercado y se muda a su casa no solo para emprende un nuevo negocio, la principal razón fue proveerle un futuro mejor a su hijo menor quien tenia los deseos de estudiar en ese entonces en la universidad.

Hoy, desde hace seis años, vende golosinas y bebidas embotelladas Ahora ella vive con su nieto de cinco años, de quien se encarga de mantener y criarlo.

Viajar a su ciudad natal y construir un hotel de turistas esta dentro de sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Before building her house, Celestina worked in a market located downtown in the capital city. She had a pushcart where she sold vegetables for eighteen years. Thanks to the government, she was able to build her house and at the same time a space to open a store. This is why she decided to leave her business at the market and move to her home, not only to start a new business, but mainly to offer a better future to her son who wanted to go to college back then. Now, for the past six years, she has sold candy and bottled beverages. She lives with her five-year-old grandchild, whom she tends to and is raising. Her future plans are to go back to her hometown and build a hotel for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying drinks, sodas, and water for her business.

loans.name: Los Lirios 4 Group

texts.en:
The group 4 from Los Lirios Bank of Hope is ready to receive their first loan. This is a group of entrepreneurs who live in Los Alcarrizos, a large county on the northeastern outskirts of Santo Domingo. Evelyn is 36 years old and has 3 children. She has some college education, but has not been able to finish. She runs a small beauty salon in her home where she offers basic beauty services like washing, blow drying, and perms. Evelyn hopes this loan will be the first step to expanding her business and making it grow into the big beauty parlor she dreams of. She hopes this will be a mean for her to provide a better education for her children and to finish her own.

In the picture, we can see the 5 bank members in Evelyn´s salon, which is located in her garage. On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase beauty products for salon services

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Group 4 of the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Bank of Hope is now in its second loan cycle. Marilandy V. is the group coordinator. She is married and has 2 children. She and the other group members live in Batey Palmara, a small community, part of Los Alcarrizos, outside Santo Domingo (Dominican Republic´s capital city).

Marilandy´s first loan was used for her fried chicken business. Now for her second loan, Marilandy has started a new venture: a tire-selling business where she can repair and sell second-hand tires. She has found that sometimes people have problems with their tires while passing by her isolated area and there was no one offering that service. She hopes she can establish herself in these two very different markets (food and vehicle repair) in order to build a better future for herself and her family.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase various essentials for their small businesses

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, habita en anexo villa libertad entrada principal 6 cuadras al sur ½ c al este, junto a su esposa e hijos,  su negocio es un taller de zapatería que inicio con su papa desde muy joven pues era el trabajo que realizaba. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materia prima para realizar su trabajo, va a comprar cuero,  suela, y lo necesario para realizar su trabajo de zapatero y poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
