A corto plazo espera comprar una maquina para confección de zapatos, y poyar a sus hijos que estudien para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and children 6 blocks south and a half block east of the main entrance to Anexo Villa Libertad. He runs a shoe repair business which his father started and which he has worked at since he was very young. This loan application is to buy the raw material (leather, rubber, etc.) necessary to do his job and to provide high-quality services to his customers. In the short term, he hopes to buy a machine to aid him in his work and to support the studies of his sons so that they can grow up to be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Belermina

texts.es:
Belermina se dedica a vender papa rellena y gelatina los fines de semana en un puesto ambulante fuera de su ciudad, negocio en el cual felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Ella empezó vendiendo en un puesto cerca de su casa, sin embargo decidió mudarse ya que la competencia era cada vez más grande.

Siempre se ha ganado la vida cocinando y vendiendo. Por ahora, además de tener su negocio os días restantes de la semana se ocupa en colaborar en el comedor popular desde hace quince años.

Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción y también como pintor, esto depende de las oportunidades. Cuando ambos reúnan el dinero suficiente planean abrir una tienda de bebidas o de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Belermina is dedicated to selling papa rellena (stuffed potatoes) and gelatin on weekends in a traveling stand outside the city, a business which she does happily with the help of her children. She began selling from a stand near her house, but she decided to move because the competition was always getting bigger. She always has earned a living cooking and selling. For now, aside from having her own business, she is busy working the remaining days of the week at the popular dining hall and has done so since fifteen years ago. Her husband works as a construction worker and also as a painter, depending on the opportunities. When they gather sufficient money, they plan to open a beverage or grocery store in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic ingredients for her business

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es: El Sr., Alberto es un hombre  bien trabajador, pues tiene dos trabajo es taxista y soldador desde hace veinte años,  el cual con ahorros compro las herramientas, y el taxi por medio de financiamiento, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa es ama de casa y con dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad que cursan la secundaria. Con este crédito es el séptimo que quiere para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con estos créditos que Afodenic ha otorgado han sido de muchos beneficios para su vida personal, como en su trabajo para salir adelante con los negocios. Sus metas es comprar otra unidad de taxi, y poder dar estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alberto is a hard working man. He has worked as a taxi driver and a welder for 20 years, using his savings to buy hardware and to help finance his taxi. He is 48 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación. His wife is a house wife and his 15 and 17 year-old children are in high school. This loan, his seventh, will be used for maintenance on his vehicle in order to provide better service to his customers. The loans that he has received from Afodenic have benefited him personally as well as helped his business to grow. His goal is to purchase another taxi, and to educate his daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es: Virginia Patricia Rodríguez Ríos tiene 49 años, está casada, y tiene cuatro hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan o estudian, y tienen 24, 21, 20, y 19 años, respectivamente. Doña Virginia tiene de poseer este negocio hace más de 30 años, ella inicio este negocio desde que era muy joven ya que sus padres ejercían esta actividad. Más tarde, Doña Virginia decidió independizarse por su propia cuenta logrando sufragar los gastos de su familia. La ventad de sus productos las realiza en el mercado central, por lo que es muy importante para ella poseer capital de trabajo. Por eso,  Doña Virginia buscó la ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y con un préstamo de Kiva, ella va a vender una variedad más grande de productos en el mercado. Sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El monto que solicita es de C$ 12.000 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Virginia Patricia Rodríguez Ríos is a 49-year-old married mother with four children, ages 24, 21, 20, and 19, who all either work or study. Ms. Virginia has been in business for over 30 years, starting out at a very young age because her parents were also in this trade. Virginia later went independent, thus managing to cover the family expenses. She sells her products at the central market, so it is very important for her to have business capital, which is why she sought the help of Fundación León 2000. With a loan from Kiva, she will offer a greater variety of products at the market. She dreams of improving her home. She is requesting a loan for C$ 12.000 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Su espíritu emprendedor ha permitido que Esther sea una madre ejemplar para sus dos hijos de diecinueve y veintidós años. Ella cuenta que empezó a trabajar desde los trece años. Siempre vendiendo diversas cosas, en tiendas o en puestos ambulantes. No obstante, en sus tiempos libres ella gustaba del tejido de lana y confeccionaba prendas pequeñas. No fue sino hasta que tejió una chompa grande para adulto que la gente empezó a apreciar su arte.

Poco a poco los pedidos han ido incrementando, pero también su visión de negocio, es por ello que gozando de sus habilidades también vende tamales los fines de semana en las mañanas. Esta fue una de sus primeras labres que hoy en día, gracias a su empeño y buen sabor, continúa desde hace veintitrés años.

Como madre y padre de sus hijos sus únicos planes para el futuro se basan con la idea de ver a sus hijos estudiar una carrera. Por ahora, estaba averiguando cuando le cuesta abrir una fuente de soda en su misma casa.
texts.en:
Esther's enterprising spirit has allowed her to be an exemplary mother for her two children of ages 19 and 22. She says that she began to work at age 13. She was always selling different things in stores or in traveling stands. However, in her free time she liked to knit with wool and make little clothing garments. It wasn't until she knit a big sweater for an adult that the people began to appreciate her art.

Little by little the orders were increasing, but in her business vision, she also wanted to enjoy her cooking abilities by selling tamales in the mornings on weekends. This was one of her first jobs, and thanks to her determination and good taste, she continues to do this business after 23 years.

As a mother and father of two children, their only plans for the future are based in the dream of seeing their kids study for a career. For now, they are ascertaining the funds to open a soda shop in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Los Laureles 1 Group

texts.en:
The group 1 from the "Los Laureles" Bank of Hope, a group of 5 entrepreneurs, live in Los Alcarrizos, on the northwestern outskirts of Santo Domingo, the capital city. Pressina H. is the group coordinator. She is divorced and has no children.

Pressina, like many of the group members and the people who live in her area, is a Haitian inmigrant. She barely has elementary school education. Pressina sells clothes as her micro-business. Some of the other group members´ businesses are food stands and small grocery/convenience stores. Pressina hopes that taking loans to expand her merchandise and be able to satisfy a larger clientele will allow her to be financially independent one day and live in better conditions. She also hopes her business reaches a point where she makes enough profits to help others in need.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase a wider variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra., Trinidad tiene 37 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad que cursan la secundaria, su esposo es albañil, doña Trinidad trabaja de conserje en una Terminal de buses el Mayoreo que son los buses que viajan al norte del país, es un trabajo agotador pues desde la mañana hay que estar limpiado para dar un buen servicio de higiene  a los clientes. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, y poder gozar de una casa digna para su familia que gracias a Afodenic esta logrando cumplir sus objetivos. Sus metas como madre es ver a sus hijos unos profesionales para que puedan tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. R. M. is 37 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua. Her children are 15 and 18 years old; they live with her and attend high school. Her husband is a builder. She works as a caretaker in a large bus terminal, from which buses travel to the northern part of the country. Her work is exhausting because from the morning the terminal must be clean to give good service to the customers. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to improve her house and will be able to enjoy a decent house with her family. Thanks to Afodenic she is achieving her objectives. Her aim as a mother is to see her children become professionals, so they can have a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to remodel her house

loans.name: Mayra Rosa

texts.es: Mayra Rosa M. A. tiene 49 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos. Doña Mayra empezó con un pequeño horno produciendo pan, pero las cantidades de producción era muy pequeñas.  Hace más de cinco años que tiene de poseer su negocio, y por eso, ella le proporcionaba ganancias para invertir en este negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Mayra son de mantener la atención de sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende la venta de pan. Más tarde, logra realizar un préstamo en Kiva para capital de trabajo ya que necesita la compra de materia prima para que su negocio pueda salir adelante. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 20.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Mayra Rosa M. A. is 49-years old, married, and has two children. Mayra began baking bread in her small oven in small quantities. She has run her business for over five years, always investing some of her earnings back into the business. Mayra's priority is good customer service, since her sales depend on her clients. She needs a working capital loan from Kiva to buy raw materials and advance her business. Mayra will repay the loan amount of 20,000 córdobas (NIO) over a period of 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Durante ocho años Isabel se dedico a vender productos de belleza. No le iba nada mal pero cuando se animo a vender por temporada navideña  el año pasado, decidió cambiar de negocio. Es así que desde inicios de este año vende como ambulante diversos productos según la temporada. Ella tiene planes de crecer en el comercio, es por ello que actualmente se encuentra averiguando el costo de un local para abrir su tienda. 

Por otro lado, también dedica gran parte de su tiempo a la administración del comedor popular de su localidad. Desde hace veinte años que, junto con unas compañeras, mantiene el comedor en funcionamiento, siendo ella la fundadora de este

Su esposo trabajaba en el banco industrial pero el cambio de gobierno hizo cerrar estos bancos y ahora él trabaja como albañil.

Entre ambos ayudan a mantener el hogar y la crianza de sus dos menores hijos.
texts.en:
For eight years, Isabel was dedicated to selling beauty products. The business never went poorly for her, but when she began to sell for Christmas time last year, she decided to change businesses. This is how, since the start of this year, she began to sell in ambulatory manner various products according to the season. She has plans to grow in her business, which is why she is presently acquiring the funds for a site to open her business.

On the other side, she also dedicates a great part of her time to managing the popular canteen in her area. For twenty years, along with some friends, she has maintained the canteen in functioning order, and she was also the founder of it.

Her husband works in the industrial bank but the change in government caused these banks to close and now he works as a mason.

Between the two of them they work to maintain their home and raise their two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Downpayment for a site to open up a store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres De Paciencia Group

texts.en:
Calina J. owns a clothing store outside of the city of Cabarete, near the small community she lives in called La Bombita. She is the leader of the Bank of Hope named "Mujeres de Paciencia" or in English, "Women of Patience." The bank has 10 people in it, most of whom sell food products in their community.

All ten of these women left Haiti and moved to the Dominican Republic for greater opportunities. Many only speak Haitian Creole and have fewer opportunities than most Dominicans because they cannot speak Spanish. Calina sells perfume, cream, undergarments, and other beauty products. She will purchase additional products with her loan to sell in her store. Many of her group members will replenish the stock in their stores also.

Calina has been married four years to her husband Rafael and has a daughter who is eight years old. She first heard of Esperanza from an associate and decided she would like a loan to help her with her business. This is the first Esperanza loan for "Mujeres de Paciencia," and they are excited for this great opportunity!

On behalf of Calina, Mujeres de Paciencia, and all of us at Esperanza International, we thank you for your contribution and desire to make a direct impact in fighting poverty!

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell in store

loans.name: Luz De Paz 1 Group

texts.en:
The Luz de Paz (Light of Peace) Bank of Hope members all live in Los Alcarrizos. This group of five ladies is on their second loan cycle. Rosa E. is the group coordinator and has a ¨colmado¨, a small grocery store where you can also find other convenience items. Some other group members have similar businesses.

Rosa is 27 years old and lives with her spouse and her 5 children. She was unable to complete basic education (elementary and middle school) so one of her biggest concerns is her children´s education. She hopes she can provide better for them in that matter, which is why she is committed to making her business grow enough to produce profits that will allow her to send her children to college one day. She also hopes to have a bigger store, more like a supermarket.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock business

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Empezó trabajando para otra persona en la galería de ropa más grande de la ciudad,  eventualmente sigue apoyando con sus servicios cuando tiene tiempo y en temporadas de ventas fuertes (como Navidad o día de la madre). Luego de más de quince años de haberse dedicado a este trabajo decidió independizarse.

Contando solo con sus conocimientos de confección personalizada y de confección industrial, además de una pequeña máquina de coser, ambientó un pequeño taller en su casa. En el cual ya tiene seis años produciendo polares y ropa de verano. Ella se encarga de mantener los gastos básicos de su casa y también a sus tres hijos. Solo de vez en cuando su ex esposo le da ayuda mínima.

Lo que más quisiera ella es comprar una máquina industrial para así poder producir mayores cantidad de prendas.
texts.en:
María began working for another person in the largest clothing store in the city and she continues supporting this person with her services when she has time and during high sales periods such as Christmas and Mother’s Day. After more than fifteen years of working as a seamstress she has decided to become an independent businesswoman.

Relying only on her knowledge of personalized tailoring, the tailoring industry and a small sewing machine she set up a small workshop in her home. She has run a business producing sweatshirts and summer clothing for six years. She sees to the expenses of her household and of her three children. Her ex-husband will only give her minimal help on occasion.

What she wants the most is to be able to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can produce greater quantities of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Siendo ya su trabajo un modelo a seguir para cualquier negociante, ella aun aspira a seguir creciendo. Con la idea de sus hijos quien ya trabajaba en el rubro para terceras personas, desde hace diez años Elena empezó su negocio de venta de cuadros decorativos.

El negocio se inició cuando compraba cuadros ya hechos y  los revendía. Poco a poco  y junto con sus hijos se dio cuenta que si ellos mismos producían sus cuadros, tanto la pintura como el enmarcado,  podrían generar un mayor ingreso.

Hoy en día Elena no solo cuenta con su taller de elaboración de cuadros, si no también es propietaria de cuatro puestos donde exhibe y vende cuadros en el mercado central de la capital. Dos de los puestos los administra ella y los otros dos sus hijos.

A pesar de todas sus obligaciones con su pequeña empresa, Elena también se desempeña como profesora inicial en temporada escolar. Por otro lado, más adelante, ella planea abrir un puesto para la venta de jamones, ya que gracias la concurrencia de turistas en el mercado donde vende es grande y este negocio tiene futuro.
texts.en:
Her business already being a model to follow for any business persion, she aspires to continue to grow further. Elena began her business of selling decorative pictures 10 years ago, the idea having come from her sons who already worked with older aged persons. The business began when she purchased pictures that were already built and resold them. Little by little, and with her sons, they told themselves that if they could produce their own pictures, both the painting as well as the frame, they could generate a greater profit. Today, Elena does not only count on her studio where she makes these pictures, she is also the proprieter of four locations at the central market in the capity city where she sells and exhibits paintings. Two of these locations she manages and the other two her sons manage. In addition to the obligations of her little business, Elena is a teacher during school season. In the future, she plans to open a place to sell hams, which, thanks to the many tourists in the market, is a business that holds a future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
A sus setenta y cinco años, Fernanda es una mujer que aprovecha todo su tiempo. Es así que por las mañana se dedica, desde hace veinte años, a cocinar en el comedor popular de su localidad mientras que por las tardes vende frituras en un puesto ambulante en un mercado, negocio que desde hace treinta años lo maneja.

Al inicio ella trabajaba para otra persona vendiendo en una pollería, con la menudencia que sobraba de la mercadería empezó a cocinarla y a venderla para que todo ello no sea desperdiciado. Al cabo de unos años se dio cuenta que podía ganar más dinero dedicándose a ese negocio, ya que era propio y en gran parte porque, debido a su cambio de vivienda, la pollería le quedaba muy lejos y gastaba en pasajes. 

Además se ser negociante, Fernanda también es una madre ejemplar, pues sin la ayuda de nadie crio a sus seis hijos que hoy en día ya son independientes. En sus planes se encuentra el dejar el cargo de cocinera del comedor popular a otra persona y dedicarle más tiempo a su puesto de comida para crecer en el negocio y más que nada porque hace poco sufrió un robo.
texts.en:
At seventy-five years old, Fernanda is a women who makes the most of all of her time. This is why in the mornings she has been dedicated, for the past twenty years, to cook in her town's welfare kitchen while in the afternoons she has sold foods in a traveling stall in a market for the past thirty years. In the beginning she worked for another salesperson in a poultry store, but began to cook the leftover giblets from the market and sell them so that they would not be wasted. After one year she told herself that she could increase her profit if she dedicated herself to this business. This was correct, largely due to the fact that, due to where she lived, the poultry shop was very far away and she wasted fares to get there. In addition to being a business person, Fernanda is also an exemplary mother, as without the help from anybody else she raised her six children who are now independent. In her plans she would like to leave the cooking for the welfare kitchen into the hands of someone else and dedicate herself more to her food stall to expand her business, mostly because a little while ago she was robbed.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new food stall and purchase crockery/dinner service

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
S. (PURITO NORTE) 

Desde hace medio año Milagros vende hamburguesas en la esquina más cercana de su casa. Antes de ello y durante cinco años se dedico a la venta de ropa según  los pedidos que le hacían sus clientes. No obstante, debido a que no contaba con el capital suficiente para adquirir más mercadería decidió cambiar de negocio.

Por ahora, una péquela parte de sus ganancias las ahorra para poder en el futuro retomar el negocio de la venta de ropa. Sin embargo, lo que ella más quisiera es contar con el dinero suficiente para poder abrir un restaurante.

Milagros por ahora esta separada de su esposo y a pesar de que recibe muy poca ayuda de el para la manutención de sus hijos, es su suegra quien la apoya acogiéndola en su casa. Eventualmente, cuando tiene gastos mayores ofrece el servicio de limpieza y de lavado de ropa.
texts.en:
For the last six months Milagros has been selling hamburgers on the corner near his home. Prior to this and for five years she was dedicated to the sale of clothing based on the requests of her clients. Despite this, as she did not have sufficient capital to acquire more merchandise, she decided to change businesses. Today, she places a small part of her earnings away in order to, in the future, be able to return to the sales of clothing. However, what she would most like to do now is have enough money to open a restaurant. For the moment Milagros is separated from her husband and due to this receives very little help to support her children, and it is her in-laws who support her and took her in their home. Eventually, when she has enough money, she would like to offer a service that cleans and washes clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her new business by purchasing chairs and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ernesto Aquiles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Ernesto C. se dedica muy arduamente a su actividad de sastrería y costura el cual posee en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por muchos clientes y además elabora trajes típicos nicaragüenses para venderlos. Es importante destacar que en su negocio no solamente el trabaja ya que posee personas que le trabajan ya que su negocio va en desarrollo y únicamente él no puede llevar a cabo dicho trabajo.

El motive por el cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como lo son hilos, botones, agujas, entre otros. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia de igual forma a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya Mr. Ernesto C. works very hard as a tailor and dressmaker in his home where he is visited by many customers. He also sews typical Nicaraguan garments to sell. It is important to point out that in his business he is not the only one working, but that he has other people who work for him since his business is developing and he would not be able to carry out the aforementioned work alone. His motivation for seeking out the support of Ceprodel is to be benefited by a loan to buy work materials such as thread, buttons, and needles, among others. With the loan he will be greatly benefited as will his family who depends so much on his support.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura comenzó a trabajar en una tienda propia, estuvo muchos años pero no fue si no hasta que cayó enferma que lo abandono. Luego de ello emprendió un nuevo negocio cojo vendedora de libros en el centro de la capital. No tenía capital para comprar un puesto o alquilar, es por eso que se desenvolvió  como ambulante todo el tiempo que estuvo en este negocio, que fue cinco años.

Aunque no le fue mal vendiendo libros, opto por abrir un negocio que le permitiera estar más cerca de sus tres hijos con el fin de supervisarlos mejor en sus estudios. Hace año y medio que se dedica a cocinar y atender en su restaurante, abierto desde las 10am hasta después del almuerzo. Más adelante le gustaría construir un segundo piso en su casa para alquilar cuartos y agradar el local que usa para el restaurante con la idea de no solo vender comida si no también de abrir un deposito de cerveza.
texts.en:
Rosaura began working in her own store. She had it for several years but abandoned it when she fell ill. Later she started a new business as a bookseller in the center of the capital city. She did not have the financial capital to buy a market stall or to rent one, so she worked as a street seller the entire time she was in that business, which was five years. Although it wasn’t bad selling books, she decided to open a business that would allow her to be closer to her three children so that she could better supervise their studies. For the past year-and-a-half she has been cooking and tending to customers in her restaurant, which is open from 10:00am until after lunch. Eventually, she would like to build a second floor in her house for the purpose of renting rooms, and to expand the space she uses for her restaurant with the idea of not only selling food, but also to include beer sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, other restaurant ingredients

loans.name: Maria Inés

texts.es:
Maria Ines S. es una dama que a raíz de sus múltiples esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante surtiendo su pequeña pulpería de venta de productos comestibles el cual posee desde hace dos años con el motivo de beneficiar a su familia compuesta por sus hijos.

Todos los días la señora S. abre sus puertas para ofrecer los productos comestibles siendo visitada por las personas de su sector. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar los productos debido a que pronto se le agotan. Es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Maria Ines S. is a lady who, at the bottom of it all, has been able to get ahead by stocking her small grocery store and selling food for the past two years for the purpose of benefiting her family, which is comprised of her children. Every day Mrs. S. opens her doors to offer food and is visited by people of her neighborhood. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to purchase more products due to the fact that soon she will run out. It is for this reason that she hopes and trusts her loan will be successfully granted.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga es una mujer que ha trabajado desde muy joven a sus 38 años de edad, ha logrado poder salir adelante con su familia, y con ayuda de sus padre pudo culminar su carrera, pues a un  no se ha casado y ni tiene bebe, sus metas por el momento es poder sacar una maestría en Biología, para mejorar su nivel académico, y en lo personal poder tener su propia familia. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y poder terminar de hacer su cuarto, y poder gozar de sus mejoras que gracias al apoyo que Afodenic le ha otorgado esta haciendo sus sueños realidad de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Domingo is a woman who has worked since she was very young. Now 38 years old, she has managed to move ahead with her family, and with help from her father she has been able to complete her education. Since she has not yet married and does not have children, her goals for the moment are to get a master's degree in biology, in order to improve her academic level, and in her personal life be able to have her own family. This credit application is to buy construction materials, to be able to finish building her room, and to enjoy the improvements thanks to the support Afodenic has granted, making her dreams of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to build a room

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Aproximadamente quince años fue el tiempo que Susana dedicó a la venta de productos de plástico junto con su esposo, el aun continua vendiendo; no obstante Susana se dio cuenta que también podría generar ingresos teniendo su propio negocio, es así que desde hace dos años vende dulces y bebidas en su casa.

Ella junto con su esposo se esfuerza al máximo para poder cubrir no solo los gastos de su casa sino también la crianza de sus tres hijos, de quince, doce y seis años.

Dentro de algunos meses, quiere ampliar su tienda, para ello tiene pensado terminar de construir una habitación en su casa que la permita mudar su mercadería e implementar su tienda con muchos más productos.
texts.en:
Susana has spent about fifteen years, along with her husband, earning her living selling plastic products. She still sells them, however, she realized that she could also make money by having her own business, so for two years she's been selling sweets and drinks from her house. She and her husband are trying as hard as they can not only to afford their household expenses, but also to support their three children, who are 15, 12, and 6. They would like to expand their store within the next few months, so they want to finish building a room onto their house into which they can move their merchandise. Then their store can offer many more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for grocery store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: César

texts.es: César R. G., es un hombre trabajador, el cuál vela por su esposa e hijos día tras día. A sus 54 años de edad, reside en el cantón Chancuyo, departamento de Ahuachapán. Tiene tres años de invertir su trabajo en un pequeño negocio propio, en el cuál se comercializa productos lácteos y embutidos, tales como queso, salchichas, crema, entre otras cosas. Debido a que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico tiene muchos clientes, es por ellos que solícita un préstamo para poder de esta manera invertir más en su negocio, ya que ha pesar de sus limitaciones ha logrado incluir otros productos como golosinas y pan. Es por ellos que su deseo más grande es poder obtener la capital necesaria para incrementar sus productos, brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos los cuales contribuyan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
César R. G. is a hard working man who looks after his wife and children. He is 54 years old and lives in the county of Chancuyo, in the suburb of Ahuachapan. He has owned his own business for the past 3 years, which sells dairy and deli products, such as cheese, sausage, and cream among other things. Because his business is located in such a favorable location, he has many clients. As a result, Cesar is asking for a loan to invest in his business so that he can expand his offerings to include bread and soft drinks. For these reasons his greatest desire is to obtain a loan so that he can increase his inventory, offer a better service and increase his income, which will improve his family's finances.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics for her seamstress business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, junto con su esposo, lleva adelante su negocio de confección y venta de ropa. Gracias a su esfuerzo en solo siete años han podido hacerse de un puesto en la principal galería de ropa en la capital.  Ella empezó brindando servicio de bordados para una tercera persona.

Con la idea de crecer se independizo y ahora se dedica a la confección industrial. Actualmente, Vilma tiene la visión de producir ropa para poder exportar al extranjero con la ayuda de familiares que viven fuera del país.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como cobrador en una empresa de transportes. Entre ambos mantienen todos los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Vilma, together with her husband, owns and operates a clothing production and sales business. Thanks to her effort, in only 7 years Vilma and her husband have been able to bring their business to the main booth in the clothing gallery in the capital. Vilma began her career embroidering for another business. With the idea of growth, she opened her own business and dedicated herself to the large-scale production of clothing. Currently, Vilma envisions producing clothing to export with the help of relatives that live in other countries. Her husband would work as a collector in the transportation business. Between them, Vilma and her husband are able to support their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine to produce clothing on a large-scale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mildred Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mildred tiene la edad de 46 años, reside en Hialeah II etapa, con dos hijos de 18 y20 años de edad,  su esposo es contratista en la construcción, el negocio de la Sra. Mildred es la venta de fresco, y bebidas pues  tiene diez años de vender variedad de alimentos, es una pequeña pulpería, y también vende productos de cosméticos, que inicio con ahorro propios, con esta solicitud  es la séptima que hace en Afodenic, que va invertir en comprar granos básicos y otros producto que son de consumo del cliente para sastifacer las necesidades. Sus planes es  poder remodelar su casa, comercializar otros productos que generen buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Mildred is 46 years old and lives in Hialeah with two sons, 18 and 20 years old. Her husband is a construction contractor. Ms. Mildred's business of 10 years is the sale of soft drinks and other beverages and a variety of foods in her small store. She also sells cosmetics products which she got started in with her own savings. With this loan request, her seventh with Afodenic, she will invest in buying basic grains and other products which are for consumption by her clients to satisfy their needs. Her plans are to remodel her home and market other products that generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and products for daily consumption for her store

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: el señor Jose H. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la colonia villanueva de la ciudad capital, el tiene un negocio de barberia en general, la cual tiene el nombre de Barberia RAZA, el tiene mas de 5 años de tener su negocio en esa ubicacion, anteriormente donde estaba  ubicado su negocio era en la colonia Kennedy siempre en la ciudad capital, el poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio a logrado nuevamenete adquirir clientela, cabe mensionar que esta actividad la aprendio ya que el trabajaba en una barberia desde niño, recogiendo y barriendo pelo cuando terminaban de cortar pelo a los clientes, el tambien estuvo en los Estados Unidos en donde aprendio mas cosas, el esta casado y tiene un hijo y con el esfuerzo que realiza con su trabajo diariamente logra mantener a su familia, el necesita un credito para ajustar el dinero para comprar un carro pick-up ya que lo necesita para comprar frutas y venderlas frente a su barberia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose H. is 23 years old and lives in Colonia Villanueva in the capital city. He owns a a barber shop named Raza Barber Shop. Jose has operated the business in this location for the past 5 years, as it was previously located in Colonia Kennedy, also in the capital city. Jose, little by little, with great sacrifice has been able to atract new clients. Jose learned his trade of cutting hair when he was a young boy, as he used to sweep the floor of a babershop when he was younger. Jose also traveled to the United States, where he furthered his knowledge of the trade. Mr. H. is married with one son. From all his daily efforts in his work, Jose is able to support his family. Currently, he is requesting a loan to purchase a pick-up truck which he will use to transport fruits and vegetables that he sells outside of his barber shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pick-up truck

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves tiene 50 años, vive en su propica casa junto a su esposo y su hijo de 14 años. Se dedica a la fabricación de collares y adornos, los cuales diseña con mucha creatividad dentro de su casa, donde puede estar muy a gusto, lo difícil es elaborar grandes cantidades pues no tiene una hija mujer que la ayude y tampoco tiene los medios necesarios para contratar una ayudante. Es por eso que su trabajo es muy cansado, sobre todo cuando sale a las calles y mercados para vender sus productos, los cuales son muy rentables gracias a que Nieves está pendiente de la moda en cuanto a colores y diseños para plasmarlos en su trabajo y realizar  nuevos diseños que impacten a las jóvenes y marquen la diferencia  ante la competencia. Sin embargo, en estas fechas los materiales están subiendo de precio y perjudica la producción de doña Nieves, quien tiene el sueño de instalar un bazar en su domicilio. Nieves viene trabajando con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por 3 años y está muy contenta por el apoyo que encontró en esta institución. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá materiales para sus trabajos los que le ayudarán a aumentar su producción e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nieves is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her 14 year old son. She makes necklaces and decorations, and is a creative designer in her own home, where she can by very comfortable. The hard part is finishing large quantities of work because she has neither a daughter to help her nor the necessary means to hire someone to help. Because of this her job is very tiring, especially when she goes out to the streets and markets to sell her products. The business is very profitable thanks to the fact that Nieves is attuned to fashion as far as colors and designs to reflect in her work and she creates new designs that appeal to the young people and differ from the competition. However, these days the materials are increasing in price and it is harming Mrs. Nieves' production. She has the dream of installing a shop in her own home. Nieves has been working with Microfianzas PRISMA for 3 years and is very happy with the help she found with this organization. With the requested money she will acquire more materials for her jobs that will help her to increase her production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her work

loans.name: Julia Marcelina

texts.es:
Ahora que es temporada de verano, Julia se dedica a vender por las noches caramelos como ambulante. Ya lleva dos años con este negocio. Antes se dedicaba a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, pero abandono este negocio por quedar embarazada. 

Cuando era más joven ofrecía el servicio de limpieza y de lavado de ropa, pero no quería estar lejos de sus hijos ni dejarlos solos, ya que no había quien los cuidara, por eso desde aquel tiempo busca siempre negocio que le permitan cuidar de su familia. Y esta necesidad aumentó desde que su última niña de dos años nación con un problema salió con un problema en sus piernas que no le permiten caminar correctamente.

En un futuro, cuando sus hijos estén más grandes, desearía abrir un puesto en el mercado. Por ahora, trabajaba lo que le permite las obligaciones de su casa. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como obrero en una empresa.

caramelos y rehabilitación de su hija
texts.en:
Now that it is summer (in South America), Julia dedicates her time to selling caramels. She has been doing this for two years. She used to sell anticuchos (small pieces of grilled, skewered meat popular in Peru) from her home, but quit doing that after she got pregnant. When she was younger she worked cleaning and washing clothes, but she didn’t want to leave her children alone and there was no one else to watch them, so she had to look for a job that would allow her to care for her family. This necessity increased when her 2-year-old daughter was born with a problem in her legs that prevents her from walking correctly. In the future, when her children are older, she would like to open a store in the market. For now, she works as much as her familial obligations allow. Luckily she has the help of her husband, who works as a laborer for a company. [She will use the loan for] purchasing caramels and to help with the therapy for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy caramels to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 28 años es casada, vive con su hermano y su hijo, por motivos de trabajo su pareja no está con ella. Tiene una microempresa familiar que presta servicios de fumigación, el cual viene funcionando hace 10 meses en  su casa, pues instaló una oficina para atender a sus clientes quienes estan muy contentos por los servicios que prestan Elizabeth y su hermano. Pero el escaso capital de inversión limita que puedan atender a sus clientes ya que no cuentan con los insumos necesarios para las fumigaciones. Sin embargo, sigue adelante tratando de brindar los mejores servicios con los escasos  productos que cuenta, pues gracias a su negocio puede estar junto a su familia, sobre todo con su pequeño hijo, sin descuidar  su actividad como  empresaria, pues ha podido mantener esta micro empresa rentable, y está segura que con el tiempo se consolidará como una empresa de servicios más prospera y rentable. Elizabeth viene trabajando con MFP hace tres años y está muy contenta con el respaldo económico que tiene en esta institución. Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado invertir en la compra de grandes cantidades de extintores que elevarían sus ganancias, sobre todo en la compra de maquinaria que la ayude a prestar servicios a locales más grandes y hacer el mantenimiento adecuado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28, married, and lives with her brother and son. Because of his work, her husband does not live with her right now. She has a small family business that offers fumigation services. She has been running the business out of her home for the past 10 months, in an office that she put in to attend to her customers. Everyone is very content with the service Elizabeth and her brother have been offering. But the lack of investment capital limits the customers they can serve because they don’t have the necessary supplies for fumigation. However, they keep moving forward by offering the best service possible with the resources that they have. Thanks to this business she is able to be with her family, especially her young son, without having to give up her job as a businesswoman. She has been able to make this a profitable business and she is sure that in the future it will be an even more prosperous company. Elizabeth has worked with MFP for 3 years and is very happy with the financial support this institution offers. With the money from this loan she will invest in large quantities of sprayers that will increase her earnings. Buying the machines will help her serve more locations and perform routine maintenance. help her serve more locations and perform routine maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fumigation sprayers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana C. tiene la edad de 48 años,  habita en la concepción junto a su esposo; sus hijos están casado y viven independiente, el esposo de doña Juana trabaja en la agricultura al igual que ella, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo para poder tener mas ingresos y terminar de construir su vivienda. Con esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en insumos agrícola para el abono de sus cultivos y así poder tener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana C. is 48 years old and lives in La Concepción with her husband. Their children are married and live independently. Juana's husband, like her, works in agriculture. Her plans for her family are to improve farming conditions to increase their income and finish building their home. With this loan, she will invest in agricultural inputs for fertilizing her crops to reap a good harvest and sell her produce at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to fertilize crops

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es: Andrés García M. tiene 49 años de edad, reside en la colonia los claveles en el departamento de Ahuachapán, desde ya hace 30 años. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos, los cuales son la razón de todo su esfuerzo y trabajo. Andrés posee su propio negocio, el cuál consiste en una venta de ropa de cama, los cuales los comercializa de manera ambulante en su motocicleta. Debido a que no cuenta con el lugar apropiado para colocar la ropa que comercializa, él solícita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar 3 muebles para poder ubicar la ropa de forma ordenada y de esta manera tener más espacio para ello. Es por eso que Andrés sueña poder incrementar el número de ropa que vende para poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder brindar un mejor futuro a sus pequeños hijos y poder proveer de todo lo necesario a su esposa e hijos. La compra de estos tres muebles contribuirán a que Andrés tenga la popa de cama a la mano y en mayores cantidades y como consecuencia de esto, él podrá aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Andrés García M. is 49 years old and has lived in the claveles neighborhood of the Ahuachapan region in El Salvador for the past 30 years. He lives with his wife and three children, who are the reason for all of his hard work. Andres has his own business, which consists of selling bed linens. He sells his products from his motorcycle. Since he doesn’t have a good place to put the linens, he is asking for a loan to purchase 3 shelving units. This way he can neatly store his products and have more space. Andres would like to increase the amount of linens he sells in order to increase his earnings and provide a better future for his children and wife. By buying this furniture Andres will be able to store all of his products and to purchase more linens in the future. In this way he can increase his family’s earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage units for merchandise

location.town: Colonia los claveles, departamento de ahuachapan

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es: Eunice tiene 23 años de edad, hace un año vive con el padre de sus dos hijos; actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres. Ella y su esposo trabajan como operarios en cultivos ajenos, les pagan diario por la jornada 10 soles, se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los alimentos y a eso de las 8.00am ya está trabajando en las chacras. Su padre les regaló unas plantas de plátano, para que trabajen y las abonen, por ello van a sembrar en una parte pequeña de la chacra de sus padres estas plantitas y esperarán pacientemente de tres a cinco años para cosechar. Eunice dice que no tienen otra alternativa que sembrar, aunque tenga que esperar varios años, pero una vez que empiezan a producir está segura que mejorará su situación económica, lo que les permitirá alquilar o comprar unas chacras de cultivo, para que no sigan trabajando en chacras ajenas. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchas expectativas de trabajar en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a realizar sus pagos en las fechas programadas por su analista de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para las plantas que su padre le dio, y si alcanza comprará otras plantitas de plátanos para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Eunice is 23 years old. For the past year she has been living with the father of her two children. Right now they all live with her parents. Both her and her husband work on other people’s farms and are paid 10 soles per day. They get up at 4:00 am to prepare food and by 8:00 am they are already working in the fields. Her father gave them some banana plants for them to cultivate and harvest. She is going to plant them on a small part of her father’s farm and wait patiently for 3-5 years for them to bear fruit. Eunice says the only thing she can do is to plant them—even though she will have to wait several years, once they begin producing fruit she is sure her economic situation will improve. Then she will be able to rent or buy some farm land, so she doesn’t have to keep working on someone else’s farm. This is her second loan with MFP and she hopes to begin working with her community bank. She is committed to making her payments on time. The money she is asking for will be used to buy fertilizer for the banana plants and if there is money left over she will buy a few more banana plants to keep planting.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
A sus cuarenta y nueve años, Hercilia ha trabajado en casi todo. Siempre que ha tenido la oportunidad ha trabajado, no sabe decirle “no” a cualquier propuesta de trabajo, pues las condiciones en las que vive ella y su familia no le permiten rechazar cualquier ingreso de dinero a la economía del hogar.

Por ahora, ella se decía a vende los fines de semana, anticucho por el mercado en un pequeño puesto ambulante. Trabajo que viene realizando desde hace tres años. Paralelamente, desde hace un par de años, también vende papel higiénico por los mercados, ofreciendo no solo a los clientes si no también a los comerciantes. Hace algunos meses abandono la venta de kerosene pues el precio de este ha subido, por lo que las compras bajaron y ya no le era un negocio rentable.

Por otro lado, algunos días a la semana ayuda a en el negocio de su hermano, quien maneja una pastelería. Es así como comenzó a trabajar hace quince años. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción civil. Ambos ayudan en los gastos de la casa y en la manutención de sus dos hijas, de quince y trece años.

En sus planes se encuentra el terminar de construir su casa y  poner una licorería o tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
At 49 years old, Hercilia has worked in almost every type of job. She has never said “no” to any type of job offer since the conditions that her and her family live in do not allow them to pass up any type of opportunity to earn income for their home On the weekends, she sells anticucho (pieces of grilled, skewered meat sold in Peru) in a small stall in the local market. She has been doing this for the past three years. At the same time, she also sells toilet paper in the markets--she sells to individual customers and to businesses. Up until a few months ago she also sold kerosene but the price went up too much and the demand went down so it was not longer a profitable activity. Additionally, she also helps out in her brother’s bakery several days a week. That is how she first started working more than 15 years ago. Her husband works in civil construction. They both help pay for household expenses and for the care of their two daughters, who are 15 and 13 years old. Her future plans are to finish building her house and eventually open a liquor or grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly cuenta con 48 años D. edad, está separada del padre D. sus 5 hijos, actualmente vive en la casa D. su madre. DesD. muy joven apoyaba a su madre en la venta D. combustible para cocina; pero desD. que tuvo varios hijos y tras el abandono D. su esposo comparte el local con ella implementando un espacio para la venta D. abarrotes. Debido a las carencias económicas, desD. hace 5 años atrás también venD. golosinas D. forma ambulatoria en la puerta D. los colegios, ubicándose en el momento D. ingreso y salida D. los alumnos, D. lunes a viernes; negocio que le ha resultado muy rentable, y ahora  espera con ansias el mes D. marzo, que inicien nuevamente las clases, para que retome esa actividad. Nelly dice estar muy contenta con sus negocios, tanto D. golosinas y su bodega, por ello que está renovando una pared D. adobe, por material noble, para que su negocio sea un lugar más atractivo y acogedor para sus clientes. Ella es muy activa en su banco comunal, en el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo D. vocal, se encargaba D. pasar los comunicados del asesor D. crédito a los integrantes, este es su 12vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita lo va utilizar en dos rubros: una parte es para mandar a hacer la puerta del renovado local  D. su bodega, y la otra parte es para la compra D. golosinas, ya que se aproxima  la épocas escolar.
texts.en:
Nellly is 48 years old and is separated from the father of her 5 children. She currently lives with her mother. From the time she was very young she helped her mother sell cooking fuel. With the birth of her children and her husband's departure, she now shares the shop with her mother and is setting up space to sell groceries. Due to economic hardship, for the past 5 years Nelly has also sold candy in front of high schools, positioning herself in the doorway at the start and end of classes, Monday through Friday. The business has been very profitable, and she is anxiously awaiting March, when classes start again, in order to resume sales. Nelly is very happy with her businesses, both the candy and the shop. For this reason she is replacing an adobe wall with one of better materials, so that her business is more attractive and welcoming for her customers. Nelly is very active in her communal bank. In the previous cycle, she held the position of spokesperson, in charge of passing communications from the credit assesor to members. This is her 12th loan with MFP, and she has always conscientiously paid the amounts due. The money that she is requesting will be used in two ways: one part is to have a door maD. for the renovated part of her shop, and the rest is for the purchase of candy, now that the school year is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the wall in her shop and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
F. 

Hace cinco años Liliam vendía frutas en un puesto del mercado de su casa. Con la idea de conseguirle un trabajo a su hermana, le dio el encargo de cuidar el puesto de venta de jugos de una compañera (quien se fue de viaje al extranjero) haciendo que el negocio continuara funcionando.

Es así que durante un tiempo, ella se encargo de vender frutas y su hermana de vender en la juguería. No obstante su hermana le dijo que porqué mejor ella se encarga de vender frutas y Liliam atendía en la juguería, pues Liliam tenía mas habilidad en la cocina que su hermana.

Entonces des hace dos años, Liliam atiende en el puesto de jugos todos los días desde la mañana hasta después de almuerzo. Ella es madre de tres menores de trece, seis y cuatro años. El padre de sus hijos no la apoya para nada es así que con la idea de progresar esta pensando abrir en su casa un negocio ya que no sabe hasta cuando tendrá a su disposición el puesto de jugos.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Liliam was selling fruit at a stand in the market near her house. While she looked for work for her sister, she left a friend (who is now out of the country on a trip) in charge of the stand so the business could keep running. So, for a while she sold fruit and her sister sold juices. However, her sister suggested it might be better if she sold the fruit, while Liliam took care of the juice bar, since Liliam was better in the kitchen than her sister. For the past two years, Liliam has worked the juice bar every day from morning until after lunch. She is the mother of three youngsters, who are 13, 6, and 4. The children's father gives Liliam no support at all, so she is thinking about starting a business in her house, as she doesn't know how long she'll have the juice stand at her disposal.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nercy

texts.es: Nercy tiene 38 años de edad, es casada hace 18 años, madre de 4 hijos que actuadamente viven con ella. Se dedica a cultivar sus cultivos de fruta apoyando a su esposo, pero el arte y la creatividad, es lo que sobra en Nercy, por ello le agrada más la confección de cushmas nativas, que son como especie de atuendos de una solo pieza, y complementa esta prenda con la elaboración de collares y pulseras a base de semillas nativas, los cuales, en épocas festivas, por día llega a vender de 20 a 30 soles. Y con lo que respecta a la confección de atuendos que alquila a los colegios y escuelas por cada uno cobra 8 soles, pero en ocasiones llega a negociar por cada atuendo hasta 25. A Nercy le gusta confeccionar todo tipo de prendas y vestidos, pero tampoco deja de realizar su trabajo como agricultora, cada 15 días realizan la cosecha de plátanos y los negocia en su chacra misma. Nercy es la tesorera de su banco comunal, encargada de recolectara los pagos que cada mes efectúan los integrantes, bajo la asesoría del asesor de crédito. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de plátanos, para conservar su buena producción; y la otra  parte en para la compra se semillas y telas para la confección de atuendos y collares.
texts.en:
Nercy is 38 years old. She has been married for 18 years, and is mother to 4 children who currently live with her. She works cultivating fruit with her husband, but art and creativity are what she has in abundance. For this reason, what she enjoys most is making native "cushmas", a type of outfit made from a single piece of cloth. She complements this item of clothing with necklaces and bracelets made from native seeds, which, in festival periods, can be sold for 20 to 30 soles per day. She rents the outfits she makes to high schools and elementary schools for 8 soles each, though occasionally she can negotiate up to 25 soles for each one. Nercy likes making all types of clothing and dresses, but she does not neglect her agricultural work. Every 15 days she harvests bananas and sells them from her own subsistence farm. Nercy is the treasurer of her communal bank, in charge of collecting monthly payments from the members, under the supervision of the credit advisor. This is her second loan through MFP, and she has been punctual in her payments. The money that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm to maintain its good production, and to purchase seeds and fabrics to make necklaces and outfits.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her work

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: FELIX TIENE 4 HIJOS DE LOS CUALES AUN MANTIENE A 3, TIENE CASA PROPIA DONDE VIVE CON SUS HIJOS. EL SE DEDICA  AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS ES SOCIO EN EL SINDICATO DE TRANSPORTES 10 DE FEBRERO TRABAJA COMO MOTOTAXISTA. YA LLEVA 3 AÑOS  EN ESTA MISMA ACTIVIDAD. SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE FRUTA ESTACIONAL EN LA TRANCA VEHICULAR DE SANTA FE. TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE EL TRANSPORTE TIENE VARIOS OFERENTES QUE CON EL MISMO SERVICIO. ES FACIL DE INGRESAR A ESTE RUBRO. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA MOTOCICLETA YA QUE DESEA MEJORAR SU HERRAMIENTA DE TRABAJO QUE TIENE. ES SU TERCERA OPERACION Y TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO ES SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS, APARTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION TIENE CREDITO EN OTRA ENTIDAD.
texts.en:
Felix has four children, and he is currently caring for three of them. He has his own house, where he lives with his children. He works with the transportation union "10 de Febrero" as a motorcycle taxi driver, and has done so for three years. His wife works selling seasonal fruit in the Santa Fe transport center. He has a lot of competition since there are many suppliers of the same transport services and it is easy to enter this field. This loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle, as he hopes to improve his work equipment. This is his third transaction and he has shown very good conduct in his previous loans. Apart from this institution, he also has credit with another organization.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle purchase

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery cuenta con 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 9 años y tiene un hijo. Por la noche descansa en su casa, pero prepara los alimentos en la casa de su madre. De pequeña realizaba las labores agrícolas y el cuidado de las vacas, ahora con su propia familia, siembra mayormente espinaca; pero le es más rentable comprar por chacras porque al comprar se puede calcular por un aproximado de 40 canastas, pero al cosechar saca entre 60 o 70 canastas, esto le permite pagar peones y transporte de los productos, así gana un 50 % más de lo invertido. Asimismo también se dedica a repartir leche junto a su madre; la que lleva haciéndolo por más 27 años, reparten la leche a los restaurantes y pastelerías, pero en forma alternada es decir;  una semana su madre y la otra ella. Rosmery está muy contenta con lo que realiza y tiene planes de incrementar sus siembras de espinacas y avena para la alimentación de las vacas. Rosmery es una socia muy emprendedora y muy puntual en las reuniones que el asesor programa, este es su 12vo préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos de acuerdo al cronograma programado. El dinero  que ha solicitado es para la compra de grandes cantidades de avena para alimentar a sus vacas y que no deje de faltarles la leche, y de ese modo cubran sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 27 years old, has lived with her husband for 9 years and has a son. At night she sleeps at her home, but prepares food in her mother’s home. Since she was young she has worked in farming and raising cattle. Now that she has her own family, she mostly grows spinach. Spinach is profitable because when you purchase a field and calculate that it will yield about 40 baskets of spinach, it will actually yield between 60-70 baskets during the harvest. The extra crop allows her to pay workers and to transport her products, and she earns 50% more than she invests. At the same time, she also works with her mother delivering milk. For the past 27 years her mother has delivered milk to restaurants and bakeries. Now Rosmery and her mother alternate weeks—one week Rosmery delivers milk and the next her mother delivers it. Rosmery is very content with what she does and has plans to increase her spinach crops. She will also increase her oat crop in order to feed her cows. Rosmery is an entrepreneurial member [of the community bank] and very punctual at their programmed meetings. This is her twelfth loan and she has always been on-time with her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy large quantities of oats to feed to her cows so they will continue producing milk and she can pay for her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oats to feed to cattle

loans.name: Flor De Oriente Group

texts.es:
las señoras antes mensionadas son integrantes del Grupo Flor de Oriente, ubicado en la comunidad de la Montañita, el Chichicaste, en la actualidad ellos no cuentan con capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir sus negocios, razon por la cual estan solicitando un credito. las actividades del grupo son las siguientes:
Marisela S.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas desde hace 5 y medio años, ella es viuda, tiene una hija la cual depende de ella al 100%, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre todos los gastos del hogar y tambien los gastos de sus estudios. el producto que ella elabora lo vende de manera ambulante en el lugar donde ella reside, su condicion de vida cada vez va mejorando.
Martha A.: ella se dedica al comercio tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de consumo popular ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio, tambien ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, ella es casada y madre de tres hijos los cuales dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura (siembra maiz y frijoles) con los que le generan ingresos para salir adelante con su hogar.
Dilcia S.; ella se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas tambien, tiene 6 años de realizar esta actividad, ella vende su producto de forma ambulante y principalmente a pulperias y mercaditos de su comunidad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos que toda via dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y juntos los dos sacan adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
The women mentioned here are members of the Flor de Oriente group, located in the Montañita community of Chichicaste. Currently they do not have enough capital to continue with their work—for this reason they are asking for a loan. The different jobs of the group are: Marisela S.—For the past five years has made and sold rosquillas (a type of doughnut). She is a widow and has a daughter who depends on her 100%. With the income she generates with this work she pays for all household expenses as well as her daughter’s studies. She sells the doughnuts on the streets where she lives and every day her life is improving. Martha A.—For the past four years she has run a small store with everyday goods from her home. She also works making rosquillas. She is a married mother of three children who all depend on her. Her husband works in agriculture (planting corn and beans) and they both generate income to help their family get ahead. Dilcia S.—For the past six years she has also made and sold rosquillas. She sells her product on the streets and also to grocery stores and small markets in her community. She is married and has 4 children who depend on her. Her husband works in agriculture and the two of them work to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: materials for making rosquillas (a type of doughnut)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sandra De

texts.es: SANDRA ES PROFESORA EN UN COLEGIO DE SAN CARLOS, TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS Y ACTUALMENTE ESTÁ EMBARAZADA. SU ESPOSO ES AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑILERIA. LA FAMILIA VIVE EN DOMICILIO PROPIO. SANDRA TRABAJA COMO PROFESORA POR LO QUE NO TIENE COMPETENCIA EN SUS LABORES. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA EL ARREGLO DE SU CASA. ES SU TERCERA OPERACION OPERACION, TUVO MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO EN  SU ANTERIOR CREDITO..
texts.en:
Sandra is a teacher at a high school in San Carlos. She has two small children and is currently pregnant. Her husband is a masonry assistant. The family lives in their own home. Sandra works as a teacher so there is no competition in her work. The loan will be used to fix their house. This is their third loan. They behaved well with their last loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix her house.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita tiene 48 años de edad, casada hace 26 años con el padre de sus 4 hijos, su hijo mayor vive en otra ciudad, por lo que está viviendo con sus 3 hijos en la casa heredó de un familiar. Se dedica a pastar sus animales, también le ayuda a su esposo con los cultivos generalmente  cultivan zanahorias, porque aprovecha doblemente este cultivo, cosechar y vende los frutos, y con el resto que no ha cosechado los procesa y para conseguir la semilla que vende a unos clientes bolivianos que las cotizan a un buen precio y se llevan de 100 a 200 kilos. Este proceso es muy trabajoso pero también muy rentable, en temporadas altas le llena de mucha alegría porque su negocio le permite cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. En sus préstamos anteriores con MFP tuvo varios cargos, era secretaria, también vocal, y estos cargos los asumió con mucha responsabilidad, este es su 12vo crédito, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para sus chacras de zanahorias y papas, para ayudar a desarrollar sus frutos y den un buen tamaño.
texts.en:
Sarita is 48 years old and has been married for 26 years. She has 4 children—her oldest son lives in another city so she lives with her other three children in a home a family member left her. She raises animals for a living in addition to helping her husband with their crops. Normally they plant carrots because they get an extra advantage with this crop: first they harvest the vegetables and sell them and with what they don’t harvest, they process the seeds and sell them to Bolivian clients, who buy 100-200 kilos at a good price. This process is a lot of work but it is profitable. In good seasons she is filled with happiness because her job allows her to cover educational costs for her children. With previous MFP loans she has had various responsibilities, like secretary and spokeswoman. This is her twelfth loan and she has always made her payments on time. The money she is asking for is to buy fertilizer for her carrot and potato fields, to help the plants develop into a good size.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: CARMEN TIENE DOS HIJOS AMBOS SON PEQUEÑOS SU ESPOSO HACE CASI 6 MESES QUE LA ABANDONO POR LO CUAL ELLA ESTA DEDICADA DE INTEGRO A SU TRABAJA Y A SUS PEQUEÑOS POR LO CUAL HA DECIDIDO TRABAJAR MAS. CARMEN TRABAJA COMO COCINERA EN PANCHO POLLO POR LAS MAÑANAS Y EN LA TARDE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ASADITOS , EMPANADAS , REFRESCOS Y OTROS ELLA NO TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE VENDE EN LA ESQUINA DE LA AV. ALEMANA Y ER ANILLO, EL DINERO QUE LE PRESTAMOS FUE PARA QUE SE COMPRE UN CARRITO A MEDIO USO EN EL CUAL PUEDA LLEVAR Y TRAER SUS PRODUCTOS Y SOBRE TODO QUE SEA MAS COMODO Y ACOMODE OTRAS COSAS PARA VENDER, LA CLIENTE TIENE EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO, QUE AUN A PESAR DE SUS PROBLEMAS FAMILIARES ELLA RESPONDIO MUY BIEN AL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carmen has two children, both of whom are small. Almost six months ago, her husband abandoned her. As a result, she is completely dedicating herself to her work and to her small children for whom she had decided to work more. Carmen works as a cook at "Pancho Pollo" in the mornings and, in the evenings, she is dedicated to selling barbecue, empanadas, sodas and other items. She does not have a lot of competition since she sells on the corner of Alemana Avenue and ER Anillo. The money that we are lending her is so that she may purchase a used cart in which she can carry and bring her products and, above all, everything can be more comfortable and can accomodate other things to sell. This client has excellent credit behavior who, despite her family problems, responds well to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es: EMIGDIO CUENTA CON 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN SU PROPIA CASA UBICADA SOBRE LA AV. VIRU, ZONA PEATONAL JUNTO A SU ESPOSA Y SUS 4 HIJOS DE 20, 17, 14 Y 16 AÑOS DE EDAD. EMIGDIO TIENE SU TALLER DE REFRIGERACION CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE ANTIGÜEDAD SOBRE LA AVENIDA ANTES MENCIONADA, AHÍ MISMO VIVE Y TIENE SU ALOJAMINETO, PARA LO CUAL CUENTA CON LA AYUDA DE SUS HIJOS. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA EN CUANTO A SU TALLER, YA QUE ES EL UNICO POR LA ZONA. POR TAL MOTIVO TIENE MUCHO TRABAJO AL RESPECTO. Y MEDIANA EN CUANTO A SU ALOJAMIENTO, ESTO DEBIDO A QUE EXISTEN OTROS POR ESE LUGAR. EMIGDIO INVIRTIO TODO EL MONTO DEL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO EN SU TALLER DE REFRIGERACION, CON UN VALOR DE $US. 1,000.- ESTE SERIA EL TERCER PRESTAMO SOLICITADO EN LA INSTITUCIÓN Y TODOS LOS ANTERIORES LOS A CANCELADO PUNTUALMENTE. EL TIENE UNA DEUDA VIGENTE EN OTRA ENTIDAD FINANCIERA.
texts.en:
Emigdio is 45 years old. He lives in his own home located on Viru Avenue in the Peatonal Zone with his wife and their four children who are 20, 17, 14 and 16 years old. Emigdio has had his refrigeration shop on the same avenue for many years. There he lives and has his accomodation and he can count on his children for help. Competition is low since his shop is the only one of its kind in the area. As a result, he has a lot of work. And regarding his accomodation, this is because there are others in that place. Emigdio invested the whole requested loan amount in his refrigeration shop, a value of US $1,000. This would be his third loan requested from this institution. All of the previous ones he repaid punctually. He has an outstanding debt with another financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital in his refrigeration shop.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Amanecer se conforma de la siguiente manera;
Fidelia Amparo F.; ella se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, actualmente tiene una caseta donde vende golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Centro Educacional Juan Lindo de la aldea de Quebrada Larga, Jamastran, ella es casada y su esposo es propietario de transportes que viajan de Danli a Quebrada Larga y viceversa, ellos tienen 2 hijos que toda via dependen de ellos al 100%, con los ingresos que les generan sus negocios ellos pueden sacar adelante su familia y cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar.
Ana H.: ella se dedica a la venta de agro-insumos, tambien vende tarjetas y recargas de llamadas para celulares actividad que realiza hace 3 años, ella es madre de tres hijos y vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar, el trabaja como conductor de una empresa de transportes, ellos con sus trabajos sacan adelante su familia.
Elizabeth H.: ella de dedica al comercio desde hace 5 años, ella vende golosinas como ser: refrescos, churros, galletas, bombones etc. su negocio esta ubicado en quebrada larga, Jamastran, los fines de semana se dedica a la produccion de nacatamales y pan, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo migro a USA y ella tiene que sacar adelante su hogar sola. ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando.
texts.en:
The El Amanecer (The Sunrise) group is made up of the following people: Fidelia Amparo F.—She has worked in business for the past 10 years. She has a booth where she sells candy located in the Juan Lindo educational center in the Quebrada Larga neighborhood of Jamastran. She is married and her husband owns a transportation company that travels back and forth between Danli and Quebrada Larga. They have 2 children who depend on them 100%. With the money their businesses generate, they are able to care for their family and cover their household expenses. Ana H.—She works selling agricultural supples. She also sells and recharges phone cards for cellular phones, which she has done for the past 3 years. She is the mother of 3 children and lives with her common-law husband who works as a driver for a transportation company. With their jobs they help their family get ahead. Elizabeth H.—She has worked in business for the past 5 years. She sells sweets like: soft drinks, churros, cookies, candies, etc. Her business is located in Quebrada Larga in Jamastran. On the weekends she makes nacatamales (a type of large tamale) and bread. With her income she pays for all of the household expenses since her husband left for the United States. She has to help her family alone. She is a single mother with two children who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cornmeal, meat, vegetables, cheese, tortillas, salsa, salt, sugar, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es soltero,  tiene 34 años.
Marco es técnico en mecánica automotriz, reparaba autos en un taller, por un tiempo ejerció su carrera  pero decidió cambiar de trabajo, se encarga de cobrar los alquileres a los  departamentos de unos familiares.   
Hace cuatro años atrás empezó haciendo movilidad escolar con un  woswagwen  una vecina le pidió que llevara a su niña al colegio  por una semana, en el colegio se pasaron la voz las señoras que estaba haciendo movilidad, y le pidieron  para que llevara a otras niñas. Ahora  se ha comprado un carro  grande, por día  lleva a veinticuatro niñas cada día.
Necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para su carro es gasolinera y quiere convertirlo a gas.
El sueño de Marcos es, ahorra hasta llegar a comprar una combi.
texts.en:
Marco is 34 years old and single. He is an automotive mechanic who used to repair cars in a shop. He decided to change his job and now he manages the rents of some apartments his family owns. Four years ago he also started working in school transportation with his Volkswagen. A neighbor asked him to take her daughter to school for a week—at the school other people heard he was driving kids to school and they asked him to start driving more students.
