Now he has bought a big car and every day he drives 24 girls to school. He is asking for a loan of 2,400 soles because his car uses gasoline and he wants to convert it to use propane. Marco’s dream is to save enough to be able to buy a bus.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: convert his car to use propane gas

loans.name: Virginia Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Virginia Filedia P. tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto con su compañero de vida, ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo a uno tiene a su cargo; ya que uno se caso y el otro estudia en el seminario. Ella desde hace cinco años trabaja en el sector comercio, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa no tiene división y es muy insegura por que es partes forrada con zinc, y lo que mas desea es poder vivir con una casa digna, es por eso que con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su casa. A si como incrementar su inventario que es la venta de ropa usada, golosinas y productos de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Virginia Filedia P. is 45 years old, lives with Juan Ramon Padilla, together with her life partner, she has three children of which she only cares for one; now that one is married and the other studies in seminary. She has worked in the commercial sector for five years, her plans for her family are to improve the living conditions since her house does not have division and is very insecure because parts are made of zinc, and what she wants most is to be able to live in a dignified house, which is why with this loan she is going to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home, as well as increase her inventory which is selling used clothes, household goods, and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Gladys Jannette

texts.es: Gladys Jannette F. D. V., con 32 años D. edad resiD. en la colonia San José en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 8 y 2 años D. edad habitan en la casa D. sus suegros. Gladys posee una tienda en la cuál comercializa productos como alimentos, golosinas, papelería, entre otras cosas más. Junto a su esposo son conocidos como personas muy trabajadoras, ya que su esposo D. 32 años D. edad y estudios obtenidos hasta secundaria, trabaja como taxista en una moto, la cuál le deja pocos ingresos, es por ello que Gladys desea obtener un préstamo, a través del cuál pueda aumentar los productos D. su tienda y D. esta manera  obtener mayores ganancias a través D. las cuales pueda contribuir a la economía familiar, brindar estudio a sus hijos y D. esta manera un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Jannette F. D. V., who is 32 years old, lives in the San José neighborhood in the department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are 8 and 2 years old. They live in her in-laws’ home. Gladys owns a store, where she sells products like food, candies, and stationary, among other things. She and her husband are known as hard-working people. Her husband is 32 years old and has finished secondary school. He is a taxi-driver on a motorcycle, which earns him little income. Because of this, Gladys wants to take out a loan, through which she can increase the amount of products in her store and, in this way, she can have more earnings through which she can contribute to the family’s finances. The loan will also allow her to offer an education to her children, and a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 59 años D. edad, enviudo hace 7 años, es madre D. 8 hijos, que ya tienen sus familias y viven en otras ciudades, ahora se ha quedado sin compañía, por ello se dedica mucho a su trabajo D. cocinera, en un restaurante cerca a su pueblo. En vida su esposo realizaba los trabajos D. la chacra, habiendo cultivado plantas D. piña, plátanos y  café; ahora sus plantas  requieren  D. abonos y otros cuidados dedicándole la menor parte del tiempo ya que solo se dedica a ella los sábados y domingos; D. lunes a viernes ella trabaja D. cocinera en un restaurante (en la foto), D. 4 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, explotando sus habilidades culinarias, gana 350 soles gracias a su buena sazón, en épocas D. cosecha D. café,  su sueldo aumenta a 400 soles ya que existe más clientela. Ana esta contenta con su trabajo D. cocinera, y también con sus labores agrícolas, pero a veces al observar su cosecha D. café le entra la nostalgia al recordar a su numerosa familia, ella sabe que le ofreció lo mejor que pudo a sus hijos y que ahora ellos son hombres D. bien y con ese orgullo espera seguir adelante porque sabe que aún la vida le depara muchas sorpresas. Ana pese a sus labores, separa su tiempo para cumplir sus funciones D. presidenta D. su banco comunal, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y ella es muy puntual en realizar sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes y la otra parte es para mandar a machetear su chacra D. café y cosechar sin dificultades, ella quiere invertir en su chacra ya que la ha dejado D. lado y a su esposo le habría gustado, también agradece a su banco comunal porque le ha enseñado la responsabilidad en los pagos y le da la oportunidad D. seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old, has been widowed for 7 years, and has 8 children, who already have families and live in other cities. She now lives alone, and because of this, she works very hard as a cook in a restaurant near her town. While her husband was alive, he worked on a small farm, where he cultivated pineapples, bananas, and coffee. Now his plants require fertilizer and other treatments, and Ana spends a little time on the weekends tending to them. From Monday to Friday, she works as a cook in a restaurant from 4 in the morning until 9 at night, using her culinary skills. She earns 250 soles thanks to the good flavor of her food. During the coffee harvest, her salary increases to 400 soles since she has more clients. Ana is happy with her job as a cook and with her agricultural work, but sometimes, when she sees the coffee harvest she gets nostalgic upon remembering her large family. She knows that it offered the best to her children and that now they are good people. With her priD. she hopes to continue forward because she knows that life provides many surprises. Ana, in spite of her work, sets asiD. some time to work as the president of her community bank. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very punctual in making her payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and the other part will be used to order cutting her coffee farm and to grow without difficulties. She wants to invest in her farm since it has been left to her and her husband and because her husband would have liked it. She is also thankful to the community bank because she has learned the responsibilities of repayments and it has given her the opportunity to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, convive hace 4 años, con su compañera y madre de su hija de 1 año y 8 meses, actualmente viven en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a diferentes actividades, pero no conseguía un trabajo formal; pero desde el año 2002 puso en un kiosco su propio taller de electrónica llamado “G.”, ubicándolo en un lugar estratégico, ya que ahí circula toda la gente; se dedica a reparar radios y televisores usados, lo cual es su pasión y está muy contento de realizarlo, pero también compra artefactos electrónicos usados a los cuales le repone todas las piezas faltantes, revendiéndolos a un precio considerable. Carlos comenta que cuando no es tiempo de la cosecha de café, la gente no tiene ganancias y por lo tanto no solicita mucho su trabajo, pero en tiempo de cosecha (Abril), sus ganancias mejoran ganando de 400 a 500 soles por semana, sin contar las posibles ganancias por las ventas de los televisores y radios usadas. Su esposa vende ropa, y él quiere apoyarla con parte del dinero que solicita, y de ese modo alentar el crecimiento de sus negocios. Carlos tiene un buen sentido del humor, y es muy apasionado en su trabajo, se integró a su banco comunal para tener posibilidades de desarrollo, asimismo se compromete en efectuar el pago en las fechas señaladas y horas exactas, este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará radios y televisores usados, y con la otra parte apoyará a su esposa con capital para la compra de prendas y así aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old. He has been living common-law with his partner for four years; they have a daughter aged 1 year and 8 month. They are currently living with his in-laws. He has had many jobs since he was a young man, but never had formal employment. Since 2002 however he has had a kiosk, his own electronics shop called "G.", strategically located where there are many passers-by. He repairs radios and television sets; this is his passion and he is very happy doing this job. He also buys used electronics which he repairs, replacing missing parts and reselling them for a good profit. Carlos says that when it is not time to harvest the coffee beans, people do not have money and then do not need his services; but, when harvest time comes in April, his income improves to 400 to 500 soles per week not including the income from selling used televisions and radios. His wife sells clothing and he wants to help her with part of the loan which he is requesting and so encourage the growth of his businesses. Carlos has a good sense of humour and is very passionate about his work. He joined his community bank in order to explore development possibilities. He is committed to repaying his loan on time. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use part of the loan to buy used radios and televisions and the rest of the loan to help his wife to buy clothing and so increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used radios and televisions.

loans.name: Estelbina

texts.es: La señora Estelbina B. A. tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo el cual le ayuda en los cultivos. Los planes de doña Estelbina es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo ya que ha sido afectado por plagas; con el préstamo va a comprar  fertilizantes necesarios y aplicárselos antes que el cultivo se vea mas afectado y así poder tener una buena cosecha para vender a buen aprecio en el  mercado. A futuro es poder cultivar sus tierras con más productos para aprovechar la temporada, tener mejores ingresos así como apoyar a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estelbina B. A. is 47 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio with her husband, whom she helps with the household expenses. They take care of one son who helps them with the crops. Estelbina plans to improve her crop conditions, which have been affected by plagues. With this loan she will buy the necessary fertilizers and apply them before the crop becomes more affected, so she will have a good harvest to sell at the market for a good price. In the future, she will be able to cultivate her land with more products to take advantage of the season, obtain a better income, and support her son's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to fertilize pithaya (dragonfruit) crop

loans.name: Ericson

texts.es: Ericson tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres con sus demás hermanos. Tiene la profesión de docente, trabaja en la selva rural del Perú desde el año 2005, esta labor le llena de mucha complacencia por prestar sus servicios a los niños de esta zona tan alejada donde debido a la distancia y las carencias económicas en la que viven no pueden compran en su totalidad los útiles escolares. Entonces él les vende los libros y demás artículos y van pagando poco a poco, para que de ese modo sus hijos puedan tener con qué estudiar.  Ante esta realidad Ericson lleva cuadernos, lápices, gomas, colores, etc; entonces los reparte a sus alumnos y les cobra fraccionadamente, al brindar esta facilidad a sus alumnos se siente muy complacido y le llena de mucha satisfacción, y a la vez le está resultando muy rentable a su economía ingresando algunos soles que muchas veces le cubre sus pasajes. Ericson nos comenta que por su trabajo a veces no asiste a todas sus reuniones del banco comunal, pero deja encargado a su madre para que pueda pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado sus cuotas responsablemente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de útiles escolares, y de ese modo brindar apoyo a estos niños de la zona rural de la selva peruana.
texts.en:
Ericson is 27, single and lives in his parents' home with his siblings. He is a teacher, working in the jungle of Peru since 2005. This work fills him with satisfaction that he has lent his services to the children of this area, so remote where because of distance and lack of funding they cannot buy all the school supplies they need. Because of this he sells books and other articles and is paid in installments so that his kids can have the tools they need to study. In view of the reality he faces, Ericson brings notebooks, pencils, erasers, crayons and so on. He distributes them to his students and is repaid over time. Providing this service to his students gives him pleasure and fills him with satisfaction. At the same time, it is profitable and is an extra income which often pays for his travel expenses. Ericson tells us that because of his work he sometimes misses community bank meetings but he has entrusted his mother with paying his loan on time. This is his second loan with MFP and in all this time he has proven himself responsible in repaying on time. He will use the loan to buy school supplies and in this way support these children of the Peruvian jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more school supplies to resell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 43 años de edad, cumple la doble función de padre y madre para sus 2 hijas, actualmente viven en una casa alquilada. Ella  viene laborando en el hospital de la ciudad de Tarma en el área de enfermería hace ya 23 años, en esta profesión se siente muy productiva y como tiene muchas amistades, aprovecha para realizar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, de tres líneas diferentes, todas relacionadas con el rubro de los cosméticos y perfumes, Ella comenta que cada pedido que eleva a estas compañías de belleza es de 900 a 1000 soles por mes, por cada uno de estos pedidos, gana el 20 por ciento, ganancias que son utilizadas para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y para sus gastos personales, ella está muy contenta con su trabajo adicional de promotora en productos de belleza, ya que le permite acumular ganancias, para la comodidad de su hogar. Lleva en esta actividad más de 5 años, y le viene siendo muy rentable, por ello trata de aprovechar al máximo sus horas libres, realizando sus cobranzas y de paso mostrando sus catálogos para los próximos pedidos. Esmeralda es una mujer muy activa, pese a sus dos trabajos se organiza para asistir a todas las reuniones y actividades que se programan dentro de su banco comunal, ella es la presidenta y la han vuelto a elegir en el cargo, siendo este su octavo préstamo, ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la adquisición de cosméticos, además está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible este préstamo ya que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Esmerelda is 43 years old and fulfils the double function of mother and father to her two daughters. They currently live in a rented house. She has worked as a nurse in the hospital in the city of Tarma for the past 23 years, and feels very productive in this profession. She has made the most of her many friendships to start her business selling beauty products from three different brands, all related to cosmetics and perfume. She says that each order she makes to these beauty companies is between 900 and 1000 soles per month, and for each one of these orders she earns 20 percent. She uses her earnings to continue investing in the business and for her personal expenses. She is very happy with her additional job promoting beauty products, as it allows her to increase her income and make her household more comfortable. She has worked in this field for 5 years, and it has been very profitable for her. She tries to make the most of her free time, doing her accounts and showing her catalogues for the next round of orders. Esmerelda is a very active woman, and in addition to her two jobs she attends all of the meetings and activities that are programmed within her community bank. She is the president of the community bank, and has been selected again to hold this position. This will be her eighth loan, and has demonstrated that she makes her repayments punctually. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics. She is very grateful to the people who make this loan possible, as the loan allows her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La señora Luz Maria R. habita en el barrio Los Ríos junto a su esposo e hijos la señora tiene a su cargo tres pequeños que todavía estudian su primaria, el esposo de la señora trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya. , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar,  ella desde hace quince años de trabajar las tierras que le heredo sus padres con la ayuda que le ha brindado nuestra financiera  durante ocho ciclo a logrado establecer una manzana mas de piña, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de sus pequeños ya que todos duermen en el mismo cuarto y desea hacer un cuarto para cada uno. Con este préstamo va a comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar el cultivo de piña.
texts.en:
Luz Maria R. lives in Los Ríos neighborhood with her husband and children. She has in her care three small ones who are already studying in elementary school. Her husband works as a seller in the Masaya market. To help him with the bills of the home, for fifteen years, she has been working the lands that she inherited from her parents. With the help that our financial institution has provided, in the eighth cycle, she has been able to establish one more block of pineapple. Her plans for the future are to improve her children's conditions since all of them sleep in the same bedroom and she wishes that each one can have their own bedroom. With this loan, she is going to purchase farming materials to improve her pineapple crop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural materials to improve pineapple production.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco A. B. tiene la edad de  51 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como cocinera para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo una hija de 20 años que actualmente estudia su ultimo año de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es poder seguir dándole estudio a su hija para que ella pueda ser una profesional.  Don Francisco es agricultor desde hace veinte años, el inicio a cultivar sus tierras por medio de cooperativa y ahora con los beneficios que Afodenic le a brindado a logrado mejorar y establecer mas cultivo. Con este préstamo es para dar mantenimiento en fertilización al cultivo de piña para tener una buena producción
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. B. is 51 years old and lives in the division of Juan Ramón Padilla with his wife, who works as a cook to help him with the household expenses. They care for their 20-year-old daughter who is currently in her final year of secondary school. The family plans are to continue her studies so she can become a professional. Francisco has been a farmer for 20 years. He began cultivating his fields through a co-op, and now with the support of Afodenic he has improved and established more crops. With this loan, he will fertilize his pineapple crop to improve productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to improve pineapple crop

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a vegetable vendor in her community. She roams around their village and goes from one house to another, carrying her aluminum basin full of vegetables that she sells to her customers. Aside from vegetables, she also sells fish. She has been in this kind of business for almost 20 years and is still enjoying it despite her age.

She wishes to improve her business with the hope of increased income to further sustain the needs of their family such as food, clothing, and medicines for herself and her husband. To realize her plan, she is requesting a loan capital of PHP 4,000. She believes that this amount will greatly help to improve her business.

Aurora is 51 years old but is still active in the business. They are living in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela. Their village is located along the other side of the Cagayan River and residents take a ferry boat every time they go to the market to buy their necessities. Aurora's husband is a fisherman and their children are already married and living on their own with their families.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther acaba de cumplir 46 años, vive con su pareja desde hace 18 años, tienen 4 hijos que viven con ellos. Desde hace 10 años es responsable del comedor popular de la comunidad de Manankiari ubicada en uno de los más recónditos lugares de la selva peruana central. Este comedor está organizado por 40 socias, de las cuales 29 son activas que cumplen su función en la marcha de dicho comedor. A diario se turnan para preparar el almuerzo que cuesta 2.50 soles. Asimismo en horas de la tarde Esther ayuda a su esposo a realizar los cultivos de sus terrenos y de no acudir al comedor prepara tamales y los va vendiendo a todos sus vecinos, en esta actividad ya lleva cerca de los 15 años, y le es muy rentable, porque diario llega a ganar 12 a 15 soles, que invierte en la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos, con la única finalidad de convertirlos en profesionales y puedan contribuir al desarrollo de su comunidad. Esther tiene el cargo de secretaria en su banco comunal, se dedica a tomar todos los acuerdos de los integrantes en un libro de actas. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de maíz, ya que piensa incrementar su producción de tamales y también comprará una cacerola más grande.
texts.en:
Esther just turned 46 years old She lives with her husband of 18 years. They have 4 children that live with them. For ten years she has been the head of a popular cafeteria in the Manankiari community located in one of the most remote places in the Peruvian jungle. This cafeteria is organized by 40 members. 29 of whom are active members who are responsible for running the cafeteria. On a daily basis, they take turns preparing lunches that cost 2.50 soles. At the same time, in the afternoon hours, she helps her husband cultivate their farmland. When she is not working in the cafeteria, Esther prepares tamales and sells them to her neighbors. She has been in this business for nearly 15 years. The business is very profitable because she earns about 12 to 15 soles a day that she invests in food and education for her children. Her ultimate goal is to turn them into professionals who will be able to contribute to the development of their community. Esther is the secretary in her community bank and is responsible for making all of the entries in the record book. This is her second loan with MFP and, in this time, she has shown that she makes her payments responsibly. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of corn since she is planning to increase her production of tamales and for the purchase of a larger pan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn to make tamales

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia C. is 37 years old. She lives in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela, a rural village located near the Cagayan River. Ybanag is the common dialect of the people. She is married to Minileo, a farmer, and they have no children as of now.

She chooses to engage in eggplant production as her business. She has a 200 square meter vegetable garden near their house that she has planted with eggplant. This serves as their alternative source of income that helps provide their daily needs.

Leocadia wants to borrow the amount of PHP 3, 000 that she can use in her business. Aside from eggplant, she is also engaged in meat-vending and part of the loan will also be used for this. She said that she will work hard towards the development of their life.

loans.use: For eggplant production and meat vending

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 40 años de edad, convive hace 5 años con su segunda pareja, el cual es el padre del último de sus tres hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Ella es una negociante muy próspera, vende frutas y verduras, y a base de mucho trabajo ha logrado comprar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, gracias a que hace 5 años se enteró de un puesto en venta, y solicitó un préstamo que cubrió los gastos de 3 mil soles, precio del puesto que ahora es suyo, está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que le da buenas  ganancias y tranquilidad económica, además en todo este tiempo ha crecido como negociante, y ha logrado adquirir unos terrenos en la selva, en los que está sembrando frutas. Por todos estos logros alcanzados ella esta profundamente agradecida con el banco comunal, y espera seguir trabajando como lo ha venido haciendo hasta ahora. Luz en todo este tiempo ha realizado sus pagos puntualmente en las reuniones programadas por su asesor de crédito, es una de las más fieles clientes de MFP, y está agradecida por los préstamos que le facilitan y que le permiten seguir trabajando, este es su doceavo préstamo y todo este tiempo ha sido muy responsable en las reuniones y los pagos. El dinero solicitado es para la inversión en manzanas, además de la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de frutas.
texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and has lived with her second husband, who is the father of the last of her three children, for 5 years. At present, she is living in her parents’ house. She is a very prosperous businesswoman. She sells fruits and vegetables and after a lot of work, she has succeeded in buying a stand in the wholesale market. She has had a stand for 5 years, and she requested a loan that covered the three thousand soles for her stand. She is very happy with her business, since it gives her good earnings and financial peace of mind. In addition, in all this time she has grown as a businesswoman, and she has succeeded in acquiring some plots in the jungle, where she is growing fruit. She is deeply thankful to the community bank for all of her successes. She hopes to continue working as she has until now. In all this time, Luz has made her payments punctually in the planned meetings with her loan advisor. She is one of MFP’s most faithful clients and is thankful for the loans that they have provided for her because they permit her to continue working. This is her twelfth loan and during all this time, she has been very responsible in the meetings and with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to invest in apples. In addition, she will buy fertilizers for her fruit farm.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Priza

texts.en:
Priza C. runs a sari-sari store (general store) in her village. She is 33 years old and her husband, Bernalino, is working as a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Cristel – 8 years old, currently in the third grade; Krizell – 15 years old, fourth year high school; and Kelvin – 17 years old, a first year college student. Priza proudly shares that they have a good relationship in the family and remain faithful to God, especially in times of problems or difficulties.

Priza wants to improve her small village store. Thus, she hopes to receive a loan amounting to PHP 3, 000 that will serve as additional capital. The loan will be utilized to purchase rice, vegetables, meat, and fish. She is also planning to buy basic commodities for her store. Priza is hoping that through her business, she can help her husband in supporting the educational expenses of their children and hopefully repair their house in the future. Priza says that by working hand-in-hand towards their goal, they will become successful with their endeavor.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable, meat and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Rochelle Anne

texts.en:
Rochelle is a young mother. She is only 20 years old and married to Noel. They have a seven-month-old daughter named Quinnie Fhail and they are currently living in the rural village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela. The place has rough road conditions, and residents need to take a ferry boat to go to the town proper of Tumauini. According to Rochelle, they have a happy family despite the challenges that they are experiencing.

Rochelle runs a small store in their village that offers basic commodities for household needs. Due to her early marriage, she needs to be more patient and responsible to assist her husband in providing the needs of their family. She works hard for the improvement of her store which is already one year old. Her husband is a part-time worker in the printing and art design business in their village.

Rochelle Anne wants to receive a loan of PHP 4, 000 that she will use to increase merchandise such as coffee, sugar, salt, canned goods, and other basic commodities. She is also planning to use the loan to start a small canteen business, selling snacks to earn extra income. She believes that “Time is gold” that is why she chooses to maximize her time in the business and starts from 5:00 in the morning, working until 8:00 in the evening.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and start a new canteen business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is engaged in a vegetable vending business. She sells crops coming from her backyard. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 that she can use to improve her vending business. Through it, she is able to help her husband generate income for their family. She hopes that someday, she can venture into other kind of business like livestock to further improve their poor living standard. She and her husband are striving to achieve their dreams and to save something for the future education of their daughter.

Janet is 25 years old and her husband Ramon is working in a feed company. They are living in the rural village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela with their one-month-old daughter.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel D. C. is a business-minded young woman at age 21. She is still single and lives with her parents in Barangay Alibagu Ilagan, Isabela which has a big population.

Jonabel has been in the direct-selling business of AVON and NATASHA products for two years. She is hoping that her business will grow so she can help her parents and her future family. To realize her plan, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 4, 000. She is also planning to buy a retailer mobile phone SIM and venture into another business: electronic loading, and later on into the food-vending business. She has a lot of business plans but she lacks financial capital to pursue her goals in life. She always keeps in mind that “honesty is the best policy”. For her, someone must be honest to become successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase addtional products and a retailer mobile phone

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de su madre que es muy anciana. Ella trabajó como empleada durante 23 años en un grifo de la ciudad, pero ahora la han cesado debido a una reducción de personal, tenía la esperanza de reincorporarse, pero ya pasaron 6 meses desde esto y no le dieron una respuesta afirmativa. Es así que Maria decidió no depender de nadie y  decidió dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores, especialmente de conejos, los cuales vende en los mercados, bajo la suma de 21 soles, ganancias que le sirven para la compra de alfalfa (alimento de los animales), y también para comprar productos de primera necesidad. Asimismo, ha decidido incursionar en la compra de quesos, manjar blanco y carne roja, con la finalidad de venderlos a sus amistades y familiares, pero por el momento está en proceso de invertir en la compra de estos productos, ella siente mucho temor al fracaso, pero a la vez tiene mucha fe en el progreso con este negocio. Ella es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal y tiene el cargo de tesorera, cumple sus funciones muy responsablemente. Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado realizar sus pagos en las fechas indicadas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de quesos, manjar blanco y carnes rojas, dinero que le servirá para incursionar en este negocio, estando muy agradecida con todos aquellos que hacen posible este préstamo que le permite tener esperanzas de prosperar.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, is single, and lives in her very old mother’s house. She worked as an employee for 23 years in a filling station in the city, but she stopped because they were laying off workers. She had wanted to return, but 6 months have already passed since this, and she hasn’t had a positive response. Because of this, Maria decided that she didn’t want to depend on anyone, so she decided to raise young animals, especially rabbits, which she sells in the markets, under the amount of 21 soles. These earnings allow her to buy alfalfa (animal feed), and are also used to necessary products. Also, she has decided to venture into the sale of cheeses, dulce de leche, and red meat, with the end of selling them to her friends and family. At the moment, though, she is in the process of investing in the purchase of these products. She is very afraid of failure, but right now, she has a lot of faith in the progress in her business. She is a very active member of her community bank and is the treasurer. She fulfills her duties very responsibly. This is her twelfth loan with MFP and in all this time, she has shown that she makes her payments on time. The money she requests will be used to buy cheeses, dulce de leche, and red meat. The money will allow her to venture into this business. She is very thankful to all the people who have made this loan possible because it lets her have hope of prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. runs a community store in the village of Alibagu Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old and married to Espedito, an elementary teacher. They are blessed with two children: Ria Eden – 25 years old, a college graduate and Ron Eduardo – 21 years old, a college student. Josephine is hoping that her son will also finish his studies and have a better future.

She has been running her business for almost two years. She came up with this idea so she could help her husband in providing not only the needs of their family but also in sending their children to school. Josephine wants to borrow an additional capital of PHP 6, 000 that she can use for her store. She hopes that with this loan and with hard work, her business will grow. Since her husband is already a retiree, they can have an alternative source of income that they can use. She believes that time is gold and it needs to be treasured to make the best out of it.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is hoping to receive a loan amounting to PHP 3, 000 to maintain and improve her fish-vending business. Due to limited capital, she cannot meet the demands of her customers. If she receives a loan, she plans to buy different kinds of fish and other seafood such as 3-5 kilos of milkfish, 10 kilos of tilapia, 20 kilos of galunggong, and 13 kilos of pusit (squid).

She first sells her product to their village, then travels to other nearby villages to sell fish. Her business has been her partner in supporting the educational needs of her children. For this, she is really hoping that her business will continue to grow. She and her husband are working hand-in-hand in achieving their dreams.

Virginia is 43 years old. Her husband Domingo is a farmer and their marriage has been blessed with four children: Sarah Joy – 3 years old; Christin Joy – 11 years old, already in grade six, Ivy – 18 years, currently in third year college (Nursing) and Erica – 19 years old, fourth year BS Information Technology student. Virginia's family is living happily in the village of Pilitan Tumauini, Isabela located near the Cagayan River and she takes a ferry boat when going to the market to buy her merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase of fish and seafood for re-sale

loans.name: Natilde

texts.es:
Natilde tiene 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja hace 10 años, siendo el motor de las actividades que realiza su esposo, ella es madre de un hijo de dos años y actualmente viven en casa de su suegra. Después de haber brindado apoyo incondicional por 10 años a sus suegros en los cultivos de la chacra, como en la compra venta de frutas y el transporte hacia los mercados y a las ciudades; ella busca su independencia económica, para lo cual ha adquirido una moto taxi, la cual sacó pagando en cuotas; su esposo ya trabaja con la moto, para  terminar de pagar las letras, asimismo Reyna en el local de su suegra iniciará la venta de gaseosas y golosinas, con la finalidad de  convertirse en una bodega muy bien surtida.
Esta pareja tiene muchas ilusiones de crecer y prosperar con su trabajo, uniendo las ganancias de la moto y la de venta de golosinas, esperan realizar un sembrío de cítricos y plátanos en la chacra de sus padres, pero ya serán sus propios cultivos. A Reyna le agrada mucho los trabajos de la chacra, pero lo que más le gusta es el comercio, asi que espera hacer crecer su pequeña tiendita. Natilde acaba de juramentar como presidenta, sometiéndose a cumplir con sus obligaciones, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para adelantar la letra de su moto, y de ese modo acumular el dinero para terminar de cancelar las cuotas. La otra cantidad menor es para la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Natilde is 27 years old and has lived with partner for 10 years. She is the driving force behind her husband’s activities. She is the mother of a two-year-old son and, at present, they live in her mother-in-law’s house. She has offered unconditional support to her in-laws for 10 years through the crops from the farm, like by buying and selling fruits and by transport to the markets and cities. She is looking for economic independence, so she has acquired a motor-taxi, which she is paying for in installments. Her husband already works with the vehicle, so that they can finish making the payments. Also, Reyna began selling sodas and candies in her mother-in-law’s premises, with the end of turning it into a well-stocked small store. This pair has many dreams of growing and prospering with their work, combining the earnings from the vehicle and from the sale of candies. They hope to have a field of citrus and bananas in her parents’ farm, but they will be their own crops. Reyna enjoys working in the farm a lot, but what she likes most is business, so that she hopes it will grow to a small store. Natilde has just been sworn in as president, and she promises to fulfill her obligations. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and in all this time, she has paid her installments responsibly. The money she is requesting is to take the payments for the motor-taxi forward. In this way, she will accumulate money to repay all the installments. The remaining amount will be used to buy sweets and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her motor-taxi

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda C. is 42 years old and married to Romeo, a farmer by day and a fisherman by night. The couple has four children: Rommel – 21 years old, high school graduate; Jayson – 17 years old, high school student; Rochel – 12 years old, grade six, and Roy – 7 years old, grade one. Imelda and her husband are doing their best in order to meet the needs of their family and send their children to school. They are living in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela where farming is one of the major sources of income for most of the residents, aside from fishing.

Imelda used to work as a hired farm laborer in their village. They are doing their best in providing a better life for their children, so they will not have to experience what their parents have been through. Because of the struggles they had, Imelda was motivated to maintain her hog-raising business for them to have an alternative source of income. At present, she is seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 3,000 that she will use to buy feed supplies and hopefully expand the business. The financial assistance would be a great opportunity for Imelda to improve their living conditions. Sometimes, she still works as a farm laborer when not fully occupied in her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed supplies for their pigs

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. lives in Barangay San Vicente Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Claro who serves as Barangay (township) Councilor in their village. They are blessed with a son named Tristan who is already 28 years old, an accounting graduate, and already married. Together with her husband and extended family, they live harmoniously in their home though they have no grandchildren yet.

Julieta runs a canteen stall located in Centro supermarket which is just walking distance from their house. According to Julieta, the loan amounting to PHP 8, 000 will be used to purchase additional stock for her business such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients for cooking traditional rice cakes and delicacies for her canteen. She wants to increase her products to meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes to expand her business into cooking soft noodles for her regular customers. She further said that it is good to generate income out of hard work.

loans.use: purchase of additional products to sell and ingredients for her canteen

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 37 años de edad, y una hija la cual es su razón de vivir, vive hace 17 años con su pareja y actualmente está viviendo en una casa alquilada. Tras la desgracia del huayco (salida del río, causando derrumbe de cerros) que sufrió en el año 2007, Vilma interrumpió su trabajo, ya que sus prendas y demás mercadería fueron afectadas, arruinando sus ventas, hace dos años comenzó de cero su negocio y fue sobreponiéndose poco a poco, alquilando un local, desde entonces viaja a Lima a traer mercadería cada 15 días. Además, también es instructora de aeróbicos, cobrando por semana 40 soles; su esposo también  trabaja en la venta de ropa, pero él lleva la mercadería a otros lugares fuera de la ciudad. Cuando necesitan hacer una inversión juntan sus ganancias por semana que son de 500 a 800 soles, para poder afrontar el alquiler del local y los gastos de educación para su hija que quiere estudiar diseño de modas. Vilma esta muy contenta con sus dos actividades, las cuales la llenan de esperanzas en el futuro, y está pensando construir su casa. Vilma es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, es la tesorera, cargo que cumple con mucha responsabilidad, brindándole su apoyo a la asesora de crédito. Ella está muy contenta de pertenecer a este banco comunal, siendo este su 5to préstamo con MFP y pagando puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su capital, con la adquisición de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and has one daughter, who is her reason for living. She has lived with her husband for the past 17 years, and they currently live in a rented house. The flashflood of 2007, during which the river overflowed, causing a landslide, suspended Vilma's work, as her clothing and other merchandise were affected, ruining her sales. She started her business from scratch two years ago, and has been building it up little by little, renting a storefront and travelling to Lima every 15 days to buy merchandise. In addition she works as an aerobics instructor, earning 40 soles per week. Her husband also works selling clothes, but he takes his merchandise to other places outside of the city. When they need to make an investment they combine their weekly earnings of between 500 and 800 soles. This allows them to pay the rent on the storefront and the education expenses for their daughter, who wants to study fashion design. Vilma is very happy with her two jobs, which fill her with hope for the future, and she is thinking of building her own home. Vilma is a very active member of her community bank. She is the treasurer, a position which comes with a lot of responsibility. She is very happy belonging to this community bank, with this being her fifth loan with MFP, and having made all of her repayments on time. The loan will be used to build up her capital, through purchasing clothing merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M., 54 years old, lives in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Claro who operates their passenger tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) and sometimes hires out as a carpenter in their village and other villages if there is available carpentry work or if someone asks him to do carpentry. They have six children, Mario – 31 years old elementary undegraduate, same as Allan –who is now 30 years old; Danilo – 26 years old, unfortunately did not enter any grades; Clarita – 21 years old, high school graduate, Catherine – 19 years old high school graduate; and Clary – 14 years old, grade six student.

Lolita is looking forward to receiving a loan amounting to PHP 5, 000 as assistance for their passenger "tricycle" business. The amount will be utilized to maintain the operation of their motorcycle daily. Some will also be used by Lolita to start up a new business: buying and selling vegetables, provided they still have enough funds to start up said business.

According to Lolita, she will work with her husband for their family's welfare because they really want to improve their life and ultimately overcome poverty. Part of her goal in life is to finally finish their house for her family's safety and comfort because until now, it is still unfinished.

loans.use: to sustain their passenger "tricycle" business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela A. is already 53 years old; she is the wife of a farmer named Rodolfo who also served as Barangay (township) Chief of Police in the village. The couple is blessed with six children, five male and one female namely: Reynaldo – 35 years old, married, high school graduate, Rodel – 33 years old, college graduate, also married, Jinky – 29 years old, graduate of a two year course in college: Arnel – 28 years old, married, and a high school graduate: Ronel – 20 years old, currently in fourth year college; and Romel – 16 years old, presently third year high school. Marcela has a big happy family, living in the village of Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela, a developing village and religious community.

Marcela is engaged in the vending business, selling various street foods such as barbecue, chicken intestines, hot dogs, and vegetables which are displayed on a portable table in front of their house. She has already been in the business for three years and hopes to increase her vending capital to buy more foods to offer in the business and gain higher income so that she’ll be able help her husband in supporting their family's needs, allowances, and tuition fees for their two children who are still studying. Aside from this, Marcela also wants to have her own mini-grocery store in the village to have additional income.

She wants to receive additional business capital of PHP 4, 000 to buy additional stock for her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: purchase additional products for her vending business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 45 años de edad, vive hace 20 años con su pareja, es madre de tres hijos, con los cuales viven en su casa propia. Ella es enfermera de profesión y trabaja en el hospital, tiene muchos amigos, ya que es muy carismática, entonces ha visto por conveniente aprovechar su popularidad vendiendo mochillas y maletas por la campaña escolar, ella compra esta mercadería directamente de los fabricantes, al por mayor a un precio más económico y las vende individualmente a un precio mayor, este negocio le resulta muy rentable, ya que le permite cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Carmen ofrece la mercadería a sus compañeros de trabajo en el hospital donde trabaja, y el resto de sus clientes son los compañeros de estudios de sus hijos, pero una vez pasada la campaña escolar, su negocio ya no es tan rentable, entonces  invierte sus ganancias en productos cosméticos, y de ese modo trata de estar en contacto con sus clientes. Pese a su trabajo de enfermera se da tiempo para las reuniones de su banco comunal, ella ocupa el cargo de vocal (pasando los comunicados a los integrantes), este es su doceavo préstamo en MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mochilas y maletas, Carmen en verdad esta muy agradecida con aquellos que hacen posible este crédito, ya que su sueldo de técnica enfermera no cubre sus gastos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and has lived with her partner for 20 years. She is the mother of 3 children who live with her in her house. She works as a nurse in a hospital and has a lot of friends since she is so charismatic. She has taken advantage of her popularity by selling backpacks and suitcases for the school season. She buys directly from the manufacturers, mostly at inexpensive prices, and sells the merchandise individually at a higher price. This business has been very profitable and has allowed her to cover the expenses of her household. Carmen offers the merchandise to her co-workers in the hospital and the rest of her customers are the classmates of her children. However, during one past school season, her business was not as profitable, so she started investing her profits in cosmetic products, and continued selling to her customers this way. Despite her job as a nurse, she still makes time to attend the meetings of the communal bank, and holds a position distributing bank communications to all members. This is her twelfth loan from Kiva partner MFP, and has always demonstrated that she repays the installments on time. The money she is requesting is to purchase additional backpacks and suitcases. Carmen is truly thankful to those who make this credit possible since her salary as a nurse technician does not cover all her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise from manufacturers

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora B. lives in the village of Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. She is 35 years old and married to Luiseno, a farmer. They have four children: Marmites, 17, a high school student; Richard, 15, an elementary school graduate; Mary Rose, 12, and Melody, 10, both elementary school students. Nora is hoping that in the future, she will be able to send all her children to school through her business.

Nora sells vegetables in their village. She earns around PHP300 daily. This is budgeted for their daily needs and allowances for her children. Her husband is sometimes hired as farm laborer in their village and this also generates additional income for their family.

Nora wants to request a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional capital for her vegetable vending business. She will utilize the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables including some native snacks to increase her daily vending income, which would somehow improve her business. Nora promises to repay the amount weekly so that she will be able to avoid past due accounts.

loans.use: Buy different kinds of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a village store operator. She is married to Dignomar, who works as a government employee, and they are blessed with a six-year-old daughter named Desiree, who is now a grade one student. She is thankful that her family is blessed with good health.

She requests a loan amounting to PHP10,000 as business additional capital for her business where she offers different goods such as bottled and canned goods, soft drinks and so on. The loan she is requesting will be of great help towards the improvement of her business and for the education of her child. She further said that she must be good in the business and she knows that she should bring out her best to sustain it.

She is thankful to God that in time of trouble He is always there to guide them.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia acaba de cumplir 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, actualmente viven en su casa propia. Años anteriores vivía en un pueblo rural, cultivando plantas frutales, pero debido a las necesidades y a los gastos mayores para sus hijos, se vio obligada a migrar de su pueblo con miras de hacer negocio más grande que pueda cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Es así, que se dedicó a la venta de frutas de forma ambulatoria por un lapso de 3 años, le fue muy bien resultándole rentable, y gracias a ello pudo adquirir un terreno donde posteriormente construyó su casa de madera con el apoyo de sus familiares, ahí puso su negocio de venta de carne de pollo, el cual que poco a poco ha ido captando más clientes y le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias. Es por ello que Lidia está muy contenta, ya que además ha logrado poner un pequeño negocio de venta de cerveza en su mismo establecimiento. Acaba de recibir el cargo de tesorera en su banco comunal, lo que la hace feliz, por la confianza brindada, este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo a demostrado pagar con mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que está solicitando invertirá en su negocio de venta de carne de pollo, además comprará más frutas y otra parte para incrementar la cantidad de cervezas que vende.
texts.en:
Lidia has just turned 35 years old. She is a single mother with 3 children, who live in her own house. Years ago she lived in a rural village, cultivating fruit plants, but owing to the needs and costs for her children, she saw it necessary to migrate from her village to create a bigger business that could cover the needs of her children. It's for this reason that she dedicated herself to the sale of fruits by cart, 3 years ago. She did very well, resulting in a profitable business, and thanks to this she was able to acquire land where afterwards she built her house from wood with the help of her family. There she established her business selling chicken meat, which little by little has captured more clients and has permitted her to obtain good earnings. It's because of this business that Lidia is very happy, because she also has been able to add a small business selling beer in the same establishment. She has just received the position of treasurer at her communal bank, which makes her happy, for the confidence that it shows. This is her 5th loan with MFP and in all this time she has repaid the loans with great responsibility. With the money that she is requesting this time, she will invest it in her chicken sale business, and will also buy more fruit, and will increase the amount of beer that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailanie M. lives in Barangay Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Ferdinand, who is a construction worker. They have two children: Micah Ruth, 9, a grade V student and Franshelle, who is just three months old. Lailanie said that though they are poor, they are still a happy family.

Lailanie wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP6, 000, which will be utilized as additional capital for her store. She intends to use the money to buy stocks to avoid frequent visits to the market to save time and money. Her wish is to send her children to school and for them to finish college education in order to have a better future. Lailanie also hopes to overcome life's difficulties by simply striving to work hard in order to achieve her ambitions.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is already 33 years old and a mother of three named: Jamaica, 12, a grade 6 student; Glorylyn, 7, a grade one student; and Janelymae, 4 years old. Julieta is married to Lino, a furniture worker. Julieta manages to serve as beautician in their village at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela.

Despite the difficulties experienced by her family, Julieta and her husband are able to support all the needs of their family and they are able to live happily and harmoniously with the other members of their community.

Julieta wanted to have a better life someday by improving her skills in providing beauty services such as hair fixing, face make-up, pedicure and manicure in their village. She wants to buy new sets of beauty kits for her business. The loan will also enable her to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her eggplants which are planted in their backyard. For the realization of her plans, Julieta wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP4,000.

Julieta promised that she will never try to be a burden with her co-members in the program and promised to work hard to attain her goal in life. She also added that God is always guiding her and her family till the end.

loans.use: Purchase new sets of beauty kits and fertilizers for her eggplants

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married to Gerbacio D. and they are blessed with four children: Jonel, 34, a high school graduate; Joper, 32, a high school graduate; Jameson, 30, a college graduate; Jerly, 27, a high school graduate. All their children are already married and have their own families. Only one grandson lives with them in their house located at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. According to Yolanda, her family can be described as happy and God-fearing.

“Yoly”, as she is fondly called by her friends, is already 52 years old and still runs a vending business which she hated to do before. But due to life's difficulties, she is engaged in selling meats, rice, and fish in their village in order to generate income for their daily living. Her husband is a farmer and they need to help each other to satisfy the needs of their family. Thus, Yoly wants to request a loan amounting to PHP5,000 as additional capital for her vending business in order to have a sustainable and progressive business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta N. is engaged in a tailoring business situated near in their home. Her business is their alternative source of income aside from her husband's farming business.

She is 56 years old and married to Rogelio. They live in Paragu Tumauini, Isabela, a small rural area, together with their seven children: Jason – 36 years old, an automotive technology graduate; Samson – 34 years old, an elementary school graduate; Nelson – 30 years old, a high school graduate; Raquel – 29 years old, a computer secretarial graduate; Jeriel – 27 years old, an elementary graduate; Ronalyn – 24 years old, an HRM graduate and Jenny – 20 years old, a college undergraduate. Her dream for her family is to overcome their poor living situation.

Julieta is requesting for a loan of PHP 5,000 that she plans to use to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She has been in this kind of business for ten years and she was glad that business is still doing well.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis L. operates a passenger tricycle in their village, while his wife Sherill is working as a high school teacher. They do not have children since they just get married. As a husband, Dennis does not want to depend on the income of his wife, this is the reason why he keeps on striving hard to help his wife in their household expenses and save something for their future children.

Dennis would like to engage in the hog-raising business. For this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that he can use to purchase at least three piglets to start the new business. He is planning to use his income from his tricycle operation to buy feeds for his piglets. Dennis is hoping that his income from his tricycle will increase and his plan for his hog-raising business will succeed and generate additional income. Dennis is working hard and tries to be patient to overcome the obstacles in the business for him to become successful.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo A. operates a passenger tricycle in their village at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela, an Agriculture Reformed Community (ARC) village. Reynaldo is 35 years old. His wife, Marites, is a simple housewife who takes care of their two children: Rema – 14 years old, who is in her second year of high school and Remark – 6 years old, who is in day care. Though operating a passenger tricycle is the only source of income, Reynaldo has able to support his family basic needs and education of his two children.

He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP6,000 to maintain his tricycle operation that travels from their village to the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. He plans to use his loan to buy new spare parts for the safety of his passengers. Reynaldo is a hard-working man. He prays that God will help him in achieving his dreams and provide a better life for their family.

loans.use: Buy spare parts

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is asking for financial support that amounts to PHP6, 000 that will serve as additional business capital for her sari-sari store (a community-based store). She inherited her store from her stepfather who is working as a government employee. Some of the things that she plans to buy are soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar and other basic commodities that are needed by her customers. With additional capital, she is also positive that her income will increase. She is willing to do her best for her business to succeed. Aside from her store, Revelyn is also a hog raiser. She believes that investing in the business will be of great help in preparation for the education of her child.

Revelyn is 31 years old and her husband, Feliciano, is working as a security guard. They have a son named Raen. She hopes to improve her village store for the welfare of her family and to show her stepfather that she really deserved his trust.

loans.use: Buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Rhodalyn

texts.en:
Rhodalyn G. is a vegetable vendor in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. Their place is a big community with seven “puroks” (districts) and is part of the Agriculture Reformed Community (ARC) in the municipality of Tumauini. Her husband is a fisherman since they are living near the Cagayan River. They have four children: Jessica – 15 years old, an elementary graduate; Joseph – 11 years old, currently entering grade four; Felix Jr. – 10 years old, in grade three and Jonalyn – 9 years old, in grade two.

Having limited sources of income, Rhodalyn and her husband are striving to work hard to support the needs of their family and send their children to school. For the improvement of her business, Rhodalyn is asking to borrow PHP4,000 to finance her vegetable vending business. She hopes that through her business, she can uplift their living condition and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Roselene

texts.en:
Roselene S. is managing a small sari-sari store (a community based store) business along the Maharlika highway of Barangay Alibagu, Ilagan, Isabela.  She can say that their place is striving towards development.  She is married to Rogelio and they were gifted with one daughter named Mary Rose; she is now 13 years old and already in high school.  Roselene can say that they have an average way of living since they are both working to meet the needs of their family.  

Her husband is working as a maintenance officer in their village while she runs her village store and ventures into direct selling.  For her business to grow, Roselene is asking to borrow a loan of PHP7,000.00 that she can use to improve her store.  With her determination to succeed, she is hoping that someday her daughter will earn a college degree and have a better job.

loans.use: Improvement of village store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira Bucad is a mother to six children: Elvie – 16 years old, senior high school student; Clarissa – 15 years old, sophomore high school; Mary Jane – 13 years old, a graduating elementary student; Gilvies – 11 years old, grade five; Rosemarie – 9 years old, grade three and the youngest is two years old.  Her husband is a farmer and they are living in the the rural village of Pilitan Tumauini, Isabela. 

Elvira is engaged in the sari-sari store business (a community based store).  Aside from her store, she would also like to expand her hog raising business.  With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP4,000.00 that she can use to purchase two piglets and maybe 30 kilos of feed supply.  She will also use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  

She is hoping to uplift their living status through her patience and hard works in the business. Elvira also prays that all her children will someday finish their college education and hopefully have a better job in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets and feed supply and commodities for her store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and married to Martino, who operates a jeep to and from their village at Alibagu to Centro Ilagan, Isabela.  They were blessed with six children: Hary Jun, 26 years old, Micheal, 24 years old, and Jomar, 23 years, were all college undergraduates; Roman – 18 years old, is currently in his second year of college; Roland – 13 years old, high school student; and Rio – 6 years old, already in grade one.  According to Rosalinda, the village where they live is peaceful and businesses are progressing since it is near to the public market of Ilagan, Isabela. 

Rosalinda has been helping her husband manage their small electronic shop in their village for almost 12 years. She wanted to make a difference in the coming days thus Rosalinda wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP7,000 that she can use as business capital.  She intends to use the loan to assist her husband in purchasing additional equipment or materials needed in their electronic shop and for the maintenance of their passenger jeep.  She said that their family business is really of great help in sustaining their needs and allowances of her children to school.

loans.use: Purchase of electronic parts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is so grateful that their own backyard, where they raise eggplants, has been their source of income since 2003.  Indeed, it has been a great help to her and her family composed of her husband and four children who are all beyond the age of 20.

She wants to request a loan amounting to Php6,000 in order to purchase farm inputs which include water supply and fertilizer to ensure a good harvest.  Being in the business of growing and selling vegetables for five years has taught her a lot of experiences, one of which is having a poor harvest resulting from inability to provide the needed fertilizer and water supply.  She does not want it to recur so she grabbed the opportunity to get a loan from a micro-finance institution which does not only offer monetary capital but also renders capacity building such as seminars on agriculture and financial literacy.  

Teresita has high hopes that her business will grow and they will become more successful and ultimately have their own stall in the market someday.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is 27 years old.  Her husband Pepito is a construction worker and a farmer. They have two children: Joanna, 22 years old, college under graduate and Jonalyn, 19 years old, a college student taking a biology course. They live in the simple village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela, a place rich in agricultural land and most of their products are corn, tobacco and vegetables. Lolita also shares that her family is doing well despite the hardships that they are experiencing.

Rice mill is their family business.  She helps her husband in maintaining the business to sustain their basic needs and education of their daughter.  With her desire to help her husband in their rice mill, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 3,000.00 that they will use for business operations and buy some spare parts for the machine.  Part of the loan will also be used in her fish vending business.  She plans to buy at least 10 kilos of fish for additional income that will support not only their family needs but also to support their businesses.  

She is hoping that through their income, they can support the education of their youngest child until college.

loans.use: Business operations and for fish vending

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is managing a sari-sari store (a community based store) business in their village.  Through her store, she was able to provide the basic needs of their family.  She wants her business to grow to further meet the needs of her family.  With this, she would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP7,000.00.  This amount will be of great help in increasing her merchandise and in maintaining her electronic loading business.  Believing that through hard work and perseverance she will able to sustain her business and support all their needs someday.  She enjoys what she is doing right now and treasure every moment towards the development of her village store.        

Elena is 47 years old and still single.  She is the bread winner of the family and they live in a peaceful village and most of the people are hospitable and friendly.

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is operating a sound system service in their village. Her family is the only one who has this kind of business in their community.  Residents rent their sound system during weddings, feast, birthdays, anniversaries and other special occasions. However due to the modernization and advancement of technologies, their sound system is becoming obsolete.  With this, Ana Marie wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP4,000 that she will use to buy modern equipment that will satisfy the demands of their customers. They have been in this business for almost ten years and the rental fee for their sound system is PHP2,500 for two days. 
 
She spends most of her income in supporting their farming needs and educational needs of their children who are still studying. Ana Marie tries her best to improve their business service in order to attract more customers to generate more income for her family. 

Ana Marie is 49 years old and married to Zaldy.  Their marriage was gifted with four children: Ana Claire – 11 years old, graduating elementary student; Albert – 17 years, college student; Mylene – 23 years old, college graduate and working in Dubai and Crizaldo – 25 years old, a vocational course graduate.  She is working hard to sustain her business and hopefully venture to another type of business someday.

loans.use: Purchase of modern equipment

loans.name: Dina Fe

texts.en:
Dina Fe is engaged in retailing business.  She owns a sari-sari store (a community based store) in their village.  Their village is located beside the Cagayan River which is considered the longest river in the Philippines. She is married to Garry and they were blessed with a daughter named Divine Grace and she is only ten months old.  
	
Due to lack of business capital, she has decided to borrow a loan of PHP4,000.  She believes that this amount will help her to cope up with her business.  Some of the things that she plans to buy for her store are: sardines, cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk, noodles, salt, laundry soap and toiletries.  In this way, she can meet the demands of her customers and at the same time increase her income.
 
Her business also enables her to assist her husband in search of better livelihood opportunities and save something for the future of their family.  House improvement is also one of her wish in the coming years aside from business development.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
“Love your neighbor as you love yourself”, this is one of God’s commandments that Jonaliza tries to practice for she believes that loving your fellow man means loving God. She is already 40 years old and married to Juan M..  Her husband is a farmer which is the main occupation of the residents in their village.  They do not have a child but they are still hoping that their prayers will be answered despite their age.  

Jonaliza is engaged in the sari-sari store (a community based store) business.  Aside from selling different commodities, she is also planning to venture into rice retailing.  With this, she would like to borrow at least PHP 7,000.00 that she will use to buy a minimum of 5 sacks of rice.  The amount will also assist her in developing her village store in terms of increase in merchandise.  In this way, she can meet the demands of her customers and they do not have to go to the town proper.  Her store has been operating for almost one year and she is hoping that it will last for years.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of rice

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T. is living in the rural and rough road community of Barangay Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela together with her parents. Lina shares that most of the residents in their community maintain corn and tobacco farming while some are engaged in fishing at night for extra income while waiting for the harvest season.  Living conditions in their village are so simple but they are striving to overcome poverty.  She is 26 years old, single and she still has no plan of getting married at the moment.  

She manages a Panciteria (a small canteen business selling cooked noodles and other snacks) business in their village.  She has been in this business for two years and her store is open from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening.  She usually goes to the market once a week to purchase the necessary ingredients she needs and to minimize transportation expenses.  Before reaching the public market, she needs to ride a ferry boat and tricycle. 

To further improve her business, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP5,000.00 that will serve as financial assistance in purchasing the main ingredients such as eggs and pancit (soft noodles). She is also planning to engage in the hog raising business and buy one piglet.  Lina dreams of uplifting the living condition of her family. This is the reason why she keeps on working hard to attain her dreams.

loans.use: Financial Assistance

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia O. vive en Soyapango, municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Ana Julia vive en una colonia con un flujo muy alto de trabajadores clase obrera con pocos ingresos, este flujo de personas lleva a Ana Julia a idear su propio negocio. Con mucho valor y visión Ana Julia montó un pequeño comedor para empleados que no pueden preparar sus propios alimentos, poniendo a sus servicios almuerzos y todo tipo de comida casera a bajo precios. Su negocio se ha desarrollado muy bien pero a pesar de ello Ana julia monta una tortillería y vende productos AVON para obtener mas ingresos, y Ahora Ana Julia solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en materiales y productos nuevos para continuar ampliando su comedor, y a su vez, ampliar los servicios brindados a todos aquellos trabajadores de la zona que los necesitan.
texts.en:
Ana Julia O. lives in Soyapango, a municipality in the administrative district of San Salvador. Ana Julia lives in a neighborhood with a very high flow of working class citizens with little income, and this flow of people gave Ana Julia an idea to start her own business. With much courage and vision Ana Julia opened a small eatery for workers who cannot cook their own meals. She offers lunches and all types of home-cooked meals at a low price. Her business has grown very well, and in addition Ana Julia also runs a shop selling tortillas and sells Avon products to increase her income. Ana Julia is now seeking a loan to buy new products and materials in order to continue expanding her eatery, and in turn, expand the services offered to all of those workers in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for her eatery

loans.name: Carmen Alfredo

texts.es: Carmen Alfredo C. vive en  el municipio de Apopa, La Libertad.  Alfredo es padre soltero de 3 niños pequeños. Hace ocho años, Alfredo monto su propia panadería siempre ha tenido la necesidad de buscar cómo superarse y ser mejor cada día. Su negocio ha crecido en los últimos años el cual genera empleo a 3 personas que le ayudan en su negocio, prueba del éxito y demanda de su pan es que Alfredo  siempre ha  manejado con disciplina y responsabilidad su negocio. Alfredo solicita un préstamo para  comprar un horno más para que aumente su producción de pan y genere más ingresos en sus ventas obtenidas. Ya que hasta el día de hoy solo posee dos hornos que ya no alcanzan a sacar la suficiente producción de pan que los clientes exigen.
texts.en:
Carmen Alfredo C. lives in the municipality of Apopa, La Libertad. Alfredo is a single father with 3 small children. 8 years ago, Alfredo set up his own bakery. He had always had the need to see how he could improve himself and be better each day. His business has grown in the last few years, and he now employs 3 people who help him in his business - proof of his success and the demand for his bread. Alfredo has always driven his business with discipline and responsibility. He is seeking a loan to buy one more oven so he can expand his bread production and generate more income from his sales. Until today he has only put in 2 ovens which now aren't enough to produce the amount of bread that his clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de un horno para elaboración de pan
