location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely C. vive en Soyapando dentro del departamento de San Salvador.  Desde hace ya 5 años  Delmy es madre de dos niños menores de edad, que reciben educación primaria. Delmy  se dedica a su pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de belleza AVON. Tras no poder pagar un local en una zona de actividad económica, Delmy sale día a día de su casa para recorrer calles y vender ambulantemente de casa en casa.Con perseverancia y optimismo Delmy encuentra las fuerzas para levantarse cada mañana. Ahora Delmy solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y extender la gama de mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes,  pues considera necesario innovar en sus productos y ofrecer siempre novedades para mantener sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely C. lives in Soyapando in the region of San Salvador. For 5 years, Delmy has been mother to 2 young children, who are at primary school. Delmy has a small business consisting of the sale of Avon Beauty Products. After not being able to pay for a location in the economically active zone, Delmy leaves her house every day to travel around the streets and make mobile sales house to house. With perserverance and optimism, Delmy finds the strength to get up each day. Delmy is seeking a loan to buy new products and extend the range of products that she offers her clients, because she considers it necessary to be innovative with her products and always offer new things to maintain satisfied clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon beauty products and perfumes

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora del Carmen C. D. O. vive en el municipio D. Ciudad Delgado en la capital del país, con su esposo Ramón D. 70 años y sus dos hijos. Debido a la alta edad D. su esposo, Dinora no pueD. contar ya con el respaldo económico suyo, y es ahora la responsable y cabeza D. la familia.
Dinora maneja una venta D. prendas D. vestir y materiales D. costura, negocio con el cual mantiene su familia y paga las cuentas mensualmente. Su enorme dedicación en su negocio la han llevado a ser uno D. los puestos más reconocidos D. su zona, alcanzando una gran demanda frecuente. Dinora y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nuevos artículos y mercadería que le permitan ampliar su margen D. ganancia y brindar seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora del Carmen C. D. O. lives in the municipality of Ciudad Delgado in the country's capital, with her husband Ramon, who is 70 years old, and their two children. As her husband is of an advanced age Dinora can no longer rely on his economic support, and she is now the head of the family. Dinora works selling clothing and sewing materials, and with this business she is able to support her family and pay the monthly bills. Her enormous dedication to her business has resulted in it being one of the most well-known in the neighborhood, and attracting many regular customers. Dinora and her family are seeking a loan to buy new items and merchandise, which will allow her to increase her profit margin and offer economic security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Francisca Gladys

texts.es: Francisca Gladys D. de 54 años de edad reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador.  Hace varios años abrió una venta de cosméticos y papelería en su propia casa. Con este humilde negocio Francisca pago sus estudios universitarios que ahora le permiten ejercer un mejor ejemplo a sus dos hijos quienes también han salido adelante. A pesar de todos sus logros Francisca y su familia siempre buscan la manera de avanzar y crecer un poco más, por lo que Francisca solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio  y comprar nueva mercadería  que den nueva vida a su negocio y le permitan  crecer aún más.
texts.en:
Francisca Gladys D., 54 years old, lives in the town of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. A few years ago she opened a cosmetics and stationery business in her own house. With this humble business Francisca paid for her university studies which now permit her to set a better example for her 2 children, who have also progressed forward. In spite of all her achievements, Francisca and her family always look for a way to advance and grow a little more, for which reason Francisca is seeking a loan to reinvest in her business and buy new products, which will give new life to her business and allow it to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercarderia para su negocio

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es: José Guillermo R. P. vive en Soyapango , departamento de San Salvador. El no contar con educación formal nunca ha sido impedimento para buscar trabajo, y desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la albañilería por contrato.  El negocio de la albañilería  es muchas veces inestable, pues Jose Guillermo  trabajo por proyectos, y no siempre logra obtener contrataciones continuas. Esto no desanima a Jose, quien siempre busca la manera de aprender nuevas cosas que le permitan lograr mas contratos, en este momento, solicita un préstamo para adquirir nuevos materiales y herramientas de albañilería que le permitan acceder a nuevos y más proyectos.
texts.en:
José Guillermo R. P. lives in Soyapango, a district of San Salvador. Although he doesn't have a formal education this has never been an impediment in looking for work, and he has worked for a number of years as a contract bricklayer. The bricklaying business is often unstable, and as Jose Guillermo works on a project basis he is not always able to obtain continuous work. This doesn't deter Jose, who always looks for ways to learn new skills which will allow him to obtain more contracts. He is currently seeking a loan to buy new bricklaying tools and materials which will give him access to new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bricklaying tools and materials

loans.name: Mercedes Eloisa

texts.es:
Mercedes Eloisa A. D. S. vive en Soyapango con  su hijo Miguel D. tan solo  6 años D. edad.
Debido a dificultades económicas su esposo se mudo a E.E.U.U. para buscar una mejor manera D. ayudar a la familia y asegurar el futuro D. su niño, dejando a Mercedes con la manutención diaria y educación D. Miguel.
Mercedes maneja un pequeño negocio ambulante D. venta D. perfumes y ropa que venD. a sus vecinos y familiares. Con el incremento D. los gastos familiares y la necesidad D. cubrir la educación D. su hijo, Mercedes Eloisa solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y poder ampliar sus ingresos, y así cimentar un mejor futuro para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes Eloisa A. D. S. lives in Soyapango with her son, Miguel, only 6 years old.

Owing to financial difficulties, her husband moved to the United States to seek a better way to help his family and secure his son’s future, leaving Mercedes to raise and educate Miguel.

Mercedes manages a small mobile business selling perfume and clothing to her neighbors and family. Due to the increase in household expenses and the need to cover the costs of her son’s education, Mercedes Eloisa is asking for a loan to purchase new merchandise so she will be able to increase her income and assure a better future for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Soleyvi Vanesa

texts.es: Soleyvi Vanesa E. R. vive en el municipio de ciudad Delgado, San Salvador.  A sus escasos 23 años, Soleyvi tiene ya su propio negocio de belleza, un salón donde ofrece todo tipo de servicios a excelentes precios.  Su gran espíritu de superación han llevado  a Soleyvi a soñar con la apertura de una cadena de salones de belleza en todo el país, sueño que ha iniciado hace ya cuatro años cuando abrió el negocio. Soleyvi solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y abastecer con nuevos productos su negocio para poder servir de mejor manera a sus clientes y dar un paso más en la obtención de su sueño.
texts.en:
Soleyvi Vanesa E. R. lives in the Delgado municipality of San Salvador. At only 23 years old, Soleyvi already had her own business, a beauty salon that offers all kinds of services at excellent prices. With her great strength in prevailing, Soleyvi dreams of opening a chain of beauty salons across the whole country, a dream that began four years ago when she opened her business. Soleyvi is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise and supply new products so her business can better serve its customers and get a step closer to obtaining her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally M.  is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business man . He is a carpentry man. He runs the business at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.  He makes and sells different types of furniture to customers. Buguruni is a trading timber market center.  He need a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more business stocks

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en: Godlove M.  runs a business of selling cold drinks at Yombo Vituka Dar es Salaam. He is a micro-entrepreneur, Tanzanian, and a married man. Cold drinks business is in high demand in Dar es Salaam due to the hot weather. He meets his family's daily demand including paying the children's school fees from the business income.  He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,00,000 to boost up his business.

loans.use: To buy more business stocks

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia E. is a married woman. She runs a business of selling charcoal at Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She buys stock direct from the wholesale producers from different Tanzanian regions. Charcoal is the main source of power for domestic cooking in Tanzania and the rest of the developing countries. She sells to retail customers. She is in need of  a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to purchase more stocks.

loans.use: To buy more stocks

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en: Silvester E. runs a business of selling charcoal at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. E. is a married man with four children. Charcoal is the main source of power in most developing countries. This is due to high cost of electricity for low-income people. He has been in the business for three years. He purchases the charcoal direct from the producers and sells it retail to customers. He needs loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more stocks.

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid M. is a Tanzanian, an entrepreneur, and a married man. He runs a Tailoring mart business at Yombo Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. He makes varieties of clothes with different designs for different people including school uniforms. He purchases the items from Kariakoo wholesale shops. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to keep up his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nelson Fernando

texts.pt:
Nelson Fernando F. é natural de Maputo cidade e vive neste momento no distrito de Boane, tendo se mudado quando o seu pai foi transferido da cidade para Boane, tem 23 anos de idade, solteiro. É estudante do 3ºano da psicologia escolar.

Nelson é professor permanente a 4 anos, obedecendo um horário de trabalho que vai das 7h as 12h. Com um salário mensal de 5125,00mt faz poupanças n final do mês, vive numa casa própria.

Para Nelson este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 13000,00mt e este de 18000,00mt para continuidade do projecto de construção, Nelson pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Nelson Fernando F. is from Maputo and currently lives in the district of Boane, having moved here when he was transferred from the city. He is 23 years old, single and a 3rd year psychology student.

Nelson has been a permanent teacher for 4 years, following a work timetable from 7:00 am to 12:00 noon. With his monthly salary of 5125,00 MZN he manages to save money at the end of the month and lives in his own house.

This is Nelson’s second loan from Hluvuku and his first from Kiva. His first loan was for 13000,00 MZN and this one is for 18000,00 MZN in order to continue the construction of his house. Nelson intends to pay off his loan early so he can request another one to furnish his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Araujos João Da Costa

texts.pt:
Araujos João da Costa M. é natural de Boane um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos, com idade entre 13; 9; 5 e 2 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família e vive numa casa própria.

Araujos estudou até 12ªclasse do ensino técnico profissional como docente, desde a sua infância esta a viver neste distrito de Boane apenas saiu durante 4 anos quando foi a formação. Em 1996 casou se casamento que resultou nos 4 filhos. Desde 1989 trabalha como docente e trabalha das 8h as 14h. com um salário mensal de 6400,00mt.

Para Araujos este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, assim também pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Araujos João da Costa M. is from Boane, one of the provinces of the district of Maputo. He is 35 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged 13, 9, 5 and 2. His only dependents are his family and he lives in his own house.

Araujos was in school until the 12th grade and is a professional teacher. He has lived in this district of Boane since his childhood, leaving only for 4 years whilst on training. In 1996 he got married and his marriage resulted in 4 children. Since 1989 he has been working as a teacher and works from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm with a monthly salary of 64000,00 MZN.

This is Araujos’ third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He also intends to pay the loan off before it is due in order to solicit another one to furnish his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.pt:
José Maria D. S. é natural da cidade da Matola província do Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de dois filhos com idade entre 7 e 4 anos respectivamente, onde o mais velho já vai a escola.

José estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por ter tido pequenos problemas de carater social, desde a sua infância nunca mudou da cidade sempre viveu na mesma e em casa D. seus pais até ao seu casamento.

Jose trabalha numa esplanada como supervisor a mais de 10 anos, tem um salário mensal de 10000,00mt, obedecendo um horário de trabalho das 8h as 22h. vive numa casa própria.

Para José este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, tendo como maior sonho ver a sua casa concluída e concluir o pagamento antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de comprar uma viatura.
texts.en:
José Maria D. S. is from the city of Matola in the province of Maputo. He is 36 years old, married and a father to two children aged 7 and 4, the eldest of whom already goes to school.

José was in school until the 12th grade when he left his studies due to a few small social problems. He has never moved away from the city and he lived with his parents until he got married.

José has worked as a supervisor in a café for more than 10 years and has a monthly salary of 10000,00 MZN, working from 8 am to 10 pm. He lives in his own house.

This is José's third loan from Hluvuku and his first from Kiva. His biggest dream is to see his house be completed and to repay his loan before it is due in order to ask for another loan to purchase a vehicle.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Sílvia Da Conceição Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Sílvia da Conceição Gonçalves D. V. é natural da província D. Maputo, tem 26 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de dois filhos com idade entre 6 e 3 anos respectivamente, o primeiro já vai a escola. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos. Neste momento vive numa casa de aluguer.

Sílvia estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quanD. ficou grávida tenD. iD. ao lar, desde a sua infância nunca mudou se de cidade. Sílvia é comerciante e dona D. negocio, qual conta com apoio de um empregaD., tenD. um estabelecimento que abre das 7h e fecha as 18h da segunda-feira à sábaD.. O estabelecimento fornece quase um pouco de tuD. onde destaca se o amendoim que o adquira por 30,00mt o kg e vende por 45,00mt. Desta forma obtêm um rendimento diário de 1300,00mt e faz poupança no final D. mês. 

Sílvia solicita empréstimo pela quarta vez na Hluvuku e primeira no Kiva, nos seguintes montantes (7200,00mt; 10500,00mt; 16000,00mt e este que será de 20000,00mt) sempre aplicou no aumento D. estoque. Assim tem como planos futuros a construção de um aviário para criação de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Sílvia da Conceição Gonçalves D. V. is from the province of Maputo. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of two children aged 6 and 3, the eldest of which already goes to school. She only has her children to support. At the moment she lives in a rented house.

Sílvia was in school until the 8th grade and left when she became pregnant and moved to a home. She has never moved away from the city. Sílvia is a trader and a business owner and counts on the support of an employee as her establishment opens at 7 am and closes at 6 pm, Monday to Saturday. Her establishment sells a little bit of everything, such as peanuts which she buys for 30,00 MZN a kilo and sells for 45,00 MZN. In this way she has a daily income of 1300,00 MZN and she saves money at the end of the month.

Sílvia is requesting her fourth loan from Hluvuku and her first from Kiva - they have been for 72000,00 MZN, 10500,00 MZN, 16000,00 MZN and 20000,00 MZN and she has always used them to buy more stock. She plans to build an aviary in the future to rear hens for slaughter.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more stock

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo A. é natural de Inhambane uma das províncias da zona sul de Moçambique, tem 39 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade entre 5 e 6 meses anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta 3 irmãos.

Bernardo estudou até 12ªclasse e neste momento faz um curso a distância. Bernardo mudou se de Inhambane na companhia dos pais transferidos em missão de serviços, dai saiu da cidade para Distrito de Boane com propósito de praticar agricultura nas culturas de Hortícolas. Dai que lhe surgiu a ideia de desenvolver a criação de pintos sendo um dos negócios que tem bons rendimentos/lucros.

Para Bernardo este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende ampliar o seu negócio. É dono do negócio e desenvolve a 5 anos, onde trabalha das 6h as 12h. Bernardo pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar mais afim de construir mais capoeiras para permitir ter mais frangos.
texts.en:
Bernardo A. is from Inhambane, one of the Southern provinces of Mozambique. He is 39 years old, married and the father of 2 children - one is 5 years old and the other 6 months old. Besides his children, he also support 3 brothers.

Bernardo was in school until the 12th grade and at the moment he is on a distance learning course. Bernardo moved to Inhambane with his parents who were transferred there for work. He left the city for the district of Boane in order to practice agriculture in the more horticultural region. This is where the idea to breed chickens came from, as it is a business with a good income/profits.

This is Bernardo's first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva, which he intends to use to grow his business. He owns the business which he has been developing for 5 years and works on it from 6 am to 12 noon. Bernardo intends to pay off his loan before it is due in order to request another one to build more hencoops and breed more chickens.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and breeding of chickens

loans.name: Osvaldo Júlio

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Júlio N. é natural da província do Maputo distrito de Matola, tem 30 anos de idade, casados maritalmente e pai de dois filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 4 anos e o segundo com um ano de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Osvaldo estudou até 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições, desde a sua infância viveu na Matola e aos vinte anos mudou se para distrito de Boane no bairro de Massaca local onde mora até data hoje.

Osvaldo é trabalhador como motorista mecânico a 7 anos, tem um horário das 7 as 17h da segunda a sexta-feira, tem um salário mensal de 8000,00mt e consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês, ele vive na casa cedida pelo tio.

Para Osvaldo este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva. Tomou conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku através de colegas que já são clientes. Osvaldo pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro de forma a concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Júlio N. was born in Matola, Mozambique. 30 years-old, married, and father of two children ages 4 and 1, he is the sole provider for his family. Due to financial difficulties, his studies were interrupted at the end of high-school. At age 20 Osvaldo moved from the Matola to the Boane district, where he still lives. He has been working as a driver-mechanic for 7 years. Working Mon-Fri, from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, his monthly salary is 8000,00 mt, which allows him to save some money--he currently lives in a house lent by his uncle. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He learned about Hluvuku though a friend, who is already a client. Osvaldo plans to pay his first loan back quickly, so he can apply for another one, to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Gatete

texts.en:
“Assalamu alaikum", which means peace be to you.”from GATETE A. in Remera sector, Gasabo District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda!! A. is 29 years old, single without orphans.

A. is a bead worker, he has been employed in a barbershop as a barber for 3 years and he decided to open his own barbershop at Remera in Gasabo District near the AMAHORO Stadium. A. employs 7 people who help him to run the businees. His Barbershop is called HAVANA Barbershop.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515 000Rwf, which will help him to buy more material in order to expand his business. A. believe that once he get this loan, the number of staff will increase and also his monthly income will increase.

loans.use: Expand his Business

loans.name: Mutesayire

texts.en:
Greetings from MUTESAYIRE S. in Gatenga Sector, Kicukiro District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda! S. is 33 years old, married with one child and one orphan.

S. started her business 3 years ago .She owns a clothes store where she sells different men's and women's clothes in Kimironko market. She employs 2 persons who help her to run this business and she earns about 85,000Rwf as the monthly profit.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515,000Rwf, which will help her to expand the business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Gatete

texts.en:
“Assalamu alaikum", which means peace be to you, from GATETE A. in Remera sector, Gasabo District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda!! A. is 29 years old, single without orphans.

A. is a bead worker; he has been employed in a barbershop as a barber for 3 years and he decided to open his own barbershop at Remera in Gasabo District near the AMAHORO Stadium. A. employs 7 people who help him to run the businees. His Barbershop is called HAVANA Barbershop.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515,000Rwf, which will be used in to buy more material in order to expand his business. A. believe that once he gets this loan, the number of staff will increase and also his monthly income will increase. This loan will be repaid in 12 months on monthly basis.

loans.use: Exapand his Business

loans.name: Mutamba

texts.en:
Muraho (Hello) from MUTAMBA W. in Kimironko Sector, Gasabo District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda!! W. is 35 years old, married with 2 children and 1 orphan. 

W. is a bead worker; she operates a restaurant near the Kimironko market where she has many clients. This entrepreneur employs 4 persons who help her to run this restaurant and she earns about 210,000Rwf as the monthly profit.

W. is requesting a loan worth 515,000Rwf, which will help her to buy more material in order to satisfy her client’s needs. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra. Maria vende productos omnilife desde hace dos años pues le ha ido bien ya que es un producto aceptable al público, comenzó con unos ahorro y dinero prestado, doña Maria tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Laureles norte, con dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad. Sus planes es poder mejorar su casa para vivir cómodos, poder dar a sus hijos estudios, y en lo personal `poder obtener el primer lugar en las ventas en su trabajo lo cual se tiene que esforzar mucho para lograr las metas. Con este crédito es la quinta solicitud que va invertir en comprar productos omnilife para ofertar a sus clientes. A corto plazo espera captar mas clientes para vender mas y sus ingresos sean favorables.
texts.en:
Maria has sold omnilife products for two years. This has gone well since this is a product that is well accepted by the public. She began with some savings and loaned money. Maria is 32 years old and lives in north Laureles with her two children who are 4 and 6 years old. Her plans are to be able to improve her house in order to live comfortably, to be able to give her children an education and, on a personal note, to be able to obtain first place in sales in her job for which she has to put forth a lot of effort to achieve the goals. This loan is the fifth one that she is going to invest in the purchase of omnilife products to offer to her customers. In the short-term, she hopes to capture more customersso she can sell more and that her earnings are favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more omnilife products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Doña Juana trabaja en servicio de domestica desde hace quince años donde ha estado en la misma casa por la confianza de su patrona, trabajo que ha dedicado con sus esfuerzos para mantener a su familia, tiene 43 años de edad, sus hijos son cuatros de 14,15118 y 20 años de edad, todos estudian, su esposo es misionero y apoya a su hogar  como a sus hijos. Sus planes de la Sra. Juana es poder tener su propio negocio para dejar de trabajar por que quiere algo mejor para el futuro de sus hijos, esta es la cuarta solicitud en Afodenic y con este dinero va a comprar medicamentos populares como: panadol, zepol, pastilla de desparasitante, entre otros, para salir a vender y poder salir adelante. Espera en Dios que todo le salga bien y poder captar clientes y hacer su su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Juana has worked in domestic service for fifteen years where she has been in the same house due to the trust of her employer. This is work that she has dedicated her efforts to in order to support her family. She is 43 years old. Her four children are 14, 15,18 and 20 years of age. All of them study. Her husband is a missionary and he supports his home as well as his children. Juana's plans are to be able to have her own business so she may leave her job because she wants something better for the future of her children. This is the fourth loan from Afodenic and, with this money, she is going to buy popular medications such as panadol, zepol, deworming pills, among others so she can go out and sell and be able to get ahead. She hopes in God that everything will turn out well and she can find customers and create a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general medications such as panadol, zepol, among others to sell.

loans.name: Neidy Scarleth

texts.es: La sra. Neydi tiene 30 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, en la ciudad de Managua, tiene tres hermosos hijos que estudian, su esposos es docente y ayuda  a sus hijos. Su negocio de la Sra., Neydi vende prendas de oro y plata los comercializa al contado y al crédito, lleva cuatro años de vender y captar clientes, negocio que inicio con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo lo cual ha sido de muchos beneficio en su vida personal, con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para levantar una pared y entechar parte de la casa, ya que de una solo vez no puede por que es una inversión cara y va poco a poco hasta lograr una casa buena para su familia. Sus planes es establecer una red de distribución de prendas de plata. Que espera lograr en un futuro es rentable ya que por su variedad y bonitos estilo y accesibles se vende mucho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Neydi is 30 years of age and lives in north Laureles in the city of Managua. She has three beautiful sons who are studying. Her husband is a teacher and helps their kids. Mrs. Neydi's business is selling jewelry of gold and silver for cash or credit. She has been working in this business for four years and has clients. She started the business with loans that Afodenic granted her, which have benefited her personal life greatly.

With this loan she is going to buy construction materials to build a wall and a roof over part of her house; she cannot do it all at once because it is an expensive investment, but little by little she has been making her home better for her family. Her plan is to establish a distribution network for her silver jewelry. She expects to have a profitable future due to high sales, since her jewelry has a lot of variety, good style, and is affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a concrete wall and a roof.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 53 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, sus hijos están independientes, y aportan en los gastos de la casa, su esposo es tipógrafo. Doña Juana ha sido una mujer esforzada desde muy joven  se dedico al comercio para poder apoyar a sus hijos. Sus planes es poder remodelar su casa ya que desea hacer una pared en intermedio de la casa, la cual va a comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar esta obra que será de beneficios para las mejoras de su familia. Da gracias a la institución de Afodenic por apoyarla y espera seguir trabajando con los créditos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is 53 years old and lives in north Laureles. Her children are independent and help in the costs of the house. Her husband is a typographer. Juana has been a hard-working woman since she was very young. She is dedicated to her business to be able to support her children. Her plan is to remodel her house since she wants to build a wall in the middle of her house. She is going to buy construction materials to complete this job, which will benefit her family. She gives thanks to the institution of Afodenic for supporting her and she hopes to continue working with loans from them.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Petrona Angelina

texts.es: Doña Petrona Angelina G. T. es originaria de la Comunidad del Canton Chuixchimal del Departamento de Totonicapán esta a tres kilometros de la ciudad, doña Petrona con su actividad economica que realiza en la plaza municipal de Totonicapan, en la venta de productos de consumo diario, a fortalecido el crecimiento de su familia, en educacion, vivienda hoy visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para incrementar sus productos. Por el momento solo esta vendiendo cuatro dias de la  semana pero con el credito estara vendiendo toda la semana por motivo que la influencia de las persona que requieren de sus productos estan incrementando, y aprovechar estas epocas de Carnaval Semana Santa y posteriormente la feria del Municipio.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona Angelina G. T. is from the Canton Chuixchimal community in the department of Totonicapán, three kilometers from the city. Doña Petrona, with her business in the municipal plaza of Totonicapán selling everyday products, supports the growth of her family in education and housing. She has visited the office of ASDIR to ask for a loan to increase her inventory. For the moment she only is selling four days of the week, but with the loan she will sell all week because of the increase in people who need her products and to make the most of this season’s Holy Week carnival and, later, the municipal fair.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es: Doña Leyla tiene 49 años edad, reside en Memorial sandino en la ciudad de managua con dos hijos de 11 y 17 años de edad, que cursan la secundaria, su esposo trabaja independiente pues tiene una camioneta la cual ocupa para acarreo a las personas que ocupan de su servicio. El negocio de la sra. Leyla es la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos, inicio desde hace diez años, que inicio con capital propio, con ayuda de su esposo, con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en la compra de ropa, y productos de cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes, con esto espera poder captar clientes, mejorar sus ingresos, y espera seguir beneficiándose con los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado, en un futuro espera hacer mejoras a su casa ya que piedra y madera. Sus objetivos es poder hacer su casa toda de concreto para dar una casa digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Leyla is 49 years old and lives in Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua with her two children of ages 11 and 17, who are enrolled in secondary school. Her husband works independently since he has a small truck that he got to transport the people who work with him. Mrs. Leyla's business is selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetic products, which she began ten years ago with her own capital and help from her husband. With this loan she is going to invest in purchasing clothes and cosmetic products to offer to her clients. With this loan she hopes to gain more clients, improve her income, and continue benefiting from the loans that Afodenic have granted her. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to her home of stone and wood. Her goal is to be able to make her home of concrete to give her family a respectable house.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various children and adult clothing as well as cosmetic products.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra., Narcisa es una mujer que ha logrado esforzarse desde muy joven ha trabajado para apoyar a su familia, vende granos básicos, productos lácteos, y variedad que ofrece a sus clientes. Inicio con fondos propios vendiendo golosinas, ahora ha crecido y tiene una pequeña pulpería surtida, doña Narcisa tiene 57 años de edad,  con dos hijas mayores de edad que están casada, reside en reparto los V., ahora hace préstamo en Afodenic esta es su segunda solicitud que ha sido de  beneficio para incrementar su inventario, con este crédito va a comprar granos básicos, productos enlatados, y otros que son de utilidad diario del cliente. Sus planes a futuro es hacer más grande el local de la venta.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a woman who has been successful trying her best since she was young to work to support her family. She sells basic grains, dairy products, and a variety of other goods that she offers her customers. She began with her own funds from selling candy, and now her business has grown and she has a small, well-stocked store. Dona Narcisa is 57 years old and has two grown daughters who are both married. The V. family lives in Reparto and this loan is now her second request from Kiva partner Afodenic that she benefited from to increase her inventory. With this loan, she is going to purchase basic grains, canned products, and other goods that her customers use on a daily basis. Her future plans are to expand the size of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and canned products

loans.name: Armenza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Armenza es casada, junto a su marido son propietarios de una pulperia que le brinda a sus clientes productos de consumo a bajos precios, lo que le permite mantener un mercado local constante y fijo.  El marido muy temprano garantiza la mercaderia para que su esposa se encargue de venderla a los clientes, su sueño es contar con estantes que le permitan exibir mas su negocio y fortalecer su inventario, para lo que solicita este credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Armenza is married and together with her husband they are owners of a local store that offers consumer products at low prices for their clients, which allows them to run this constant and regular local market. The husband gets the merchandise very early so that the wife is in charge of selling it to the clients. Her dream is to have shelves that will allow her to display more of her business and strengthen her inventory, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her local store

loans.name: Micaela  Florinda

texts.es: la Señora Micaela Florinda T. V. con residencia en el canton Poxlajuj es una comunidad a 8 kilometros de la cabecera departamental, doña Micaela Viene ejerciendo dicha actividad desde que tenia 8 años, que consiste en amarradora de labores que dicho trabajo se utiliza en los cortes tipios para la mujeres, productos que son vendidos, en Chimaltenango, Santa cruz del Quiche, Salcaja, Totonicapán. doña Micaela necsita un credito para la compra de herramientas, ya que la actividad que se dedican todo es realizado manualmente y que lleva un proceso muy largo, hoy necesita un credito, para incrementar su produccion y con las ganancias que obtiene le permite mejorar su nivel de vida y de su familia. Ademas con el credito otros miembros de la familia quiere aprender ese arte. ya que tiene un pedido grande de labores que entregar a  mediados de marzo por la semana santa.
texts.en:
Micaela Florinda T. V. lives in the town of Poxlaju, located 8 kilometers from the department’s center. Micaela has been working her trade for eight years, which consists of making traditional garb for women. The products are sold in Chimaltenango, Santa Cruz del Quiche. Micaela needs a loan to purchase tools, given that the activity she dedicates herself to involves manual labor and a process that is quite time-consuming. Today, she needs a loan to increase her production and, with the earnings she obtains, she will be able to improve her and her family’s standard of living. In addition, with the credit, other family members would like to learn this art. She has a large order for her work due mid-March for Holy Week.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora María del Socorro S. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, esté es su negocio y el ingreso de su familia. 
  En este momento se le presento una oportunidad de comprar  la mercancía a un preció bajo de ropa y zapatos nuevos para la venta. Pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacer la comprar de inmediato. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder obtener esa oferta que se le está presentando en este momento.
texts.en:
María del Socorro S. has more than three years of experienced selling new and used clothing. This is her business, and the means of income for the family. Currently, an opportunity has presented itself for her to buy some merchandise such as new clothes and shoes for a low price. However, she doesn’t have the funds to make the purchase immediately. It’s for this reason that she is requesting this loan, so she can obtain the offer that is presented to her at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy is married and has two adult sons. He owns a retail business and sells fishing accessories at local market. The demand is high especially in winter and the competition is low. So, his business is quite successful. 

Valeriy has been in this business for 7 years. He knows this business well, because he is a professional fisherman himself. Valeriys is very responsible and entrepreneurial person and wants to develop this business even further. 

Valeriy would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the inventories. He hopes to receive additional income and finish fixing his house.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya is divorced and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at Pavlograd market. Her net income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Lidya has been in this business for 3 years. Being a very entrepreneurial person she wants to increase her sales. To do this she wants to open a second sales place and sell different products there. It is almost like starting a new business. For this Lidya needs 4,000 UAH. Her business is the only income she has and her goal is to make it as stable as possible.

loans.use: to open second location

loans.name: Haidee

texts.es: Haidee es una mujer luchadora y muy admirada por sus vecinos, a sus 44 años es madre soltera y ha sabido darle una buena profesión a sus hija Maria de 22 años, junto a la cual tratan de mejorar la vida que llevan. Con un ojo muy acertado, Haidee se dedica a la venta por campaña, ella vende según la temporada y tiene un gran olfato para saber que es lo que más compra la gente, ahora se encuentra distribuyendo por los puestos de mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ropa de verano traída desde el país de Bolivia, ya que quiere aprovechar el intenso calor que hace en la ciudad. Para Haidee los más difícil de su trabajo, es saber cual seria un buen producto para vender, aun así disfruta mucho de llevar novedades a los puestos que compran sus productos, tiene ya 13 años en esta actividad y anhela poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los productos que trae desde distintos lugares del país y del extranjero. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Haidee con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos, y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa y siempre tiene algo de qué aconsejar al resto de las socias. Con los 800 soles que solicita comprará artículos para la temporada de carnavales, máscaras de jebe para que la gente se disfrace y pueda divertirse, además traerá ropa de Pepino (Payaso tradicional de las danzas de la región altiplánica), según dice eso será lo que más se venda en estos carnavales.
texts.en:
Haidee is a hard-working woman, very much admired by her neighbors. At 44 years of age, she is a single mother who has known how to give her daughter Maria, 22 years old, a good profession. Together, they work to improve their standard of living. With a good eye, Haidee dedicates herself to selling seasonal products and she has a great feel for knowing what will be in greatest demand by people. Currently, she is distributing products throughout the stalls at the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her offerings include summer clothing brought all the way from the country of Bolivia, as she wants to take advantage of the intense heat that the city experiences. The most difficult part of Hailee’s work is knowing what products would be good to sell, yet she still enjoys taking her novelties to the stands that buy her products. She has been doing this activity for 13 years. She yearns to have her own store to sell the products she brings from other parts of the country, as well as from overseas, herself. This is Haidee’s fourth loan with MFP, and she has repaid her previous loans in a timely manner. She hopes to pay this latest loan on time as well. She is very active in her cooperative bank, and she always has advice to share with other members. With the 800.00 Peruvian soles that she is requesting, she will buy articles for the carnival season, including costume masks so the people can dress up and enjoy themselves. In addition, she will bring clothing of Pepino (a traditional clown of dances of the Andean plains), which she says will be her most popular items during these carnivals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, tiene 39 años y vive en su casa propia, con su menor hijo Franz de 14 años, al cual le quiere dar un mejor fututo y poder pagar sus estudios superiores. Ana lleva 4 años vistiendo a la gente que concurre al mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es uno de los más visitados, ya que tiene una gran variedad de prendas de vestir, tanto para damas como para caballeros.  A ella le gustaría poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y mostrarles más ropa, puesto que disfruta de vender y conversar con sus clientes, eso sí, lo que le resulta difícil es llevar la ropa hasta su puesto de trabajo, es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Ana trabaja esforzadamente, ya que necesita dinero para pagar los estudios de su querido hijo, al cual quiere dar una vida. Este es el cuarto préstamo al que accede Ana y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los 600 soles de préstamo, planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar la cantidad de ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Ana is a very happy and hard-working person. She is 39 years old and lives in her own house, with her youngest son Franz, 14. She wants to give him a better future and be able to pay for his higher studies. For 4 years Ana has been clothing people that converge at the Tupac Amaru market (an important market of Juliaca city). Her stand is one of the most visited, and she now has a large variety of garments, as many for women as gentlemen. She would like to create a bigger shop, where she could better attend to her clients and show them more clothes. She enjoys selling and talking to her clients at her stand, but what is difficult is carrying the clothes to her stand where she works, which is too tiring for her alone. Ana works very hard, and now needs money to pay for the studies of her dear son, to whom she wants to give a good life. This is the 4th loan that Ana has accessed, and as she did with her previous loans, she desires to pay it back in time and without difficulty. Within her communal bank she is very well respected, and she is now the most active and engaged member. With the loan of 600 soles ($200) she will buy more goods and in this way increase the amount of clothes that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy garments for her shop

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: A sus 27 años, Ana es madre de dos pequeños niños, Jhon de 2 años y Lizbeth de 9 meses, tiene una casa propia, la cual esta hecha de adobe, ella se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y así darles a sus hijos una mejor vida. Tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc, Ana pasa sus días. Ella disfruta mucho de tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, sus tejidos son comprados por tiendas de ropa, donde son vendidas con mucha rapidez, es por eso que tiene una gran demanda por las prendas que teje. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma la ropa que teje y así mejorar sus ingresos, aunque tiene 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza, espera poder darles unos buenos estudios a sus hijos y anhela que sean unos buenos profesionales útiles a la sociedad. Ana se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con el dinero solicitado planea comprar más lana para confeccionar más prendas, lo que le costará alrededor de 1500 soles, lo que le falta para completar esta suma, lo sacará de sus ahorros personales.
texts.en:
vAt the age of 27 Ana is the mother of two small children, Jhon, 2 years, and Lizbeth, 9 months, and she has her own adobe house. She's working very hard to get ahead so she can give her children a better life. Ana spends her days weaving sweaters, scarves, gloves, etc. She really enjoys weaving and she is very good at it. She sells her garments to clothing stores, where they sell very quickly, so they are in high demand. In the future she would like to have a store where she can sell her hand-woven clothing herself and increase her income. Even though she's been weaving for 9 years, she still finds it hard to add the fine details to her garments, no matter how hard she tries. Ana hopes to be able to provide her children a good education, and she longs for them to become professionals and useful members of society. This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she's saving up to make her payments on time. She's very happy with her village bank and she doesn't want to cause the members any problems. She plans to use her loan to buy more wool to make additional garments. That will cost around 1500 soles, and if funds are short she'll draw from her personal savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for weaving

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 30 años y desde muy joven siempre se esforzó por mejorar su vida, vive en su casa propia, con su esposo Francisco de 32 y su hijo Ubaldo de 6 años, ella trabaja sin descanso para alcanzar las metas que se ha trazado. En su pequeña casa hecha de adobe, Dionisia lleva 2 años trabajando sin descanso, tejiendo unos pequeños y graciosos muñequitos de lana, los cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puno, donde son los turistas los que más se entusiasman con sus muñequitos y los compran muy rápidamente. Dionisia se divierte mucho haciendo estos graciosos muñequitos, lo cual la llena de satisfacción, ya que sabe que también de esa manera puede darle de comer a su familia, espera que con el tiempo pueda poner un negocio más estable que le brinde unos buenos ingresos económicos, puesto que sabe que tiene que darle unos buenos estudios a su querido hijo, el cual corresponde su sacrificio con mucho amor y siempre la acompaña a todos lados. Son cuatro ya los préstamos que Dionisia ha solicitado en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Dionisia quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual invertirá todo el dinero en comprar más lana, para aumentar la cantidad de muñequitos que teje.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 30 years old, and since she was very young she has always pushed herself to improve her life. She lives in her own house with her husband Francisco, 32, and her son Ubaldo, 6 years old. She works without rest to reach the goals that she has drawn up. In her small house made of adobe, she has worked for 2 years without rest, weaving small and amusing dolls made from wool. She takes these dolls to sell in the city of Puno, where there are tourists that become excited about her dolls and buy them rapidly. Dionisia really enjoys making these amusing dolls, which fills her with satisfaction, and she now knows that through these means she can provide food for her family. She hopes in time to create a more stable business which will give her economic earnings, and she knows she has to provide good studies for her dear son, who responds to her sacrifices with a lot of love and always accompanies her everywhere she goes. Dionisia has requested 4 loans through MFP, and she has been very punctual with her repayments. She has never had problems with her communal bank, where she charged with providing the happiness quota that keeps the rest of her members very happy. Dionisia wishes to increase her working capital, and will invest all of it in buying more wool, to increase the amount of little dolls that she weaves.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for her weavings

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre de 48 años, padre de 4 hijos, José de 17, Jaime de 15, Rina de 11 y Juana de 9 años, el tiene una casa propia hecha de adobe, donde vive con ellos y a los cuales quiere dar unos buenos estudios superiores. Hernán a trabajado en muchas cosas en su vida, pero desde hace 18 años se decida al trabajo de la albañilería, en su alejado barrio Villa el Salvador de la ciudad de Juliaca, él es el albañil con más experiencia, al que sus vecinos recurren cuando hay que hacer un techamiento o levantar una pared, Hernán disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede pagar la educación de sus hijos, el desea comprar más tablones y puntales, para realizar mejor las construcciones, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Lo difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente, pero no les ha quitado la fuerza y las ganas de superación que llevan dentro. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con el dinero solicitado comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Hernan is a 48 year old man and father of 4 children; Jose is 17, Jaime is 15, Rina is 11 and Juana is 9 years old. He has his own home made of adobe, where he lives with his children and would like to provide them with a good advanced education. Hernan has worked at many things in his life, but for the last 18 years he dedicates his time to brickwork in his remote neighborhood of Villa el Salvador of the city of Juliaca. He is the most experienced bricklayer to whom his neighbors come when there is a need for roofing or building of a wall. Hernan enjoys working in construction and knows that this noble profession will enable him to pay for the education of his children. He wants to buy more beams and struts to be able to improve his construction projects and thus improve his income. The difficult part of his work is carrying the heavy bricks and having to handle the cement at times even with his hands. This has caused his hands to age rapidly, but has not taken away their strength nor the desire to get ahead that he carries inside him. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he does not want to stop paying on it due to lack of money, so he is already signing more contracts for construction work. He is the only male in his community bank and always tries to be responsible and respectful with the other members. With the money from the loan he will buy new beams and will increase the number of struts, which will allow him to work in more construction projects and improve his income

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies for his work.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria es una mujer de 28 años sencilla y trabajadora, es madre de cuatro niños, Abraham de 14 Edwin de 8 Yudith de 3 y José de 1 años, vive en su casa propia hecha de adobe y desea salir adelante. En su pequeño cuarto de adobe, Hilaria teje las artesanías más coloridas del mercado, las que vende en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Feria donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde sus clientes se dan cita todos los domingos y la buscan para comprar sus novedosos diseños. En sus 2 años en este negocio, lo más difícil para Hilaria es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí, pero sabe que eso no es impedimento para alcanzar sus metas y poner una tienda de tejidos artesanales, ya que disfruta mucho de tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos, a los cuales cuida con mucho amor. Hilaria tiene 4 préstamos en MFP, y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudara a progresar. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana, y de esta manera incrementara su mercadería, con lo cual surtirá mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a 28 year old woman, simple and hard-working, and mother of four children, Abraham is 14, Edwin is 8, Yudith is 3 and Jose is one year old. She lives in her own adobe home and wants to get ahead. In her small adobe room, Hilaria knits the most colorful handicrafts on the market. She sells them at the Laguna Temporal esplanade (Market where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca) where her customers make arrangements to be at every Sunday and look to buy her novel designs. During the 2 years in her business, the most difficult task for Hilaria has been carrying her work to her sales stall, since she lives far from there. She knows that this is not an impediment to her reaching her goals and someday having a crafts store. She enjoys knitting very much and the more she knits the better she feels, also she can this way pay for the education of her small children, which she takes care of with much love. Hilaria has 4 loans with MFP and is very punctual with her payments because she does not want to give her community bank any problems, for she feels very happy with it and know it will help her get ahead. The 1500 soles which she is requesting will be used to buy more yarn and this way she will increase her merchandise and will be able to better supply her sales booth.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn for her knitted fabrics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary a sus 29 años quiere salir adelante, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Es una vendedora de productos de belleza muy solicitada en su barrio, siempre está muy informada de los nuevos productos que han salido al mercado y no pierde la oportunidad para dar uno que otro consejito de belleza  a sus habituales clientes, puesto que disfruta de vender sus productos y más aun cuando acaba su mercadería. Lleva un año en este negocio y espera posteriormente poder abrir un salón de belleza, donde pueda vender sus cosméticos, ya que actualmente le es muy difícil ir por todos los lugares donde dejó sus productos de belleza y cobrarles uno por uno. Este es el primer préstamo de Mary con MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Este dinero le ayudará ha incrementar su capital de trabajo, planea invertir todo el crédito en la compra de más productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Mary at 29 years old wants to get ahead. She lives in the house that her parents left her. She is very hard working and has a lot of desire to excel. She is a sales woman of beauty products and is very popular in her neighborhood. She is always well informed of the new products that have come out on the market and does not pass up the opportunity to give beauty advice to her regular customers, she enjoys selling her products and more so when she sells out her merchandise. She has been in this business for a year and hopes to later open a beauty salon, where she could sell her cosmetics, since it is currently difficult to go to all the places where she sold her products and have to collect from her customers one by one. This is Mary's first loan with MFP and she feels very capable of paying it back on time, and has faith in her business and her community bank, to which she feels very happy being able to belong. This money will help increase her working capital, she plans to invest the proceeds in more cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more cosmetics.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 33 años es una dedicada ama de casa, vive en la casa que construyo junto a su esposos Ladislao de 39 años a base de adobe, tiene 4 hijos, Edwin de 16 Javier de 13 Paúl de 10 y la pequeña Verónica de 4 años, por los cuales esta dispuesta a sacrificarse, con tal de que no les falte nada. La actividad principal de Paula es la venta de leche, la cual extrae de sus 2 vacas lecheras, pero también se dedica a la fabricación de queso, ya que tiene una gran demanda por estos dos alimentos por parte de sus clientes, ella vende en su propia casa sus producto, lleva haciéndolo más de 16 años y le gusta la actividad que realiza, por que siente que gracia a ella los niños de su barrio crecen sanos y fuertes. Lo que más difícil de su trabajo es alimentar correctamente a sus vacas y evitar que coman basura, ya que esto puede contaminar la leche y malograr su sabor, es por eso que tiene que estar viéndolas todo el día, aun así con todo el sacrificio que realiza, no pierde la esperanza de poder mejorar sus futuro y el de su familia. Este es el cuarto crédito al que accede Paula en MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los trescientos nuevos soles del préstamo, Paula planea comprar más y mejores alimentos para sus vacas, por que sabe que su negocio depende de ellas.
texts.en:
Paula is 33 and a dedicated homemaker. She lives in the house that she and her husband Ladislao, 39, built out of adobe. She has 4 children: Edwin, 16; Javier, 13; Paul, 10; and little Verónica, 4. It's for them that she's willing to sacrifice, so they don't have to want for anything. Her principal business is selling milk, which she gets from her two milk cows. She makes cheese, too. Both products are in high demand by her clients. She sells out of her home, which she's been doing for more than 16 years. Paula likes what she does because she feels like, thanks to her, the local children are growing up healthy and strong. The hard part about her work is feeding the cows well. She has to watch them all day to prevent them from eating garbage, since that fouls the milk and spoils its flavor. Even with all the sacrifices she makes, she doesn't lose hope in the possibility of a better future for herself and her family. This will be Paula's fourth loan with MFP. She knows that this money will help her have a better future, but she's also aware that she needs to make payments on time so she doesn't cause problems for her village bank. Paula plans to use the 300 nuevos soles to buy more and better feed for her cows because she knows her business depends on them.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for her milk cows

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es una mujer trabajadora, que a sus 41 años es madre de 3 hijos Wilfredo de 18, Yda de 14 y Juan de 10 años, a los cuales cuida con mucho amor y en compañía de su esposo Claudio de 50 años, juntos quieren salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para pagar los estudios superiores de sus niños. En su pequeño barrio Villa el Salvador, Paulina tiene su carnicería, con la cual abastece a todo sus vecinos, es muy concurrida y por lo general acaba con toda la carne que vende, tiene 10 años en este negocio, el cual le a alcanzado para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que no le será suficiente para correr con los gatos de los estudios superiores, por eso desea poner una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde pueda vender a muchas más persona. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil llevar la carne hasta su barrio ya que está muy lejos de la ciudad, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, con el dinero de sus préstamos ha podido mejorar su carnicería, es por eso que piensa pagar todas sus cuotas y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más carne y mejorar sus instalaciones, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Paulina is a hard-working woman of 41 who has three children: Wilfredo, 18; Yda, 14; and Juan, 10. She cares for them lovingly and together with her husband Claudio, aged 50, they want to prosper and improve their income in order to pay for higher education for their children. In their small suburb of Villa el Salvador, Paulina has a butcher shop which supplies all her neighbours; it is very busy and she usually sells all the meat she has in stock. She has had this business for 10 years with which she has been able to feed her children and pay for their schooling, but she feels that it will not be sufficient to pay for their higher education and therefore she wants to open a butcher shop in downtown Juliaca, where she could sell to many more people. She enjoys talking with her clients, but it is very difficult to bring the meat all the way to her neighbourhood which is very far from the city, but at the same time her eagerness to prosper does not wane and she is prepared to work very hard to reach her goals. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has used previous loans to make improvements to her butcher shop and because of this she is certain she will repay her loan and not bring problems to her community bank. She will use this loan of 600 soles to buy more meat and improve her shop in order to give her customer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and make improvements to her shop

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es:
Rosio es una jovencita de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los cuales quiere ayudar con los gastos del hogar, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida, es por eso que trabaja duro. Aunque todavía es muy joven, Rosio se ha dado cuenta que para tener un mejor futuro, debe trabajar mucho, es por eso que desde muy niña se preocupo por aprender las actividades ganaderas, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Ahora ella tiene su propio ganado, el cual vende en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Puno, sus animales están bien alimentados y son muy grandes, motivo por el cual se venden rápidamente. A Rosio le da mucha pena vender el ganado que con tanto esfuerzo a criado y eso es lo que hace difícil su trabajo, pero sabe que tiene que hacerlo para tener ingresos económicos, con los cuales, en el futuro pueda poner su carnicería.
Tiene ya 1 año en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es criar a sus animalitos, a los cuales tiene mucho cariño. Es el primer préstamo de Rosio en MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más forraje para su ganado y de esta manera tendrá animales mejora alimentados.
texts.en:
Rosio is a 19-year-old woman who lives at home with her parents. She wants to help her parents with household expenses and also aspires to excel in life and this is why she works hard. Although she is still young, Rosio realizes that to have a better future, she must work diligently. To this end, from a very young age she has undertaken raising cattle, an activity she learned from her parents. Now she has her own cattle that she sells at the Sunday fair in Puno. They are well fed, very large, and they sell quickly. While it saddens Rosio to sell the cattle she has raised with great care, she knows it is necessary in order to earn the funds she needs to establish a butcher shop in the future. Rosio has been at this business for one year, and what she likes best is to raise the calves that she cares for and nurtures. This is Rosio’s first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying her installments on time in order to be eligible for future loans to keep improving her business. She knows her communal bank will provide guidance and support because she is a valued customer. With the requested funds she will buy fodder for her cattle and thus they will be better fed.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana es una joven que desea progresar en la vida, a sus 21 años es madre de la pequeña Katerine de 4 años, a la cual cuida con mucho amor y dedicación, vive en su casa propia de manera independiente y quiere darle unos buenos estudios a su única hija. Yendo casa por casa, Roxana vende sus productos cosméticos a sus habituales clientes, es una convincente vendedora, puesto que acaba con sus productos fácilmente, ella se divierte mucho vendiendo, ya que conversar con sus clientes es lo que más le gusta de sus trabajo, anhela poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza sin necesidad de salir a la calle todos los días, ya que le resulta muy cansado ir casa por casa y es muy difícil luego cobrarle a las persona que compraron sus cosméticos. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y sabe que tiene que ponerle todas sus ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, puesto que quiere brindarle a su hija una buena vida y unos adecuados estudios. Es el segundo préstamo de Roxana con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que siempre ahorra para poder pagarlas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre está pendiente del bienestar de las demás socias. Roxana invertirá los seiscientos nuevos soles en incrementar la cantidad de sus productos de belleza, para brindarles a sus clientes una mayor opción de compra.
texts.en:
Roxana is a young woman who desires to get ahead in life. At 21 years old she is mother to young Katerine, who is 4 years old. She cares for her with a lot of love and dedication. She lives independently in her own home and she wants to provide her only child with a good education. Roxana sells her cosmetic products from house to house to her regular customers. She is a convincing saleswoman and easily sells out of her products. She has a lot of fun selling since conversing with her customers is what she likes most about her job. She desires to be able to have a store where she can sell her beauty products without the need to go out on the street every day, as it is tiring going from house to house and difficult to later collect payments from the people who bought her cosmetics. She has been in this business for 2 years and knows that she has to put all her will and strength into it in order to get ahead and improve her economic returns. She does this so she can provide her daughter with a good life and appropriate studies. This is the second loan Roxana has had with MFP and she is very punctual in her payments since she always saves to be able to pay them. She is very active in her community bank and always attentive to the well-being of the other members. Roxana will invest the 600 nuevos soles in increasing the quantity of her beauty products to be able to offer her customers more purchasing options.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Nelly es casada, tiene tres hijos de 27, 21, el de 13 años  están estudiando en la escuela. Ella estudió secretariado pero no ejerció, por que salió embarazada y se dedico a cuidar sus hijos, su esposo es albañil. 
Nelly sentía la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos en su casa, empezó ayudando a una persona, por bastante tiempo, con la venta de productos por catalogo, hasta que junto un capital y decidió  inscribirse en la empresa para ser vendedora directa de productos de belleza por catalogo. En su casa tiene una vitrina donde exhibe los productos de belleza. En la mañana se dedica a su casa y por las tardes sale a vender, desde hace once años. Ha ganado muchos premios, por las ventas.
Desde que esta en finca, ha crecido en su negocio, ha podido comprar una vitrina exhibidor y tiene un stock grande de productos.       
Nelly necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para  el pagar los productos de belleza, y poder sacar más.  
El sueño que tiene es  terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Bancomunal Maria de la Paz. Nelly is married and has three children aged 27, 21, and a 13 year old who is in school. She attended business school but did not graduate because she became pregnant, then dedicated herself to the care of her children. Her husband is a bricklayer. Nelly felt the need to work to help with household expenses. She began by helping another person for quite a while with the sale of products by catalog. When she had saved enough capital she signed up with the business to become a direct saleswoman of beauty products by catalog. She has a showcase in her home where she displays beauty products. For the last eleven years, she has dedicated mornings to her home and in the afternoons she leaves to sell her products. She has earned many prizes for her sales. Since living on the finca, her business has advanced, allowing her to buy a showcase to display a large stock of products. Nelly needs a loan of 1000 soles to pay for beauty products and thus earn more through her sales. Her dream is to finish building their house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and buy more stock.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Maria de la Paz.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 38 años dos hijos de 14 y 4 años, que estudian en la escuela nacional.
Rosa estudio contabilidad, trabajó como cajera en varios supermercados y grifos, pero se dedico por varios años a su casa, hasta que empezó a llevarle el menú al trabajo de su esposo, él trabaja en trasporte, es chofer, sus amigos le pidieron que les lleve menú para ellos también; Así empezó, ahora  reparte a  diario menú, solo trabaja por las mañanas. 
Rosa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar una cocina, tapers, comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Desde que comenzó en Finca, gracias al sistema de ahorros que tiene, pudo  salir del infocor y pagar gastos que tenia, le gusta las reuniones del bancomunal por que conoce mas gente, las socias son solidarias unas con otras, tiene nuevas amigas.  
El sueño que tiene Rosa es que su negocio sea propio, donde ella lo pueda administrar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank "Maria de la Paz". Rosa is married common-law, 38 years old, and has two children aged 14 and 4 who attend public school. Rosa studied accounting, worked as a cashier in a number of supermarkets and gas stations but stayed at home a number of years until she began bringing her husband lunches. He was working in transportation as a driver and his friends asked her to bring them lunches as well. That is how she started her business. She now delivers lunches daily and works mornings only. Rosa needs a 1,200 soles loan to buy a stove, tupperware, foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and noodles. Since she started with Finca, thanks to the savings system they have, she has been removed from infocor [a governmental organization which maintains a list of debtors; debtors on the list cannot generally obtain credit] and has been able to pay expenses she had. She enjoys the community bank meetings because she knows more people, because the members are supportive of each other, and because she makes new friends. Rosa's dream is to own a business which she would manage.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a stove, tupperware, foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es conviviente, tiene 49 años, dos hijos, el de 17 años estudia en la escuela; El mayor murió hace cuatro años.
Maria es enfermera técnica trabaja en un centro medico, esta estudiando sicología, y tiene un negocio de taxi “TAXI 1” tenia 3 carros, el año pasado en el mes de noviembre le robaron un carro, se quedo con dos, su esposo maneja un carro y el otro  carro lo  alquila. 
Desde que esta en Finca,  siente que es un apoyo  económico, puede invertir, los prestamos le han ayudado a comprar su carro, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal ha hecho buenas amigas.
Maria necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para el mantenimiento de su carro, quiere hacerle una bajada de motor y comprar llantas nuevas para su carro.
El sueño de Maria, es terminar su carrera y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and has two children. Her 17-year old who studies in school. The oldest died four years ago. Maria is a nurse and works in a medical center. She is studying psychology and has a taxi business, Taxi 1. She had 3 cars, but last year in November one was stolen. She was left with two. Her common law husband drives one car, and the other car is rented out.

Since she has been with Finca, she feels that it has been an economic support so she can make investments. The loans have helped her buy her car. She enjoys the meetings with Bancomunal and has made good friends there. Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles ($625 USD) to maintain her car, she wants to repair the motor and buy new tires.

Maria’s dream is to finish her degree and buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance, motor repair and new tires

loans.name: Isabel Petronila

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Bancomunal Maria De la Paz.
Isabel  es casada tiene 46 años, tres hijos 22, 21, y 20 años, ellos  estudios superiores.
Estudió corte y confección, trabajando conoció al que ahora es su esposo, que también confeccionaba, se casaron y ambos pusieron un taller de confección, desde hace diez años, ahora reparte su mercadería a gamarra, al mercado central y lleva para Trujillo.  
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió   como enseñan a ahorrar ha sido de mucha ayuda, también los prestamos que brindan, le gusta por que ha conocido mujeres emprendedoras responsables, también puede hacer intercambio de negocios, su auto-estima  como mujer a crecido.  
Isabel necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para la compra de tela polipima blanca y zapatos.
El sueño de Isabel es tener una tienda para vender la ropa que confecciona.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the community bank "Maria de la Paz". Isabel is married, 46 years old, and has three children aged 22, 21, and 20; they are attending higher education schools.
