She studied dressmaking and met her husband through work as was also in tailoring; they married and opened a dressmaking and tailoring shop 10 years ago. Now she delivers her merchandise to the Gamarra shopping centre, to the central market and to Trujillo. Since joining Finca she has learned about saving money, which has been very helpful, as wells as about loans; she likes that she has met responsable women entrepreneurs as well as been able to exchange businesses. Her self-confidence as a woman has grown. Isabel needs a 1,600 soles loan to buy white polycotton fabric and shoes. Isabel's dream is to own a store where she would sell the clothes she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white polycotton fabric and shoes

loans.name: Luz Amelia

texts.es:
Luz  es socia del Bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Luz es conviviente, tiene 53 años  dos hijos de 32 y 29 años, que están casados. 
Desde hace quince años Tiene una bodega donde vende gas, empezó con diez balones de gas, ahora vende mucho mas, su hijo le ayuda en la tienda. 
Ella también se dedica hacer movilidad escolar con su esposo, por las mañanas.
Desde que esta en Finca tiene la oportunidad para surgir como mujer, les enseñan a ahorrar y les ayudan dándoles prestamos, tiene mas amigas que son solidarias.
Luz  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para  cambio de motor de su carro de gasolinera a gas. 
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de taxis.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank "Maria de la Paz". She lives with her partner, she is 53 years old and she has two children. They are 32 and 29 years old and they are married. For 15 years now, Luz has owned a store where she sells canisters of gas. She started with only 10 canister of gas. Now she sells much more and her daughter helps her in the store. She also makes money taking school children to school in the mornings. Since she has been part of the group "Finca" she has had the opportunity to flourish as a woman. The group has taught her how to save money and it has also helped her by giving her loans. She also has made many faithful friends. Luz needs a loan of $325 (1,000 Soles) so that she can replace the motor of her vehicle. The dream of Luz is to own a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luz needs a loan of 1,000 soles to replace the motor in her vehicle

loans.name: Mercedes Graciela

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Bancomunal  Maria de la Paz.
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene  39 años dos hijos de  12 y 3 años, que están en la escuela particular. 
A Mercedes desde de niña le gusto cocinar, y una vecina siempre le pedía que le ayudara a pelar papas, alverjas, ella siempre aceptaba con justo. Desde joven siempre trabajaba en cocina, hasta que entro a trabajar en un restauran como cocinera, a la dueña le dio un derrame cerebral, y tuvo que dejar de administrar el negocio,  y tuvo que  traspasarlo. Ella con sus ahorros acepta el traspaso, junto con un familiar, ahora mercedes tiene su restaurante y lo administra.  
Desde que esta en Finca su negocio ha cambiado puede invertir, siente menos presión por lo que tiene ahorros, le son un respaldo, ahora puede compra al por mayor. 
Mercedes solicita un préstamo de 800 soles,  para comprar mesas y sillas
El sueño de Mercedes es tener un restaurante en su casa, ella vive en Tablada de Lurin y él restauran donde trabaja queda en Surquillo, le queda muy lejos de su casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the communal bank Maria de la Paz. She is 39 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has two children ages 12 and 3 both of who are in public school. Mercedes has liked cooking since she was a little girl. One of her neighbors always asked for her help peeling potatoes and shelling peas and she always happily accepted. She always worked in the kitchen from the time she was young until she started working at a restaurant as a cook. The owner of the restaurant had a brain hemorrhage and could not run the business so she had to sell it. Mercedes, with her savings, bought it along with a family member. Mercedes now owns and runs her own restaurant. Since she has been in Finca, Mercedes' business has changed as she is now able to invest in it. She feels less pressure as she has savings and she can buy her products wholesale. Mercedes is asking for a loan in the amount of 800 soles so that she can buy tables and chairs. Mercedes' dream is to have a restaurant in her home. She lives in Tablada de Lurin and the restaurant where she works is located in Surquillo which is far from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan  es socio del Bancomunal Maria de al Paz. 
Juan es conviviente, tiene 41 años, tiene un hijo de 13 años que estudia en la escuela particular. 
Juan estudia administración de empresas y decidió poner un negocio, pero los negocios que emprendía le iban mal, le estafaban, sufrió asaltos, pero salió adelante gracias al apoyo de su familia, con la liquidación que recibió en  la empresa donde trabajaba. Puso  otro negocio;  El negocio de Juan desde hace cinco años es la venta de licor, tiene una  tienda se llama  “YEMBA –YEMBA”
Juan, ha pasado por varios negocios  y él más rentable ha sido la venta de cerveza y gaseosas.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede mantener un stock de mercadería, en el bancomunal aprendió la unidad que hay entre las socias.
Juan necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar cerveza, gaseosa. 
El sueño de Juan es que su hijo sea un profesional, abrir  en otros distritos sucursales  de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the communal bank Maria de la Paz. He is 41 years old and lives with his common law wife. He has a 13 year old son who studies in public school. Juan is studying business administration and decided to open a business but the businesses he started did not go well for him as he was defrauded and assaulted. However, he managed to succeed with the support of his family and with a settlement he received from the company he worked for. He started another business five years ago selling liquor. The name of his store is "Yemba - Yemba." Juan has had several businesses and the most profitable one has been the sale of beer and soft drinks. Since he has been in FINCA, Juan has been able to maintain a stock of merchandise. In the communal bank he has learned of the unity between members. Juan needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles to purchase beer and soft drinks. Juan's dream is for his son to become a professional and to open chains of his business in other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and soft drinks for his store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Maria Elena es conviviente, tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos de 19,18,14 y 12 años estudian en la escuela estatal. 
Maria es enfermera técnica, con especialidad en geriatría, actualmente trabaja como enfermera particular; ella tiene el negocio de servicio de moto-taxi en Lurín.  Maria con toda su familia se fue a vivir a Lurín, hace cuatro años, a una zona rustica donde no  había como trasportarse, y con sus ahorros compró una moto-taxi y la puso a trabajar.   
Desde que es socia de Finca, recibe capacitaciones de cómo llevar su negocio, esta contenta  con el préstamo que recibe,  le gustan mucho las reuniones por que se encuentra con sus amigas.
Ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para hacer una bajada de motor, a su moto-taxi.
El sueño de Maria Elena es poner en su casa una botica, por que no hay por la zona.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the communal bank Mi Buen Pastor. She is 39 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has four children ages 19, 18, 14 and 12 who study at the state school. Maria Elena is a technical nurse who specializes in geriatrics. She currently works as a private nurse. She also has a motorbike taxi business in Lurin. Maria Elena moved to Lurin with her family four years ago. She moved to a rural area where there were no means of transportation and with her savings she bought a motorbike which she put to work as a taxi. Since becoming a member of FINCA, she receives training on how to manage her business. She is very happy with the loan she receives and enjoys the meetings because she gets to see friends. Maria Elena needs a loan of 1000 soles to change the motor of her motorbike taxi. Her dream is to open a drug store in her home as there isn't one in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the motor in her motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es socia del Bancomunal mi Buen Pastor.
Micaela es casada, tiene 77 años, cuatro hijos, todos mayores que están casados.
Estudió cosmetología, puso una peluquería  donD. trabajo quince años, pero los líquidos son demasiado fuertes,  afectando su salud, le empezaron a salir ronchas en el cuerpo, y  dejó personal a cargo D. su peluquería, pero con el tiempo tuvo que cerrar. Ella se dedicó a vender productos D. belleza por catalogo, llegando a destacar en las ventas.   
DesD. que esta en Finca tiene mas facilidad para trabajar, a pesar D. su edad ella tiene ganas D. seguir trabajando, en el Bancomunal tiene muchas amigas, es como una familia para ella.   
Micaela solicita un crédito D. 1800 soles, para compra D. cosméticos y cremas D. rostro.
El sueño D. Micaela es volver a poner su peluquería.
texts.en:
Micaela is a member of the communal bank “Mi Buen Pastor” (My Good Shepherd). She is married, is 77 years old, and has four children, all of whom are grown and married. She studied cosmetology and opened a hair salon, where she worked for fifteen years. However, the chemicals are very strong and they affected her health; she started to get rashes on her skin. She left personnel in charge of the salon, but she eventually had to close it. She began selling beauty products from catalogs and excelled in her sales. Since she has been with FINCA, she’s had an easier time working. Despite her age, she wants to continue working. She has a lot of friends in the communal bank; it’s like a family to her. Micaela is requesting a loan of 1,800.00 soles to buy cosmetics and face creams. Micaela’s dream is to open her hair salon again.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Micaela is requesting a loan of 1,800.00 soles to buy cosmetics and face creams.

loans.name: Sara Dina

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen pastor.
Sara es conviviente, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años ambos estudian en la escuela privada.
Estudio contabilidad técnica, esto le permitió trabajaren un estudio contable, lo dejo de trabajar por que se caso, su mama hacia dulces en su casa, a  ella siempre le gusto,  y empezó a estudiar pastelería fina, vende al por mayor y menor. Tiene una fuente de soda “la vallita” distribuye a los mercados y a dulcerías, su hija mayor  le ayuda.     
Desde que esta en Finca, ella siente un apoyo a podido comprar varias cosas entre ellos una batidora industrial, horno industrial antes preparaba sus dulces en horno de su  cocina. Aprende de las experiencias de las demás socias.  
Sara necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de miel en insumo, harina, leche, huevos.   
El sueño de Sara es tener una dulcería y partería fina, fuera de San Juan.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the community bank "Mi Buen Pastor". Sara is married common-law, 38 years old, and has two children aged 16 and 9 who both attend private school. She studied accounting which allowed her to work in an accounting office. She stopped working when she got married. Her mother made candies at home, which she always enjoyed doing, and she began studying fine baking. She sells wholesale and retail. She also has a soda fountain, "la vallita". She distributes to the marketplaces and candy shops with her eldest daughter's help. Since joining Finca, she has felt supported in being able to buy a variety of things such as an industrial mixer, and an industrial oven. Previously she had been preparing her sweets in the oven of her kitchen. She also learns from her fellow members' experience. Sara needs a 2,000 soles loan to buy honey in bulk, flour, milk and eggs. Sara dreams of owning a fine cake shop outside of San Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey in bulk, flour, milk and eggs

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
Dora es socia del  Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor 
Dora es casada tiene 63 años ocho hijos, todos casados.
Tenia un puesto en el mercado vendía ropa pero lo dejo por problemas constantes con la  municipalidad, sufrió un pre-infarto y dejo D. trabajar por un buen tiempo. Hace siete años  empezó a vender menú  en las obras constructoras,  cada día  reparte menú para 20 a 25 comenzarles; en el terremoto del  año pasado se rompió el brazo lo cual le dificulta cocinar hoy en día.
DesD. que esta en Finca, disfruta del compañerismo D. las socias, recibe asesoramiento D. la promotora, ha podido construir su casa, gracias a los préstamos que recibe D. Finca, que le permiten invertir.   
Dora necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para invertirlo en la venta D. menú.  
El sueño D. Dora es que sus hijos sean cristianos, y  ver a sus hijos realizados.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of Bancommunal Mi Buen Pastor. She is 63, married, with 8 married children. She had a stand in the market selling clothing but she abandoned it because of constant problems with the city, and she also suffered a heart attack and stopped working for a good while. Seven years ago she started to sell meals at construction sites, selling 20 to 25 meals per day at the beginning. During last year´s earthquake she broke her arm which bothers her while cooking to this day. Since she has been in Finca, she has enjoyed the companionship of the other members, receives advice from the leader, and has been able to build her house thanks to the loans she has received from Finca. Dora needs a loan of US$325 to invest in selling meals. Dora´s dream is that her children would be Christians, and to see her children fulfilled.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dora needs a loan of $325 to invest in selling meals

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 67 años, cinco hijos que están casados.  
Trabajo 27 años en el ministerio D. defensa, como auxiliar D. farmacia, ahora es cesante, se dedica a su casa y a vender productos D. belleza por  catalogo, también hace marcianos y  los venD. en su casa.  
Ella necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. productos D. belleza.  
El sueño D. Yolanda es viajar a Chiclayo  y  vivir allá.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor. Yolanda is 67, married, and has 5 married children. She worked for 27 years in the ministry of defense and as a pharmacy aiD., now she is unemployed and dedicates herself to her home and to selling beauty products by catalog. She also makes "marcianos" and sells them from her home. She needs a loan of $325 to purchase beauty products. Yolanda´s dream is to move to Chiclayo and live there.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of $325 to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Ana  Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. 
Ana Maria es casada, tiene 49 años, cuatro hijos D. 31, 29, 24, estudian instituto superior  y  el D. 6 años que esta en el colegio. 
Ana Trabajó en un restaurante con su mama por mucho tiempo, es donD. aprendió a cocinar, después  en su casa empezó a vender ceviche, y lo hace desD. hace cinco años, ya tiene clientela, semanal compra veinte kilos D. pescado, para su cevicheria.   
DesD. que esta en Finca, ha comprado mas mercadería, arreglo su casa, gracias a los prestamos que recibe,  aprendió a ser más responsable, con los pagos. 
Necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D. mesas, sillas y cerveza para su cevichería. 
El sueño D. Ana Maria es estudiar contabilidad en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a member of Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. She is 49, married, and has 4 children. The elder, ages 31, 29 and 24 are studying in higher education, and the 6-year-old is in school. Ana worked in a restaurant with her mother for a long time, which is where she learned how to cook. Later she started to sell fish dishes from her home, which she has been doing for five years. She has a clientele, each week she buys 20 kilos of fish for her fish dishes. Since she has been a member of Finca, she has bought more merchandise and repaired her house. Thanks to the loans she has received, she has learned to be more responsible with her payments. She needs a loan of $500 to purchase tables, chairs, and beer for her fish stand. Ana Maria´s dream is to study accounting at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of $500 to purchase tables, chairs, and beer for her fish stand.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luís es socio del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Luis es soltero, tiene 23 años, termina la escuela, y esta  estudiando pastelería fina.
Luís trabajo en wong en el área de pastelería, es allí donde se inclino mas por el negocio de pastelería, y viendo a su mama hacer pasteles. Empezó vendiendo leche asada y postres en los puestos del mercado y en dulcerías; cada día reparte cincuenta leches asadas.
Luís necesita un crédito de 1600 soles para la compra de un horno industrial e ingredientes para preparar  pasteles.  
El sueño de Luís abrir una pastelería y hacer pasteles para empresas grandes como wong.
texts.en:
Luís is a member of Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. Luis is single, 23, is finishing school and studying fine baking. Luis works at Wong in the pastry section, which is where he became more inclined towards the pastry business, as well as seeing his mother make pastries. He started selling puddings and desserts to market stands and sweet shops. Every day he would distribute 50 puddings. Luis needs a loan of $500 to buy an industrial oven and ingredients to prepare pastries. His dream is to open a bakery and make pastries for large companies such as Wong.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luis needs a loan of $500 to buy an industrial oven and ingredients to prepare pastries.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. 
Elena es conviviente, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 7 y 12 años que están en la escuela particular.
Ella estudió cosmética dermatológica por tres años, tenia un salón de belleza, pero lo cerro por que conoció a su esposo desde hace nueve años, su esposo vende fruta, y ella se puso a trabajar con él en la venta de fruta todos los días de 9 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.
En finca se siente tranquila, puede invertir  y mover más capital, aprende del negocio de las demás socias. 
Necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para comprar de 30 cajones de fruta diaria. 
El sueño de Maria es terminar de estudiar dermatología y trabajar enseñando cosmetología.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank Mi Buen Pastor. She is married, 38 years old and has two children aged 7 and 12 that are in private school. She studied cosmetic dermatology for three years and had a beauty salon, but closed it because she met her husband. For nine years her husband has sold fruit and she went to work with him selling fruit every day from 9 am until 10 pm. On the farm she feels tranquil, she can invest and move more capital and learn the business from the other members. She needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase 30 crates of fruit daily. The dream of Maria is to finish studying dermatology and work by teaching cosmetology.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy 30 crates of fruit

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Lube es socia de Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Lube es casada, tiene 50 años, cuatro hijos, de 18, 15  13Y 10 años que está en la escuela estatal. 
Lube nació en cañete en la cacha de sus padres, desde niña ayudada en la chacra, y aprendió el manejo de la misma, con el tiempo estudio contabilidad y ahora la aplica a su negocio. Su negocio es de venta de frutas, uvas, manzanas, y palta. Que siembra en su chacra. 
Necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para la compra de insecticida, abono.
El sueño de Lube es que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una casa, por que vive en casa de sus padres, le gustaría tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Lube is a member of San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. Lube is married, 50 years old and has four children aged 18, 15, 13 and 10 who are at the state school. Lube was born in the city of Cañete in the home of her parents and from the time that she was a child she has helped on the ranch and learned the operation of the business; with time she studied accounting and now she applies it to her business. Her business is selling fruit- grapes, apples, and avocado, which she raises on the farm. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide and fertilizer. Lube dreams of her children becoming professionals, having a house because she lives in the house of her parents, and she would like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs a loan of 2600 soles to purchase insecticide, fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria  es socia del bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Gloria es casado, tiene 65 años,  diez hijos, que están casados. Llego a lima hace 40 años, de Piura.  
En Piura ella tenía una picantería, con su familia, cuando llego a Lima se puso vender ropa, y se dedico a su familia.  
Ahora ella puso una  picantería en su casa vende comida criolla  desde hace tres años con tres de sus hijas que le ayudan, cada día tiene 15 comensales.
Necesita un crédito de 2200 soles, para compra de cerveza, arroz, aceite.
Desde que esta en Finca ella siente que es una ayuda, por que les explican como deben trabaja, en su negocio y les enseñan a ser cumplidas en los pagos.   
Gloria tiene ganas de seguir trabajando, y el sueño que tiene es ver a sus hijos prosperar.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. She is 65 years old, married, and has 10 children who are all married. She came to Lima forty years ago from Piura. In Piura she had a restaurant with her family. When she arrived in Lima she began selling clothing and dedicated her time to her family. Three years ago she started a restaurant in her home selling Creole food. Three of her daughters help her. Each day fifteen diners come to the restaurant. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles ($700 USD) to buy beer, rice, and oil. Since she has been a part of Finca she has felt that it has been helpful because they explain to the members how they should work at their businesses and teach them how to make their payments. Gloria really wants to keep working, and her dream is to see her children prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, rice, and oil

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 38 años, tiene una hija de 5 años que esta en la escuela.
El negocio que tiene es venta de golosinas en la casa de su tía. 
Estudio enfermería técnica, ejerció por un tiempo y cuando la solicitan va a trabaja, pero  es un trabajo muy pesado, por eso  empezó a trabajaba en un cafetería por tres años, le gusto el negocio y quiere poner en su casa una tienda, ella esta arreglando su casa.  También trabaja limpiando casas. 
Necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para el arreglo de su casa, poner piso y compra de golosinas. 
Con los ahorros y préstamos  en Finca a comprado estante, se siente mas realizada por que cuenta con un capital para invertir ve como las socias tiene iniciativa para surgir en sus negocios,  eso le contagia a ella. Siente que  tiene opción para salir adelante.
El sueño de Rosa es tener un depósito de venta de gas en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the San Judas Tadeo Community Bank. She is a 38-year-old single mother of a 5-year-old girl who attends school. Rosa's business is selling sweets from her aunt's home. She studied to be a nursing technician, and practiced for a while, but it is a very difficult job. So, she began working in a cafeteria and enjoyed working there for three years. Currently, Rosa cleans houses and is building a shop in her home. Rosa would like a loan for 2,400 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $750). She will use the money to build a shop, install flooring, and purchase sweets. With her savings and previous loans from Kiva's partner FINCA Peru, she has purchased shelving. Rosa is grateful for her association with the community bank. She feels more secure because she has working capital, and watching other women take initiative in their businesses has increased her own enthusiasm. She knows that she has the opportunity to get ahead. Rosa's dream is to one day sell gas canisters from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a shop, install flooring, and purchase sweets

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda, es soltera, tiene 40 años, estudio contabilidad. Pero no quiso trabajar en ninguna empresa, si no  tener su propio negocio.   
Los padres de Hermelinda tenían negocio de fruta, ella trabajaba con sus padres, ella decidió trabajar en el negocio por que se gana más. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado mayorista, vende limón, maracuyá empezó kiliando, ósea vendiendo por kilos, ella consiguió a una persona que le mandan del norte de Piura, Chulucanas, cada semana, se levanta a  trabajar a las tres de la mañana hasta  el medio día.    
Su negocio cambia desde que esta en Finca, por los prestamos que recibe, ha crecido puede invertir mas, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que aprende, se entretiene, y tiene amigas.    
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles, para la compra de sacos de maracayá. 
El sueño de Hermelinda es comprar su parcela de terreno en el norte para sembrar limón, maracuyá, y tener su casa propia por que vive en casas de sus padres.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is single and 40 years old. She studied accounting, but didn't want to work for a company - she wanted to have her own business. Hermelinda's parents had a fruit business, and she worked with her parents. She decided to work in this business because she earns more there. She has a stand in the major market, where she sells limes and passionfruit. She began selling by the kilo, and found a person who sends the fruit north to Piura and Chulucanas each week. Hermelinda gets up at 3am to work, and works until midday. Her business has changed since she has been in Finca. Because of the loans she has received, she has been able to invest more. She enjoys the Bancomunal's meetings because she learns, she has fun, and she has friends. Hermelinda requires a loan of 3600 soles ($1125) to buy sacks of passionfruit. Her dream is to buy a piece of land in the north so she can sow limes and passionfruit, and have her own house, because she lives with her parents at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of passionfruit

loans.name: Julia Juana

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Julia es madre soltera, tiene  58 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados.
Julia se dedica a la venta de frutas por cajones, desde su juventud. 
Todos los fines de semana Julia va a  tres horas de Lima, hasta Cañete al sur del País,  para compra en la chacra fruta  por cajones y repartir en la  semana  a su vecinas, también vende comida sureña los domingos en su casa, con estas dos actividades ella ha mantenido a sus hijos por años.   
Desde que esta en Finca esta construyendo su casa poco a poco,  puede invertir mas, en su negocio, siente que es una  ayuda para  ella y para todas  las socias,  les ayuda a surgir en  sus negocios y en sus  vidas. 
Necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar cajones de fruta.    
El sueño de Julia es techar su casa y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. She is a 58 year-old single mother with four adult children, all of whom are married. Julia makes a living selling fruit by the crate, which she has done since a young age. Every weekend Julia makes a three-hour trip from Lima south to Cañete in order to buy crates of fruit at a small farm. Julia delivers the fruit to her neighbors during the week, and also sells Southern Peruvian food at her home on Sundays. She has been able to support her children for years through these two activities. Since getting involved with Kiva partner Finca, Julia has been working on building her home a little bit at a time. Julia invests more in her business when she can—she feels that this is helpful both for herself and for the other members of her bank, since it helps them improve their businesses and their lives. Julia needs a loan of 1200 Soles so that she can purchase crates of fruit. Her dream is to finish roofing her house and to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles so that she can purchase crates of fruit.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Alejandrina es conviviente, tiene 49 años, cuatro hijos  25, 24, 20,  y 9 están soleteros y  todos estudian.
Llego de Huanuco a los 16 años, trabajo en casas hasta que se caso, su esposo no quiso que siguiera trabajando, él es albañil, pero hace dos años puso una bodega  abarrotes  en su casa, pero no ganaba mucho, cambio de  giró decidió vender cerveza, gaseosas  y golosina, le deja mas ganancias. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, tiene mas dinero para  invertir, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que tiene amigas.   
Necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para comprar cerveza, gaseosa y galletas,  
El sueño de Alejandrina es que su negocio crezca, para seguir  educando a sus hijos y que todos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank. Alejandrina lives with her partner, is 49 years old, and has four children who are 25, 24, 20, and 9. All of her children are single and are students. She arrived from Huanuco when she was 16 years old and worked in homes until she got married. Her husband, a bricklayer, did not want her to keep working. Two years ago she started a small grocery story in her home but she did not earn much money. She decided to change things around to sell beer, soft drinks, and sweets to increase her earnings. Since she has been a part of Finca she has learned how to save and she has more money to invest. She likes the bank meetings because she has friends there. She needs a loan of 1600 soles ($500 USD) to buy beer, soft drinks, and cookies. Alejandrina's dream is for her business to grow and to continue educating her children so that they all become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Justa es separada, tiene 50 años,  tres hijos 32, 30 y 27 años todos trabajan. 
Justa trabajo desde los diez años, no vivió con sus padres por que se separaron,  hace tres años  trabajaba con una sobrina en comas, atendiendo una librería, después de un tiempo, ella abrió su propia librería-bazar en el mercado modelo, se llama librería- bazar “ALEXA” su hija la ayuda con la administración del negocio.
Justa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cuadernos, colores, pápelo grafos.   
El sueño de Justa es que su negocio de librería crezca y abrir en su casa  una librería.
texts.en:
Justa is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Justa is separated. She is 50 years old and has three children aged 32, 30 and 27 who are all working. Justa has been working since she was 10 years old. She did not live with her parents because they separated. Three years ago she was working with a niece in Coma: she ran a bookstore. In time she opened her own bookstore-bazaar in the Modelo market. Her business is called "Librería-Bazar ALEXA". Her daughter helps her manage the store. Justa needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy school supplies, notebooks, crayons, easel pads. Justa's dream is to grow her business and open a bookstore in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies, crayons, notebooks, easel pads for resale

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa  es socia del bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Carmen es casada, tiene 45 años, cuatro hijos, de 22,16, 14 y 8 años  estudian en la escuela estatal.
El  esposo de Carmen Rosa  trabajaba en una fábrica y con la liquidación  compro un carro tiko  que lo ponen a trabajar, es una entrada más para su casa.
El negocio de Carmen Rosa es de taxi ella tiene un carro y lo da a trabajar. Carmen Rosa hace tamales los fines de semana 150 tamales, que los venden en su barrio con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para el mantenimiento de su taxi. 
Desde que esta en finca, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias 
El sueño de carmen Rosa es poder ir a Cajamarca allá tiene parcelas de tierra, quiere sembrar  pallar, palta y  lúcuma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Carmen is married. She is 45 years old and has four children aged 22, 16, 14 and 8 who attend public school. Carmen Rosa's husband worked in a factory and with the severance pay he bought a motocar which they have put to work as this business brings additional income to their household. Carmen Rosa's business is the taxi business: she has a car which she rents out. Carmen Rosa prepares tamales on weekends: 150 tamales, which she sells in her neighbourhood with the help of her children. She needs a loan of 1,800 soles to perform maintenance on her taxi. Since joining Finca, she has enjoyed the companionship between members. Carmen Rosa dreams of going to Cajamarca where she has land which she wants to sow with butter beans, avocado and eggfruit.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To perform maintenance on her taxi

loans.name: Katy Ana

texts.es:
Katy  es madre soltera, tiene 30 años, tres hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años, que están en la escuela.  
Katy creció en le negocio, viendo a su familia, tíos, primos, trabajar, sus padres se separaron, ella tuvo que trabajar con su mamá vendiendo comida, ahora da pensión a las obras constructoras  en Lima y en provincia. Cuando es en provincia ella lleva en el camión de la empresa  constructora  su cocina,  ollas, platos, todos lo utensilios necesarios, contrata a dos chicas para que él ayude, da pensión a 60 personas.   
Katy necesita 1200 soles, para comprar un juego de ollas, platos, cubiertos. 
Desde que esta en finca siente que es un apoyo económico, se siente muy agradecida tiene mas capital y se siente realizada.
El sueño de Katy es poner un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Katy is a single mother. She is 30 years old and has three children aged 9, 7 and 5 who attend school. Katy grew up in the business, watching her family, uncles and cousins, working. Her parents were separated. She had to work with her mother selling food. Today she prepares meals for construction workers in Lima and in the province. When she works in the province, she takes the construction company's truck to bring her stove, pots, dishes, all the utensils she needs, hires two girls to help her in order to feed 60 people. Katy needs 1,200 soles to buy a set of pots, dishes and cutlery. Since joining Finca, Katy has felt financially supported. She is very grateful to have more capital and she feels fulfilled. Katy's dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a set of pots, dishes and cutlery

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo 
Ana es casada, tiene 43 años, dos hijos de 23 y 19 años estudiantes de instituto superior.
Empezó trabajando en un salón de belleza, hasta que se caso se dedicó a su casa e hijos hasta que crecieron. Con su hermano a medias pusieron una boutique, ella aprendió del negocio y ahora tiene  su  tienda de venta ropa se llama  “ANITA”,  ella trae ropa de gamarra y ropa importada del sur del país. Trabaja de lunes a domingo, su hijo le ayuda con la contabilidad cada fin del mes.    
Desde que esta en Finca puede invertir más, aprende de las otras socias, comparten experiencias que enriquecen su negocio y vida.   
Ana necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para invertirlo en la compra de ropa escolar, pantalones, blusas, polos. 
El sueño de ana es tener una tienda propia, la que tiene es alquilada.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Ana is married. She is 43 years old and has two children, aged 23 and 19 who attend institutions of higher learning. She worked in a beauty salon until she married, at which time she became a homemaker and cared for her children until they were older. She and her brother co-owned a boutique where she learned the business. Today she has her own clothing store called "ANITA". She brings in clothing from the Gamarra shopping mall as well as clothing imported from the South of the country. She works from Monday to Sunday. Her son helps her with the accounting at the end of each month. Since joining Finca she has been able to invest more, she is learning from the other members who share experiences which enrich her business and her life. Ana needs a 1,200 soles loan to invest in clothing for school, pants, blouses, polo shirts. Ana's dream is to own her own locale: the one she has now is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for school, pants, blouses, polo shirts for retail

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg D. is a single mother who lives with four children. Two of her children she adopted after her sibling died a few years ago. Her own son has already graduated from university, and he works as a policeman. Her own daughter is a university student. She has been taking loans with XacBank since 2005 to expand her book sales business. Many types of used and new books are sold at her stall.

Since 2002, Altantsetseg has rented the bookstall at one of the capital city, Ulaanbaatar's, five biggest bookstores. Her business capital is MNT 2,000,000 (about 1,335 USD). She gets an average daily income from sales of MNT 28,000 (about 18.70 USD). At this time, she plans to buy textbooks to sell to high school students who are preparing for their university test. She has a very good credit history with XacBank.

loans.use: To buy students' textbooks for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcar and some seeds for his land

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Evelyn D. is a native resident of Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is 36 years old and blessed with 4 children. She is married to a man who provides for the needs of his family that’s why he is working as security guard in CitiAppliance in Antique.

Her business is buying and selling frozen foods. She started this business since she joined ASHI. Before, she only read cookbooks and recipes. At the moment she needs to purchase a refrigerator for her frozen products. As of now she is suffering from grief over the death of her 3-year-old child. But she still looks forward to the success of her business. As another source of income, she also sells ice, plates, umbrellas and appliances.

Evelyn dreams that someday she may have a stall in Manila where all her homemade frozen products would be there. She also dreams that someday she may have her dream house and send her four children to school . She would like to thank ASHI for the capital which helps her generate an income and sustain their basic needs. She has also benefited from the insurance claims for her son who died and in the future, emergencies are not a problem.

loans.use: Buying  and selling frozen foods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru: Масуда женщина в возрасте  37 лет , мать троих детей, муж работает водителем маршрутного городского  такси.Масуда продаёт на рынке канцелярскими товарами для учёбы.Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 8 лет.Раньше она работала медсестрой в детской поликлинике,но из-за того что её заработная плата не хватала для проживания семьи, она решила открыть свой бизнес.Для начала ей помог её муж,дав ей небольшую сумму денег.Вначале у неё был маленький оборот , но со временем она его стала увеличивать.Узнав о кредитах Масума решила взяв кредит закупить ещё товар.
texts.en:
Masuda is a woman of 37 years of age, she is a mother of three children. Her husband works as a driver of a shuttle city taxi. Masuda sells school supplies on the market. She has been in this business for eight years. Before that she was working as a nurse in a children's hospital, but her salary was not enough to support the family and she decided to start her own business. In the beginning her husband was helping her and gave her a small amount of money. When she started her turnover was very small, but with time she started increasing it. When she heard about MicroInvest loan program Masuda decided to apply for a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies merchandise

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of four members, all residents of Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. V. has been selected to be the group leader by the members. She is 24 years old and is married to Sat, who is also 24. The young couple makes a living by working as carriers at the fish market, and they can earn around US$ 3 per day. They currently have two children; they are both young. The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is broken frequently; thus, they both have decided to request a loan to repair their old house.

The other three borrowers are:

K. is a reserve worker and she needs a loan to purchase a motorcycle for family transport.

R. is a reserve worker, a widow, and she is requesting a loan to repair her old house.

P. is a reserve worker, a widow, and she is asking for a loan as capital to R. a new business as a grocery seller.

All four of the borrowers are working at the same place in their community.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorenda M. hails from Sibalom, Antique, Philippines and is blessed with ten children. At the moment, she has encountered challenges in the schooling of her 2 high school students. Being a mother of 10 is a serious matter, that’s why any problem encountered at her age of 55 is just a part of ordinary life.

"Nanay" (Mama) Lorenda is engaged in buying and selling bamboo products and charcoal. She started with only 10 sacks of charcoal. She had lots of customers such as restaurant owners, neighbors, students and employees. As of now, she and her relative share one stall, that’s why she dreams of having her own shop to display all her products since the customers are satisfied seeing her bamboo products. She is also accepting orders for bamboo as another source of income.

She perseveres to have a name in this kind of business and send her children to school so that they will have a good future someday. She also would like to establish her own shop to display all her bamboo products there. For her, ASHI is a great help for her business, providing capital and insurance for death, and business training that will mould ASHI members' lives.

loans.use: Buying and selling bamboo products and charcoal

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq S. is 23-years-old, single and lives in district two in Jalalabad. He is uneducated because he has the responsibility to take care of his family. He is a hard working man and has been involved in agriculture for more than seven years. Now he wants to enlarge his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 26 months, to enlarge his shop and improve his business. This will bring more success and provide a good monthly income for his family.

Tariq wants to thank lenders around the world and thank KIVA and AFSG for this fantastic process of getting a loan. He would like to say that at his age this is such a good program in Afghanistan as people are faced with lots of difficulty. He would love to see more success in the future.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Krin

texts.en:
S. is 49 years old, a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she makes a living as a local cultivator. She normally grows corn and tobacco, which she sells to buyers three or four months after beginning planting them. She is married and the mother of eight children: five are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home.

To help meet the family's foods needs a little more, four of her children are employed, while her husband, whose name is Khon, 54, works with her in growing crops. S. works hard at her business activities and never wastes time. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump, and gasoline to use for growing crops. The loan will allow them to get the highest quality products, better than in the previous year. (S.'s husband appears in the picture on the farmland, because she was not available for photographing.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump, and gasoline

loans.name: Eliaich

texts.en:
Eleaich has owned a small shop and  has been a tailor in the  Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 19 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 12.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy another sewing machine for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Eliaich is 38 years old, married, and has one child: ages 12. She also cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Chipukizi Group

texts.en:
Rukia has been a seamstress in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Every day she works at her business from 8:30am to 18.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rukia is 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 2. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanaid, Bertha, Lightnes and Erasmimi. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more sewing notions for her business

loans.name: Unimums Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been a food seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 7am to 4pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mariam is 32 years old, married, and has two children: ages 15 and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aisha, Sharifa and Aziza. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Amina has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 550. Every day she works at her business from 12am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 38 years old, married, and has three children: aged between 16 and 13. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza, Elizabeth, Mariam, and Zuhura. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar B. is a single mother whose husband died five years ago. She has four children. Three of them go to elementary school and one is a university student. Six years ago, her family moved to UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia, from Uvs province, which is 2,000 kilometers away. Since she moved, she has been running a meat stall business, buying a whole cow or sheep and selling it off cut by cut, to feed her children and survive in the big city.

As a country woman, she has experience butchering goat and sheep meat. All her children help with their mother's business after school. Otgonbayar lives in a "ger" -- the traditional nomadic housing used on the Mongolian steppe -- sharing her relatives' yard and paying rent. She is taking her fifth loan with XacBank, Kiva's partner MFI in Mongolia. Her dream is to see all her children graduate from the university. (In the picture, Otgonbayar is on the left.)

loans.use: to buy more cow and sheep meat for sale during the Lunar New Year period

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Evaline has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business from 7am to 6pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Evaline is 31 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19, 17, 6, and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Christina, Stellah, Prisca, and Mary. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Upako Group

texts.en:
Hilda has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business from 7am to 6pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Hilda is married, and has two children: ages 10 and 6. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Glory, Mwanamkuu, Anna, Grace, Mariam, Asia, and Fatma. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the expansion of her business

loans.name: 29- Nam Ngạn Group

texts.vi:
Thanh hóa là một tỉnh nghèo nhất cả nước,cách Hà Nội 156 km về phía Nam.Phố Tân Nam II ,Phường nam Ngạn Thành Phố Thanh Hóa,là một phố có đông dân cư , họ sống chủ yếu dựa vào nghề sản xuất và buôn bán.Nhóm 29 phố Tân Sơn Thành Phố thanh Hóa gồm 5 thành viên .Họ đều vay ở mức 1.963.500 VND (112USD),chu kỳ II.
* Chị N. Thị H.,38 tuổi,chồng chị là anh N.  Văn Khánh ,Anh ở nhà phụ giúp vợ bán bún chả và chả tôm. Anh chị có 2 con. Con gái đầu của chị đang học C. đẳng kế toán ở trường đại học Hồng Đức. Con trai út của chị đang học lớp 7. Chu kỳ trước chị vay vốn để bán bún chả và chị đã dùng lợi nhuận thu được để mua tủ lạnh để đựng tôm làm hàng. Chu kỳ nay chị vay  vốn về để đầu tư thêm vào việc bán chả tôm.
*Chị P. Thị T.nh 30 tuổi chị vay vốn  đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng điện thoại
* Chị C. thị Duyên 45 Tuổi, chị vay vốn bán hoa quả 
* Chị N. Thị Phượng chị vay vốn để làm bún
* Chị N. Thị Tuyết, chị vay vốn để bán thuốc thú y
texts.en:
Thanh Hoa, 156km south of Ha Noi, is one of the poorest province in the country. Tan Nam 2 Street in Nam Ngan Commune, Thanh Hoa Province is a street with high population density. The inhabitants make a living by trading and manufacturing business. Group "29 Tan Son Street, Thanh Hoa Province" has five members. They wish to borrow VND1,963,500 (USD112) for each member in this second loan cycle. * Mrs Nguyen Thi Huong, 38 years old. Her husband is Mr. Nguyen Van Khanh. The husband stays at home to help his wife to sell grilled chopped meat and vermicelli and grilled chopped shrimp. They have two children. The daughter is studying accounting at Hong Duc university. And the son is studying at Grade 7. In the previous loan cycle, she borrowed money to start selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli. She used the profits to buy a freezer to store shrimp. In this loan cycle, she borrows money to invest further in selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli. * Mrs. Pham Thi Thinh, 30 years old. She borrows money to invest further in the phone shop. * Mrs. C. Thi Duyen, 45 years old. She borrows money to buy and resell fruits * Mrs. Nguyen Thi Phuong. She borrows money to make vermicelli * Mrs. Nguyen Thi Tuyet. she borrow money to buy and resell veterinary medicine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in selling grilled chopped meat/shrimp and vermicelli.

loans.name: Mohammad Aqa Group

texts.en:
M. Aqa is the group leader of M. Aqa group. There are four members in this group and all of them want a loan for his/her business.

M. Aqa wants a loan for his fruit cart business. He wants to buy the necessary materials for his business. Zayah Jan wants a loan for her husband’s general store to expand and improve his business. Maleha wants to take a loan for her tailoring business so she can purchase a new sewing machine. And Palwasha wants to take a loan for her brother’s fruit cart business so he can make it a larger his business.

They want to say this loan is very useful because this loan can provide a good opportunity for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger not only in their business, but also in their lives. The group wants to thank everyone involved in this process of offering loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses-fruit carts, tailoring and general store

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Mr. Hieng S. is a villager in Trapaing Khda Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Yorn Chroeb, sells firewood to help support the family. They have five children who are all attending the local school. Although they try to work hard, they cannot provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Hieng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and hopes to increase their income after selling the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch U. is a widow who lives in Tei Muoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a dry fish seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell. She is 58 years old and she has a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish to resell.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: abdoulaye a 22 ans il est celibataire .Apres les etudes primaires qui ont été abandonnées tres tot,abdoulaye  pour gagner sa vie s'est lancé dans le commerce de petits objets ( sacs chausures ect)dans la rue .les revenus tirés de l' activité lui permettent d 'envoyer queque chose à ses parents restés au village.Le pret solliciter lui permet d'accroitre et de diversifier ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is 22 years old and unmarried. After primary school, which he abandoned early on, he earned his living by starting off in the commerce of small items (bags, shoes, etc.) on the street. The income derived from his work enables him to send something to his parents, who remain in the village. The loan being requested will allow him to augment and diversify his merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has owned a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 5 years. She belongs to Neema group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 21.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Joyce is 22 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Eliaishi

texts.en:
Eliaishi  a member of Wema group in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha. She has been a business woman for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $110. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Eliaishi is 25 years old, married, and has one child: ages 1. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more items in order to expand her business.

loans.name: 03- Đông Hải Group

texts.vi:
* Sơn Vạn, Đông Hải, Thanh Hóa là một xã ven sông. Dân cư thưa thớt, người dân đời sống rất khó khăn.Nhóm 03,thôn Sơn Vạn, xã Đông Hải bao gồm 7 thành viên, chị Lê Thị Thúy Vân , sinh năm 1984, làm nhóm trưởng.Tuy tuổi còn trẻ nhưng chị rất năng động, chị đã biết đến Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ nữ nghèo Thanh Hóa và vận động chị em vay vốn để tìm cách thay đổi cuộc sống nghèo khó từ lâu đã quen gắn bó với nghề nông nghiệp.Chồng chị là anh N. Hồng Trung sinh năm 1983,anh chị có 1 con gái còn nhỏ.Bằng đồng vốn vay được, anh chị mua lợn , gà giống để chăn nuôi thêm và đi bán hoa quả vào những lúc rảnh rỗi.Các thành viên trong nhóm cùng vay mức vốn 1.626.900 VNĐ(~92USD).
* Chị Lê Thị Tho, sinh năm 1971, chị cũng làm ruộng và mua hoa quả đi bán rong để có thêm thu nhập.
* Chị N. Thị Đông, sinh năm 1973, cũng làm ruộng và bán hoa quả.
* Chị Tô Thị Yến, sinh năm 1977, ngoài làm ruộng chị còn đi bán rau.
* Chị Lê Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1968, ngoài làm ruộng chị chăn nuôi thêm lợn gà.
* Chị Lê Thị Phương, sinh năm 1986, chị chăn nuôi lợn gà và trồng rau.
* Chị Đỗ Thị Tuynh, sinh năm 1952, chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn gà.
texts.en:
Son Van Commune in Dong Hai, Thanh Hoa is by the side of the river. The population is dispersed, and the people suffered many hardships. Group 03 Son Van Commune, Dong Hai has 7 members. Mrs. Le Thi Thuy Van, born 1984, is group leader. Despite of young age, she is very active. She heard about the Fund and encouraged her neighbors to borrow money to find ways to change their poor lives that have long been linked to agriculture. Her husband is Mr. Nguyen Hong Trung, born 1983, and they have a small daughter. With the money, they will buy pigs and chickens to raise. They also sell fruits in spare time. Each members in the group borrows VND1,626,900 (about USD92).

Ms. Le Thi Tho, born 1971, is a farmer. She buys and resells fruits to earn extra income

Ms. Nguyen Thi Dong, born 1973, is also a farmer and buys and resells fruits

Ms. To Thi Yen, born 1977, sells vegetables in addition to farming

Ms. Le Thi Hoa, born 1968, raises pigs and chickens in addition to farming

Ms. Le Thi Phuong, born 1986, raises chickens and pigs and grows vegetable

Ms. Do Thi Tuynh, born 1952, is a farmer and she raises pigs and chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Khem Chor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group, which consists of ten people, is located in Trapang Kda village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Khem C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who can make a little rice revenue that cannot support the family well. In order to provide better conditions, Mrs. Khem C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of rice field to cultivate rice and expand her rice revenue. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Chhaing, is a taxi driver who also can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Khem C. is 43 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Mr. Khen C. and Mr. Tet T. did not attend the loan meeting, so their wives are presented in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of rice field to cultivate rice and expand rice revenue.

loans.name: Abdul Malek

texts.en:
A. Malek is married and lives with his family. He has owned his own restaurant business for a long time. He received a first cycle loan and used it to improve his business. Now he plans to enlarge it and wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 40,000 AFN with a term of nine months to enlarge his restaurant, increase his stock and change the design. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future. A. plans to open another restaurant in the next five years. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his restaurant to be its best and he hopes that he is going to continue to be the best in the future. He is happy.

loans.use: To expand and improve his restaurant

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has been a  a maize seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 11 years. She belongs to Ikunda group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $235. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 5pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize  for resale to expand her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Leah is married, and has three children: ages 14, 9 and 7. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.en:
Naisiligaki has been a  tailor in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8.30am to 18.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Naisiligaki is 48 years old, married, and has one child, age 17. She also cares for three additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kanaely, who also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items

loans.name: Ojo

texts.en:
Ojo O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. 
He bakes bread and sells to his customers. He is requesting a loan of 50,000NGN to purchase more baking flour to make more bread to sell. 
He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and material for baking bread.

loans.name: Elisiana

texts.en:
Elisiana is a banana seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She belongs to Zingatia group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bananas for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Elisiana is  married, and has four children: ages 12, 10, 11 and 9. She also cares for three additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Eliashea

texts.en:
Eliashea has been a  maize seller in the Tengeru in the neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 4pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Eliashea is married, and has two children. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Sonagnon Félicienne

texts.fr: Originaire d'Odja,elle vit le jour le 08/04/1973 à Houlènou. Elle est à Mr KOUNNOU Valentin commerçant de profession. La dame Sonagnon est mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles tous scolarisés. L'aîné du nom Juste est au CM1 et les deux jumelles sont à la  marternelle. Elle acquiert ses marchandises( pétrole, lait, tomates fraiches, charbon...) dans le marché international du Bénin (Tokpa). Elle est à son quatrième crédit et elle sollicite un prêt. Son lieu d'activité est à son domicile sise à Kpondéhou dans la rue opposée au commissaisriat.
texts.en:
With an origin in Odja, Ms. Sonagnon saw the light of day on April 8, 1973 in Houlènou. She is married to Mr. Valentin Kounnou, who is a merchant. Ms. Sonagnon is the mother of 3 children, one son and two daughters, all in school. The eldest, Juste by name, is in 4th grade and the twin girls are in kindergarten. She obtains her merchandise (gasoline, milk, fresh tomatoes, charcoal...) in the international market of Benin (Tokpa). She is presently requesting her fourth loan. She sells out of her home in Kpondéhou in the street across from the police station.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 sacks of charcoal, soap, and some foodstuffs

loans.name: Mr. Jok Jor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who all live in Trapang Kda village in Kampong Chhnang province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Jok J. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He owns a coal kiln where he can make coal to sell for an income. Since this business is going well, he wants to sell his coal door-to-door, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy a cart in order to carry his coal to sell. His wife, Mrs. Tes Saran, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Jok J. is 32 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other two are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fifteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These clients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to carry coal for door-to-door sales.

loans.name: Evaness

texts.en:
Evaness has been a  maize seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She belongs to Mercy group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Evaness is married, and has three children: ages 8, 4 and 2. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Daima

texts.en:
Daima has owned a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She is a member of Jiinue group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business from 12am to 10pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Daima is married, and has two children: ages 12 and 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY a 40 ans elle est mariée et mere de famille.Elle travaille comme agent de sante communautaire.parallelement ce travail elle vend des beignets pour arrondir les fin de fin.Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarite des enfants.Elle sollocite un pret pour developper son commerce.
texts.en:
Khady, 40, is married and the mother of a family. She is a community health worker and at the same time, she sells beignets (fried dough) to make ends meet. The income she makes from the business allows her to pay school fees for her children. She is requesting this loan to further develop her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her little business

loans.name: Ichinhorloo

texts.en: Ichinhorloo D. is a 38-year-old married woman who has 2 children. Unfortunately, her husband has been in prison since 2007. She has been working as a taxi driver since 2004 in Baganuur, a province of Mongolia. The town where she lives is a very small and most of the residents know each other. This works to her advantage as her clients find her to be very flexible about payment, and she has built up a good reputation this way. For instance, if someone has no money for cab, she says that "You can pay tomorrow." She also doesn't smoke; therefore, her cab is cleaner than other cabs. One year ago she sold her old car which was made in Korea and bought a second-hand but better Nissan "Sunny" Japanese car. Ichinhorloo is one of Kiva partner XacBank's best clients and repeat borrowers. She keeps working hard for her children's future. Her dream is for her two children to finish their high school successfully and graduate from university. She wants a Kiva loan to buy car tires and fuel injector for her car.

loans.use: To buy car tires and fuel injector

loans.name: Mr. Sarum Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of fifteen people is located in Trapang Kda village in Kampong Chhnang province and all the members will use the loan for a different purpose. Mr. Sarum P. is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Sok Than, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Sarum P. is 50 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These clients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Yandaa

texts.en: Yandaa B. is a 70-year-old woman who lives with her daughter, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. She has been receiving her pension for the last 15 years; in addition, she runs her little business, as her pension is enough only to just scrape by and she doesn't want to ask her children for money. She rents a stall for clothing sales at the local market, specifically selling children's clothes for newborns. She has a total of four children. One of her children who lives with her helps her to buy clothes from a wholesale market. Yandaa's repeat clients are mostly mothers who just gave birth. (It is a Mongolian superstition not to buy anything for an unborn child). She is one of XacBank's repeat borrowers who has a very good credit history. She told XacBank's credit officer: "I don't want to be a trouble for my children; therefore, I'll keep my little business as long as I can."

loans.use: To buy clothes for newborns for her clothing sales

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells palm oil in wholesale and retail. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. The demands for her palm oil are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Maly T. is a group leader of six members who all live in Thlouk Vien village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Thuong Roth, is a laborer. Mrs. Maly T. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study yet.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her inventory

loans.name: Iyabo Comfort

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 46 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband sells kerosene. She sells sarongs of various colours to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her boutique

loans.name: Mr. Chey Ket Village Bank Group

texts.en:
14 people living in Spean Dek village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan. Mr. Chey K., the 32 year-old village bank president is a motor taxi driver. Aside frO. this career, he is a rice miller who owns a small rice mill. His wife, Mrs. Oeurn Saren, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chey K. is applying for a loan to increase her savings so that she can buy a piece of land to cultivate rice and earn more income. He is the father of four children, two of whO. are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to increase rice revenue.

loans.name: Basurat

texts.en: Basurat sells provisions like noodles, candles, bathing soap, detergent, etc. She is a LAPO client and she is the leader of her lending group. She is 50 years old and she is married with 5 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and Lapo microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Gnomi Véronique

texts.fr:
La dame K. G Véronique est née vers l'année 1961 à Ekpè originaire de TCHEMEdans la Commune de Sèmè Kpodji. Elle est mère de troisenfants dont deux garçons et une fille tous majeurs et responsables. Son mari s'appelle ANAGO Josias agent de SOBEFRIP en retraite. Elle achète les bois de chauffage à ONAB et les tomates fraîches à Ekoè puis les revend à Tokpa. Elle est ancienne dans son activité et souhaite renforcer son capital d'où elle sollicite un prêt d'un montant. Cette bénéficiaire commercialise ses marchandises en son domicile sise à Kpondéhou.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Véronique K. was born about 1961 in Ekpè and has roots in Tcheme, in the community of Sèmè Kpodji. She is a mother with three children, all adults and on their own. Her husband’s name is Josias ANAGO, who is a retired SOBEFRIP agent. Ms. K. buys firewood in Onab and fresh tomatoes in Ekoè, and then she resells them in Tokpa. She has extensive experience in this work and would like to boost her capital. Thus, she is requesting a loan. This loan recipient markets merchandise out of her home, located in Kpondéhou.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two truck-loads of firewood bundles

loans.name: Muritala

texts.en: Muritala T. sells medicine in wholesale and retail. The demands for his medicine are high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers.
