He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He is 35 years old and he is married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Salohiddin

texts.ru:
Умарову Салохиддину 39 лет. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. У него собственная мельница, где он производит муки. Он часто закупает пшеницу для производства муки. А потом перепродает. Этим он занимается 3 года. А также фермеры привозят свой урожай пшеницы. Он за услуги мельницы берет с фермеров определенную сумму денег.  
Салохиддин хочет участвовать в программу Кива и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, для покупки муки.
texts.en:
Salohiddin U., 39, is married and has 2 children. Salohiddin owns a flour mill. He purchases some of the grain he grinds and local farmers bring the rest. Salohiddin has been in business for three years. He will use this loan to purchase grain for his mill.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grain for flour production

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Riel Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of 15 members and is located in Spean Dek village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Thy R. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a firewood seller. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Ros Neth, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he gets a little income to support his family living. Mrs. Thy R. is applying for a loan to buy rice for her family's consumption. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. The youngest one is not ready to work or study. 

Five members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice for her family's consumption

loans.name: Chakiratou-Laï

texts.fr:
A.  Chakiratou-Laï est née le 07/08/1982 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous mineurs. Elle gère officiellement une cabine téléphonique dans laquelle des cartes de recharge de tous les reseaux du Bénin sont mises en vente. Elle commercialise également des tissus et des colliers. Elle va généralement s'approvisionner à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Sa clientèle est constituée par les habitants de son environnement. Pour mieux les satisfaire, elle sollicite un prêt d'un montant pour réhausser le niveau de son activité. Lequel crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner considérablement pour pouvoir faire face à sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accoître. Son lieu de vente est situé au quartier Midombo juste à proximité de la clôture de l'Ecole Primaire Publique.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Chakiratou-Laï A. was born on August 7, 1982 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, who are all minors. She officially manages a telephone booth, where rechargeable phone cards of all the networks in Benin are offered for sale. She also markets fabrics and necklaces. Her goods are acquired generally in Tokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. Customers are composed of people living in her area. To satisfy them better, she is requesting a loan for boosting her level of business. This loan will enable her to acquire considerable supplies in order to address her ever-growing customer base. Her sales outlet is located in the Midombo district, very close to the fence line of the public elementary school.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone card for any network

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sacks of maize, millet, and beans for re-sale

loans.name: Amuda

texts.en: Amuda is 51 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Arabbibi

texts.ru:
Ширинова Араббиби Туйчиевна родилась в 1958 году. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Араббиби по национальности узбек, живет и работает в Гисарском районе. Она торгует детскими одеждами широкого ассортимента и для любого сезона. В этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов. Закупает свой товар с оптового рынка «Корвон» и продает в местном рынке «Мубориз».  А иногда сама ездит за товаром в Бишкек.
Араббиби очень хотелось бы еще закупить комплекты для новорожденных и таким образом  увеличить оборотный капитал. Для этого она хочет получить займ  в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 3 месяца.
texts.en:
Arabbibi S. was born in 1958. She is married and has 5 children. Arabbibi lives and works in Gissarskiy region. She sells clothing for children at a local market. Arabbibi buys most of her goods at the wholesale market "Korvon," but sometimes she buys them in Beshkek. Arabbibi will use this loan to purchase clothing sets for newborns. She will repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing sets for newborns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying a new washing machine

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
G. Mukaddas is 39 years old. She is married with three children of school age. Mukaddas is selling fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business for almost 10 years. Tursunoy has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover Mukaddas’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has the wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that she derives allows her to educate her children. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now Mukaddas needs $ 1000 USD for purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling. She promises to pay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Hamzadin

texts.en:
Hamzadin H. is a young man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani with a term of 26 months to buy new land and start growing. He is a professional man and, in the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Hamzadin to help with their problems. 
Hamzadin is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agriculture workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: Buying more land and seeds for growing

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah A. is 30 years old and married with 2 children. He sells provisions, medicine and drinks. He started this business in 2000. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions, medicine and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, medicine and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
H. Rohat is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Rohat's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the family. This was the reason that Rohat decided to start her own business 9 years ago selling the fabrics of the national dresses.

Little by little, she has made her business grow and by allowing her clients to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger. Now, her business is running smoothly; however, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business so her situation will be stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1000 USD that she will pay back in 3 months. With this money, Rohat will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the national dresses. The power to help her business to grow is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing the seasonal fabrics for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions like beverages, juice, candles, and tomato paste. She has been in this business for a long time. Fumilayo is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.en:
Sanovbar is a lovely 56-year-old woman who lives with her three children.  She runs a small fabric selling business at the market where she offers a variety types of fabrics for different tastes and ages.  

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of goods.  The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise and, thus, improve her business and increase her profits. 

Her dreams are to have her own large store one day—but most importantly, enable her children to have a better future, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives.  On behalf of Sanovbar and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a new washing machine

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.ru:
Курбонов Махкам Бобожонович, 1967 года рождения, женат, имеет 6 детей. Они живут в Гиссарском районе. Махкам 4 года как занимается откармливанием крупно - рогатого скота. Он имеет большой двор около своего дома, где он держит свой скот. В данный момент у него два бычка. Он встанет рано утром, чтобы чистить навес, и пастбища. Иногда ему помогает старший сын. Махкам недавно понял, что его бизнес имеет потенциал для существенного роста, и решил купить еще одного скота. Он просит этот заем, чтобы достигнуть своей цели, стать успешным предпринимателем. 
 2000-6
texts.en:
Mahkam K., 42, is married and has 6 children. Mahkam lives with his family in Gissarskiy region. For four years, Mahkam has been raising cattle. At present, he has two young bulls. Mahkam works in his small cattle farm from sunrise to sunset. Sometimes, Mahkam's son helps his father. This loan Mahkam will use to purchase another young bull.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another young bull

loans.name: Oniyo

texts.en: Oniyo sells motor spare parts. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. Oniyo is a hard working man. He is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
D. Roziya is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of two adorable children. Roziya has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business 6 years ago with financial support from her husband who currently earns money in Russia. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to improve her business she is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to increase the variety available to her customers. She promises to repay her loan within 9 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: To purchase a greater range of goods.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira E. is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children. Her husband currently is working in Russia. Nazira is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago she got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Slowly the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Nazira’s business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Oihol

texts.ru:
Эльмуродова Ойхол 8 лет как занимается предпринимательской деятельности. Родилась она в 1966 году, разведенная и имеет 4 детей. Она торгует исключительно женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских демисезонных курточек, пуловер и джемперов, а также большой выбор банных и домашних халатов со штанами. Она закупает свой товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон». Место ее деятельности рынок «Мубориз» города Гиссар. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. 
Ойхол хочет получить займ 4000 сомони и закупить новый товар.
texts.en:
Oihol was born in 1966. She is a single mother of four. Oihol E. has been in business for eight years selling clothing for women. Oihol purchases her goods at a wholesale market "Kovron" and sells the clothing at her retail spot at "Muboriz" market in Gissar. She has many loyal customers. This loan Oihol will use to purchase new inventory for her store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory

loans.name: Osahon

texts.en: Osahon is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He sells medicine to people in his community. He has been in this business for a long time and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. Osahon hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.en:
Since 2005 Muhammadjon G. has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has a daughter of 17 whom he needs to support and properly educate. Muhammadjon has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton H. is 64 years old. He is married with two adult children. Sulton works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. The role of father, which he has carried out for 37 years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He works farming different kinds of fruits all day, trying to take care of them and fertilize them, mainly during harvest, which is what he loves the most. This time, he would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other substances for his garden.

loans.name: Omoyemwen

texts.en: Omoyemwen is 37 years old and married with 4 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд мужчина в возрасте 42 года, женат имеет пятерых детей.Жена работает в больнице медсестрой,двое дочек учатся в Университетах г.Худжанда,два маленьких сына ходят в детсад.Сам Махмуд имеет высшее образование,работает экономистом в Хукумате Худжанда.Махмуд также занимается бизнесом продажей автомашин, но из-за кризиса он сейчас временно не выходит на рынок автомашин.У Махмуда старшей дочери исполнилось 20 лет и они хотят её выдать замуж,но для мелких расходов невесты им стало не хватать денежных средств.поэтому Махмуд решил обратится в Микроинвест
texts.en:
Mahmud, 42, is married and has 5 children. His wife works as a nurse at a hospital. Two of Mahmud's daughters are in college in Khudzhand, and two of his young sons are in kindergarten. Mahmud works as an economist for the city of Khudzhand. In addition, Mahmud has a car sales business. One of Mahmud's daughters turned 20 and is ready to get married. This loan with help Mahmud pay for the wedding and related expenses.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a daughter's wedding and related expenses

loans.name: Opeyemi

texts.en: Opeyemi O. produces and sells notebooks and he also prints textbooks. He started this business in 1995. He hopes to expand this business and needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more printing materials. Opeyemi is 38 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is a LAPO client and says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for printing and production of notebooks

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: A. Julius is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Julius sells planks. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: B. Maria is 40 years old and married with 4 children.Maria sells wooden planks. She is a LAPO client and she lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGn ( $350) to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all who makes these loans possible.

loans.use: To purchase more wooden planks to sell

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of  70, 000NGN to purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She is a Lapo client. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A. sells drinks and pure water in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for quite a long time. She needs a loan in the amount of 70, 000NGN to purchase more drinks and pure water to sell. Susan is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pure water to resell

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
M. Zarifa is a 32-year old lady. Zarifa and her husband, who is currently in Russia, have been married for 12 years and raised two wonderful children. Zarifa has been running her own small business for 11 years. She has a store selling shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste, brushes and other items. Zarifa is very friendly and polite which has earned her a large clientele. Now she is requesting for a loan of $1200 US Dollars. Zarifa is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods to sell and increasethe variety of the products that she stocks. She promises to repay her loan in 9 months and thanks everybody at Kiva who supports her.

loans.use: To iIncrease the supply and variety of goods that she sells.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз клиент в Микроинвест с 2003года , он каждый раз берёт займ для расширения своего бизнеса.Он продаёт женскую обувь.Получив кредит он закупает товар смотря на сезон.Пока до весеннего сезона у него достаточно товара,поэтому для арендной платы своего ларька он хочет получить небольшую сумму.
texts.en:
Aziz M. has been a MicroInvest client since 2003. He has been taking loans to develop his business. Aziz sells shoes for women. Usually, Aziz spends the loan money to purchase additional inventory, but he still has enough shoes to sell for the spring season. This loan Aziz will use to pay rent for his stall.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay rent for retail stall

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna O. is 24 years old. She is married and has a kid. Difficult living conditions forced her husband to leave to earn money in Russia. Mavzuna has been running a grocery store for the past 5 years. Currently, her business is the only source of income for her family of a little child and the parents of her husband. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents in her grocery store. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Mavzuna is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Mavzuna is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan to increase inventory. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Mavzuna reach all of her aspirations.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her inventory of goods.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy sells pork in Santana market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a longtime. The demands for her pork are high and she hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan to purchase more pork to sell. Happy is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more pork to sell.

loans.name: Khalik

texts.en:
Khalik R. is a 53 year-old married man who lives with his daughters and owns a small farm. Khalik is a teacher of school by profession, but he earns very little so he also runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has 11 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Khalik has become a very successful businessman. Khalik has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus, his wife and daughter help him with the cattle raising business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Khalik wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan. He promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Khalik can get ahead.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Oladeji

texts.en: Oladeji O. is 45 years old and married. He sells planks of wood, and is requesting a loan to purchase more wood to sell. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз закончив свой очередной займ хочет получить следующий для покупки деревянных досок.Которые относятся к его бизнесу сырьём для изготовления продукции.Ассортиментом его продукции относятся скалки для мучнных изделий, доски,сита.У Абдуазиза свои покупатели которые оптом закупают его продукцию.Микроинвест рад выдавать кредит таким пунктуальным клиентам как Абдуазиз.
texts.en:
After repaying his previous loan, Abduaziz T. would like to borrow money to purchase wooden boards. Abduaziz uses the wood to produce a variety of kitchen tools such as cutting boards, sieves, etc. Abduaziz has many loyal customers, who buy his products wholesale. MicroInvest is happy to broker a loan for Abduaziz, who is a very reliable borrower.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of wooden kitchen tools

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Muborak and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of sheep. Muborak and her family are waiting for your quick response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She sells sarongs. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit from this business. She hopes for a loan to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Ruzibibi

texts.en:
R. Ruzibibi is a hard working woman and since 2004 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Kanibadam. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings, which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 4 children that she would like to offer an education to them as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working hard labor. To realize this dream, Ruzibibi now requests $800 USD for the term of 6 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables at her produce stand.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Esther sells planks. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN ($350 US) to purchase more planks to sell. She says, "Thanks" to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира женщина 36 лет , мать троих детей.Муж работает слесарем.Сама Шоира занимается продажей детской одежды и обуви.Для приобретения весеннего ассортимента одежды Шоира хочет получить кредит.Она занимается этим бизнесом уже несколько лет,и поддерживает среднее семейное проживание.За товаром она ездит сама.По перевозке груза ей помогает её муж.
texts.en:
Shoira U., 36, is married. She has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. For several years, Shoira has been in business of selling clothing and shoes for children. She needs this loan to purchase spring clothing inventory. Shoira's business helps her to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spring clothing inventory

loans.name: Moudjibatou

texts.fr:
La dame B. Moudjibatou est née vers l'année 1977. Elle est mariée à MOUDACHIROU Deep et mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle mène comme activité la vente des produits divers tels que les savons et omo de toutes qualité. Elle va acquerir ses marchandises à Tokpa pour les revendre à ses clients toujours dans le marché.Son lieu de vente est situé dans le marché TOKPA dans une zone dénommée Gbossodji. Elle a exprimé un besoin de financement pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Moudjibatou B. was born around 1977. She is married to Deep Moudachirou and is the mother of 3 children who are all enrolled in school. Her business involves selling various items such as soaps and detergents (such as Omo) of all varieties. She buys her merchandise at Tokpa and sells it to her customers, in that very same market. Her sales point is located in the Tokpa market in an area called Gbossodji. She said that she needs a loan to bolster her working capital.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of several cases of soaps and detergents

loans.name: Giwa

texts.en: Giwa A. is 63 years old and married with 9 children. He has a shop where he sells spare motor parts. A. is requesting the loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says, "Thanks!" to Kiva and all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara A. is 49 years old and a widow with 2 children. She has two shops. One of the shops is for the sales of shoes, bags and jewelries while the other is for the sales of foodstuffs like salt and rice. She is requesting the loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more clothes, shoes, jewelries and foodstuff to sell. She says, "Thanks!" to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr:
Née en 1956 à Grand Popo, TEVI Clémentine est originaire de MONO. Elle est veuve depuis 6 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont les trois premiers sont déjà tous majeurs. Les deux derniers enfants sont au collège. La dame est vendeuse de pagnes et des fagots de bois de chauffage. Résident à Hlacomey, un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou, elle a embrassé depuis quelques années des activités économiques afin de venir en aide à sa petite famille et assurer à ses enfants une bonne instruction. Elle est à son cinquième crédit. Les crédits passés lui ont été d’un grand appui pour elle. Les remboursements ont été très réguliers à son niveau. Actuellement, ses activités économiques sont très florissantes et le besoin de financement se fait sentir de plus en plus. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite pour son sixième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Grand Popo, Clémentine T.'s family is from Mono. She has been a widow for 6 years and is the mother of 5 children, of whom the first three are already adults. Her two younger children are in high school. Clémentine sells lengths of African print cloth ("pagnes") and firewood. A resident of Hlacomey, a district on the outskirts of the city of Cotonou, she has been working for several years at various jobs to support her little family and ensure a good education for her children.

She is on her fifth loan. The preceding loans have been a great help to her, and her repayments have been very regular. Presently, her businesses are flourishing so that she needs more and more financial support. For that reason she is requesting her sixth loan.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and 3 pick-up truck loads of firewood

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Originaire d’AGONLI, un petit VILLAGE du département du ZOU situé à près de 52 Km  de la ville historique d’ABOMEY, Dame H. est vers 1949 à COTONOU la capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles et un garçon tous majeurs. Dame H. Célestine réside a  est revendeuse de maïs en gros et en détail, de bois de chauffage etc. Elle va régulièrement s’approvisionner dans des marchés locaux à l’intérieur du pays. De retour du marché, elle livre le maïs aux grossistes du marché international du BENIN et ramène le reste à la maison pour le revendre en détail aux gens de son quartier. Elle traverse actuellement une période dans laquelle la demande en ses différents produits est élevée. Alors, pour éviter d'éventuelles ruptures de stocks, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son chiffre d'affaire. Cette bénéficiaire est à son 4ième  crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Originally from Agonli, a small village in the department of ZOU, located about 52 km from the historic city of Abomey, Mrs. Célestine H. has been in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, since around 1949. She is a widow and has three children, two girls and a boy, all of whom are grown up. Mrs. H. is a re-seller of maize both in bulk and at retail, firewood, and other items. She regularly goes to supply herself at the local markets in the interior of the country. After returning from the market, she delivers some of the maize to the wholesalers at the international market in Benin, and takes the rest home to re-sell at retail to the people in her area. She is currently going through a period in which the demand for her various products is high. Thus, to avoid eventual stock shortages, she is asking for a loan to increase her turnover. She is on her fourth loan. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, a local language of Benin, is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and the per capita GDP is $1,500. Alidé offers special loans with 0% interest to highly vulnerable people, and it is part of a group that will soon launch a micro-health insurance program.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 100 kg bags of maize and one cord of firewood

loans.name: Adepegba

texts.en: Adepegba O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes and she is a hair stylist.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Originaire de l’OUEME, dame K. Jeanne est née en 1955 Gbodjè. Mère de 5 enfants dont deux garçons et trois filles, elle est mariée à GOUTON Adrien un chauffeur de taxi. Le couple vit à Agbodjèdo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou depuis 25 ans où la dame exerce l’activité de la vente des condiments, des divers, du maïs en détail etc. Elle est à son 3ième crédit. Elle sollicite un prêr pour renforcer son activité.


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeanne K. is from OUEME but was born in Gbodjè in 1955. She is the mother of five children (two boys and three girls) and is married to Adrien GOUTON, a taxi driver. For 25 years, this couple has been living in Agbodjèdo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou. There, she is in the business of selling condiments, various goods, corn, etc. at the retail level. She is on her third loan, which she is requesting to bolster her business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments, various goods, and sacks of corn

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Née vers 1976 à Natitingou une ville du nord BENIN; dame T. Delphine est originaire de l'atacora. Mariée à GOUDJEMEDJI   Eli un assistant du chef de leur arrondissement, elle est mère d'une fille âgée de 3 ans. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des fruits à savoir : ananas, bananes, orange, pomme fruit etc et en plus de la farine de manioc. Par rapport aux fruits, elle achète en tonne et les livre en même temps aux détaillants à Tokpa (le marché international du BENIN). Elle va s'approvisionner à GLO-DJIGBE, un marché local du pays situé à 75 km de la ville de Cotonou. Son activité est très rentable et elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pour pallier à cet état de chose qu'elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. Delphine CHAGAGA was born about 1976 in Natitingou, a city in northern Benin, and has roots in Atacora. She is married to Eli GOUDJEMEDJI, an assistant of their district’s chief. She became specialized in selling fruit, namely pineapples, bananas, oranges, apples, etc., plus cassava flour. With regards to the fruit, she buys by the tonne and delivers them at once to retailers in Tokpa (the international marketplace of Benin). Her goods will be gotten in GLO-DJIGBE, a local market located 75 km from the city of Cotonou. Her business is very profitable; and she is not able to satisfy her customers. And so, to mitigate the situation, she is applying for her third loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a very sizable quantity of fruit and some cassava flour

loans.name: H. Cécile

texts.fr:
Née le 22/11/1955 à Parakou, dame H. est originaire d'Agonli. Mère de 4 enfants dont 3 filles et un garçon tous majeurs. Son mari du nom de AHOUANGONOU Georges est un mécanicien velo moteur de profession. Elle mène l'activité de la vente de l'huile d'arachide et de palme, de charbon en détail, des balaies, des paniers. Elle sollicite pour son 5ième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. H. was born on November 22, 1955 in Parakou and has roots in Agonli. She is the mother of four children (three girls and a boy), who are all of age. Her husband’s name is Georges AHOUANGONOU, a motorbike mechanic by profession. Her work involves selling peanut oil, palm oil, and charcoal at the retail level, plus brooms and baskets. She is applying for her fifth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of charcoal, two 50-liter drums of  peanut oil and palm oil and some brooms and sponges

loans.name: Akinwale

texts.en: A. Akinwale is 40 years old and married with 2 children who are doing well in school.  He sells electronics parts, and he is requesting this loan to purchase more electronics parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics parts to sell

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
F. Cathérine a 35 ans et est originaire de Adjohoun. F. Cathérine est mariée à DADJO Félix, un conducteur de vehicule, au ministère de la culture et du tourisme. F. Cathérine a deux enfants:un garçon et une fille,tous scolarisés. F. Cathérine a décidé de se lancer dans le commerce des produits vivriers afin d'aider son mari dont le revenu est presque insignifiant, à véritablement faire face aux charges familiales et assurer un avenir meilleur à leurs enfants. F. Cathérine achette des produits vivriers dans les marchés locaux du Bénin, en dehors de la ville de Cotonou. De retour des marchés locaux, elle se rend directement à TOKPA (le marché international du BENIN) et vend ces produits vivriers aux semi-grossistes et aux détaillants, qui à leur tour les revendent dans le même marché TOKPA. L'activité de F. Cathérine évolue de jour en jour; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un nouveau prêt pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest. Le Bénin est à coté du Nigeria; son PIB par habitant est de $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux à 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Cathérine ADONOUGBO is 35 years old and is from Adjohoun. She is married to Félix DADJO, a driver for the ministry of culture and tourism. She is a mother with two children (a boy and a girl), who are both in school. No longer wanting to let her husband cope alone with the day-to-day household expenses, she has decided to use her almost-insignificant income to get started in the commerce of staple foods. This will also help her husband to ensure the best future for their children. For this, she acquires her goods at the local marketplaces outside the city of Cotonou. Upon returning from the market, she goes directly to TOKPA (the international market of Benin), where she delivers her goods to wholesalers and retailers, who in turn resell them at TOKPA. Let us note that staple foods cost more at TOKPA than at local marketplaces. Her business is continuously evolving, and this is why she is requesting a new loan to satisfy her customers. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Raetchi's Group

texts.en: These 7 persons decided to take out a loan from MicroInvest to buy seeds to extend their farming business. All of them live in the same village and they are relatives. They inherited a good place for growing grain and vegetables from grandparents (50 hectares of arable land). For them, it is very beneficial to work together because someone is responsible for the processing of the land and others are responsible for the sales market.  The leader of this group is Raetchi I., who launched the loan idea, and all members of the group have agreed to take out the loan together.  Each member of the group supports the others and is responsible for paying back the loans. If someone is delinquent or defaults, the others will pay the loan. MicroInvest is sure they have a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to increase working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Originaire d'ALLADA où dame A. vit le jour le 30 Décembre 1971. Elle s'est mariée à HOUENOU Théophile un peintre de formation. Elle est mère de deux enfants dont un garçon et une fille tous scolarisés. Elle exerce l'activité de la vente des glacières, des bassines en plastique, des tissus, des bazins riches, des pagnes et des chaussures. Elle va s'apprauvisionner à LOME et au GHANA. Actuellement, ses activités économiques sont très florissantes et le besoin de financement se fait sentir de plus en plus. C’est son quatrième prêt. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
Ms. A. was born on December 30, 1971 in ALLADA, where her roots are. She is married to Théophile HOUENOU, a painter by training. And she is the mother of two children (a boy and a girl), who are both in school. Her work involves selling coolers (insulated containers), plastic tubs, shoes, and cloth -- rich damask fabrics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Her goods will be gotten in LOME and in GHANA. Currently, her commercial business is booming, and the need for financing is felt more and more. This is her fourth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coolers, tubs, cloth, and shoes

loans.name: Candelaria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria del Pilar M. C. tiene 34 años, vive en la Urb. Rázuri, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que no culmino porque se caso y se dedico a su hogar, tiene una pequeña hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Candelaria se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que inicio hace casi 2 años, al principio tenia muy pocas ventas pero con el tiempo a logrado hacerse de clientes, su  negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Candelaria es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para su stock.
Candelaria sueña tener su casa propia y un pequeño negocio de abarrotes o ropa.
texts.en:
Candelaria del Pilar M. C. is 34 years old and lives in the Trujillo district in La Libertad, Perú. She studied as an executive secretary, a career she wasn’t able to pursue because she married and dedicated herself to homemaking. She has a young daughter who depends entirely on her. Candelaria dedicates herself to selling beauty products, a business she started almost two years ago. At the beginning she had few sales but, over time, she has managed to build her customer base. Her business activities take place right in her own home. Candelaria is a new member of the “Mujeres Decididas II” (“Decisive Women II”) cooperative bank. With this loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products to supply her enterprise. Candelaria dreams of owning her own home, and of having a small business selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products to supply her business.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Originaire du TOGO, dame G. vit le jour à Cotonou, la capitale économique du BENIN le 23 Août 1980. Elle y est restée pour grandir, se marier et pour mener son activité génératrice de revenu. Mère de 2 garçons tous scolarisés, elle veille scrupuleusement pour leur bonne éducation. Ces enfants sont tous à la charge de leurs parents. Les activités menées par cette bénéficiaire sont multiples. Il s'agit de la vente des chaussures, de la fabrication et la vente des oreillets. Elle sollicite un crédit pouvant lui permettre de faire un approvisionnement important. Dame G. désire faire un achat de 3 cartons de chaussures et du materiels pour la fabrication des oreillets. Cette bénéficiaire, qui a toujours un respect scrupuleux de l'échéancier de remboursement est à son 5ième crédit. 


La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé.
texts.en:
With roots in TOGO, Ms. G. was born on August 23, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN. There, she stayed to grow up, get married, and earn an income. She is the mother of two boys, both in school, and she oversees their education scrupulously. Both these children are supported by their parents.

This loan recipient’s business activities are many. They involve selling shoes and making and selling pillows. She is requesting a loan that will enable her to acquire important supplies. She would like to buy three boxes of shoes and the materials to make pillows. This loan recipient, who always has a scrupulous respect for making payments on time, is on her fifth loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three boxes (36-count each) of shoes and some material for making pillows

loans.name: Iyenda

texts.en: A. Iyenda is 65 years old and married with 7 children. He sells groundnut oil and he hopes to increase his sales. He is requesting for this loan to purchase more groundnut oil to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnut oil to sell

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Digna Mercedes G. C., tiene 36 años, vive en la Urb. La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, no termino sus estudios debido a que vino a vivir a Trujillo y se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene un hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Digna tiene una bodega, cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía verduras y papas, con las ganancias que obtuvo fue ampliando su negocio a la venta de abarrotes ahora tiene una bodega surtida,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Digna sueña con lograr que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Digna Mercedes G. C. is 36 years old and lives in the Trujillo district in La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the 4th year of secondary school, but she didn’t complete her studies because she moved to Trujillo and was more inclined to work. She has one son who depends on her entirely. Digna has a store, and when she started she only sold vegetables and potatoes. With the money she earned, she began expanding her business to selling other types of groceries and she now has a well-supplied store. Her business activities take place in her own home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Mujeres Decididas II” (“Decisive Women II”), she invested in the purchase of groceries to supply her store. With this loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. Digna dreams of helping her son become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store.  Digna dreams of helping her son become a professional.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: La sra. Vilma tiene una pulpería y vende comida desde hace ocho años, que inicio estas ventas para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos y poder ayudar a sus hijos que no les falte nada, son dos uno de 5 y 15 años de edad, estudian, doña Vilma tiene 32 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Jocote dulce, su esposo trabaja de asesor administrativo,  sus planes para su familia es apoyar a sus hijos que estudien para que sean jóvenes de bien ante la sociedad, sus metas es poder tener una venta amplia, y vender productos variados. Con los prestamos que esta haciendo en Afodenic ha podido incrementar su inventario esta es su segunda solicitud que va invertir en   comprar granos básicos, consumo diario y productos de limpieza. Lo cual espera sea de muchos beneficios para su negocio. A futuro espera remodelar el local de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma has a local store and sells food. She began these sales eight years ago to help her husband with the expenses and to be able to help her children never lack anything. The two children, who are five and fifteen years of age, study. Vilma is 32 years old and resides in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, which is called Jocote Dulce. Her husband works as an administrative advisor. Their plans for the family are to support their kids who are studying so that they can be good young people in their community. Their goals are to have lots of sales and sell various products. With the loans that she is getting from Afodenic, she has been able to increase her inventory. This is her second loan, with which she is going to buy basic grains, daily goods, and cleaning products, things which she thinks will benefit her business a lot. In the future, she hopes to remodel her local store.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and daily goods.

loans.name: Enma Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Enma Soledad C. S., tiene 33 años, vive en la Urb. Libertad, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo los estudios debido a que sus padres ya no quisieron enviarla al colegio, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Enma se dedica a la venta de quesos, roscas, manjar y salchipollo, al principio inicio vendiendo quesos, roscas y manjar de casa en casa, ahora tiene clientes que le compran, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro un carrito sanguchero con el que también vende salchipollo en las noches,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  quesos, roscas y manjar para la venta.
Con el crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de quesos, roscas y manjar.
Enma sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Enma Soledad C. S. is 33 years old, lives in Libertad of the district of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed primary school but she left school because her parents no longer wanted her to attend. She has 2 children, both of whom are financially dependent on her.

Enma sells cheeses, breads, caramels, french fries with fried chicken. In the beginning she started out selling cheeses, breads and caramels from door to door, but now she has a client base that buy from her. With her earnings she purchased a sandwhich cart that she now uses to sell french fries and fried chicken in the evenings. She runs her business from home.

With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the Community Bank "Mujeres Decididas II", she invested in the purchase of cheeses, breads and caramels for resale.

With the current loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of cheeses, breads and caramel. Enma dreams of having her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses, breads and caramel.

loans.name: Gladys Predesvinda

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Predesvinda S. D. A., tiene 51 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Curso estudios D. fisioterapia, carrera que no culmino debido a que se caso. Tiene 03 hijas que dependen enteramente D. ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños, se inicio en el negocio con la venta D. cerveza y ropa D. niños, luego en un restaurante que cerro debido a que se enfermo, ahora solo se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cerveza, el cual le da muchas ganancias, su negocio se desarrollo en su propia casa.
Con este primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. cerveza.
Con el crédito D. 750 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. cerveza y ropa D. niños.
Gladys sueña con tener una dulcería y un stand para venta D. ropa.
texts.en:
Gladys Predesvinda S. D. A. is 51 years old and lives in the Libertad neighborhood in Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She studied physical therapy for a while but had to quit her studies when she got married. She has three daughters who are dependent on her. She works selling children's clothing; she began her business selling beer and children's clothing and later started a restaurant that she had to close when she got sick. Now she only sells clothing and beer which gives her a good income; she developed her business out of her own home. With her first loan of $100 that she received from Cielo II (Heaven II) village bank, she invested in the purchase of beer. With this $250 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and children's clothing. Gladys dreams of one day running a candy store and putting up a stand where she can sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and children's clothing to sell; Gladys dreams of running a candy shop and putting up a stand where she can sell clothing

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Fidelia Onainor is 29 years old and married with one child.  She sells fried meat, drinks such as beer, and pepper soup. She is requesting this loan to purchase more meat, drinks, and pepper soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and meat to sell

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es: El joven Adrián tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Hialeah II etapa en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 6meses, ella venda productos de la Avon para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos,  el sr. Adrián se desempeña como auxiliar de bodega desde hace cuatro años, inicio como ayudante de bodega, y por sus buenas habilidades lo promovieron, pero el espera seguir mejorando para obtener un cargo donde pueda ganar bien para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Este es la octava solicitud de crédito en Afodenic que han sido de beneficios para su familia ya que ha mejorado la infraestructura de su humilde casa, con esta solicitud la quiere para  construir dos paredes de concreto para ir comenzando su casa en las mejores condiciones. Sus planes es tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Adrián is 28 years old and lives in Hialeah II in Managua, the capital. He and his wife have a six-month-old son. His wife sells Avon products to help with their expenses, and Adrián has worked as a warehouse assistant for four years. He began as a helper and was promoted because of his good skills, but he hopes to keep improving to obtain a post where he can earn enough to cover his household expenses. This is his eighth loan with Afodenic, which has benefited his family and improved the infrastructure of his humble home. With this loan, he will construct two concrete walls to continue improving the condition of his house. His plan is to have a worthy home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make two concrete walls

loans.name: Jesús Angelita

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Angelita V. C., tiene 34 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo los estudios porque se inclino mas por el negocio y porque se vino a vivir a Trujillo, tiene 02 hijas que dependen enteramente de ella.
Jesús se dedica a la venta de cerveza y productos de belleza, al principio empezó su negocio vendiendo pan y raspadilla en verano, luego con sus ganancias se inicio en la venta de productos de belleza, roscas, manjar, y cerveza, negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su propia casa y que le da muchas ganancias. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  quesos, roscas y manjar.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, productos de belleza e insumos para la venta de raspadilla.
Jesús sueña con construir su casa y tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus Angelita V. C. is 34 years old and lives in the Rinconada neighborhood in Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She was able to complete her studies through elementary school but left them because she was more inclined to working and because she came to live in Trujillo. She has two children who are dependent on her. Jesus works selling beer and beauty products; in the beginning she started her business selling bread and snow-cones during the summer. Later, with her income she began selling beauty products, small ring-cakes, caramel, and beer; she has developed the business out of her own home and it provides her with a good income. With her first loan of $100 which she received from Mujeres Decididas II (Decisive Women II) village bank, she invested in the purchase of cheeses, ring-cakes and caramel. With this $475 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer, beauty products and ingredients for the sale of snow-cones. Jesus dreams of building a home and having a small store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, beauty products, and ingredients for snow-cone sales; Jesus dreams of building a home and having her own store

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo O. is 37 years old and married without a child. Taiwo sells kerosene in liters to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell and increase her business. She says, "Thanks!" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Maria Valeria

texts.es: Maria Valeria es una mujer de 54 años, tiene 9 hijos, y ya todos son mayores de edad y ya no viven con ella.   Tiene 15 años de vender maíz y fríjol en el mercado de su localidad.  Vende por pequeñas cantidades su producto y también por volúmenes mayores.  Su esposo le ayuda en su negocio.  Los días de mas venta son los días jueves y domingo, se les llama “días de mercado”, los cuales ella aprovecha mucho.  Los demás días de la semana ella esta en su casa, y allí se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.  Ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y fríjol por cantidades grandes, así logra un mejor precio para la venta.  Su deseo es mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos y no depender de otras personas para poder vivir.
texts.en:
Maria Valeria is 54 years old and has 9 children, all of whom are adults and no longer live with her. For the past 15 years, she has sold corn and beans in her neighborhood market. She sells her product in both small and large quantities. Her husband helps her in her business. The days she is able to sell the most are Thursdays and Sundays, which are called "market days," and she takes advantage of these days. The other days of the week, she stays in her home and makes hand-woven fabrics. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and beans in large quantities in order to be able to sell at a better price. Her goal is to improve her business and her income so she doesn't have to depend on others for her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business selling corn and beans

loans.name: Juanita Yoana

texts.es:
La señora Juanita Yoana C. B., tiene 24 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que salio embarazada, tiene 02 hijos que  dependen de ella económicamente.
Se dedica a la venta de quesos, roscas, manjar, se inicio en el negocio hace poco tiempo, al principio fue muy difícil para ella, pero ahora tiene muchos clientes y ganancias, su  negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Juanita es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de quesos, roscas y manjar para la venta.
Ella sueña con tener su casa propia.
Ella pertenece al  vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Juanita Yoana C. B. is 24 years old and she lives in La Rinconada within the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed grade 9, but left school because she was pregnant. She has 2 children that are her dependents.

She sells cheeses, breads, and caramel. She started her business a short while ago, and at the beginning it was very diffcult forher. But now she has many clients and good earnings. She runs her business from her home.<./p>

Juanita is a member of the Community bank "Mujeres Decididas II". With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of cheeses, breads, and caramel for resale.

She dreams of having her own home.

She is part of a Peruvian government’s program called “Glass of Milk” where she receives a daily basket of basic food products to feed her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses, breads, and caramel for resale.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 35 years old and married with four children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, and yams. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Luisa Lesvia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa Lesvia M. J. vive en el Municipio de Nejapa. Tiene  15 años de experiencia en la confección de  prendas de vestir y  ocho años de poseer su  propio negocio en el oficio de la costura a mano, lo que le de un toque de calidad y perfeccionismo a cada pieza que elabora con mucha dedicación. 

Sin embargo  doña Luisa desea   prosperar su negocio, elaborando más ropa  e incrementando de esta forma  sus ganancias.  Razón por la que ha solicitado a integral un préstamo que   desea invertir en capital de trabajo, lo que le permitirá  adquirir variedad de telas y colores que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa Lesvia Martinez J. lives in the municipality of Nejapa. She has 15 years' experience in fashioning articles of clothing and for the past 8 years she has had her own business in hand-made clothing, giving her articles a touch of quality and perfectionism to each and every piece she makes with special attention.

But Luisa wishes to make her business grow, making more clothing and therefore increasing this way her earnings. This is the reason why she has requested a loan which she wishes to invest as working capital, permitting her to acquire a variety of fabrics and different colors that her clients have requested.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to fashion clothing.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị B. năm nay 46 tuổi, chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua xe ngựa để chồng đi chở hàng thuê. Đến năm 2004, gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để thu mua phế liệu và giặt bao bì bán. Đây cũng là  những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm máy giặt bao bì nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi B. is 46 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1999. Initially she borrowed money to invest in livestock and bought a horse-drawn carriage for her husband to do transportation service. In 2004, her family invested money in buying scrap materials and washing packaging bags to resell. These businesses bring the main source of income of her family with an income of VND5,000,000 per month. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy packaging bag washing machine to get extra income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packaging bag washing machine

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Julia Isabel A. O., tiene 48 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 1ro de secundaria, dejo de estudiar porque se dedico a trabajar, tiene 02 hijos que no dependen de ella económicamente.
Tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo solamente útiles escolares, con las ganancias que obtuvo amplio su negocio a la venta de abarrotes, que con el tiempo se convirtió en bodega, su  negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Julia es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para campaña escolar.
Julia sueña con tener una pollería en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Julia Isable A. O. is 48 years old and she lives in La Rinconada within the district of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed a grade 7 education, but she quit school because she started working. She has 2 children that are no longer dependent on her.

She runs a supply store, and she starting out by selling school supplies. With the earnings she expanded her store to include groceries, and with time she converted to a wholesale business. She runs her business from her own home.

Julia is a new member of the Community Bank "Mujeres Decididas II". With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of school supplies for a school campaign.

Julia dreams of having a rotisserie business run from her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for a school campaign.

loans.name: Khong Thi
