texts.vi: Chị Khổng Thị Duyên năm nay 52 tuổi. Chị Duyên  đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ hưu trí và 3 con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Sóc Sơn - Hà nội. Năm 2006 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện nay với việc chăn nuôi 15 con lợn và sự hỗ trợ của các con hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khong Thi D. is 52 years old. Mrs. D. lives with her husband who is a pensioner and 3 grown-up children in Soc Son District, Hanoi. In 2006, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to raise pigs. Currently, by raising 15 pigs and financial support of her children, the income of her family reaches VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND12,000,000 to buy foods for the pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying foods for pigs

loans.name: Katia Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Katia Cecilia A. A., tiene 19 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que salio embarazada, tiene 01 pequeño hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Se dedica a la venta de ceviche y combinado conjuntamente con su mamá , al principio ayudaba a su mamá, con el tiempo se hizo de un pequeño capital y ahora es socia de su mamá, su negocio lo desarrolla en la Av. Unión 1934..
Katia es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad que requiere  para su negocio.
Ella sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Katia Cecilia A. A. is 19 years old and lives in La Rinconada in the district of Trujillo, of the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed a grade 10 education, but she quit school because she became pregnant. She has a little boy that completely depends on her.

She sells marinated seafood together with her mother. At first she only helped out her mother, but with time she saved herself a small capital and now she partner with her mother. Their business is run from 1934 Union Avenue.

Katia is a new member of the Community Bank "Mujeres Decididas II". With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of products of primary need for her business.

She dreams of having her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products of primary need for her business.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hán năm nay 51  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con trong đó có một con đã đi làm. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Năm 2001 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng ăn . Đến nay sau 8 năm công việc chăn nuôi , kinh doanh của gia đình chị phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thêm một số loại đồ uống giải khát phục vụ nhu cầu của khách hàng và mua thêm thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 51 years old. She is living with her husband and 2 children - one of the children is employed. Before joining TYM Fund, the main source of income of her family were from raising livestock and farming. In 2001, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to open a restaurant. After 8 years, livestock raising and restaurant business have been going well and bring an income of VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wished to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy more beverages to sell to customers, and to buy more foods for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages to sell, buy foods for livestock

loans.name: Ayandeji

texts.en: Ayandeji O. is 35 years old and married with two children. He sells building materials. The demands for his building materials are high and he hopes to meet the demands for his goods. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Hằng năm nay 32  tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn -Hà nội. Năm 2008 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiện nay bên cạnh nguồn thu nhập từ buôn bán thịt lợn, gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc làm thợ lắp đặt điện nước của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng đầu tư thêm vốn buôn bán thịt lợn, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thêm thiết bị phục vụ cho công việc lắp đặt điện nước của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ta Thi H. is 32 years old. She is living with her husband and two small children in Soc Son District, Hanoi. In 2008, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to buy and resell pork. Currently, in addition to income from pork trading, her family also receive income from electrical/water installation work of her husband. With an income of VND3,000,000 per month, the condition of living of her family has been improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000. She will use part of the loan to buy more pork to sell, and the remaining part to buy tools and equipment for the electrical/installation work of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pork to sell, buy tools for electrical/water installation

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 55 años de edad, reside en un bario en la capital de Managua que se llama Mirna Ugarte, junto a su familia, sus niñas cursan la secundaria, durante estos años ha laborado en diferentes expresas como fontanero, de mensajero lo cual han sido de mucha experiencia en su vida personal, en estos momentos se desempeña en vigilante tiene diez años pero sus ingresos son bajos es por eso espera encontrar un trabajo mejor para tener mejores beneficios, con esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo del porche de su casa que esta en mal estado y desea en este invierno poder tener su casa en buen estado para gozar junto con su familia los logros.
texts.en:
Juan is 55 years old and lives in a Managua neighborhood called Mirna Ugarte with his family. His daughters attend secondary school. In recent years, he has worked as a plumber and messenger, which has been a great experience in his personal life. He has worked as a guard for ten years, but his income is low, so he is seeking a better job that will bring better benefits. He will invest this loan in construction materials to repair the porch roof on his house which is in poor condition. He hopes to have his house in good condition this winter to enjoy his achievements with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair porch roof

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Tuyết năm nay 41 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con trong đoa có 1 con đang đi học. Chị Tuyết tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi cả hai vợ chồng chị đều  tham gia buôn bán thịt bê và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Tuyết is 41 years old. She has two children, one of whom is now in school. Mrs. Tuyết has participated in the TYM Fund since 1997. Currently, in addition to raising animals, both she and her husband work selling veal. This is their main source of income, earning them about 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (875 USD) to invest in the family’s business selling veal.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Veal business

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo se compone de cuatro integrantes quienes residen en la aldea de Lajero Blanco. María de la Paz Hernández es una señora trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como: jeans, camisas, blusas, ropa de cama y ropa interior de ambos sexos, la cual vende en la comunidad donde vive, tiene un puesto ubicado en la casa de habitación, ahora también vende en excosur es una empacadora de melón. espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, con esta actividad a podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos, dos de ellas estudian y en sus tiempos libres ayudan a su mama en el negocio, el esposo trabaja como albañil en diferentes lugares de la aldea. Ana Isabel Álvarez es una mujer joven, casada, ella y su esposo tienen una hija de seis años. Ana vende golosinas como:enchiladas,tacos,pastelitos y tajaditas de plátano, vende en el mismo lugar donde vive, ella  a podido crecer en su negocio, sus ventas han mejorado, sale todas las tardes a vender sus golosinas recorre toda la aldea en donde termina de vender todo el producto. las verduras como: tomates, cebollas, chiles y repollo los compra a carros que pasan por la aldea, los condimentos y otras cosas las compra en la pulpería del mismo lugar. Espera seguir creciendo en su negocio. María Luisa Madariaga se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace cuatro años  antes vendía su producto solo en el  lugar donde vive, ahora su negocio ha crecido, ahora vende también en excosur y promangle, esta actividad le a generado ingresos con los cuales a ayudado a su esposo con los gastos de la vivienda, es madre de tres hijos, una está en la escuela en cuarto grado los demás están pequeños, los cuales deja con su mama cuando sale a vender, el esposo se dedica a la soldadura, por el tipo de trabajo que él tiene pasa muy poco en el hogar. Etelvina Sarai se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace cinco años ella viaja a la ciudad de Choluteca cada quince días donde compra ropa de niño, dama y hombre, ella sale todos los días a vender también vende en excosur antes solo vendía en la aldea donde vive ahora viaja a excosur por que su negocio a crecido, esto le a permitido vivir mejor y colaborar más en su hogar, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura tienen un hijo .
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four members who live in the Lajero Blanco village. María de la Paz Hernández is a working woman who sells new clothing, such as jeans, shirts, blouses, bedclothes, and underwear. She sells her merchandise in the community where she lives and has a stand set up in her house. Currently, she also sells her goods at a melon packing company called Excosur. She hopes to continue growing her business, since it has allowed her to help her husband improve the livelihood of their children. She has two girls who are currently in school and they help their mother with her business in their free time. Her husband is a construction worker who works at various locations in the village. Ana Isabel Álvarez is a young, married woman with a 6 year old girl. Ana sells snacks such as enchiladas, tacos, small cakes, and banana chips. She sells her goods out of the her house and her business and sales have grown to the point that she spends every afternoon selling her snacks. The entire village comes to buy and she runs out of all of her products. She wants to purchase vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, chilis, and cabbage from the sellers in cars that pass through the village. Also, she wants to buy condiments and other goods that she can buy from the local store. With these, she hopes to continue growing her business. María Luisa Madariaga has been selling food and snacks for 4 years. Previously, she sold her products exclusively out of her home, but since her business has grown, she now also sells in Excosur and Promangle. This has generated income that has helped her husband with the household expenses. She is the mother of three children, one is in 4th grade and the others are not yet old enough for school. She leaves her children with her mother when she leaves to go sell her goods. Her husband is a welder and is not able to spend very much time at home. Etelvina Sarai has been selling new clothing for 4 years. She travels to the city of Choluteca every 15 days to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing. She leaves the house every day to sell her clothes in Excosur. Previously, she only sold in the village where she lives, but now she travels to Excosur because her business has grown. This has allowed her to live better and contribute more to the household. Her husband works in the agriculture industry and they have one child.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new men's, women's, and children's clothing, underwear, dishes, glasses, condiments, vegetables, meats, dairy products, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Dieu

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Diệu Quyên  năm nay 31 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con còn nhỏ. Chị Quyên tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Chị hiện đang làm kế toán  còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe. Ngoài ra gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị Quyên đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Diệu Quyên, 31 years old, has two young children. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. She currently works as a bookkeeper, and her husband is a driver. She and her family also raise pigs to earn some additional income. With their income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month, Mrs. Quyên’s family is now able to gradually improve their standard of living. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more pigs and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị A.  năm nay 32 tuổi. Chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị hiện đang sống cùng 1 con còn nhỏ. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003.Trước khi tham gia Quỹ chị A. buôn bán quần áo trẻ em tại nhà. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị A. đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ dùng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị A., 32 years old, lives with her one young child. Unfortunately, her husband passed away at A. early age. Mrs. A. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Before becoming a member of the Fund, she sold children’s clothing from her home. When she joined the Fund, Mrs. A. opened a business selling breakfast, and now this has become her main source of income. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (350 USD) to buy supplies and equipment for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and clothes in a shop. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca C. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tambien vende cosmeticos en sus ratos libres cuando termina la produccion de tortillas, ella es viuda, ella tiene varios años de hacer esta actividad para poder sostener su familia y hogar, ella quiere lo mejor para sus hijos y quiere darles un buena educacion ya que la educacion para los niños es muy importante. ella vive en la colonia Bertilia desde hace varios años. ella es una persona honrrada, honesta y puntual con todos sus compromisos, en estos momentos ella necesita sacar adelante su negocio por tal razon esta solicitando un credito.
texts.en:
La senora Francisca C. produces and sells tortillas, and also sells cosmetics in her spare moments, when she finished making tortillas. She is a widow, and has been doing this activity for various years so she can maintain her family and home. She wants the best for her children and wants to give them a good education, as children's education is very important. She has lived in the district of Bertilia for several years. She is an honourable person, honest and punctual with all her obligations, and in this moment she needs to drive forward her business - for this reason, she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients and cosmetics

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Bắc năm nay 37 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn nái và  tiền công làm thợ xây của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Bắc đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Bắc, 37 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising sows and the wages her husband earns as a construction worker. With a monthly income of 3,000,000 VND (178 USD), the lives of Mrs. Bắc and her family are steadily improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sows

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is 40 years old and married with four children. Esther sells foodstuffs like fish, garri, rice, and plantain. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Dayra Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Dayra es una mujer que a sus 48 años de edad, se ha esforzado para dar lo mejor a sus hijos los cuales han salido adelante, reside en memorial sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo es jefe de almacén en una empresa privada. El trabajo de la Sra.: Dayra es la especialidad en la cocina del ejército de Nicaragua pues lleva ya muchos años laborando en la institución, anteriormente estaba en el área de lavandería. Con la solicitud de crédito en Afodenic es para hacer mejoras a su casa ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para repellar  la sala y los cuartos de su casa. Gracias al apoyo que Afodenic ha otorgado mediante sus créditos esta haciendo realidad sus metas de tener una casa digna para su familia. Sus planes personales es poder tener un mejor ingreso que le permita seguir haciendo las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dayra is a woman who, at 48 years of age, has striven to give the best to her children who have now moved ahead. She lives in Memorial Sandino in the capital of Managua. Her husband is the manager of a storehouse for a private company. Dayra works as a cook for the Nicaraguan military, and has done so for many years. Previously, she worked as a launderer. This loan is for home improvements--she wishes to buy construction materials to plaster the living room and bedrooms. Thanks to the support of Afodenic credit, she is realizing her goal of providing a worthy home for her family. Her personal plan is to obtain a better wage, which will allow her to continue making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to plaster the house walls

loans.name: Kely Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Kely Azucena S. C., tiene 33 años, vive en  el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Antropología,  carrera que no culmino debido a que salio embarazada muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse a su hijo, tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Kely se dedica a la venta de ropa, se inicio vendiendo productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo formo un capital que le permitió ingresar a la venta de ropa, negocio que le da muchas ganancias y que actualmente desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  ropa para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para campaña de verano.
Kely sueña con ejercer su profesión y tener un stand de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Kely Azucena S. C. is 33 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied anthropology, but never started her career as she became pregnant very young and had to dedicate herself to her son, who is 2 years old and depends entirely on her. Kely sells clothes, and has begun selling beauty products. With the earnings she obtained she created capital that permitted her to begin selling clothes, a business that gives her great earnings and that she undertakes in her own house. With her first loan of 300 soles from her Communal Bank 'Mujeres Decididas II ('Determined Women II') she invested it in buying clothes for her business. With this loan of 1400 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest it in buying clothes for summer. Kely dreams of working in her profession and having a clothing stand to sell her clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer clothes

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness E. is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and to sell.

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo O. is a 48-year-old married woman with 5 children.  To earn a living, Ayo makes local soap and resells such soap for a profit.  Fortunately, there is a great deal of demand for her soap in her community.  She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more raw materials in order to make more soap for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by purchasing additional raw materials for her soap-making business

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh Thị Hợi năm nay 50tuổi,  gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi hai vợ chồng chị đều đang  kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Đây cũng là công việc đem  lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm thực phẩm phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Hợi, 50 years old, has three children, of whom two are still in school. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, in addition to raising animals, both she and her husband work at their breakfast-selling business, which is their main source of income, earning them about 3,000,000 VND (178 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy supplies for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breakfast restaurant

loans.name: Gbemileke

texts.en: Gbemileke O. is a 35-year-old married man with 2 children.  Gbemileke owns and operates a shop where he sells spare motor parts.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more motor parts for resale purposes.  He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Maximina C. H., tiene 73 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no estudio debido a que sus padres no la enviaron a la escuela, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y panca durante casi 25 años, al principio empezó vendiendo pan y alfalfa poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientela y amplio su negocio con la venta de panca, negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de alfalfa y panca para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alfalfa y panca.
Maria sueña con tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. 
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Maria Maximina C. H. is 73 years old and lives in La Rinconada, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, in Perú. She didn't study, owing to the fact that her parents didn't send her to school. She has 5 children, none of whom depend on her. Maria has been selling alfalfa and chilies for 25 years. At the beginning she started selling bread and alfalfa, and little by little began getting clients. She expanded her business with the sale of panca chili, a business which until now she has operated from her own house. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her communal bank, 'Mujeres Decididas II' (Determined Women II), she invested it in buying alfalfa and panca chillies for her business. With this loan of 800 soles, which she will pay back within 4 months, she will invest it in buying alfalfa and panca chillies. Maria dreams of having a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alfalfa and chillies to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia O.  F. de 41 años de edad vive en el Municipio de Apopa en San Salvador. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pupusas, una de las comidas típicas  de mayor demanda en El Salvador  tanto por su sabor y  por su precio accesible. Además elabora tortilla para los tres tiempos de comida. 

Doña Alicia desea  aumentar el número de  clientes, por lo que ha solicitado a integral un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas e insumos necesarios para mejorar la atención  que actualmente ofrece a sus clientes en su negocio ubicado en el mercado de la colonia Santa Lucia.   Y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar el nivel de vida de su grupo familiar integrado por cuatro personas.  Cabe mencionar que  doña Alicia cuenta con experiencia y buen record  crediticio.
texts.en:
Alicia O. F. is 41 years old and lives in the Apopa municipality of San Salvador. For seven years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of “pupusas” which is a typical food of El Salvador. This dish is in great demand because it is flavorful and reasonably priced. In addition, she makes tortillas for any meal of the day. Alicia wants to increase her customer base, for which she has turned to Integral for a loan to buy seats, tables, and the necessary supplies to improve her service. She currently tends to customers at her business located in the Santa Lucia market. In this way, she will be able to increase her earnings and improve the standard of living of her family, comprised of four members. It is worth mentioning that Alicia is experienced and has a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and ingredients for her food preparation business.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 44 tuổi,  Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại huyện Quảng Xương - Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại hàng tháng nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị  là từ việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H., 44 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals, weaving straw mats, and the wages her husband earns as a construction worker. Their total income is 2,500,000 VND (146 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny E. D. G., tiene 50 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Curso hasta 5to D. primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 03 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. menú, inicio su negocio vendiendo verduras en un mercado donD. estuvo durante 25 años hasta que la botaron por ser ambulante, también con la venta D. animales menores, el mismo que abandono cuando sufrió el robo D. todos sus animales., con las ganancias que obtuvo opto por dedicarse a la venta D. menú, negocio que si le deja ganancias y desarrolla en su propio domicilio
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra animales menores para la venta.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra alimentos D. primera necesidad para su negocio D. menú.
Marleny sueña con tener un restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Marleny E. D. G. is 50 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to the 5th year of primary school, but did not continue as she was more inclined to work. She has five children, three of whom still depend on her financially. She dedicates herself to selling prepared foods, having started her business selling vegetables at a market until she was asked to leave after 25 years there. She also sold small livestock, an activity she stopped after all her animals were stolen. With her earnings, she opted to dedicate herself instead to food sales. This business, which she runs out of her home, does proviD. her with an income. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Cielo II”, she invested in the purchase of young animals to sell. With this loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for her business. Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food preparation business.  Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her house.

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Doãn Thị Nhạn năm nay 56 tuổi.  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà, chồng chị làm bảo vệ tại Hà Nội. Cùng với sự hỗ trợ cúa các con đã đi làm hàng tháng thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và sửa sang chuồng tại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doãn Thị Nhạn, 56 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she works at home raising pigs, and her husband works as a security guard in Hà Nội. With some additional support from their grown children, their monthly income is about 5,000,000 VND (288 USD). In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to buy more pigs and to repair her pigpen.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Dụng năm nay 41 tuổi,  Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại huyện Quảng Xương - Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại hàng tháng nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị  là từ việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phụcvụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Dụng is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quảng Xương district in Thanh Hóa province. Mrs. Lê has been participating in TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, the main source of her family's monthly income is from rearing livestock, weaving mats, and her husband's construction worker salary - totally 2,500,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND to invest in purchasing more raw materials for their mat weaving business to improve the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw Materials for Weaving Mats

loans.name: Suyapa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Los salvadoreños a lo largo y ancho del mundo se  han caracterizado  por ser hombres y mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La señora Suyapa Guadalupe G. es un claro ejemplo de ello a sus 24 años cuenta con  tres puestos en el mercado de San Vicente; logros obtenidos a través de sacrificios y esfuerzos.  Su sueño es renovar los productos de su negocio y contar con mercadería variada  que  a atraiga nuevos clientes. 

Actualmente  esta solicitando a  integral  su tercer crédito para lograr comprar más insumos para sus  puestos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Además  en los créditos anteriores Suyapa  ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Salvadorian people have characterized themselves as extremely hard-working and enterprising men and women throughout the world. Suyapa Guadalupe G. is a clear example of this, having three stalls at the San Vicente market at only 24 years of age. She has managed her accomplishments through much sacrifice and effort. Her dream is to update the products she carries so she has a variety of items to attract new customers. Currently, she is requesting her third loan through Integral to purchase more supplies and improve her income. In addition, Suyapa has demonstrated she is responsible about her payments in previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Nancy Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Nelly S. C., tiene 34 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Curso hasta 2do de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que salio embarazado y se caso, tiene 03 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche, combinados, se inicio vendiendo menú, roscas, quesos, manjar en su domicilio, en la actualidad solo se dedica a la venta de ceviche,  combinado, roscas, queso y manjar blanco; su negocio lo desarrolla en la casa de su suegra.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de roscas, quesos, manjar y alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de roscas, quesos, manjar y  alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
Nancy sueña con tener un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nancy Nelly S. C. is 34 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied until her second year of high school but left her studies because she got pregnant and got married. She has three children who depend on her. She sells ceviche (citrus-marinaded fish), combo-meals, she started by selling set meals, bread rolls, cheese and blancmange. Her business is located in her mother-in-law's home. She used her first loan of 300 soles which she received from her community bank, "Cielo II", to buy buns, cheese, blancmange and staple foods for her business. She is asking for a 1,500 soles loan to be repaid over six months to buy buns, cheese, blancmange and staple foods for her business. Nancy dreams of having her own restaurant in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buns, cheese, blancmange and basic foods for her business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel A. is a 35-year-old married man with three children.  To earn a living, he sells spare motor parts.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more motor parts for resale purposes.  He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional spare motor parts

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Xuân năm nay 44 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại hàng tháng nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị  là từ việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu, lương thợ xây của chồng  và sự hỗ trợ của hai con với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phụcvụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Xuân is 44 years old. She has been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, she has a monthly income of 4,000,000 VND from raising livestock, weaving mats, her husband's salary as a construction worker and the support of their two children. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 7,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to support her mat weaving business and further improve the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Nancy Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Zoila A. M., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Curso hasta 2do de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 03 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de roscas, quesos, manjar y productos naturales, inicio su negocio vendiendo fruta en un triciclo y productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo se inicio en la venta de roscas, quesos, manjar blanco y productos naturales, negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de roscas, quesos, manjar y productos naturales.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de roscas, quesos, manjar y productos naturales.
Nancy tiene el sueño de construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Nancy Zoila A. M. is 32 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied until the second year of high school then left because she was more interested in working. She has three children who depend on her financially. She sells buns, cheese, blancmange and natural products. She started her business selling fruit from a tricycle as well as beauty products. With the profits she made she began selling buns, cheese, blancmange and natural products, a business she can conduct from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles which she received from her community bank, "Cielo II", she invested in buns, cheese, blancmange and natural products. With this loan of 800 soles which she will repay over six months, she will buy buns, cheese, blancmange and natural products. Nancy dreams of building a home. She is a member of the "Vaso de Leche" municipal programme [which provides milk, milk substitutes, cereals and so on to low-income households].

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buns, cheese, blancmange and natural products

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Vân  năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào công việc dệt chiếu và xưởng mộc của chồng. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm gỗ phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất đồ mộc của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Vân is 45 years old. She has three children - two of which have grown up. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed funds to invest in the business of weaving mats and into her husband's woodwork shop. Right now it is also the business that is the family's main source of income in the amount of 3,000,000 VND per month. This upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VNd to buy more wood for her family's woodworking business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is 35 years old and married with four children. He sells beef in small quantities to consumers.

Michael is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 naira to purchase more beef to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Bình  năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại Thanh Hóa.  Chị Bình tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại chị  đang làm may tại xưởng may công nghiệp còn chồng chị buôn bán hàng rong và nuôi cá giống tại nhà. Với mức thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Thời gian tới gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch đầu tư mua máy khoan cắt bê tông để phụcvụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương  vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ.
texts.en:
Ms. Hoàng Thị Bình is 26 years old. She lives in Thanh Hoa with her husband and young child. Ms. Bình joined TYM Fund in 2005. She is currently working as a seamstress at a sewing factory, while her husband raises fish and peddles miscellaneous goods. With a monthly income of 3,500,000 VND, her family's life continues to improve each day. In the near future, because her family plans to invest in a cement cutter to meet the demands of the local community she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machinery construction activities

loans.name: Patricia Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Lourdes C. R.,  tiene 30 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo en Sullana durante 1 año, carrera que no ejerció porque se vino a vivir a Trujillo, tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina, se inicio en el negocio vendiendo productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo empezó la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina, el mismo que le da mas ganancias, su  negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Patricia es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de algarrobina y miel de abeja para la venta.
Patricia sueña tener una distribuidora de miel de abeja y algarrobina
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche se su sector.
texts.en:
Patricia Lourdes C. R. is 30 years old and lives in La Rinconada, in the district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied to be an executive assistant in Sullana for a year, a career she never pursued as she came to live in Trujillo. She has two small children who are completely dependent upon her. She sells honey and syrup of algarrobo (algarrobo is a tree). She started her business by selling beauty products. With the profits she made, she began selling honey and syrup of algarrobo which she can make higher profits from. She runs her business from her home. Patricia is a new member of the community bank "Mujeres Decididas II". With this 300 soles loan which she will repay over four months, she will buy syrup of algarrobo and honey for resale. Patricia dreams of being a distributor of honey and syrup of algarrobo. She is a member of her local "Vaso de Leche" programme, a programme to distribute milk, milk products, cereals and so on to low-income households.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy syrup of algarrobo and honey for resale

loans.name: Jamiu

texts.en:
Jamiu is 33 years old and married with two children. He sells rechargeable phone cards and he also rents CDs to his customers.

Jamiu is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương năm nay 46 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại  cả gia đình chị đều làm công việc dệt chiếu và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hương is 46 years old. She has three grown children. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed funds to invest in the family's mat weaving business. Right now, her entire family works in the mat weaving business and it is also their main source of income providing 3,000,000 VND per month. For this upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to further the her family's weaving business and improve their income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to weave mats

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses A. is 42 years old and married with five children. He sells beef in large quantities to his consumers.

Moses is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more beef to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia M. C., tiene 27 años, vive en la Urb. Rázuri, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella es profesora de Educación Inicial, carrera que ejerció durante varios años y que tuvo que abandonar por dedicarse al cuidado de sus 02 pequeñas hijas que dependen enteramente de ella.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa, se inicio vendiendo productos de belleza, con las ganancias que obtuvo formo un capital que le permitió ingresar a la venta de ropa, negocio que le da muchas ganancias y que actualmente desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  ropa para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
Rosa sueña con tener su casa propia y tener un negocio de ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia M. C. is 27 years old and lives in the Rázuri residential zone of the district and province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She is trained as an early education teacher and worked in this field for a number of years, however she had to stop working as a teacher in order to care for her two young daughters who depend entirely on her. Rosa now works selling clothing. She started out selling beauty products, and with her earnings she saved enough capital to be able to start selling clothes. This business brings in a lot of income, and she currently runs the business from her own home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the “Mujeres Decididas II” (Determined Women II) Community Bank she invested in more clothing for her business. With this loan of 300 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will again invest in more clothing for her business. Rosa dreams of owning her own home and clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell in her business

loans.name: Ester Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Ester tiene la edad de 60 años, desde muy joven ha trabajado en las ventas, vende refresco, alquila sillas, y vende comida, todo que sea un buen ingreso para su bolsillo, empezó solo vendiendo repostería con ahorros propio, sus hijos son independiente, reside en  el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, con este solicitud de crédito es la sexta que va invertir en comprar dos puertas para la sala ya que las que tiene están en mal estado, también  va a comprar una maya y poner en el cerco para repararlo mejor y estar segura. Con este crédito en Afodenic se ha beneficiado ya que ha logrado hacer las mejoras  a su casa. Sus planes es incrementar el volumen de venta para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ester is 60 years old, since she was young she has worked in sales, she sells drinks, rents chairs and sells food, all of which is a good income for her pocket. She started selling with her own savings, her children are independent, and she lives in the 380 neighborhood in the city of Managua, with this credit request it is the sixth which she will invest in buying two doors for her living room now that the ones she has are in bad condition, she is also going to buy a and put it close to repair it better and be safe. With this loan in Afodenic she has benefited since she has been able to improve her house. Her plan is to increase the volume of sales to have better incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two doors

loans.name: Phamthi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Chuông  năm nay 52 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh chănn nuôi hiện nay gia đình Chuông còn dệt chiếu và làm nghề đan thủ công. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của con trai làm công nhân xăng dầu với tổng thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng. Thời gian tới gia đình chị có dự định đầu tư vốn để mua xe và kinh doanh dịch vụ chở hàng thuê vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ
texts.en:
Ms. Phạm Thị Chuông is 52 years old. She has three grown children. In 2004, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed capital to rear livestock. Her family also weaves mats and rattan handicraft to supplement the livestock rearing. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND from these activities plus the additional support from a son that works in the petroleum fuels (gasoline and oil) industry. In the near future, she and her family have plans to invest in a car and a car rental business. Therefore, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car and invest in car rental business.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Tĩnh năm nay 29 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho việc buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiện nay hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua lợn thịt về giết mổ còn chị cung cấp thịt lợn cho bà con địa phương tại chợ . Công việc kinh doanh buôn bán phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Tinh is 29 yrs old. Her family has 2 young children. In 2006 she joined TYM fund and borrowed a loan to invest in a pork-selling business. Currently, her husband would purchase the pigs to slaughter daily, and she would then sell the meat to the community at the market. The business is profitable bringing in 233 USD per month for her family. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to continue investment in the pork-selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Rosa Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Bertha V. P., tiene 42 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 5to de primaria, dejo los estudios porque se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 04 hijos de los cuales solo 01 depende de ella económicamente.
Rosa tiene un Internet, se inicio en el negocio vendiendo pan, con las ganancias que obtuvo empezó a vender ropa y luego amplio su negocio instalando un Internet, el cual le da muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en un local que ella alquila.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y mantenimiento de sus computadoras.
Rosa sueña con tener su casa propia y un carro.
texts.en:
Rosa Bertha V. P. is 42 years old and lives in the La Rinconada residential zone of the district and province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed the fifth year of primary school before leaving her studies because she was more inclined to work. She has four children, although only one is still economically dependent on her. Rosa runs an internet business. She started out selling bread, and with her earnings she was able to start selling clothing, and later expand her business by installing an internet service. This business brings in a lot of income, and she runs it from a rented storefront. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the “Mujeres Decididas II” (Determined Women II) Community Bank she bought clothing for her business. With this loan of 2500 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in more clothing and the maintenance of her computers. Rosa dreams of owning her own home and car.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise and maintain her computers

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike O. is 26 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a commercial driver. Nike is a fashion designer and she makes lovely styles for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials.

Nike plans to expand her business and so she is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ngoan

texts.vi:
Chị Nguy ễn Th ị Ngoan   năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu nhưng sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để mở cửa hàng kinh doanh tạp hóa. Hiện nay chị là chủ một cửa hàng tạp hóa nhỏ tại địa phương. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị đang ngày càng có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua thêm hàng hóa và mở rộng quy mô kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Ngoan is 32 yrs old. She joined TYM fund since 2004. At the beginning, she borrowed money to invest in the business of weaving sedge mats, but later she borrowed additional money and invested in a grocery store. Currently she is the owner of a small grocery store in the region. With income of 175 USD per month, her family has the ability to improve their standard of living and invest in the children's education. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional merchandise and expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Loc

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Lọc năm nay 38 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đang tuổi đến trường. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề say sát lúa. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho  gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Loc is 38 yrs old. Her family has 2 children of school age. She joined TYM fund in 2004. Currently she raises pigs at home while her husband works in the rice-making business. These are the main sources of income for her family averaging 117 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to purchase additional pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Rafatu

texts.en: Rafatu Y. is 50 years old and married with five children. Rafatu has a shop where she sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El joven Henry tiene 23 años de edad, reside en Hilaleah  en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2, y 4 años de edad, ella es ama de casa ya que todavía sus niños están pequeño para irse a atrabajar pero sus planes es ayudar a su esposo económicamente ya que todo esta caro, Henry se desempeña de electricista desde hace dos años, el cual inicio como conductor, y espera seguir superando ya que sus metas es poder seguir estudiando para poder dar mejor nivel de vida a su familia esta solicitud de crédito la quiere para invertir en materiales de construcción para hacer la cocina de su casa para estar un poco con mas espacio. Para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros. Le da gracias a Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado para poder terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Henry is 23 years old, and lives in Hilaleah in the capital of Managua, his wife has two children, 2 and 4 years old,a nd she is a housewife since their children are still young to go to work, but her plan is to help her husband economically now that everything is expensive. Henry works as an electrician, and has for two years, which he started as a conductor, and hopes to continue improving now that his means are sufficient to continue studying to be able to provide a better level of life to his family. He wants this loan to invest in construction materials to build a kitchen in his house to have a little more space. For this he is going to buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and others. He thanks Afodenic for the support now that he has been able to finish making his house.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: He

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hệ năm nay 54 tuổi. Chồng chị không may mất sớm, chị đang sống cùng hai con tại xã Quảng Khê huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại gia đình chị  làm công việc dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi và  mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi He is 54 yrs old. Her husband unfortunately died early; she currently lives with her 2 children in the village of Quang Khe, the district of Quang Xuong in the town of Thanh Hoa. In 2003 she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the family business of weaving sedge mats. Presently she has the business of weaving sedge mats as well as raising pigs. These are the main sources of income for her family averaging 178 USD per month. For her next loan she wishes to borrow 475 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise, and to buy additional supplies for her mat-weaving business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mat-weaving business, raising pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario M. L., tiene 42 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Curso estudios de pedagogía, carrera que no culmino porque sus padres no la siguieron apoyando, a pesar de eso ejerció como profesora durante 11 años hasta que se caso. Tiene 03 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores, cuando se inicio tenia un gallo y una gallina, que al poco tiempo dieron muchas crías, negocio que ha decidido abandonar debido a que sus animales estaban muriendo, ahora esta empezando con la siembra de verduras en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  alimento balanceado para sus animales.
Con este crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y hortalizas para sembrar sus verduras.
Rosario sueña con tener un minimarket en su domicilio y construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Rosario M. L. is 42 and lives in La Libertad in the district of Trujillo, in the province of the same name, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to become a teacher but was unable to pursue this career as her parents did not support her in it. In spite of this, she worked as a teacher for 11 years until she married. She has three children who depend entirely on her. She sells small animals; when she started she had a rooster and a hen. With time, they gave her many chicks. She abandoned this enterprise because her animals kept dying. She is now starting to grow vegetables at home. With her first 300 soles loan which she received from her community bank, "Cielo II", she invested in balanced feed for her animals. With this 200 soles loan, which she will repay in four months, she will buy supplies and starter plants to start her vegetable garden. Rosario dreams of having a convenience store in her house and of building a home of her own. She belongs to her local "vaso de leche", a governmental programme to supply milk, milk substitutes, cereals and so on to low-income households.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and starter plants to start her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses O. is 30 years old and married with a child. He makes furniture and he plans to purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture. To that end, he is requesting for the loan of 50,000 naira.

Moses is a hard working man and he hopes to lift his family above poverty. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials.

loans.name: Nicolae Cebotari Group

texts.en:
This is a group of farmers that is hoping to secure a loan via MicroInvest to improve and expand their respective businesses. In particular, they are seeking this loan because they do not have sufficient capital to pay rent at the wholesale market, which hinders their ability to generate an increase in their profits.

The entire group consists of relatives, and everyone is held accountable by each other. Even so, the leader of this group is Nicolae C., who is the oldest of the group and who convinced everyone to request this loan from MicroInvest. Notably, this is not the first loan Nicolae has sought from MicroInvest, and he explains that he has a good credit history and that lenders should have confidence that the group will promptly repay this loan.

loans.use: To improve their businesses by increasing working capital to enable them to rent space at the wholesale market

loans.name: Hien

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền năm nay32 tuổi. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương năm 2006 và vay vốn để đầu tư buôn bán cá. Hàng ngày chị mua cá của ngư dân vùng biển và đem cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại thành phố Thanh Hóa . Công việc kinh doanh phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 100.000đ/ ngày. Bên cạnh đó chồng chị làm bảo vệ nên hàng tháng cũng hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình khoảng 2.000.000đ vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000d để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán cá .
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hien is 32 yrs old. She joined TYM fund in 2006 and borrowed money to invest in selling fish. Every day she would buy fish from the fishermen and re-sell them to the locals in the town of Thanh Hoa. Her business is profitable and brings in 6.00 USD per day. In addition, her husband works as a security guard so every month he supplements their income with approximately 117 USD, and thus her family's economic situation is quite stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to invest in her fish-selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Bien

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Biển năm nay 55 tuổi. Chồng chị mất sớm,  chị đang sống cùng 1 con trai đã trưởng thành. Năm 2005 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại bên cạnh chăn nuôi chị còn nấu rượu để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Ngoài ra hàng tháng  con trai chị cũng hỗ trợ thêm cho chị nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn với mức thu nhập  3.000.000đ/ tháng.  Thời gian tới chị Biển dự định xin vay thêm vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 
9.000.000đ.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Bien is 55 yrs old. Her husband died early; she lives with 1adult son. In 2005, she joined TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in raising animals. Currently, besides raising animals she also makes wine to increase her family's income. In addition, her son also helps out and thus her family's economic situation is improving daily with income of 175 USD per month. In the near future, Ms. Bien plans to open a grocery store and thus wishes to borrow 525 USD to invest in this business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Roxana Melita

texts.es:
La señora Roxana Melita A. M., tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijas que dependen económicamente de ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, agua mineral, cerveza y menú los domingos, su negocio lleva mas de 8 años, dejo la venta de menú debido a que se enfermo el año pasado y la cerveza le da mas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en un local deportivo que es de propiedad de su esposo en el distrito de el porvenir.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra de cerveza, agua mineral, gaseosa y envases vacíos.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, agua mineral, gaseosa.
Roxana sueña con tener un bar restaurant en su domicilio.
ccCsdee
texts.en:
Roxana Melita A. M. is 28 and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school and has two daughters who are dependent on her. She sells soft drinks, mineral water, beer and on Sundays, set menus. She has had her business for more than eight years. She stopped preparing set menus because she fell ill last year and beer sales were more profitable. Her business is located in a sport store which her husband owns in the district of El Porvenir. She received a first loan of 300 soles from her community bank, "Cielo II", which she used to buy beer, mineral water, soft drinks and empty bottles. With this loan of 500 soles which she will repay in four months, she will buy beer, mineral water and soft drinks. Roxana dreams of having a bar-restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, mineral water and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy yams and ingredients for her foufou restaurant

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde O. is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells engine oil and she is requesting for the loan amount of 50,000 naira to purchase more engine oil to sell.

Kehinde wants to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Danaya est composé de cinq (05) femmes toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants, vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (la 4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles ont comme activités génératrices de revenu l’achat et la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des pagnes et des bazins teintés. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle qu’elles ont décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir bien remboursé tous les 5  prêts précédents elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe)
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, plusieurs objets en plastiques tels : 6 douzaines de pots, 3 douzaines de seaux, 3 douzaines de bassine, 13 douzaines de petites tasses, une douzaine de barrique et 33 pièces de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou pour l’ensemble des articles auprès des grossistes. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit  au grand marché de Ségou et en ambulant dans les quartiers pour les pagnes wax à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCA  qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants et les petits besoins de la famille (savon et complément du prix des condiments). 
 Elles ambitionnent avoir un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of five (05) women, all married, on average 35 years old with 5 children, who live in monogamous households in the Darsalam area of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali). They run as income-generating businesses the purchase and sale of plastic cooking utensils, pagnes (a type of West African cloth), and tinted "bazin" cloth. It was with the aim of satisfying the needs of their clientele that these women decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid all 5 previous loans without incident, they are seeking their 6th group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy several pastic objects such as : 6 dozen pots, 3 dozen buckets, 3 dozen basins, one dozen barrels, and 33 pieces of pagnes wax (a highly prized African cloth). They supply themselves at the main market in Ségou with all their items from wholesalers. They re-sell at retail, in cash or in credit, at the main market in Ségou and wandering through other areas, their pagnes wax to a clientele composed to men and women. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA, which will be used to buy school supplies for the children and small household goods (soap and condiments). They strive ultimately to have a housing plot.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils and pagnes wax

loans.name: Silvia Magali

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Magali U. V., tiene 26 años, vive en la Urb. La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Computación e Informática, carrera que ejercio durante 1 año y abandono debido a que se caso y tuvo a su pequeño hijo el cual depende económicamente de ella.
Silvia tiene una bodega, cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía pan, avena, leche, con sus ganancias logro surtir su bodega en la cual ahora vende de todo y le da muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Silvia sueña con tener un minimarket en su domicilio y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia Magali U. V. is 26 years old. She lives in the town La Rinconada, district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied Computation and Information, a career that she worked in for 1 year and then left after she got married and had a small son, who depends economically on her. Silvia has a neighbourhood shop. When she started it she sold only bread, oats, and milk. With her profits she was able to improve her shop, such that she now sells everything, and it gives her a good income. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank “Mujeres Decididas II” (Decided Women II), she invested in the purchase of groceries to stock her store. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she would repay in 4 months, she would invest in the purchase of groceries to increase the stock in her shop. Silvia dreams of having a mini-market in her home, and of traveling overseas

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her shop

loans.name: Oyeyemi

texts.en:
Oyeyemi Arowosegbe is 70 years old and married with six children. He sells building materials in wholesale and retail. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more building materials to sell.

Oyeyemi says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Néhémie Group

texts.en:
Deborah is a 42-year-old woman with five children. All of her children are 12 years old or younger, and three of them are currently attending school.

With starting capital of just $200, Deborah began her business in 2002 by selling soft drinks. Today, she operates a general boutique, selling her goods in the northeastern area of Kinshasa. She explains that her business prospered from 2002 through 2004, but that the business went bankrupt in 2005 due to theft. Nevertheless, in 2007, Deborah re-launched her business with five crates of soft drinks and purified water. By generating profits of approximately $5 per day, she increased her working capital to $100.

Currently, Deborah is happy to be a part of one of Hope’s groups. Indeed, she joined the group in October 2008, and she notes that her business has been reinforced and has improved through the loan she received. Her dream is to open a soft drink store. For the time being, she is seeking this loan in order to expand her inventory: she would like to purchase five additional crates of soft drinks.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing five crates of soft drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tunlaye

texts.en:
Tunlaye is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells medicine and provisions.

Tunlaye plans to increase her sales by increasing her stocks. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 naira to purchase more medicine and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 45 years old and married with four children. He has a provision shop where he sells foodstuffs, drinks and kerosene. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 naira to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions for his grocery store.

loans.name: Djèkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du  groupe Djèkadi  tous mariés, ayant en moyenne 38 ans avec 5 enfants vivent dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Voisines de quartier, les membres  du groupe se sont connus dans l’association traditionnelle d’entre aide Parissain qui veut dire  en dialecte Bobo. 
Ce groupe de femmes exerce comme activités génératrices de revenus, la vente du riz et la transformation des légumes (oignon tomates). Leur bonne organisation et leur dévouement dans les activités de transformation leurs ont valu un appui de l’US AID à travers des séchoirs et une machine de collage de sachets.
Ainsi dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro Yiriwaso qu’elles ont connu à travers l’Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. Après avoir bien remboursés les 2  prêts  précédents elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 sacs de sel de cuisine, 50kg de laye, 5 sacs d’oignon dont une partie est séchée au séchoir avant la vente et un sac d’arachide qui serait transformé en pâte. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement au marché de Diamarabougou  pour tous ces condiments ci dessus cités. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Diamarabougou et à domicile  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour acheter du savon et subvenir aux dépenses de nutrition de la famille.
 Leur ambition est de préparer les trousseaux de mariage de leurs filles.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Djèkadi group are all married, are on average 38 years old with 5 children, and live in monogamous households in the Rails ko area of Markala (4th administrative region of Mali). Living in the same area, the members of the group met each other in a traditional mutual assistance association named Parissain. This group of women runs as a revenue-generating business the sale of rice and the processing of vegetables (onions and tomatoes). Their good organizational skills and their dedication to their business of processing vegetables earned them support from US AID in the form of dehydrators and a machine to seal bags. Thus, with the hope of increasing the profitability of their businesses, these women decided to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which they found out about through the General Assembly of Artisans in Markala. After having repaid their 2 previous loans without problems, they are seeking their 3rd group loan. This loan will be used to buy 10 bags of cooking salt, 50 kg of milk, 5 bags of onions, of which one portion is dried in the dehydrator before sale, and 1 bag of peanuts, which will be converted to paste. They supply themselves weekly at the Diamarabougou market for all the condiments mentioned above. They sell at retail, in cash or on credit, in the Diamarabougou market and at home to a clientele composed primarily of women. They intend to realize an average monthly profit of 11,000 FCA, which will be used to buy soap and meet the nutritional needs of their families. Their ambition is to prepare bridal trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
el grupo Dios proveera se integra por tres mujeres las cuales son personas agradables, sociables y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, ellas son vecinas cercanas, Sra. Herminia tiene tres años de dedicarse a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana al molino a quebrar el maiz para elaborar las tortillas, ya que tiene que entregar a las 10 de la mañana 500 tortillas en una caseta ubicada en la colonia Carrizal, asi mismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de condimentos para darle sabor a las comidas, los condimentos que ella vende son; especias, achiote, sal de ajo, azafan y canela.
