Ella tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian y su meta es poder pagarles sus estudios universitarios.   
la Sra. Norma se dedica a la produccion  y venta de tortillas, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella desde que era pequeña siempre le gusto hacer tortillas, y gracias a este negocio puede mantener a su hijo y su madre, ya que su papa murio cuando ella era pequeña, el sueño de ella es gradurse de perito mercantil, ella estudia en el colegio en las noches.   la Sra Rosa tambien se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales sale a vender a las colonias cercanas, su esposo se dedica a la reparacion de aparatos electricos y de esta forma han podido sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, en estos momentos todas ellas necesitan credito monetario para comprar maiz, leña, agua y asi tener maor produccion y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group “Dios Proveera” (God Provides) is made up of three women who are kind, sociable, and who have a great desire to improve their lives. They are close neighbours. Ms. Herminia has spent three years making and selling tortillas. She gets up at 4 AM to grind the corn flour to make her tortillas, so that she is delivering 500 tortillas by 10AM in a little kiosk located in the neighbourhood Carrizal. Also, in the afternoons, she works selling condiments to give flavour to food. The condiments that she sells are: spice, annatto, garlic salt, saffron, and caramel. She has two children who are studying, and her goal is to be able to pay for their university studies. Ms. Norma works making and selling tortillas. She has done this activity for 5 years. Ever since she was small, she has always liked making tortillas, and thanks to this business she has been able to support her son and her mother, since her father died when she was little. Her dream is to graduate as a commercial technician; she is studying at night school. Ms. Rosa also works making and selling tortillas, which she goes to sell in the neighbourhoods nearby. Her husband works repairing electrical appliances, and in this manner they have been able to improve the lives of their two children. At the moment they need a credit to buy corn, wool, water, and so improve production and get a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, water, wool, fertilizers, salt, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en el Jr. Lloque Yupanqui Mz. G Lt 21, de Km 6,200 en la Asociación Pro vivienda San Martin D. Distrito de Callería. Tiene 50 años de edad con 02 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad de Coronel Portillo. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró gaseosas, ollas y artículos de primera necesidad para poder vender menú.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1300 nuevos soles, comprará una olla arrocera,  4 ollas grandes ya que  brinda servicios de alimentos  a todo el personal  de una empresa maderera  cerca de su casa donde su hija labora. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su  ayuda y confianza  que  deposita en ella.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to The Winners community bank located in San Martin, Peru. She is 50 years old and has two children. Her husband is a works in the municipality of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan Adeloa received of 300 soles, she purchased soft drinks, pots and pans, and articles of primary need to be able to sell her meals. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,300 soles, she plans to purchase a rice cooker and four big pots so she can provide food services to all the workers at a lumber business where her daughter works near her home. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its help and the confidence it places in her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a rice cooker and four big pots

loans.name: Vilcanota Group

texts.es:
El nombre de este banco comunal se llama, "VILCANOTA"; Este nombre proviene de la época INKA, es el río mayor que alimenta a otros pequeños ríos en el valle de Cusco; Se funda este banquito el día 13 de febrero del 2009, y está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis del del departamento de Cusco, está situado a 1.15 hora de la ciudad del Cusco, considerado zona rural, la gente vive de la agricultura y ganadería, convinando así sus actividades domésticas, dentro de estas actividades muchos de los socios también son estibadores (cargan en sus pequeños bolquetes ormigón, arena, piedras, entre otros); Los socios estan sumamente agradecidos por la ayuda brindada, así mismo ellos se comprometen a compensar el préstamo a tiempo.

Este préstamo será invertido en, 08 socios invertiran para la compra de ovejas, y terneros, para mejorar la raza y así poder vender sus ganados a mayor precio, 02 socios invertirán el préstamo en la compra de accsesorios para sus bolquetes de carga pesada, de ese modo podrán seguir siendo alquilados; 02 socias invertirán el préstamo en la compra de productos para cocinar,ellas comprarán, carne, papas, sal, limónes, verduras, entre otras especies, puesto que ellas venden comida en el mercado local y desean mejorar sus servicio para atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is "VILCANOTA"; This name comes of the Inca times. It is the biggest river that feeds other small rivers in the Cusco valley. This small group was formed on February 13, 2009, and is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis of the department of Cusco. It is 1.15 hour away from of the city of the Cusco, this area is considered rural zone. The people in the area live of agriculture and cattle, They combine their domestic activities with these. Many of the partners also are stevedores (they load in their small dump trucks concrete, sand, stones, among others); The partners are extremely grateful by the offered help, therefore they promise to repay the loan on time. This loan will used by 8 partners and they will invest it to buy sheep, and calves, in order to improve the race and then be able to sell their cattle at a better price. Two of partners will invest the loan in buying accessories for their heavy load dump trucks, this way they will be able to keep on being hired. Other 2 of the partners will invest the loan in buying cooking products like meat, potatoes, salt, lemons, vegetables, among others, since they sell meals at the local market and want to improve their service to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell wholesale and retail animals.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Saniya est composé de huit (08) femmes toutes mariées ayant 35 ans et 5 enfants  en moyenne. Elles vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (la 4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le petit commerce d’articles divers de poissons de mer, la fabrication de jus locaux, des gâteaux frits (pâté), des pagnes wax etc. Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une commerçante de pagnes wax dans le marché Médine Ségou qui est dans le système depuis plusieurs années.
 Après avoir bien remboursé le 1ier prêt, elles sont à leur 2ème prêt de groupe qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 9 sacs de sucre, 10kg de gingembre, 1sac de citron, 30kg d’oseille de Guinée, 50kg de poudre de pain de singe (fruits de baobab,) 1carton d’essences (aromes) et 18cartons de 20kg de poisson de mer.
 Elles s’approvisionnent en ingrédients de jus locaux au marché de Médine Ségou et en poisson de mer à Bamako auprès d’un grossiste du marché Dibida. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Médine, à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.000FCA dont une partie est épargnée et le reste rentre dans le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Saniya is composed of eight women, all married, who average 35 years of age and five children. They live in monogamous families in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do small-scale commerce in various items... seafood, making local juices, fried cakes (pâté), Wax-brand pagnes cloth, etc. They discovered Soro Yiriwaso through Wax pagnes merchants at the Médine Ségou marketplace, which has been in the system for several years.

After having repaid their first loan, the women of the group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy: 9 sacks of sugar, 10 kg of ginger, 1 sack of lemons, 30 kg of oseille de Guinée (dried hibiscus flowers), 50 kg of monkey bread powder (from the fruit of the baobab tree), 1 box of flavorings, and 18 boxes of ocean fish (20-kg per box). The local juices are gotten at the Médine Ségou market, and the fish is gotten in Bamako from a wholesaler at the Dibida market. The goods are sold at the Médine market, at home, and door-to-door through the districts, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children.

They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 48,000 francs CFA, of which a portion will be saved, and the rest, for repaying the loan and covering the children's schooling costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for local drinks and seafood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a 34-year-old woman. She is divorced and the mother of 2 kids. She divorced after her husband refused to take responsibility for the children. Currently, the kids are in school. She lives with her kids in Shiashie, a suburb of Accra in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. Mary is an achiever and a resourceful mother who always wants to see smiles on the faces of her children. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She trades in maize and cocoa drinks. She treks to the Volta Region and Brong Ahafo to purchase bulk stocks of maize from farmers and retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of maize and to add groundnuts and millet to her stock, which she believes will enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her kids in school. She belongs to a village bank called Honesty.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of maize and cocoa powder

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Soutoura (5 veuves et une femme) a une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans et 6 enfants, elles vivent dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Membre de l’association Parissain qui veut dire travaillons ensemble, elles font   la vente du riz, de pagnes et la transformation des légumes (oignon tomates). Leur bonne organisation et leur dévouement dans les activités leurs ont valu un appui de l’US AID à travers des séchoirs et une machine de collage de sachets.
Afin de satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro Yiriwaso qu’elles ont connu à travers l’Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. Après avoir bien remboursés les  prêts précédents elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt de groupe.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  7 sacs de riz  et 20 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement au marché de Diamarabougou pour l’ensemble des articles. Elles revendent en détail au comptant et à crédit  au marché de Diamarabougou et à domicile  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24.375FCA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires.
texts.en:
The group Soutoura is composed of six women, including 5 widows, who average 51 years of age and 6 children. They live in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members of the association Parissain, which means "let's work together", are sellers of rice and pagne cloth, and they process vegetables (onions, tomatoes). Being well-organized and devoted to their work, they have been worthy of assistance from US-AID in terms of dryers and a machine for sealing packets.

In order to satisfy their customers, the group members decided to approach Soro Yiriwaso, which they had discovered through the Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. After having repaid the preceding loans, they are on their third group one. They plan to use this loan to buy 7 sacks of rice and 20 lengths of Wax-brand pagnes (colorful West African cloth). All supplies are gotten weekly at the Diamarabougou market. Sales are made retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Diamarabougou market and at home, to customers composed of men and women.

They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 24,375 francs CFA that will be used to cover family expenses and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and cloth

loans.name: Angela Teresa

texts.es:
ANGELA TERESA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” ubicado en la Av. Alfonso Ugarte Mz. 278 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 53 años de edad, 03 hijos , socia   de Manuela Ramos 09 años.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, compro carne roja (res), vísceras (mondongos, lengua, riñón, etc.); en poca cantidad, obtuvo un puesto en el mercado N° 02 de la ciudad de Pucallpa, la razón de vender fue el fallecimiento de su esposo, busco la manera de trabajar para cumplir con el sustento familiar con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 Nuevos Soles compró carne roja en cantidad, vísceras, su venta  aumenta  de igual manera los clientes, para mantener su carne fresca compró un congelador de gran ayuda para ella, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos. 

Esta muy contenta por el gran apoyo que le brindo y le brinda Manuela Ramos en los momentos que mas a necesitado.
texts.en:
ANGELA TERESA belongs to the Communal Bank called “Las Triunfadoras” located on Av. Alfonso Ugarte 278 – District of Callería. She is 53 years old, and she has 3 children. She has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for 9 years. With first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90) she bought meat (beef), and guts (tripes, tongue kidney, etc.); in small quantities. She obtained a stand in the market N ° 02 of the city of Pucallpa.The reason for working selling meat is the death of her husband. She looked for a way of working to meet with the family needs with the help and support of her children. With this loan of 1000.00 Nuevos Soles ($325) she bought meat and guts in bigger quantity, her sales increased the same way as her clients. In order to keep her the meat fresh, she bought a freezer that has been of great help for her. She works as a team with her children. She is very happy for the support that Manuela Ramos (Kiva's partner) is giving her at the moments she needs it most.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat and guts in bigger quantities and a freezer to keep the meat.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
CLAUDIA ISABEL, pertenece al banco comunal “vecinas Unidas” ubicado en Jr. Piura N° 136 –Distrito de Callería, tiene 29 años de edad, 2 hijos, es madre soltera, es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, viajó a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropas al por mayor, para venderlos a sus amistades, como short, polos, pantalones, zapatos, todo solo pedidos. El negocio cada vez creció, en su casa apertura una bodega pequeña.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 1 saco de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar, 30 Kg. de fideos, medio paquete de detergente, 24 unidades de leche grande, 02 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de huevos, jabones, 1 saco de sal, ambiento su local.

Feliz muy contenta por pertenecer a Manuela Ramos,  porque tiene amigas que la apoyan y la acompañan  siempre.
texts.en:
CLAUDIA ISABEL belongs to the communal bank called “Vecinas Unidas” located on Piura N ° 136 – district of Callería. She is 29 years old and she has 2 children. She is a single mother and she has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for 5 years. The first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90), she traveled to the city of Lima to buy wholesale clothes, and sold them to her friends, like short, shirts, trousers, shoes. The business grew every time and then she open a small grocery shop at home. With this loan of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles ($325) she will buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 30 kg of noodles, half a pack of detergent, 24 units of milk, 2 bundles of toilet paper, 1 box of eggs, soap, 1 sack of salt. She is very glad to belong to Manuela Ramos (Kiva's partner), because she has friends who support her and always accompany her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 30 kg of noodles, half a pack of detergent, 24 units of milk, 2 bundles of toilet paper, 1 box of eggs, soap, 1 sack of salt.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A., Pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, ubicado en Mz, I Lt. 03, Urbanización Pedro Portillo – Distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 43 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es constructor civil.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compro una impresora pequeña, artículos de oficina, papeles bond A-4.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos de oficina en mayor  cantidad, una impresora con escáner, y se financio una computadora, para realizar en su casa tipeos, y diseños gráfico.

Agradece a Manuel Ramos, por apoyarla, su anhelo era tener una computadora completa, ahora lo tiene gracias a Manuela Ramos, y puede realizar y cumplir con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A. belongs to the communal Bank called "Las Trinfadoras" located in the urban development Pedro Portillo – District of Yarinacocha in the city of Pucallpa. She is 43 years old and she has 3 children. Her husband is a civil builder. The first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90), she bought a small printer, office supplies and A-4 paper. With this loan of 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles ($375) she bought more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs. She is grateful to Manuel Ramos (Kiva's partner) for supporting her. Her wish was to be able to have a complete computer equipment, now she has it thanks to Manuela Ramos, and she can make and fulfill carry out her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Raimondi N° 948 de la ciudad de Pucallpa, Distrito de Callería, tiene 45 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, ella vende bebidas y productos variados en su casa, es socia de Manuelas Ramos 02 años. 
	
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró gaseosas, golosinas, una vitrina chica para mostrar sus golosinas y otR. productos como limones, plátanos, tomates, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,100.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una vitrina grande, golosinas, gaseosas, agua mineral, verduras, frutas, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.

Esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y no la defraudara.
texts.en:
Miss Gladis, belongs to the Communal Bank called "Las triunfadoras", located in Raimondi N ° 948 of the city of Pucallpa, District of Callería. She is 45 years old and she has 2 children. Her husband is a taxi driver and she sells drinks and different products at her house. She has been partner of Manuelas Ramos (Kiva's partner) for 2 years. With first loan of 300.00 Nuevos soles ($90) she bought soda drinks, sweets, a small display cabinet to show her sweets and other products like lemons, bananas, tomatoes, etc. With this loan of 1,100.00 Nuevos Soles ($350), she will buy a big display cabinet, sweets, sodas, mineral water, vegetables, fruits. She gets up quite early to serve her clients. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting in her and she will not disappoint them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a big display cabinet, sweets, soda drinks, mineral water, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
ISABEL, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Lima Mz. A Lt. 30 – Tercera zona D. Yarinacocha – Distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 60 años D. edad, 05 hijos, su esposo es agricultor, ella es costurera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00),  compró telas, hilos, botones, cierres, tela D. algodón, confecciona ropas interiores, y es la que aporta  con los gastos D. su casa pues su esposo no tiene trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 10kg D. tela para confeccionar sabanas, 4kg D. hilos para remallar, 30 metros D. telas para confeccionar conjuntos D. ropa D. vestir, como falda y pantalones tipo sastre.

Le gusta la organización que le ayuda a crecer cada vez más con su trabajo D. costura, sus dos hijos van a llegar a ser profesionales, gracias al apoyo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
ISABEL belongs to the communal bank called "Vecinas Unidas", located in Lima Mz A Lt. 30 – Third zone of Yarinacocha – District of Yarinacocha. She is 60 years old and she has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer and she is a seamstress. The first loan that she received was for 300 Nuevos Soles ($ 90), she bought fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and cotton cloth. She makes underwear and she is the one who pays for her house's expenses since her husband doesn't work. With this loan of 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles ($625) she will buy 10 kg of fabric to make bed sheets, 4 kg of threads, 30 meters of fabric to make dressy outfits, like tailored skirts and trousers. He likes the organization that helps her to grow more and more with her work as a seamstress. Her two children are going to become professionals, thanks to the support that she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva's partner).

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 kg of fabric to make bed sheets, 4 kg of threads, 30 meters of fabric to make dressy outfits, like tailored skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is a 33-year-old mother of 3 kids, who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the kids. She has operated a seamstress shop for the past 12 years. She has one young lady (apprentice) who is learning to acquire skills and experience for her future. She sews all forms of women's wear with various kinds of styles, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sews children's school uniforms. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. It has been her dream to make progress this year to increase her business size. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids in school. She belongs to a village bank called Honesty.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Eva Felicidad

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Eva Felicidad M. es una dama que se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación. Su dedicación es la crianza de cerdos o ganado porcino el cual desde hace 5 años ha logrado desempeñar en su propia localidad.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de productos para engorde de cerdos y de esta manera mejora sus condiciones de vida proporcionándole mejores oportunidades a su familia el cual se compone de ella que es una madre soltera y de sus tres hijos que debe mantener por ser estudiantes menores de edad.
texts.en:
In the area of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega is Eva, a woman who dedicates herself arduously to improve the conditions of her household. She makes a living raising pigs, which she has been able to carry out in her own place for the past five years. Currently, Eva has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan that would allow her to purchase feed to fatten her pigs and in this way she will be able to earn more money so she can improve her living conditions and provide better opportunities for her family. She is a single mother with three children whom she provides for since they are young and still in school.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Janis Marina

texts.es:
JANIS MARINA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en el Psje Los Cedros Mz. 12 Lt. 2,  – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 25 años de edad, 02 hijos menores de edad, es mamá soltera, con una bodega  pequeña y 01 año de socia en Manuela Ramos.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compro 01 paquete de detergente, 01 saco de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar para iniciar su pequeña bodega al separarse de su esposo, las ventas crecieron poco a poco ya que era la única bodega en su barrio.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compro productos variados para su bodega como 01 saco  de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar, 10kg de fideos, aceite, 12 unidades  de un  litro, huevos 360 unidades, artículos para la fiesta de carnavales como globos, maicena, colorantes.
Esta muy agradecida de Manual Ramos, por el apoyo que le da y de esa manera poder llevar el pan de cada día a sus menores hijos, gracias muchas gracias Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Janis belongs to The Winner community bank and lives in San Fernando, Manantay, Peru. She is 25 years old and has two small children. She is a single mother who runs a small convenience store and has been a member of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for one year. With the first loan she received for 300 soles, she purchased detergent, rice and sugar to start her small store after separating from her husband. Her sales grew little by little since it was the only store of its kind in her neighborhood. With the current loan of 1,500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase various products for her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, eggs and party items like balloons, cornstarch and dyes. She is very thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its support in helping her provide daily for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase various products for her convenience store such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, eggs and party items like balloons, cornstarch and dyes

loans.name: Loida Grimaneza

texts.es:
LOIDA GRIMANEZA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas  Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Padre Bietman  N° 168 – Distrito D. Callería, tiene 54 años D. edad, 04 hijos todos mayores D. edad, su esposo es docente cesante, realiza la elaboración y venta D. Wantanes y corbatitas fritas.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró insumos para su elaboración, 01 saco D. harina, una cocina pequeña sartén para freír los wantanes y corbatitas, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus productos son deliciosos y muy solicitados.

Con este préstamo D.  S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 01 saco D. harina, 01 paquete D. aceite D. 1 litro, ketchup, chuño, insumos en variedad como bolsas para empaquetar, como así mismo  va ampliar un espacio mas en su casa para que pueda tener mas comodidad. Loida cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo.

Se siente más consolidada económicamente, independiente, ayuda con la economía del hogar, gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
LOIDA GRIMANEZA belongs to the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbours), located in Jr. Padre Bietman, number 168, in the district of Callería. She is 54 years old and has 4 grown up children. Her husband is unemployed, and she works making and selling wontons and fried pasta. The first loan that she received was 300 Soles (S/. 300.00). She bought ingredients for her work, 1 bag of flour, a small kitchen frying pan to fry the wontons and noodles. She has many clients and her products are delicious and in high demand. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, she will buy 1 bag of flour, 1 one-litre package of oil, ketchup, potato flour, and various items like bags to package her wares. In this way she will make a bigger space in her home so that she will have more convenience. Loida has the help of her husband. She feels much stronger economically and independent, helping with the economics of the household, thanks to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 bag of flour, 1 one-litre package of oil, ketchup, potato flour, and various items like bags to package her product

loans.name: Rey Isabel

texts.es:
El señor Rey Ruíz es originario del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a su actividad de ganadería por medio de la compra de novillos para su respectivo engorde. Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Rey se prepara para comenzar la ardual labora del día trasladando el ganado de un lado a otro y dedicando su tiempo a la crianza, alimentación y cuido de los animales.

Actualmente la razón por la que ha buscado el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de novillos de engorde. Por medio de los anteriores créditos que ella ha obtenido le han ayudado a crecer el hato ganadero y aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Rey is originally from the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, where he still makes a living in livestock by purchasing calves to raise and fatten. Very early every morning Rey prepares for his arduous work of moving the cattle from one side to another and dedicating his time to raising them, feeding them and caring for them. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase young bulls and heifers to fatten. Previous loans he has obtained have helped him grow his cattle herd and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase young bulls and heifers to fatten

loans.name: Luz Isola

texts.es:
LUZ  Pertenece al banquito comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. 9 de Diciembre N° 902 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 50 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, ella es costurera y hace artículos de lencería.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compro tela de algodón, confeccionan ropas interiores, toallas, salidas de baño, ropas de dormir.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000  Nuevo Soles, compro telas para  confeccionar sabanas y felpas para toallas y toallitas, ropas para dormir, tela de algodón para confeccionar vestidos, ropas interiores.

Me siento muy bien, en  Manuela Ramos, me ayudo mucho, mi negocio crece, arregle un poco mi casa, gracias a Manuel Ramos.
texts.en:
Luz belongs to the community bank “United Neighbours”, located in Jr. 9 de Diciembre, number 902, district of Callería. She is 50 years old, and has two children. Her husband is a mechanic, and she is a seamstress and makes lingerie. The first loan that she received was of 300 Nuevos Soles (S/.300.00). She bought cotton fabric, to make underwear, towels, bathrobes, and nightclothes. With this loan of S/. 2,000 Nuevo Soles, she would buy fabric to make sheets and plush for towels and handtowels, nightclothes, cotton fabric to make shirts and underwear. “I am very happy with Manuela Ramos, it has helped me a lot. My business is growing, I am improving my home a little, thanks to Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo G. es un caballero originario del municipio de El Viejo el cual se dedica a su actividad de agricultura llevado a cabo en su comunidad por medio de la siembra de frijoles. También se dedica arduamente a la construcción de casas, teniendo estas dos actividades donde se desarrolla para llevar el sustento a su humilde familia compuesta por su esposa y tres hijos.

Hoy en día espera en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los insumos para la siembra de los frijoles y para esto continua esforzándose en su construcción esperando tranquilamente en el apoyo que solamente Ceprodel puede brindarle.
texts.en:
Pablo G. is originally from the municipality of El Viejo, where he still makes a living in his community's agriculture by harvesting beans. He also works arduously building homes. He has these two activities to carry out so he can provide for his family, which consists of his wife and three children. Currently, he comes to Kiva partner Ceprodel in request of a loan so he can purchase the raw materials to plant his bean crops and also continue working hard in construction. He calmly waits for the support that only Kiva and Ceprodel can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in raw materials for harvesting beans and building homes

loans.name: Mayra Lucía

texts.es:
MAYRA LUCIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio N° 576, en L. ciudad de Pucallpa, distrito de Callería, tiene 22 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una panadería, no tiene hijos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró teckno poor, cartulinas, grampas, ambiento su local, elL. confecciona piñatas, se compro una vitrina para mostrar sus confecciones, decora locales, fiestas infantiles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos para fiestas infantiles, juguetes, peluches, gorros, sorpresas, globos, serpentinas, etc. y decora locales para todo acontecimiento.

Agradece a ManueL. Ramos por confiar en elL. a pesar de ser muy joven pero es responsable, por darle L. oportunidad de administrar su propio negocio gracias a sus préstamos.
texts.en:
MAYRA LUCIA belongs to the community bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) located in Jr. 7 de Junio N° 576, in the city Pucallpa, district of Callería. She is 22 years old, her husband works in a bread store, and she doesn’t have any children. The first loan that she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00). She bought Teckno Poor items, cards, staplers. In her store, she makes piñatas, and she bought a cabinet to show off her handiwork, that decorates places and children’s parties. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she would buy articles for children’s parties, toys, stuffed toys, caps, surprises, balloons, toy snakes, etc., and decorate places for any kind of event. Thanks to ManueL. Ramos for having confidence in her since she is very young, but she is responsible, for the opportunity to administer her own business thanks to the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for kids' parties

loans.name: Erasma

texts.es: Erasma tiene 55 años de edad, está felizmente casada desde 1969, ella es madre de un hijo, y actualmente viven en su casa propia, lugar donde fabrican y venden cajones de frutas. Desde su niñez Erasma se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y los 40 años de matrimonio los ha dedicado a la siembra y cultivo de plátanos, cítricos y paltas. En aquellos tiempos la cosecha era buena, pero ahora solo conservan unas cuantas chacras, las cuales cosechan cada 15 días y no les resultan rentables. Sus horas libres Erasma la dedica a  la fabricación de javas y cajas para el guardado de frutas, ella y su esposo jamás pensaron que este negocio les resultaría tan rentable, pero ahora tienen muchos pedidos, produciendo de 100 a 150 javas o cajones, que venden a un precio de de 90 céntimos y 1 sol dependiendo de la fruta que se empaque. Con esta actividad su esposo está muy feliz, ya que tiene el apoyo incondicional, de ella y la de su hijo, quien colabora con la fabricación, juntos buscan clientes, para ofrecer su mercadería a un precio considerable; este negocio les está dando muchas alegrías, además de permitirle ganar a la semana de 100 a 150 soles, dinero que cubre la alimentación diaria de su familia. Erasma en los ciclos pasados ocupaba el cargo de tesorera, y cumplió con mucha responsabilidad su trabajo realizando los cobros en cada fecha cronogramada, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP con el cual espera seguir dando todo de sí. Con la mayor parte del dinero solicitado, comprará materiales para la construcción de cajones, y otra menor cantidad la utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de plátanos. Erasma tiene mucha gratitud a todos los que hacen posible este préstamo, ya que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Erasma is 55 years old and has been happily married since 1969. She has one child and is currently living in a house she owns, where they prepare and sell crates of fruit. Since she was young, Erasma has been working in agriculture and for the 40 years she has been married she has raised and harvested plantain, citrus fruit and avocado. In those times the harvest was good but now they only have a limited number of fields which they harvest every 15 days and are not very profitable. In her free time, Erasma makes containers and crates to keep the fruit. She and her husband never thought this business would be as profitable as it has turned out to be and they now have good demand, creating between 100 to 150 containers or crates which they sell for 90 céntimos or 1 sol each depending on the fruit packed inside. Her husband is very pleased with this activity as he has her unconditional support and that of her child who also helps with preparations. Together, they go looking for customers, to offer they merchandise for a good price. This business is making them very happy and allows them to make between 100 and 150 soles a week, money which covers the daily food needs of the family. Erasma has in past loan cycles been the group treasurer and she accomplished this task with great responsibility, ensuring the repayments were always recorded correctly. This is her fifth loan with MFP with which she hopes to continue. She will use most of the loan to buy materials to build crates and a smaller portion to buy fertilizers for her plantain fields. Erasma is very grateful to all those who have made her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crates to sell her fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
MAYRA P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista N° 374 D. Distrito D. Callería, tiene 44 años D. edad, 03 hijos, su esposo  es soldador.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/.300.00), compro materiales como fierros corrugados para construir puertas y ventanas, con la ayuda D. su esposo, con las ganancias y ahorros que hacían se compraron un motocarro para  poder hacer entrega D. sus pedidos a domicilio.
Con este préstamo D.  S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró mas fierros corrugados, una maquina D. soldar, ya que  obtuvo un contrato granD. para construir muchas puertas  y ventanas D. fierro y entregar en el mas breve plazo.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su ayuda y hacer que   su empresa crezca cada vez más, ella esta feliz por que  ya es una empresaria.
texts.en:
MAYRA P. belongs to the community bank “Las Triumfadoras” (The Winners), located at Bellavista Avenue, N° 374 in the district Callería. She is 44 years old and has three children. Her husband is a welder. The first loan that she received was for 300 Nuevos Soles (S/.300.00). She bought materials like corrugated iron in order to build doors and windows, with her help of her husband, with the profits, and savings that she had, she bought a motorcar to be able to deliver her orders to client’s homes. With this loan of S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she would buy more corrugated iron and a soldering iron. She has already gotten a big contract to make many iron doors and windows and to deliver them in a very short period. Thanks to Manuela Ramos for its help to make her business grow bigger each time; she feels happy because now she is a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and tools to make doors and windows

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
La señora Milena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry N° 845, Distrito de Callería, tiene 52 años de edad su esposo es comerciante, ella apertura un restaurante donde vende productos naturales, ella es socia hace 3 años de Manuela Ramos.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró: arroz 25kg, azúcar 25kg, aceite 06 unidades de 01 litro, especierías, carne roja 03kg, pollos 02; se inicio vendiendo menú variado, entre ello vegetariano.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1, 700.00  Nuevos Soles, compró 06 sacos de arroz, azúcar  02 sacos, aceite 02 docenas, 20kg de fideos, 50kg de carne roja, compra 05 pollos diarios, frutas, pescados, verduras, se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus compras y atender a  sus clientes desde las 7:00 am de la mañana con la ayuda de su esposo  y  su personal. 
Esta muy Agradecida de Manuela Ramos por su confianza en ella, que siga apoyando a muchas mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milena participates with the Banco Comunal (communal bank) "Las Triunfadoras" located on Jr. Salaverry N° 845 in the Callería. She is 52 years old. Her husband is a trader. She has a restaurant where she sells natural products. She's been Manuela Ramos' partner for three years. The first loan Mrs. Milena recieved was for $300 Nuevos Soles that she used to bue 25kg of rice, 25kg of sugar, 6 liters of oil, spices, 3kg of red meat, and 2kg of chicken. She began with a varied menu that included vegetarian dishes. With this new $1700 Nuevos Soles loan, she will buy 6 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 24 liters of oil, 20kg of noodles, 50kg of meat, 5 chickens every day, fruits, fish and vegetables. She gets up very early to make her purchases and she attends her customers since 7 a.m. with her husband and staff's help. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for her trust. She hopes she will continue to support more women who wish to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 6 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 24 liters of oil, 20kg of noodles, 50kg of red meat, 5 chickens daily, fruits, fish, vegetables

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 21 años de edad, está casada hace un año, y tiene 3 hijos, con los cuales actualmente vive en una casa alquilada. Desde su infancia realizaba el labrado y cultivo de sus chacras, pero ahora que tiene 3 hijos, sus necesidades se han incrementado, entonces hace tres años atrás volcó todo su interés en la compra y venta de frutas, que en épocas de enero a abril es muy rentable, pero el resto de los meses es bajo; debido a ello puso otro negocio, el alquiler y venta de CDs, negocio que le está resultando muy rentable, porque no tiene mucha competencia, ya que su único competidor está ubicado en el otro barrio. Maribel con la venta y alquiler de películas lleva 6 meses, y se nota su alegría con este negocio, el cual ya le está captado ganancias, ya que por cada CD que alquila cobra 2 soles cincuenta y por la venta 3 soles, ella los vende en horas de la tarde y la compra y venta de frutas lo realiza cada viernes. Maribel nos comenta que estas dos ganancias las trata de ahorrar, para de ese modo contrarrestar las épocas de poca  demanda de las frutas, asi que la venta de CDs es el principal ingreso a su economía. Ella en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos, y asiste de forma puntual a las reuniones de su banco comunal, este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo, pagó sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma programado por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los CDs, tanto para alquilar como para la venta, ya sean musicales y de películas.
texts.en:
Maribel is 21 years old; she has been married for a year and has three children with whom she is living in a rented house. Since she was very young she has worked and farmed her fields, but now that she has three children her needs have grown and so three years ago she threw herself into the purchase and sale of fruit which is very profitable between January and April, but not so in the other months of the year. Because of this, she started another business: renting and selling CDs, a business which has proven very profitable because there is little competition given that her only competitor is located in a different neighbourhood. Maribel started selling and renting movies six months ago and her satisfaction with this business is obvious. She is making good profits as she rents each CD for 2.50 soles and sells each for 3 soles. She sells in the evenings and buys and sells fruit on Fridays. Maribel tells us that she tries to save the profits from these businesses in order to offset the times when fruit sales are low: the sale of CDs has become her main source of income. In all this time, she has proven herself to be very punctual with her payments and attends all the meetings of her community bank. This is her fifth loan with MFP and in all this time she was always repaid her installments on time. She is asking for this loan to buy more CDs both to rent and to sell, be they music or movies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of CDs to rent and sell

loans.name: Mitsi Esther

texts.es:
MITSI, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” ubicado en la Av. Alfonso Ugarte n° 830, puesto 79 del Mercado de Bellavista en el distrito de Callería, tiene 26 años de edad, 1 hijo, su esposo es técnico electricista.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró harinas al por mayor (plátano, soya, maíz suave, maca), maní, achote guisador, comino en grano, especerías, embutidos, vende paquetes de 250gr. las harinas que ella misma envasa  en su puesto del mercado, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 4 sacos de harina (maca, plátano, soya, maíz, etc.) canela 3Kg., pimienta y comino 2Kg de cada uno, achote 1Kg, palillo 1Kg, para aumentar su venta 
  Ella está  muy contenta con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo, gracias a ello su negocio crece cada vez más.
texts.en:
Monica Lizbeth is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Las Triunfadoras, located on Av. Alfonso Ugarte n° 830, post 79 in the Bellavista Market in the Callería district. She is 26, and has one child. Her husband is an electrician. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought flour (banana, soy, soft corn, maca) wholesale, as well as peanuts, achote, cumin, spices, and sausages. She sells 250g packages that she wraps herself in her market post. She gets up very early to attend her customers. With this new S/. 1,500 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase 4 bags of flour (maca, banana, soy and corn), 3 kg of cinnamon, 2 kg each of pepper and cumin, 1 kg of achote, 1 kg of turmeric in order to increase her sales. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support. Thanks to her, her business is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bags of flour (maca, banana, soy and corn), 3 kg of cinnamon, 2 kg each of pepper and cumin, 1 kg of achote, 1 kg of turmeric

loans.name: Mónica Lizbeth

texts.es:
MONICA LIZBETH, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Los Céticos N° 651 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 39 años de edad, 04 hijos, su esposo compra y vende productos de la región.
Se levanta muy temprano por la mañana, a las 04:00 a.m., para ir con su esposo al puerto fluvial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, compran plátanos, pescado, frutas y animales en variedad.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 30 manos de plátanos, pescado fresco, pescado salado 01 fardo, para venderlo en el mismo puerto fluvial. Con el ahorro y sus ganancias compró un motokar para poder transportar sus productos de un lugar a otro vendiendo  por la ciudad.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró repuestos para el motor de su motokar, lo pintó, tapizó los asientos, ahora esta listo para continuar trabajando.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le dio en el momento de crisis que pasaba su familia.
texts.en:
Monica Lizbeth is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Vecinas Unidas, located on Jr. Los Céticos N° 651 – San Fernando in the Mantanay district. She is 39, has four children and is sells products throughout the region. She wakes up very early in the morning, at 4 a.m., to go with her husband to the inland port in Pucalipa to buy bananas, fish, fruits and meat. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought 30 bunches of bananas, fresh fish, and one bundle of salted fish to sell in the same inland port. With her savings and her earnings, she bought a motokar in order to transport and sell her goods from one side of the city to another. With this new S/. 1,300 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase replacement parts for her motokar, paint it and upholster the seats so that it can continue to be of service. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the great support she provided during her family crisis.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for her motokar, paint, and upholstery

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en:
Elenoa P. is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband works as a driver to help meet their family's financial needs.

Meanwhile, Elenoa has 3 years of experience in the agriculture business, and she explains that she sells her crops to the public two days per week. Her typical weekly net cash flow is approximately 400 Tala ($166). Further, she notes that she has received previous loans via SPBD, and that such SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for any loans with traditional banks. She is seeking this particular loan to cover her daily business expenses and to purchase equipment needed for her business.

loans.use: To pay for her business's expenses and to purchase necessary equipment

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia del Carmen O. B. tiene 53 años, está casada, y tiene tres hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan y tienen 23, 26, y 27 anos, respectivamente. El esposo de Antonia del Carmen trabaja como panificador y está emocionado con la posibilidad de mejorar la vida de su familia con el préstamo de Kiva a su esposa. Antes de empezar su negocio, Antonia del Carmen era maestro del Colegio Modesto Armijo por más de veinticinco años y con el fin de obtener otro ingreso, comenzó a vender calzado y sandalia en los mercados en sus momentos libres. Hace veinte años desde ese comienzo, y el negocio ha crecido mucho. Con el préstamo de Kiva, Antonia del Carmen tiene ganas de vender de forma ambulante en el Mercado al Terminal de Autobuses. Al final, Antonia del Carmen le gustaría mejorar su humilde vivienda, Ella va a pagar el C$ 9.900.00 a 12 meses de plaza con cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Antonia del Carmen O. B. is 53-years old, married, and has three children. All her children work and are 23, 26, and 27-years old, respectively. Antonia del Carmen's husband works as a baker and is excited by the possibility of improving the family's life through a loan from Kiva to his wife. Before beginning her business, Antonia del Carmen was a teacher at Colegio Modesto Armijo for more than 25 years. With the objective of creating another source of income she began to sell shoes and sandals in the market in her free time. It is has been 20 years, and the business has grown a lot. With a loan from Kiva, Antonia del Carmen wants to sell her products from a cart in the bus terminal. Finally, she would like to improve her humble home. She will repay the 9,900 NIO in 12 monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelly De Jesús

texts.es:
NELLY, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Aguarico n° 299 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 37 años de edad, 02 hijos, y es enfermera.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró tela de algodón, elásticos, hilos, blondas, aguja para su maquina de coser, para la confección de sus ropas interiores (calzones, braceares), ropas de dormir, etc. a raíz del fallecimiento de su esposo se dedicó a la confección, con las ganancias que obtuvo se compró un motokar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró varios repuestos para su motokar, arreglo su motor, pinto su chasis.
Ella está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo y la comprensión, que siga apoyando a todos las mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Vecinas Unidas, located on Jr. Aguarico n° 299 in the Callería district. She is 37, has two children and is a nurse. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought cotton cloth, elastic, thread, textiles, a needle for her sowing machine, all for the confection of undergarments, pajamas, etc. Since the passing of her husband, she has been dedicated to confectionery. With her earnings, she bought a motokar. With this new S/. 1,000 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase replacement parts for her motokar, fix its motor and paint its chassis. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support and understanding. May she continue to support women who want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motokar replacement parts, engine repair and paint for chassis

loans.name: Rocío Melida

texts.es:
ROCIO MELIDA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Los Cipreses N°  202 – Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 43 años de edad, 3 hijos, su esposo es mecánico. Ella tiene una bodega. 

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró artículos para su bodega como arroz 01 saco, azúcar 01 saco, gaseosa 06 paquetes (todos descartables), golosinas y agua mineral 02 paquetes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró arroz 01 saco, azúcar 01 saco, gaseosa en botellas descartables 10 paquetes, 02 paquetes de agua mineral, embutidos en variedad, yogurt 02 paquetes, leche en tarro grande media caja.

Ella es una cliente fiel a Manuela Ramos, y agradece por poder  salir adelante en su negocio, y sabe que seguirá creciendo.
texts.en:
Rocio Melida belongs to the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors), located in Jr. Los Cipreses N 202 in the Yarinacocha district. She is 43 years old and has three sons. Her husband is a mechanic. She has a small grocery store.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), with which she bought articles for her shop such as one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, six boxes of soda, candies and two boxes of mineral water. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles (about $325 USD) she would buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, ten boxes of sodas in disposable bottles, two boxes of mineral water, a variety of sausages, two boxes of yogurt and a box of large bottles of milk.

She is a faithful client of Manuela Ramos, is thankful for the ability to move forward in her business, and knows that she will continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables for her store: a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, ten boxes of sodas in disposable bottles, two boxes of mineral water, a variety of sausages, two boxes of yogurt and a box of large bottles of milk.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
ROSARIO DEL PILAR, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”,ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano “La Inmaculada” Mz. G   Lt. 6, en el Km 6,200 de la carretera Federico Basadre, del Distrito de Callería, tiene 29 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es comerciante  compra y vende  pescados, fresco y salado, ella vende en su casa curichis (marcianos).
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compro variedad de frutas regionales, preparo gelatina, flan, queques, en poca cantidad para vender en su casa. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,600.00 Nuevos Soles, compró 06kg. de masa de aguaje, azúcar 09kg, bolsas para vender los marcianos 03 paquetes, un ciento de vasos descartables, gelatina 10 sobres, leches 05 tarros grandes, vende gelatina, flan, queques, tiene mayor clientela.
Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por ser una Organización muy comprometida  con el bienestar de las Mujeres y su superación.
texts.en:
Rosario del Pilar belongs to the community bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners), located in “La Inmaculada” at 6,200km from the Federico Basadre highway, in the Callería district. She is 29 years old and has two children. Her husband is a businessman that sells and buys fish, fresh and dried. She sells sweets and popsicles.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought a variety of local fruits, prepared gelatin, flan, and a few cakes to sell from her house.

With this loan of 1,600 Nuevos Soles she would buy 6kg of aguaje flour (made from a jungle fruit), three boxes of bags for her popsicles, a hundred disposable cups, ten packets of gelatin, five large bottles of milk, gelatin for sale, flan, cakes and have a greater clientele.

She is very grateful of Manuela Ramos for being an organization very commited to the wellbeing of the women and their success.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6kg of aguaje flour (made from a jungle fruit), three boxes of bags for her popsicles, a hundred disposable cups, ten packets of gelatin, five large bottles of milk, gelatin for sale, flan, cakes and have a greater clientele

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO, pertenece al Banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicada en Jr. Guillermo Sisley  N° 372 – Distrito D. Callería, tiene 32 años D. edad, con 02 hijos tiene una tienda D. lubricante y repuesto, su esposo trabaja con elL..

El primer préstamo que recibió fue S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles con los cuales, compró una vitrina mediana, golosinas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, waffer, gaseosas, queques, para vender en su casa. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, compró repuestos D. moto y motokar, llantas, aros, etc.; lubricantes en general, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo e hijos.

ElL. esta contenta por pertenecer y ser socia D. Manuel Ramos, gracias a Dios existe y saca D. apuros a mujeres que desea trabajar, gracias muchas gracias.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) located at Jr. Guillermo Sisley, Number 372 in the Callería district. She is 32 years old with two children. She has a motor oil and parts store. Her husband works with her.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), which with she bought a medium glass showcase, candies, cookies, chocolates, caramels, wafers, sodas, and cake to sell from her home.

With this loan of 1,700 soles ($550 USD), she will buy motorcycle and motorcar parts, tires, etc… and general motor oils. She works together with her husband and sons.

She is happy to be a part of and a partner of ManueL. Ramos. She thanks God that it exists and gets women who want to work out of trouble. Thanks. Thanks very much.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle and motorcar parts, tires, wheels, etc… and general motor oils

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
ROSSANA pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Los Mangos Nº 447 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 36 años de edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es carpintero y es socia hace 16 meses de Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 100pies de madera de la especie Capirona, para fabricar muebles de diferentes modelos con la ayuda de su esposo, ella se encarga de vender ya que tiene mucha habilidad en las ventas. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró materiales para ambientar su local propio y  aperturarlo  en el mínimo plazo para mostrar a sus clientes la variedad de modelos de muebles que fabrica, ella trabaja en conjunto con su esposo. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por darle la confianza a pesar del poco tiempo de socia. Esta contenta por el trabajo que tiene, y nos dice que siga apoyando a las mujeres que de verdad quieren trabajar y tiene talento.
texts.en:
Rossana is a member of the community bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) located at Jr. Los Mangos, number 447, San Fernando, in the Manantay district. She is 36 years old and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for 16 months.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), with which she bought 100 feet of Capirona wood to make furniture with the help of her husband. She looks after the sales, since she is very competent in sales.

With this loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles ($375 USD), she will buy materials to set up her own shop and open it as soon as possible to show her customers the variety of furniture that she makes. She works together with her husband.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for their trust despite her short time as a partner. She is happy for the work that she has, and tells us to keep helping women who really want to work and are talented.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to set up and open her own shop

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene O. L. tiene 46 años, está soltera, y no tiene hijos. Martha Irene le gustaría un préstamo para asegurar su futuro. Con un préstamo de Kiva, Martha Irene le gustaría desarrollar su venta de bisutería. Ella ha trabajada en esta manera hace 6 anos, y con el préstamo, le gustaría continuar con el desarrollo del negocio porque no existen negocios similares en su región. El propósito principal es que con el financiamiento pueda tener un ingreso, ya que cada día el costo de la vida está un poco más difícil. Martha Irene quiere un poco más tranquilidad en el pensamiento del futuro así que ella solo depende de su salario fijo. Ella va a pagar su préstamo de C$ 4,300.00 a 8 meses de plazo pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Martha Irene O. L. is 46-years old, single, and doesn't have any children. She would like a loan to secure her future. With a loan from Kiva, Martha would like to develop her costume jewelery business. She has been running it for six years and with the loan she would continue developing the business, as there are no other competitors in the area. The primary purpose of the loan is to earn income, since every day the costs of living become a little more difficult to manage. Martha Irene wants a secure future, since she relies completely on her own wages. She will repay her loan of 4,300 NIO in eight monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
SOFIA, pertenece al banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicado en Jr. Marañon Nº 144 – Distrito de Callería, tiene 49 años de edad, 05 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio como personal administrativo, es socia hace 8 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 01 balde de aceite, 01 saco de azúcar, 02 racimos de plátanos (para preparar sus chifles), refrescos, curiches (marcianos), para venderlo en un centro educativo muy conocido en la ciudad de Pucallpa. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compro 01 saco de aguaje, un ciento de cocona, 01 saco de azúcar, bolsas para sus chifles y sus chupetes, 5 Kg. canchita poorcorn, 3 racimos de plátanos.

Ella está muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por que es una organización que ve y apoya a todas las mujeres que desean progresar y en algún momento ser grande.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the “Vecinas Unidas” (“Neighbors United”) cooperative bank located in the Callería district. She is 49 years old, has five children, and her husband works as an administrator in the education department. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for eight years. She used the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received to buy 1 bucket of cooking oil, 1 sack of sugar, 2 bunches of bananas (to make her “chifles”, or fried banana snacks), and beverages to sell in a well-known educational center in the city of Pucallpa. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, she bought 1 sack of palm fruit, 100 cocona fruits, 1 bag of sugar, bags for her snacks and lollipops, 5 kg. of canchita corn snacks, and 3 bundles of bananas. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because it is an organization that supports all women who wish to get ahead and one day be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of palm fruit, 100 cocona fruits, 1 bag of sugar, bags for her snacks and lollipops, 5 kg. of canchita corn snacks, and 3 bundles of bananas.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 40 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos aún viven en casa con ella, apoyándola en el restaurante. Los padres de Elizabeth fueron agricultores, pero a ella no le gustaba mucho realizar estos trabajos agrícolas, lo que siempre le gustó fue cocinar y es asi que siempre tuvo anhelos de tener un restaurante, haciéndolo realidad años despues con la ayuda de su esposo. Ahora es la cocinera estrella de su negocio y está muy contenta de guisar y vender sus menús, los cuales vende a 4 soles, preparando de 20 a 25 platos, ganando el doble de lo invertido; este negocio ya lleva 20 años y le está brindando muchas alegrias a su familia.  Elizabeth dice estar muy contenta con su trabajo, se levanta 5 de la mañana para hacer la limpieza de su local, y a eso de las 6 ya está abierto para brindar los desayunos, mientras ella trabaja en su restaurante su esposo se dedica al cuidado de los cultivos. En todo este tiempo su negocio le sirve  para cubrir la alimentación  y la educación de sus hijos que están en etapas de estudios, asimismo en épocas de la cosecha de café, su restaurante incrementa sus ventas. Elizabeth es la vocal de su banco comunal, encargada de comunicar a los demás clientes  acerca de las reuniones que tengan con su analista de crédito, este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo pagó puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de víveres como; arroz, aceite, fideos y demás gaseosas para incrementar el estante de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, has been married for 25 years and has eight children, three of whom are still living with her helping her in the restaurant. Elizabeth's parents were farmers but she never cared for farming: she always enjoyed cooking and that is why her goal was always to have a restaurant. Her dream became reality years later with her husband's help. Today she is the stellar cook in her business and is very happy cooking and selling her set menus which sell for 4.00 soles. She prepares between 20 and 25 meals, making double her cost. She has had her business for 20 years and it brings great happiness to her family. Elizabeth says that she is very happy with her work; she gets up at 5:00 A.M. to clean and opens at 6:00 A.M. for breakfast. While she works in the restaurant, her husband takes care of the crops. Her business currently provides enough income to cover the family's food costs and the cost of tuition for their children. When it is harvest time for coffee beans, restaurant sales increase. Elizabeth is the representative for her community bank, in charge of communicating with other members during meetings which they have with their credit analyst. This is her fifth loan with MFP and in all this time she has always repaid on time. She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs such as rice, oil, noodles and more soft drinks to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to prepare meals at her restaurant

loans.name: Eveline

texts.es: Eveline tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, y actualmente realiza un negocio de producción de comidas en un local alquilado. Cuando ella vivía con su padres, solo se dedicaba a estudiar, pero cuando tuvo a su hijo, del cual tuvo que hacerse cargo ella sola; debido a las necesidades que requería el pequeño; decidió incursionar en el negocio de vender comida, entonces alquiló un local con buena ubicación por donde circulara mucha gente y pasaran los todos los carros y buses interprovinciales, es así que los chóferes se convirtieron en sus principales clientes, siendo uno de los restaurantes más concurridos de la zona, permitiéndole así cubrir los gastos de alquiler del local donde paga 150 soles y para la manutención de su pequeño. A Eveline le gusta su trabajo, por ello inicia sus actividades a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 9 de la noche, cuando los buses hayan terminado de pasar. En estas fechas la venta no es tan buena, vendiendo de 18 a 25 platos, pero en tiempos de cosecha de café las ventas al día, son de 35 a 40 platos, ganancias le permiten darle a su hijo algunas comodidades. Eveline en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual en sus pagos a MFP, ella está en su quinto préstamo, aunque no puede asistir con mucha frecuencia a las reuniones de su banco comunal porque no hay quien la remplace en su negocio. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de víveres para que pueda preparar los menús diarios en su restaurante, y de ese modo irse preparando para las fechas de la cosecha del café que ya se aproximan, desde aquí agradece a las personas que hacen posible que ella pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Eveline is 25 years old and the single mother of one daughter. She currently runs a business making prepared foods in a rented space. When she lived with her parents, she only dedicated herself to her studies. However, once she had a child, she started her business from the rented locale in order to meet her financial needs. She rented a location that is well-situated, through which a great number of people circulate as well as the buses and cars that travel between provinces. In this way, the drivers of these vehicles became some of her best customers, and her restaurant is one of the most frequented in the area. This has allowed her to pay the rent of 150 soles for her location, and also to support her daughter. Eveline enjoys her work, which is why she starts as early as 5 am and closes at 9 pm when the buses stop running. These days, business is not great and she sells 18 to 25 dishes. However, during the coffee harvest season she sells upwards of 35 to 40 plates a day, allowing her to provide some comforts for her daughter. Eveline has shown at all times to be punctual with her payments to MFP, and she is in her fifth loan. She isn’t able to attend the reunions of her cooperative bank very often, because there is no one to fill in at the business for her. The funds she requests are for the purchase of provisions so she can prepare her daily menus and, in this way, begin to prepare for the coffee harvest season which is approaching. From here, she thanks the people who make it possible for her to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase provisions for her restaurant.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Adelina V. A. tiene 49 años, vive en el sector Gran Chimu del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio primaria completa, abandonó los estudios debido a que sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente para darle educación a ella y sus hermanos; tiene 02 hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ella económicamente.
Adelina se dedica a la venta de accesorios para carros, al comienzo ayudaba a su esposo en la tienda que el tenía, entonces se animó a aperturar su propia tienda en otro local con la ayuda de su padre, el negocio le fue muy rentable motivo por el cual su esposo se asoció con ella y ahora tienen una tienda muy amplia,  la misma que se encuentra ubicado en la Av. Federico Villarreral Mz. I lote 4.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de accesorios para carros.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  accesorios para carros. 
Adelina sueña con viajar a Argentina.
texts.en:
Ms. Adelina V. A. is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Gran Chimu, district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed grade school and then left school because her parents didn’t have enough money to continue educating her and her siblings. She has two children, only one of whom depends on her economically. Adelina sells car accessories for a living. At first she helped out her husband in his shop, but then got excited about opening her own shop in another area (with help from her father). Her business turned out to be very profitable, which is why her husband decided to join her as a partner. They now have a large store, which is located on Avenue Federico Villarreal Mz. I lot 4. She invested the first loan of 300.00 that she received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium” in the purchase of car accessories. She will also invest this 1200.00 loan, which will be paid back in 4 months, in the purchase of car accessories. Adelina’s dream is to visit Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más accesorios para carros.

loans.name: Bertha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Elizabeth J. S. tiene 29 años es fiscal de su  Banco Comunal, vive en el sector Víctor Raúl del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, dejo los estudios debido a que salio embarazada y se caso, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Bertha tiene un Internet y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, empezó vendiendo ropa, con el tiempo se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza, con las ganancias obtenidas a logrado abrir un Internet; su negocio se desarrolla en su propia casa. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para la venta.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos de belleza para su stock. 
Bertha sueña con tener un stand de ropa en un centro comercial
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Elizabeth J. S. is a 29-year-old woman who is the fiscal officer at her local bank. She lives in Víctor Raúl, district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Peru. She completed three years of high school and then left school due to pregnancy and marriage. She has two children who are both economically dependent on her. Bertha has an Internet store and also sells beauty products. She began by selling clothing and then started to sell beauty products. With the money she has earned, she was able to open an Internet shop, which is located in her own home. She invested the first loan of 300.00, received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium,” in the purchase of clothing to sell. She will invest this 300.00 loan, which will be paid back in 4 months, in the purchase of beauty products for her stock. Bertha’s dream is to have a clothing stand in a mall.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más productos de belleza para su stock, para así poder obtener mas ganancias.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena R. H. tiene 46 años, vive en el sector Gran Chimu del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio solo 1ro de primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que su madre se enfermó, entonces ella tuvo que cuidarla y atenderla, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 02 aún dependen de ella económicamente.
Elena se dedica a la venta de animales y tiene una bodega, se inicio vendiendo fruta en la puerta de su casa, poco a poco fue ampliando su negocio con la venta de abarrotes, ahora tiene una gran bodega, al mismo tiempo que se dedica a la crianza de animales para la venta, el negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  abarrotes para su bodega.
Elena  tiene el gran sueño de comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena R. H. is a 46-year-old woman, who lives in Gran Shimu, district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department La Libertad, Peru. She completed the first grade, then left her studies because her mother got sick and she had to take care of her. She has five children, two of whom are economically dependent on her. Elena sells animals and has a grocery store. She began by selling fruit from the front door of her house and little by little grew her business by selling groceries as well. She now has a big grocery store. She also has a business raising animals for sale from her home. She invested the first loan of 300.00 that she received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium” in the purchase of groceries for her shop. She will also invest this 2000.00 loan in the purchase of groceries. Elena’s dream is to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más abarrotes para su bodega y asi poder ir mejorardo.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga cuenta con 28 años de edad, convive hace 11 años con su pareja, con la cual tiene 3 hijos ellos viven en una casa alquilada y se dedican a fabricar cajones de frutas. Ellos llevan trabajando en esta actividad más de11 años, y esta labor les esta dando muchas alegrías y satisfacciones económicas, ya que pese a la dura competencia Olga ama su trabajo, dedicándose a cortar y tallar las maderas, de una medida y un grosor apropiado, para la fabricación de javas y cajones para plátanos, paltas y demás productos. Ellos producen de 200 a 400 cajones al mes, invirtiendo de100 a 200 soles, siendo sus ganancias el doble de cada inversión, es asi que preparan sus cargas semanalmente, lo cual hace que muchas veces inicien su trabajo a las 4 de la mañana y dure hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche. Ya que los pedidos van en aumento se ven obligados a buscar una persona que los apoye, para aprovechar la demanda de estos meses, ya que el resto de los meses la venta no es muy buena y se dedican a realizar esporádicamente cultivos agrícolas.
